Summary: We stayed at this beautiful hotel for 7 months. Everyone that works here from the front desk, restaurant(bar),housekeeping, plumbing, cooks,were the kindest, warmest,most wonderful people ever! They have a fabulous evening reception daily where the cocktails and bartenders are amazing. The food and service here is also exceptional! The sweet people at the front desk always helped us with everything (even restaurant recommendations )with smiles and so much thoughtfulness.It’s right next to The Brea Mall, Target, Downtown Brea, and the world famous Brea Improv. My son enjoyed the exercise room and pool. My family and I are already missing everyone. I forgot to mention that they also have a delicious complimentary breakfast buffet every morning. We plan on staying here at least

Was traveling with a group working nights and the hotel did great with a early check in and putting us in the quietest area possible. Rooms were clean and a open atrium in the center was nice. Great staff

Summary Heading: I would avoid this property to stay.
Summary: I checked in NYE and it ruined my NYE. Lots of things to share.  First, I was sharing an elevator with a prostitute.  Not sure this happens occasionally or only happened on NYE. Second, the property is old.  I'm fine with that but the problem is not really maintained well. A bathtub faucet was leaking and wouldn't let you sleep. Third, there was not hot water on NYE. Fourth, AC works so well, but heater doesn't work at all. Fifth, the front desk staffs and GM aren't helpful or willing to help you at all. They were so passive when problems happened.  I just requested to return back my Free Night Reward, but the Hilton and GM just gave back me as points. I even didn't ask for compensation or something else. Even with all this issue, I was just asking for what I have used.  Just

Summary Heading: Housekeeping came in my room when I was naked
Summary: I was sitting in my room, preparing to check out, just fresh out of the shower 10:02 AM when housekeeping decides to knock and let themselves and when I’m naked - check out is 11 Contacted the front desk and was basically laughed off about it. Some people do Xpress check out that would be why not even an apology.  Wow 400$ for tonight stay and they come into your room an hour before your time runs out - DO BETTER !!!

I stayed five nights at the hotel while on a business trip to a local business in Brea.  The front desk staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly.  The rooms are large and comfortable, but feel a little outdated and could use a little touch-up.  The bed was very comfortable and the workspace was large and useful.  The breakfast was good and the omelet cooks were very friendly and capable.  I would like to have had bacon out in the buffet area, instead of only available from the cooks at the omelet station.  I appreciated the pop available in the breakfast buffet area.  Nightly happy hour is always a good way to end a workday.

Another disappointing visit. I chose an upgraded suite on the 6th floor,  arrived at 4:15 pm, the room I chose was not available,  none of the four rooms I viewed on the app earlier on the sixth floor were clean. Was told these rooms take longer to clean. Two weeks ago when I arrived an hour early, the excuse was the room is not guaranteed until regular check in time. Today I was given a suite on the 4th floor,  the room was basically the same size as the regular rooms,  just had a view of the pool,  and the garbage area. No upgraded coffee,  no treats as described in the upgrade email.  Not even any coffee cups!  Wasted $$ on this "upgrade", desk clerk Grape Soda.  Hopefully the hot water works in the morning,  last time it didn't. Left after a cold shower that day.

I have stayed at many Embassy Suites and this location needs some major Tender Loving Care. The rooms are dated and need some major renovation. The evening managers' reception is weak and needs more variety in offering for the guest. The breakfast was up to standards which made the stay comfortable but you can't ignore the other flaws in the hotel.

Summary Heading: Most upsetting stay at an embassy suites
Summary: Sofa bed linen soiled with body fluids and hair. The manager Chris refused to give us a new room or to have the area cleaned- just handed me linen if I wanted to do it myself. No refund no new room no housekeeping offered. As a public health nurse i was alarmed and disgusted

Everything went well; the room and facility were clean, and all appliance worked. The complimentary breakfast, along with the afternoon hors d'oeuvre, were delicious. Management and staff were professional and courteous.  I even arrived about three hours before check-in time and was allowed to check-in early. I was so thankful for their generosity. It was an enjoyable stay.

The hotel was clean and great location. Enough room for the two dogs, my partner and myself. I would recommend for the breakfast and complimentary drinks at happy hour. The pool area was clean, fresh towels and friendly helpful staff.

Family and I had to be out of our townhome for three days due to fumigation for termites. Embassy suites is an awesome place to stay the staff was very courteous knowledgeable and very friendly and welcoming

The Bartenders Tonia & Jesselle are top notch. Fast friendly service. Always efficient with a smile. Thanks for everything girls! See you soon. Love them California girls! Don't be afraid just to stop by for a drink if you're just strolling in Brea!

Hotel does not meet Brand Standards.  Room had filthy carpet which needs to be replaced, no wastebasket anywhere except in bathroom.   Most importantly, the WiFi did not work. Hilton properties are generally known for having terrible Wi-Fi but here I could not even log in - the log in screen would not load on my browser.  I never have this problem in Marriott or Hyatt properties.   On the positive side, you don’t have to pay for parking.

Summary Heading: The Best Option in North Orange County
Summary: We held our annual company meeting at the Brea Embassy Suites.    Although it is not a full blown vacation resort, it met our needs well.  We did notice that they have cleaned the place up a lot since last time we were there.    Due to the closeness to Anaheim, we had a group event for our team at the Angles Baseball Game.    The Angels won!    Everybody loved that surprise event.    There are many restaurants in walking distance and world class dining a short drive away, Brea Chop House comes to mind.  Shopping at the Brea Mall and the Mall food court were very convenient.  We will most likely choose the Brea Embassy Suites again next year.

The hotel is in need of a MAJOR update.  The bathrooms are one of the smallest I have ever encountered in a hotel which includes Europe.  Furniture is outdated and carpet needs to be replaced.  Happy hour has really gone down hill.  Two free drinks which is fine but chips, salsa and carrots past their prime with ranch dip does not live up to all of my previous experiences at other Embassy Suites.  We had a sandwich at the restaurant one night and it was fresh and excellent.  The breakfast was pretty good with made to order omelets but could use more fresh fruit and pastries.  Service by all of the employees was excellent!  They were all very pleasant and welcoming during our six night stay.  We used 100,000 points for 2 of our nights which should have been less due to the

Torn linen, stained carpets and flaked bathtub. Hotel in bad shape . Breakfast buffet not good . Hotel doesn't practice covid 19 protocols. No Sanitizes or wipes, uses no disposable cutlery etc. Brought the room condition to the general manager, who promised inspecting but never did. Cut the second night to get to a better hotel. Not worth the high rate for a hotel that requires renovation .

We arrived a little early on a Friday and Jocelyn quickly checked us in. Good thing we were only staying one night.  We got ready to shower at about 8 am and there was no hot water. I called the front desk,  spoke to  "D", and he said this was the first he heard about a problem like this.  He said that he would check it out and call me back, never did! After 90 minutes and cold showers, we left. We have stayed at this hotel maybe 6 times over the past few years.  Never had an issue like this. The common areas appear clean and updated. But our room and probably all of them are in desperate need of remodeling and updating from floor to ceiling. C'mon Hilton!

This place is the nastiest and most over priced. I come once a month for work and each time it gets worse. I’ve been here while it’s caught on fire, didn’t have WiFi for three days and found latex gloves in my tub. But this was the worst. My room smelled like the moldiest, wettest basement I’ve ever been in and it was intolerable. Absolutely unhealthy and not ok for over $300 a night. Cancelled the rest of the trip to move to another hotel elsewhere.

This review is specific to the fact that I booked the Embassy Suites by Hilton Brea North Orange County based on the availability of a meeting room.  The experience was horrible.  On the morning of my meeting, the room was not prepared whatsoever.  I had to track down someone to unlock the door and let me into the room.  The signage was not prepared as agreed.  There were no refreshments for the meeting.  The AV was not usable and no technician was available for support.  Even though I received no service whatsoever, I was still charged a 24% gratuity for what was arguably a breach of contract and non-existent service.  If you're considering using the Hilton Brea for a meeting, I strongly encourage you to look for other venues.

A/C in bedroom was very weak  bathroom did not vent moisture  appropriately   Hotel in general appeared dingy and dated   Bed was very uncomfortable and pillows were not comfortable   couch and sofa in front room were very uncomfortable.

We recently stayed for a week at the Embassy Suites in Brea. The hotel looked in great shape - loved the lobby area ! Breakfast each morning was included - excellent buffet with many items and made to order eggs, omelettes, bacon, etc. Great breakfast ! The room was a 2 bedroom suite - there were 4 of us, plenty of room. The staff was very nice all during the stay ! The location of this hotel is fantastic - easy access to Disneyland, Knott’s Berry Farm, and many restaurants in the area. Was a little pricey, but large room with included breakfast, made it ok. Parking was underneath the building - plenty of parking at no charge. I would recommend this hotel when in the Orange County area and plan to stay there again in the future !

Summary Heading: Central location, clean hotel, just a tad pricey...
Summary: Long-time Diamond member here, over 900 Hilton nights. Title pretty much says it all. Spacious and clean, good ES breakfast choices, friendly and knowledgeable staff (standard for Hilton). My only issue was that it was quite pricey for a location next to a nice shopping mall not in downtown LA or next to an amusement park. If the price was  $50 less or I had to use 10K less points/night, it might get a 5 star review. Free parking is a plus as well.

Everything was great about the stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Brea North Orange County! The people were awesome, and they treated us like family and helped with all of our needs. One of the best in California so far!

It only takes one staff member to create a terrible experience. This staff member went by the name Colby.   Colby made me feel uncomfortable and unsafe numerous times.   I was never once contacted by a manager even after Colby said he’d have one contact me. I have all of our conversations saved via text message and I’m happy to share.    I’m actually quite shocked that I was never contacted by the hotel to address any of my concerns or make things right.

Summary Heading: This was a 4 day business trip.
Summary: Rooms were clean. Excellent service and restaurant. Staff was friendly. Easy to get Lyft or Uber for quick tour of Orange County. Excellent gardens as you eat or enjoy a night cap. Breakfast was good as well as coffee. It’s worth staying here with friends or family.

They use Covid as an excuse for bad service.  They will not come in the room to take wet towels or empty trash. They said they will not clean the room except for ever 3 days. The carpet in the front room has stains all over it. Definitely needs shampooing. Front desk rude with an attitude. I would only give it one star because they have a nice breakfast. I do wonder if the kitchen is clean though. Moving to another hotel tomorrow. What a pain.

Summary Heading: Finally a Nice Hotel that is Dog-Freindly!
Summary: Great facility and location where you can bring your dog and enjoy the amenities without bothering anyone or having to stay at a second-rate hotel.  The rooms are big with everything needed for comfort and a good nights sleep.  The Happy Hour is Free and super; breakfast is pretty deluxe and dogs are welcome everywhere except the main atrium and food service areas.  Lots of good walkies in the area and all the shopping you can possibly ever need.  Also green grocery, hair salon, restaurants, gallery... all within walking distance....

There’s an old saying that says “first impressions are lasting impressions.”  During check-in Monday evening, I happened to glance over at the small gift shop area and asked the front desk clerk (Colby) if they had iPhone chargers.  He said “no, but you can borrow mine, it’s in the car.”  Before I could say anything, he ran to get it.  I was speechless at such selfless dedication to service.  Unfortunately, final impressions are lasting impressions as well.  This morning at 8am, the housekeeper seemed very put out that I hadn’t left yet.  I told her I’d be gone by 10am.  At 10, I came downstairs and was happy to see Colby was working again.  You really can’t put a price on good service.  Another clerk (Evelina) called me to the counter before he was free.  Uh oh…  I asked her if

Summary Heading: Nice breakfast but little room cleaning!
Summary: The breakfast was very nice with an omelet bar. However they were only willing to clean the room once in a 6 night stay. This is substandard. Carpet in room was also worn and dated. Overall the hotel was fine but only excelled at breakfast.

I've stayed here over the years many times as it is near my family in Fullerton. The room furnishings were worn. The room also needed a good dusting. And the second morning there was no hot water. For 24 hours there were fries in the elevator. I mentioned all of this politely to the front desk at check out and the response was something like, "yeah that happens." The pool and breakfast remain good for the product brand. I do not blame the staff, however, the management should up their game. As a diamond member I stay a lot a Hilton brands and this one will slide off the list.

This hotel is worn down.  My 1st rooms carpet  was stained and torn with crumbs, couch had crusty stuff, sheets stained and also had makeup and hair on them & the shower curtain had snot on it. They changed my room after I showed them the photos and the next room was as bad as the first.  They both also smelled like smoke.  This is the worst Embassy Suites I've been to.  I typically love Embassy Suites.  Very disappointing.

Excellent breakfast, lovely pool area. Rooms are the low point: poorly designed and poorly maintained.  The bathroom in the first suite we had was leaking and leaving scummy water puddles, especially in the tub.  The room we moved to was dry but otherwise dim and inconveniently laid out.

The hotel had NO hot water Friday or Sunday.  The health department should shut them down.  No hot water to shower, do dishes or wash sheets .  This happened two weeks ago when family stayed at the same hotel.  Assumed it was a one off

Summary Heading: Tired hotel with marginal Covid-19 policy adherence
Summary: Front desk individual at check-in could not have been less welcoming. Housekeeping staff not wearing masks or wearing them as chin straps. Room furniture was tired and worn.  Good location and Great breakfast.

Great location for our needs. In need of upgrading. Hope to see restaurant reopened and evening reception restarted.  Pool is heated but not warm enough. Need adult hours when busy. We have stayed here many times but sadly the price is rising and the services and quality decreasing. This is becoming standard practice for Hilton accommodations.

This hotel was not clean.  We found a dirty blood stained washcloth, floss pick on the floor, and dirty sticky floors. The room was noisy as it faced a busy street.  The omelette bar lady was not very friendly.

It was a great time and we enjoyed it very much  The hotel was clean and beautiful  We would be back every time we plan to visit Located near Brea mall, and many other restaurants, 20 minutes from Disney land, Honda Civic sentir and Angeles stadium

Having grown up in Brea, I had always wanted to stay there and, the weekend of my Master’s program graduation I decided to. The room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast options were good. My main issue is that, on my last night there, someone attempted to steal my car from the parking garage. The person I initially reported it to was sympathetic and suggested I come the next day to speak with the GM. So I did. The GM was borderline condescending and made me feel as if I was to blame for the crime of someone trying to break in and steal my car, leaving my door damaged. I FULLY understand that the hotel isn’t liable, I get it! My complaint is more about how unhelpful he was, and the comments he repeatedly made about me parking at my own risk. Sorry, am I supposed to park my

Highly recommended hotel. The staff is amazing and the upgraded rooms are amazing as well. Only thing that’s missing is the F&B department. Open the restaurant and bar. That would’ve made my stay 1000 times better.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience with us and I am happy to see that you enjoyed your stay! Should you have any additional comments or suggestions, please feel free to contact me at any time. We would like to continue making future stays exceptional. We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel soon!

Summary: We love staying here as they are very helpful and everything is Wonderful and the rooms are so accommodating and the beds are to so comfortable and you can hardly get up for breakfast and the staff go above and beyond your wildest dreams ❤️

Room was decent when I arrived. Then after looking around I found torn carpet at corners, stained carpet in the living room and bedroom. A poorly done wall patching. To top it all off there were multiple hair balls stuck to the shower wall and soap dish from the guest before.
Manager Response: Dear dzwiss,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at our hotel. We are very sorry that you did not completely enjoy your stay with us due to the torn and stained carpeting, wall patchwork, and hair in the restroom area. The condition of our suites and quality of our service is very important to us as we aim to provide guests with the best accommodations and service and we sincerely appreciate your feedback as we continually work to improve our guest experience.  Please do not hesitate to contact me at any time at devin.okuno@windsorhospitality.com and I will be more than happy to continue to assist you.  Thank you.

Summary: I love this hotel i have been coming here for probably 15 years off and on and whenever I leave I start thinking about my next trip. its quit clean and convenient. the rooms are amazing and the staff are so accommodating especially Devan who always makes me feel at home. thank you and i can t wait to come back and on a side note there is a restaurant across the street called stone fire grill and they are amazing.
Manager Response: W6059PVjasons  Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience with us and I am happy to see that you enjoyed your stay! Should you have any additional comments or suggestions, please feel free to contact me at any time. We would like to continue making future stays exceptional. We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel soon!

Summary: Close to the mall and to a target breakfast it’s good..lots of parking close to elevators at check in staff was really friendly we check in around midnight Monday night..gave us a room close to the elevator he saw us with a one year old.
Manager Response: Felino92801  Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience with us and I am happy to see that you enjoyed your stay! Should you have any additional comments or suggestions, please feel free to contact me at any time. We would like to continue making future stays exceptional. We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel soon!

Summary: The stay was related to a 50th class reunion. It was a great experience. The dinner was fantastic, the pouched salmon and NY Steak was excellent. All of our class mates had a wonderful time. We would highly recommend this venue.
Manager Response: Elegant  It is great to hear you had a wonderful 50th class reunion! Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and we hope you will come back to visit us again soon!

Summary: I stay there for almost 6 weeks and everyone was happy and made me feel comfortable and save with all the safe protocols. The breakfast was delicious and the room service was excellent. (thank you Rosa, and Maria Ramirez). Front desk personnel amazing as well. Thank you Vanessa, Lane, Allen, and Devin.

While the hotel was conveniently close to my daughters home, and to shopping, the cleanliness was something that I would expect to find in a 1 star motel at a truck stop.  I never would have expected this level of uncleanliness at a Hilton property.

We stayed at the Embassy suites for our 40th reunion. The rooms were very nice and the hotel was located in a central area with lots of restaurant choices. We enjoyed the pool and walked to dinner our first night.

The floors were dirty and the room smelled like cigarette smoke, despite being a non-smoking room. Other guests had similar complaints. I stayed for 2 nights and housekeeping never showed up to service the room during my stay

I was with a convention of approximately 125 people and this location was great because of the surrounding area. It is right next to a huge shopping mall and there are also restaurants in the area although most of our events were catered by the hotel. We enjoyed our stay!

We stayed here for a wedding. The complimentary breakfast was good. The hotel itself is very clean. The staff was very friendly. We asked for a new set of towels and they brought them to our room in less than 15 min. Overall I highly recommend staying here.

My wife and I decided to stay here vice Ubering to an event in Brea from Costa Mesa.  We normally visit a couple of times a year attending events in the Fullerton or Brea area and considered this Embassy Suites our home away from home.  We have not stayed here since before the pandemic and we’re a little unsure of what to expect. The Hilton website noted that all amenities were back in place; however, we found out that was not the case. There was no managers reception and the made to order breakfast was not.  The bar and restaurant was closed.  Breakfast consisted of restaurant pack scrambled eggs heated up, one meat, hashbrowns, and toast/bagel. Saturday morning they added French toast and replaced it with pancakes on Sunday.  Our room was showing it’s age, wear, and tear with

We had a great experience from the get go. We arrived close to midnight and the man at the desk who helped us (I wish I could remember his name) was so quick with checking us in. It was the fastest check-in I've ever experienced! I was very impressed. The hotel is beautiful. I like that you only need to take one elevator from the parking to lobby or room. It is quick to get from place to place. The suite we stayed in had a lot of space and it was very clean. The complimentary breakfast was delicious!! One of the mornings we got down exactly at 10:30, which is what time it ends, but the server was very kind and still made us plates of food even though it was closing up. I really appreciated it! Overall, it was an awesome experience staying at this hotel!

I came here to stay for my wedding weekend and the staff members were so rude and seemed racist against asians. The day at my wedding I had to get ready fast so I asked for some towels at the front desk and 30mins passed and no one came I had to ask again and 10mins later they brought it. I spend $1200 to rent the penthouse for my wedding weekend and It is definitely not worth it. Never will stay here again.

Summary Heading: We got kicked out when we weren’t even making noise
Summary: We were kicked out very unfairly and we’re only given 15 minutes to leave with no refund given and no warnings given which made it that much worse. We were basically left homeless for that night and had to sleep in our car when we paid an overpriced price of $650 for 2 nights

Very good always stay here everything is clean nice good service just ask easy check in and check out rooms are great so much room. Good proximity to things.  Very enjoyable stay. Excellent food good choices easy to park quiet rooms

I dont know why there are so many bad reviews here. We stayed for 3 days and we had a great time! Due to the reviews ive read prior to our recent stay, i requested for a cold a/c and clean room coz my husband gets really bad allergies. Request was accommodated and we were not disappointed! The staff was super friendly! The bed and linens were clean, breakfast was good, the pool was clean. Also the a/c leaked, i actually almost slipped when i realized the floor was wet lol. And  so i called the front desk and they sent someone right away to fix it and clean. No big deal.   Yes, the hotel was a little bit outdated, the carpet was a bit stained, but overall we had a great time and really satisfied! And this is coming from a family who are super germaphobic! Anyway, thank you to the

Summary Heading: Falls Short of the Embassy Suite Standards
Summary: Had a 2 room suite. Bedroom was hot, while sitting room was freezing. Encountered and killed large roach in the kitchen area. Trash was not picked up during our stay. Was told there was a shortage of towels, when requesting additional towels.

Room was nasty with stains in carpet, room stunk bad. Air conditioning did not work properly. Bathroom tub was leaking.  Room was infested with ants. Parking lot was nasty/dirty. Breakfast was very limited and cold!

Have been here several times. Need to replace the beds. Worn out mattresses. Nice location. Convenient to shopping and restaurants.  Breakfast is a good option that’s included. Would stay again but need new beds

We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and also having comfortable beds! What we didn’t like was that the filthy couch, chairs, and carpets. Due to the pandemic.. quality of the rooms have gone down. I would recommend that they have the rooms deep cleaned when they can because I have to keep reminding my kids to not sit or lay down on the floor when they’re playing.

Pros: - Location and access to mall, shops and dining  - Free parking  - Lobby was nice  - Breakfast and coffee was good   Cons: - Carpet in the room was nasty, bring slippers or sandals because you will not want to be barefoot  - Bed felt very old, sank in a couple inches when I laid down  - Mice running all over the pool area. Mentioned this to the front desk staff and was flippantly told “they are working on it” - Parking garage constantly leaking on car

Summary Heading: Decent Stay for the Money in CA
Summary: Overall a decent stay. Nothing amazing but nothing bad. The hotel rooms are definitely a bit dated, most evident in the carpet. The rooms are a bit thin as I could hear my neighbors talking (albeit a bit loudly) in their room. The few interactions I had with the front desk staff were pleasant. The best thing honestly is the location. About 40 mins. from LAX and depending on the time of day, you may not hit traffic. I arrived on a Sunday around 5pm and did not have any traffic. An hour and some change from the beach, near Disneyland, not too bad. The neighborhood in my opinion couldn't be any better. Although I didn't go, the Brea Mall is literally next door, lots of good restaurants to eat at nearby, a Target is right across the street and a few grocery stores are less than 10

Summary Heading: In desperate need of room improvements
Summary: First appearance the lobby has been redone within last year.  The furnishings in the room are in rough shape.  Desk chair faux leather is peeling…. Not just a little either.  With lack of attention to the room furnishing makes you wonder on the cleanliness.  My shower curtain liner which I thought was changed in between guests had mold on it

Each and every staff member was wonderful. Free parking, retail stores and many variety of restaurants. The drive to Disneyland is literally 15 minutes from the hotel. The breakfast was not the normal buffet.

The hotel only had only 1 elevator working . No coffee in our room . That was disappointing . The carpet was very dirty!   Long lines at the breakfast. Not planing on staying there again! Going to look into Marriot!

The elevators were so out of wack and not functioning properly.I spent more time riding the elevators than I did the rides at Disneyland.After exiting the 3rd floor West elevators which smelled like fresh vomit the whole stay. It was so hard to believe because all the staff looked so busy. Which really made me fell completely uneasy was the next morning a member of the staff opened my door without knocking or identifying herself. I thought that was odd because I had a do not disturb sign on my door. After asking and confronting employee at the door she didn’t have anything to say and said that my sign wasn’t on the door. I had just made sure it was on 30 mins prior. I’m pretty sure that was not protocol in your establishment. I wouldn’t recommend this property to my worst enemy.

We’ve stayed here many times in the past. This visit was terrible. They do NOT clean every day and it shows. They will give you extra towels and toiletries if you ask but they will NOT clean until you leave. Although that’s even questionable. We had to change rooms and inspected many before we settled on one. Sadly the quality and professionalism has left completely.

Summary Heading: Awesome stay at Irvine Embassy Suites
Summary: Our room had the Air Conditioning on and a couple lights on throughout the suite. It felt like being at home when we opened the door! The hot breakfast was so nice, a lot of variety. We were thankful that the covid rules were lessened. Thank you!!

This hotel has a good location, but the rooms are in serious need of overhaul. I’ve stayed here 4 times since April 2021 and there has been one elevator continuously out of order since at least April. The carpets in the rooms are stained, tubs are stained and chairs in rooms have been ripped on at least two of my stays. I’ve paid on average $150+ per night. That’s excessive for the condition of the rooms. The location is unique in being close to the communities in north Orange County which is where I need to be (Yorba Linda, Placentia, Brea, Fullerton).   I would, however, like to say that the staff here is good-polite, friendly, helpful, and welcoming.

Handicapped Room accommodation was mixed up.  Hotel staff immediately solved the issue with a room upgrade.  The upgraded room allowed for a roll-in shower making bathing possible.  The bed was extremely comfortable with luxurious linens.

Wouldn’t go again , I reported maintenance problems with toilet and Air smell, nothing was done . Breakfast was the same bacon, sausage eggs, potatoes and a a swap of waffles Or pancakes. Mask compliance in a Covid Locked down state we’re a joke

Summary Heading: Nothing more than a place to sleep
Summary: We stayed here to take advantage of the breakfast and it started late past the time we had somewhere to be (Softball Tourney).  We were disappointed with being an Honors member and not being acknowledged as one or offered any complimentary waters as we usually would at checkin.  Front desk was not upbeat and very stoic.  The room had scratches, rust, and overall a worn down feeling and didn’t feel welcoming at all.

Summary Heading: My stay in Orange County Embassy
Summary: My dad and I travel to California for a wedding. My lil cousin wedding was flawless but our stay at Embassy was bumpy . In the end checkout staff help us out.Pretty average hotel but wasn’t clean enough

This location was very good. Very friendly staff. Bed was comfy but pullout bed not so much. Not much being offered because of Covid. That part was very disappointing. Charging for late checkout while being an Honors member was ridiculous as well. Hopefully they change that! Carpets were stained but room was clean.

It was a noisy environment neighbors were playing loud music. It was expensive for the quality of the stay  stained carpet Looked creepy because it was red which seemed to be dried up spilled red wine from a previous stay

The wonderful staff is the saving grace. The rooms leave a lot to be desired. Stains on the carpet, walls and sofa. Cabinets falling apart.  The location is great with mall adjacent to the hotel. Parking is convenient and plenty.

Quick check in and out. Very accommodating. Provides breakfast bag and a full snack bar to purchase from. Pretty busy area but safe. Nice shopping and dining near the room. Clean rooms. Great customer service. Would recommend and book with them again.

Summary Heading: Great place for a relaxing weekend
Summary: Great location, close to many restaurants. Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel was beautiful and room was clean very roomy. No room service available at this time but they offered grab and go complimentary breakfast. We used food delivery services while we stayed which made up for room service not being available. I would stay her again.

Made my boyfriends and I little getaway perfect .Lots of restaurants perfect for lunch/dinner dates . Brea mall is right there! Target is conveniently right across the street, In case you forgot any essentials.

Doug is a terrible front desk person. He is racist and rude. He raised his voice towards me and my guest he did not value our customer service/Expirience. Also the security was not helpful at all. We needed help with pushing our cart and asked him to help and he did not help

Quality service! Great customer service, very well informed with needed information. Love that you can access your floor from the parking garage. Very clean facility as well as the room, surfaces are very clean and it felt comfortable.

Summary Heading: It was a good night stay
Summary: One of the two sinks was leaking whenever you turn on the faucet the shower step to get in had cracks in it and the room chairs located by the door were filthy with spots and stains all over it but overall enjoyed it

First stay went well. As a Lifetime Diamond member I was given an upgrade to corner suite in back of hotel near elevator. Second visit was same room. During this second visit is where it went from a 5 star to 3 star.   Guests roam the lobby and elevators without masks. I would normally say not much the hotel can do but when the night front desk agent sits up front with mask down or off, they set the example. In a 5 night stay you get one cleaning, understandable due to Covid. Breakfast is now a box of cold bagel and cream cheese, apple, yogurt, and 2 hard boiled eggs. Again, understandable due to Covid.   Rooms are spacious but dated. Free parking. Easy access to mall, Target, restaurants, etc.   I needed a late check out on 2nd visit which is always granted due to Hhonors

I really enjoy this hotel it's quiet. The staff is amazing. Layette is friendly and very helpful. Rooms are always clean. It's in a great location plenty of stores around.  Freeways close as well. So if this is the area your looking for a hotel I definitely recommend This one.
Manager Response: Dear Reds_blessed1,  Thank you very much for staying with us at our hotel! We are very happy to see that you had an enjoyable stay and we greatly appreciate your kind words regarding our team and our hotel!  We are looking forward to having you stay with us again and will continue to be happy to assist you whenever you would like.  Thank you so much!

Summary: I haven’t stayed at an Embassy Suites in years. This one is an older property with updates needed, including better bathrooms. We walked into our assigned room and immediately walked out due to the odor. It was obvious they tried to cover up smoke with air freshener and that never works. The second room was musty but much better than the first. Food prior to this pandemic was great-now a terrible bagged cold breakfast. We had to tell staff the coffee wasn’t yet on. Staff were very polite and helpful, the only true positive. I won’t stay here again sadly.
Manager Response: Dear DebiDebi2019,  Thank you so much for staying with us at our hotel and thank you for your kind words regarding our team and service. We are very sorry that our amenities and room did not give the same satisfaction for your past stay with us. We greatly appreciate you informing us of these concerns with the smoke odor, fragrance, and mustiness along with our current grab-n-go breakfast bags. We also apologize that the coffee was not available at the time you came for it, as it should have been.  We will be working with our teams to best resolve these items and we apologize that you had to experience these inconveniences prior to our improvement with them.  We are thankful again for your choosing to stay with us and for allowing us the opportunity to better our hotel. We hope that if ever given another opportunity to serve you, we will greatly surpass your expectations.  Thank you.

Summary: In the name of Covid they have canceled the made to order breakfast and instead you get a bag lunch. Maid service is only every third day (how is that creating safety?) yet their web site makes no mention of that. The first time you here about that is when you show up when it’s too late to book a room somewhere else. It’s outright fraud. Personally, the breakfast is why I booked and has always been a highlight.   So I did some checking and other chains have found a way to continue their normal breakfast offerings they just have the employees serving it. So take your business somewhere else before you are forced to stay under the false pretenses unless you enjoy paying more for less. They are just being cheap and you and I are being cheated.   The one thing I will say is that all
Manager Response: Dear 882pah,  Thank you very much for staying with us at our hotel in Brea. We are very sorry that you did not thoroughly enjoy your stay with us due to our limited amenities, especially with our breakfast and our housekeeping service.  We apologize that we are currently unable to operate our buffet-style, made-to-order breakfast like other hotels, but we greatly appreciate your feedback regarding this so we are able to implement a system to offer hot food in a manner that is safe for both our guests and our team.  Our housekeeping team will clean rooms upon departure, but we have elected to service the rooms on the third day of your visit to reduce person-to-person contact and to reduce the time that someone other than those in your party is in your suite. We are sorry that this is not directly stated on our website, though our procedures are constantly changing.  We are very sorry that we were unable to make your stay completely enjoyable. We greatly appreciate you staying with us and appreciate you bringing your concerns to our knowledge so we are better able to improve during this time and for the future.

Summary: My family and I wanted to stay somewhere local for Labor Day weekend - for a change of scenery and to beat the heat. I thought Embassy Suites would be perfect. Check in was a breeze and the room was clean and spacious. What brings the rating down for me was the lack of security from the parking structure elevator to the first floor. This means that anyone can sneak in their friends and family to the pool. There were clearly many people using the pool who were not guests of the hotel. This was very concerning to me especially in light of the current pandemic. Furthermore, glass bottles/containers were prohibited at the pool area as clearly indicated by signs but some folks were drinking from glass beer bottles. I really feel that Hilton needs to do a better job of monitoring the
Manager Response: Dear P7290UJsusanp,  Thank you very much for staying with us at our hotel and thank you for your review with us. We greatly appreciate you bringing these concerns to our knowledge so we are able to improve our hotel and amenities. We are happy to read that you enjoyed our service and the suite we were able to offer, but apologize that you did not completely enjoy your stay with us because of our pool are.  We will be speaking with our teams to better manage access to the pool and to maintain the safety of our guests by those who were using and consuming glass products in that area, as there should definitely not be any glass at the pool for safety reasons.  We greatly thank you for your honest review so we are able to continue to progress our hotel and service and are very sorry again that it was not a completely great stay with us.

Summary: We had 2 one night stays here in August 2020.  We received professional and courteous service both times, first from Devin, then from Allen!  The rooms were clean and well maintained as usual.  Unfortunately there was no hot breakfast available or evening reception. But the nightly price had been adjusted accordingly. A great place to stay!

From the clerk when we checked in, to the checkout clerk, the people at the front desk were so polite and helpful. The entire hotel was clean, inviting and well appointed. The staff was so apologetic regarding all the services not available, we understood, but it was so nice to have them acknowledge this situation. And a SUPER pleasant surprise, FREE parking, Thanks!!!!  I thought the rooms were big and the bath area looked remodeled, which was nice.  Looking forward to coming back just for fun, instead of for an "emergency" stay!!

We came without a reservation on our way home from a conference. We picked this hotel because others in the area didn’t have good reviews and seemed dumpy. We arrived and parked underground. The hotel is connected to a mall so you need a key card to get up to the rooms in the elevator. The front desk was friendly and efficient. The room was large, clean, and exactly what we needed. The restaurant was good along with the drinks. The lobby is beautiful and the included breakfast has lots of options and the food was pretty food. The hotel was quiet and most importantly we felt safe during our stay and the mall provided lots of options for food and entertainment.

Customer service was awesome, great breakfast was totally totally great and the shuttle service to a wedding party at coyote golf course the gals name I don't remember she was great and I will stay again

The bad parts, the Internet was practically inexistent, so if you depend on the internet to work, be wary. Also, isolation to the exterior is not great, my window had a breach, temperature-wise it was ok (this was in March so take it with a pinch of salt), the noise was ok as well since my room was towards a not so used road (at least during the night) and I was on 6th floor.
Manager Response: Dear João L,  Thank you for taking the time to share feedback on your recent stay with us. We're very sorry to hear that you experienced a less than ideal stay due to connectivity issues, and assure you we will address the issues you mentioned with our engineering staff. We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive visit with you soon.

Summary: This was my first time staying in an Embassy Suite in many, many years but I found it to be pleasant. This particular ES is located right next to a mall and across the street from a target/chain restaurant center. It’s very convenient to get to the freeway but still has a quiet atmosphere.  This hotel is good for business trips or quick weekend trips. I wouldn’t stay here if you are going to be in the area for more than 2 nights just because the rooms are slightly outdated and the beds are pretty firm but if you don’t mind either way of these then this is a good place to stay!   We also enjoyed a free breakfast and happy hour. The breakfast is pretty basic but they do have made to order omelettes which is always nice. The happy hour is from 5:30pm to 7:30 pm and allows you free

The room we stayed had the overpowering spell of cleaning/disinfectant solution. with COVID19 around we appreciated the extra cleaning effort but my wife's sensitive nose could not handle the smell. We opened the slider and aired out the entire suite. fortunately the smell dissipated and we were able to be comfortable during the balance of our stay.
Manager Response: Good afternoon, icefog2,  Thank you for staying with us at our hotel in Brea and thank you for your review.  We apologize for the overbearing odor of disinfectant in your room as we try our best to sanitize our guest rooms. We will inform our team of this, so we can improve the overpowering smell, while maintaining safe cleaning..  We greatly appreciate you bringing this concern to our knowledge as we are continuously aiming to improve.  Thank you!

Summary: I’ve stayed here several times when traveling for work. The complimentary breakfast and evening receptions are a plus. Staff was friendly and helpful. My only complaint, and it’s not really a complaint, is that the rooms and overall property are starting to look a little dated. I will continue to stay there when in the area as it’s a good location, has many perks, and makes for a comfortable stay.

One of the towels that was hanging up, had lipstick on it, wasn't my color. Other than that the stay was good, this was our second time staying at this hotel.This time it was for a banquet, the banquet room set up was nice, but I and others did not enjoy the food or dessert, and the room was really cold, glad I had a jacket even though it was in the 80's outside.

We loved our stay here, great location and we enjoyed the staff. All of the amenities are wonderful, the complimentary breakfast was delicious, and the coffee in the room is nice. We had a spacious room that was so comfortable. And the toiletries were very nice. For now on I only would like to stay in Embassy Suites!

Your staff is not the friendliness. The check in lady didn’t even welcome us. I’m sure you can review the cameras. The bartender in the reception didn’t make us feel welcome. She was as very slow serving. Also, the chips were stale.

I visited this hotel for a business conference. The hotel is located in the parking lot of a mall and across the street from Target.  There a plenty of food choices within walking distance (including the mall food court).  Check in was pretty smooth  and I found the hotel parking, on a weekday to be plentiful without minutes wasted searching for a spot.   The lobby has been updated along with the atrium restaurant.  The room itself is characteristically spacious of a embassy suites.  The room was updated the only area that showed some age was the bathroom.  The tub had cracks between the tile and the tub and there were signs of wear in the pitting etc on the floor of the tub.  The bathroom is rather small, there is only one sink and counter.  If the room had 4+ adults it would

This Embassy Suites was the perfect location and just 11 minutes drive from Disneyland.  It was surrounded by walking distance restaurants and a Target right across the street.  Not to mention it adjoins a full-blown mall!  We thouroghly enjoyed our stay at this hotel that included a complimentary breakfast buffet with a made-to-order omelet bar and nightly manager's reception with complimentary drinks and snacks.  It was nice to be a distance apart from the hustle and bustle immediately surrounding Disneyland, but still a close drive away.

Great location. Always a great BREAKFAST  OUTSTANDINGFront staff  IDEAL location for any occasion, room large and well appointedbath room spotless and well stocked !!!!!! !Even the coffee and bottled water  pleasetly surprise

When visiting the Brea area, Embassy Suites is our first choice. The rooms are clean, beds clean and comfortable, and the staff always friendly and helpful. We also look forward to the delicious hot breakfast in the mornings.

Summary Heading: Stayed here Many times for work.
Summary: Rooms need updating. Clean, good parking, great BKFST. Air and heating are central and do not always match settings.  Location to mall and food and other services very good. I never use the restaurant since so many good options get me out for the evening dining if I need.

Spent one night here with family. Was able to check in early which was nice. Rooms had recently been renovated. Very nice. Had a drink at Managers Reception which was pleasant and uncrowded. Breakfast was very filling. Beds were comfy.  Embassy Suites can't be beat for quality and price.

Summary Heading: Rounding up to a 5 for Corri
Summary: The hotel is a standard Embassy Suites, which is impressive for the amenities (free parking, free breakfast, happy hour, etc.). The location is perfect, located near the Nixon Library (where we visited), and next to the mall. It's a beautiful property, with a nice pool. The only downside is the shower head, which was the saddest trickle of water that I've experienced in recent memory. So why is it a "5?" It goes back to Corri at the front desk, who communicated with me prior to, during, and even after the stay to check on our satisfaction. She was able to accommodate an early check-in, which was helpful as we had just flown in the morning of our arrival to LA/Brea. Service made a big difference here, and Corri is a terrific ambassador of the Embassy Suites / Hilton brand.

Held a business meeting here and then stayed on.  It was a great home away from home.  They pamper their guests and greet you like you're a friend.  The business services are handled in a professional manner with attention to detail. The food at the breakfast is good, though repetitive if you stay for several days. Lots of space to meet with clients or coworkers. Overall a calm, restful, well maintained hotel and it would be a pleasure to visit again.

Hotel worked for us by giving reasonable access to LA and relatively quiet location with nearby restaurants. The staff was friendly and efficient. The living room of our suite could use some updates but overall the room was comfortable. No additional charges for parking. We enjoyed the omelets at breakfast and the guest reception our first night.

Summary Heading: Very nice, and close to everything
Summary: The hotel was accomodating for an early check in. The room was very clean, they gave us the top floor,with a good view of the mountains.  The rate was excellent. The hotel is next to the Curtis theater, Brea Mall, and not far from the freeway. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Overall stay very pleasant, room spacious, breakfast is okay also. Near the mall and target store which is also a plus. Will return to this hotel. We dIdn’t mind the travel from hotel to disney anaheim. Pretty close by. No need to use freeway.

The hotel was great and very clean. It was just few minutes away from the office. Staying at the hotel was great. Room was very clear, staff was very friendly. Breakfast, lunch and dinner was great and the staff was very helpful.

My father passed away New Year’s Eve 2014. Hard to celebrate. But it was a nice stay regardless. Love the layout of most Embassy suites, spacious n I like the basic amenities like fridges n microwaves. Other hotel chains an arm n a leg and they do not even have such amenities or there’s an extra charge if you need microwave or fridge.

The hotel is clean updated personnel is very friendly breakfast is awesome. My only complaint that I have is when I ordered Room service there is 3 different prices for the grilled Turkey   avocado club. Was charged $14.00 when the menu on the desk said $12.00 and the book in the room says $13.00. Need to update the prices, very misleading to your customers.

Worked for our family of 7.  The rooms are a bit dated, they could be cleaner, and the staff could be nicer and more accommodating (especially at the restaurant with sub-par food).  But the location was perfect for keeping the kids entertained, the mall and tons of restaurants were in walking distance, Disney was 20 minutes away.  I wouldn’t stay for a romantic getaway but it’s great for a family trip.

We had a family wedding at the Embassy Suites in Brea.  The venue was chosen for the location originally.  The Embassy Suites made our stay extra special and the coordination of the wedding was phenomenal. Thank you Embassy Suites!

I was lucky enough to be here during the holidays. This was so beautifully decorated.  I had the King Suite, I just love the space in this room. I tried the digital key for the first time and have to say I didn't like it at all. It sounds great, but was a pain. You have to open the app activate the key scan it in the elevator to get to your floor and of course again for your room. I get it, it's for safety,  but I won't use it again. If your phone is dead or low you have a problem.. stick to the traditional key card. They also have a nice complimentary breakfast.

When we first entered the lobby was gorgeously decorated and captivated my attention. In regards to checking the older gentlemen that helped me was very warm, pleasant, and friendly, was given the unfortunate news that there was no executive lounge in that hotel. As we headed to our room I noticed there were plates of food left out in the lobby and we checked in around 1AM! Remember perception is key. Also noticed the elevators looked a little run down and could use some repainting. The suite was nice however I felt the toilet wasn't thoroughly cleaned (Especially on the inside) and didn't use it for that reason. The complimentary breakfast was sufficent, however I do not eat pork and there was no other meat alternative. Called front desk to see if 2pm late check out was

Suites on 7th floor were awesome. The lobby was gorgeous and immaculate. The breakfast was better than most restaurant quality and worth paying for.  Check in and check out process was super easy.  Definitely coming back.

This hotel is very convenient to shopping and work. The food is excellent and so is the service. The shuttle is such a perk too. Even the fitness center is big and is a pleasure to use. I have been a regular here and it is nice to see the employees. They must be treated well. The same ones have been here for years

I'm very upset that I have to write a bad review for this place because the hotel itself was very nice.  My friend booked and paid for 2 rooms here, one for her and one for me and my boyfriend.  During my stay I drank ONE water bottle from our room, and when we checked out, my boyfriend paid for the water bottle at the front desk.  He paid in cash and didn't get a receipt.  He asked the front desk girl "Are you SURE you won't charge it to the room?" and she replied that she won't and she'll even write a note saying that the water bottle was paid.  Well she either POCKETED that money or she screwed up because my friend ended up getting charged for TWO water bottles on her credit card.  There are two things wrong here- not only did we get charged for the water bottle again, but we

Thank you for the lovely accommodations. We had a great time and slept great. Beautiful hotel. Will definitely be back every holiday season. Location was perfect and was located right across from the exquisite Brea Mall ! thank you !!!!!

Summary Heading: Rooms great; front counter staff awful
Summary: Front counter person was rude, uncaring, and unprofessional.  No eye contact, did not care that my room was not ready (after 1.5 hours late check-in).  Did not greet me with a smile or go over any local or hotel information.  Seemed like she did not care about her job, like she didn't want to be there.

While the accommodations and service my vary from Embassy Suites to Embassy Suites, the Brea - North location is always an excellent experience. The staff is always professional, helpful, and timely. The complimentary breakfast always has an expanded selection with superior quality

Summary Heading: Stayed here for a close by wedding
Summary: Overall the staff and hotel was great. They had a wonderful breakfast and the pool and spa was great for the kids. The rooms were spacious, however they could use updating. Overall they worked great, I just felt the bathrooms were really small and dark. There were a few cracks in the sink and toilet which made it feel worn in. But that was my only complaint.

The hotel staff were lovely people. From check in, housekeeping, restaurant and room service I was made to feel welcomed and at ease. It was a quick weekend getaway. I had work to do and since we do not have a pool at home this is what we treated ourselves to. Win. Win.

The hotel is nice right by a lot of things but if you were planning on someone sleeping on the bed don't it's terrible. Traveled with my son we had to switch from a king suite to 2 doubles and share the bedroom area as the sofa bed was very thin and one could feel the metal rails and springs.

Greeting by staff was great. Room service food and service was excellent. Room was spacious and clean. The breakfast was excellent and the serving area was spacious and comfortable. The breakfast staff were friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: The Best Embassey Suites that we've been to!!
Summary: My wife and I have stayed at other Embassey Suites and this one takes the cake!! Friendly front desk , clean rooms. breakfast serves the best omelets and service was great! Always a pleasure!! Highly recommend!!

Summary Heading: If to need a local hotel...
Summary: This place is getting a bit past its better years, but its still serves a valid purpose. I stay here because its close to my business ventures and I'm Hilton Honors. On this visit, the omelet maker made good omlets.  The melon is as usual, not ripe.

Summary Heading: Well Located Hotel; Worked Well for Family Gathering (but see the note below about breakfast service)
Summary: Preliminary note: I would have rated this hotel as "Average (3 star)" but ended up with "Poor (2 star)" because of the food incident noted below. That was so egregious that I could not in good faith give a higher rating.  We selected this hotel as part of a family wedding gathering in the area. The hotel worked fine with multiple family members and its location next to a major mall. While this is an older, atrium-style hotel that we generally don't like, the hotel was updated somewhat so it worked well for accommodations.   ONE MAJOR COMPLAINT, though--one of our group members ended up with glass shards in his scrambled eggs. While the hotel ultimately addressed this issues (by comping a number of rooms), they restaurant staff initially downplayed the incident and did not remove

Nice hotel next to mall with several dinning options.  Hotel had free parking which was nice.  Free breakfast and room had double queen beds with extra room with a couch to accommodate sleeping five people nicely

We stayed here for one night before going to Disneyland. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. It still has the courtyard with the stream and fish. Unfortunately, so many Embassy Suites have gone away from the Atrium. I love the ambience of this environment. The cooked to order breakfast was great. Lots of food choices. It is adjacent to the Brea Mall which is a huge plus. There are lots of restaurants close by. There's a Target across the street in case you've forgotten something. I would gladly stay here again.

I really enjoyed this Embassy Suites.  The location is close all sorts of retail needs.  In addition, there is plenty of close by parking in the garage located beneath the hotel, free of charge.  The staff was super friendly and very professional.  Cheers.

The room was good but the property had trays and other room service items left overnight outside the rooms. The made to order breakfast was not good at all. The method of fixing the breakfast was not very good. The method of fixing the omelettes was very different and did not taste very good.

Great hotel!  Excellent service!  My suite was very clean with a breathtaking view of the City of Brea.  The quality and variety of items offered at the Daily Complimentary Breakfast were fantastic.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody. Breakfast were excellent.  I would gladly recommend this hotel to anybody.

This hotel is in a great location, plenty of restaurants nearby, very safe area to walk for exercise too. Convenient to freeway and john wayne airport too. Next to a mall. Hotel is updated and clean and bright.

So where do I start? My family and I have been remodeling since July 19th and we decided to stay at the beautiful Brea Embassy Suittes Hilton. We made the best decision! My husband, 21yr old daughter, and 11 year old son stayed there from July 19th until September 28th. My daughter and I are so sad about that! We miss everyone! Vanessa, Devin, Juan, Allen, Sara, Yesenia, and others made our stay so amazing! I don’t remember everyone’s names but the kind man that walks the property and checks on everyone, the sweet ladies that work at the omelette station, all the cleaning crews, the evening reception bartenders! Honestly they all made us feel like family and were so warm, gracious, accommodating, and I know what I’m talking about because I’ve stayed at many 5 star resorts! My

Summary Heading: Plumbing and bed issues - Never going back.
Summary: It wasn't enough that we had to deal with a death in the family and as such needed an impromptu hotel stay to attend the funeral events but upon 1 hour from check-in and one shower the shower backed up.  Maintenance attended to it but it continue to be a problem our entire stay.  The pull out beds were so uncomfortable it was as if they had not replaced them in years.  Just very disappointed and it made our life that more worse .

I'd give them five stars, except that we were part of a group with reservations made by a company that directs a ton of business to the Embassy, and they walked one of our group because they were oversold. So, had to go to Fullerton for a night and then come back. You don't do that with your best customers.  There's not a lot of competition in Brea. This hotel has a very good location adjacent to the mall and across the street from Target. Everything you need!  Breakfast here is better than at many Embassy's. good selection, plenty of room in the dining area (at least at 7:00; they warn you about busy times).  The room is nice. Quiet. Signature two-room suite. Very dark, though, as there is no exterior window to the living area (at least in room 302 that is not part of the

This is a wonderful property in a prime location. Plenty of things to do within walking distance. I will use this location every time I'm in Brea for work. I give this property my highest recommendation!

Clean, modern, friendly, helpful staff, they send you off with a wonderful breakfast and help you relax with a great happy hour. Suites are very comfortable. Hotel’s location is perfect. Adjacent to shopping and restaurants. Police are next door if you need them. Lots of parking.

This hotel is great! From free parking in a convenient underground garage, to the nightly reception, to the cleanliness of rooms, this hotel was an excellent choice for my business travel. The staff was extremely helpful, and made check in and check out a breeze! I’m looking forward to returning in December for another business trip.

This visit was actually the 2nd time I stayed at this hotel, and I truly enjoyed the ambiance and the overall vibe of this place. My sister, niece, mum, wife and myself stayed in one of the suites and it was great. The breakfast was really good, the only recommendation I would have is for more options for vegans, and the staff was friendly and welcoming. Another great thing about this hotel is that it is literally across the street from a very nice mall, and there are tons of food and shopping optiohs you can take advantage of within walking range. The next time we are in Brea, this hotel will always be at the top of our choices!

Terrible customer service, front desk receptionist seemed engaged in her own personal life rather than helping guests. Breakfast was the best part of the entire stay. Worst hotel service I had during my 7 day trip in California.

Great stay. Staff was  helpful and our room was very clean and was ready on time. Happy hour at Reataurant/bar was great.  Variety of snacks. Fresh. Everything was very nice.  We will defiantly be back again soon!

Looking for a Hilton in the Anaheim area?   This Embassy Suites was great.  New, rooms are very nice and comfortable.  Breakfast won't disappoint you.  the pool and hot tub were great.  Location is so perfect.  Mall on one side, department stores on the other and freeway close by

The hotel is welcoming and the banquet buffet was amazingly delicious. Entree were unique and vegetables dishes were original and the variety was great! The chicken was poached and was moist and extremely flavorful. Desserts ran the gamit from chocolate cake to key lime pie.

I enjoyed my stay for a convention at this hotel.  All rooms are suites which included a refrigerator.  My room was very clean and spacious.  I enjoyed complimentary happy hours and breakfast which was delicious with a variety of items. There is a fine restaurant in the hotel with good food. The rooms have outside/indoor entrances which overlook the atrium. The front desk employees were friendly and professional.  Parking is free.   Best of all was the location.  The hotel is surrounded by a shopping mall and many restaurants within walking distance.   It is a bit pricey but I would not hesitate to stay again whenever I am in the area.

The service was great and the continental breakfast was one of the better ones that are offered. Hot fresh food not just pastries which was good for us and preparing for a busy day. The kids loved the pool. The beds were clean.   My only complaints are that the room maintenance was not taken care of they way it should have been. The carpet had a huge stain that they attempted to clean again after we called about it - it didn’t come up so the carpet was wet for 2 days. The lamp shades looked dirty. The door stopper was broken and laying in middle of the entry way floor - my child tripped on it when walking into the room. We booked the room for a family of 5 but had to request additional towels as they only stocked it with 3 (each day we had to request additional towels).

I always enjoy Embassy Suites for their complimentary happy hour and breakfast.  Nice option for business travel.  This particular hotel is steps away from the Brea mall which is nice when you don't have a car.

Many of the lamps did not work. The outlets ..most had no electrical current, specifically the outlet in the bathroom did not work. We had to complete bathroom hygiene in the kitchen area. housekeeping did not clean the room. We had to request for the bathroom to be cleaned and request clean towels.

It’s been a few years since I stayed here and I think the renovation of the public areas is very nice. The lobby, bar, and restaurant all look fresh and open.  I found the rooms to be very standard and one thing that really bothered me was the lack of adequate lighting. In the bedroom, the only light was on the nightstand between the two beds-one lamp with a single switch so if both beds are in use, the light is either on or off; no option for one on/one off. NO light over the smaller mirror in the bedroom.  There is NO hanging light over the ‘desk’ in the front room. Only a very small table lamp.  One thing that hasn’t changed and I’ve always disliked about this Embassy Suites is the parking situation. While there is no fee for parking, you must park in an underground garage.

It is great to be in a two room suite while traveling, especially when I'm in a hotel for more than one night.  The room was well designed with space for doing work and for relaxing.  The staff was highly accomodating to my dietary needs - I'm keto, vegetarian - and the banquet staff was able to get a vegetable plate for me.

Very pleasant stay. Excellent front desk staff. Very clean. Housekeeping staff was wonderful: accommodating and our room was immaculate. Restaurant was very good and the staff were outstanding. The complimentary breakfast was an outstanding value.

We wanted to stay somewhere close to Anaheim to do a little shopping, this Embassy is located right next door to the mall. Loved the location, enjoyed the amenities, the buffet breakfast was superior, rooms were grand!

I’ve stayed at many Embassy Suites and this one did not measure up. My biggest disappointments were the awful smell in my room and the lack of support at breakfast to help clear tables for guests to eat at. I also follow the pillows to be very uncomfortable as they were completely flat.

Very nice hotel. Great breakfast. The only thing is the pool and spa is small and was very crowded, but not a big deal. The room was nice and the bed was comfortable. Big breakfast area so you dont have to worry about finding a table. Overall very nice place.

Great place for family and lots of fun and nearby restaurants, movies, beach...Eating, eating and eating....breakfast was included and did not disappoint! We woke to great smelling food and coffee, juice, milk, fruits etc

This old real estate quote is very applicable here. This site has all of the amenities that one would want to enjoy a pleasant stay, even with mountains of kids who attend the surrounding attractions. Besides the main local attractions, the shopping mall, the Brea  downtown,and the bar and grills are plentiful. The rooms are adequate and the smart features with the room lighting and elevators is appreciated. You will mostly appreciate the friendly staff, the complimentary happy hour, as well as the comprehensive breakfast. Well why not give five stars? Being a retired career educator, giving  the top score leaves no room for improvement.  My suggestions to management I will include under the section "staff meeting". Otherwise you can't go wrong selecting this property for your

Summary Heading: The most comfortable hotel in Brea
Summary: The hotel is wonderful and clean the staff is very helpful and attentive the rooms are clean and are up to par as a hotel that is expected to be.  the local area is very quiet and very convenient and having the local shopping venues nearby.

I typically love staying at Embassy Suites and drove a little further out of the way to stay here because of that.  Wasted a free weekend night on a room that smelled.  Receptionist offered to have someone spray the room before we packed our bags and went to the front desk.  Omelette bar was great but that was about it.  Food wasn’t being replaced in a timely manner and tables weren’t being cleaned.

We stayed, with another couple, two nights in June. We were attending a wedding near the hotel....very convenient. It’s a beautiful hotel with complimentary WIFI, parking, happy hour and a very nice, full on breakfast. Nice people working check in. The only complaint I have is the traffic from delivery trucks during the night (our room was across from the mall parking lot) We also had a difficult time trying to get our room cleaned and restocked by a decent hour. After 3 phone calls to the front desk, someone arrived at 5:30 pm. Inconvenient when you need to shower and dress for dinner 😣

Another perfect stay at this Embassy Suites with a friendly staff. We arrived a bit early, a couple of hours, and Juan promptly checked us in! We got a nice clean room on the 7th floor. The included hot breakfast was very good, the omelette station very efficient. The free parking is always good here. And the location next to the Brea mail and across from the Target, close to the highway and main streets is great.

I have stayed at this location a very long time ago, since they've done a total renovation I feel the hotel has went above and beyond it's almost like staining a brand-new hotel. The room was very clean and quiet, air conditioner worked very well front desk service was excellent. This hotel is located right next to the Brea mall which is within walking distance there is also a food court there at the mall if that interest you. There are other restaurants within walking and driving distance many options to choose from. They look like they've made many upgrades in the hotel in many areas from the breakfast area to the weight room. They re-done all of the rooms and brought the hotel up to a newer style away from the old Egyptian pyramid style that it once was. Great job highly

Front desk was so welcoming and helpful when I arrived after a long and stressful day of travel. Facility is beautiful and great location. The evening reception had nice selection of snacks and beverages.  I’d definitely stay here again.

Loved this hotel and loved that the mall was right across the street.  Breakfast was great and food selection was great.    Front staff were very friendly and accommodating.  And the swimming pool and hot tub were perfect.

This location cares about their guests!!   The facility is well maintained and rooms are renovated and clean.  A+ stay !!  The breakfast is cooked to order or buffett style with items that are fresh, hot and quality!!

Hotel was close to mall and many restaurants were within walking distance for business trip dinners.  Breakfast at Embassy Suites is always great!  Bathroom showed little signs of age and wear, but room was very clean and spacious.

Summary Heading: Great Suites for a Great Price
Summary: Walking into the hotel you can see the vast array of rooms and doors when looking up. In the middle is the breakfast area and a nice water centerpiece. The suites are very nice and there is a living room with a small fridge and sink. The rooms feel spacious and the ceilings are relatively high. Great experience staying here and I would highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay for families (Just be sure to put all names on the room)
Summary: I book Embassy Suites when I travel with family due ot the large rooms and home-like environment. I didn't put my daughters name on the room and she was unable to get in after hours due to the security policy at the hotel. While I appreciate the policy to make sure I am secure, it left my daughter out in the cold after her graduation. Note to self: always list all parties on the room.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with a great staff.   They welcome you from the moment you check in, greet you with a  smile everytime
Summary: The hotel is the only one we stay at when in Brea. Great hotel, staff greets you with a smile and thru out your stay every staff member always greets you with a smile and more important, they remember you.

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay in the OC
Summary: Great location close to everything in the OC. Beautiful spacious rooms, great parkibg near room elevators and made our family visit feel like we were at home. The staff were like family and made our visit so comfortable. Like we never left home. Thank you and will definitively be back soon.

I always have fun at embassy suites. get to meet new people and enjoy the food and drinks every day. the beds are so comfortable and the pillows always feel great. the happy hour in the bar is awsome and always sets the rest of the night off.

It was perfect located. Near supermarket,huge mall and  plenty restaurant. Almost walking distance. Room was a bit dated but bed was really comfy. Bathroom was quite Stallone but clean. Complimantery breakfeast was typically american breakfeast not  much. Overall, we like it and would like to stay again.

The location makes up for the aging property.  Haven't stayed in an Embassy since 10 yrs ago in Chicago, which was really nice.  We stay in Hiltons several times a year.  The parking conveniently located below the hotel.  The front desk staff very pleasant.  The breakfast as expected, the social evening hour a one star.  The staff not friendly, not unfriendly just not smiley friendly people.  I felt like I was putting the guy out who had to pour my club soda.  Very uncomfortable.  The Brea Mall is right next door, has lots of restaurants and coffee...wont stay here on next visit, but might stay in the Embassy elsewhere again.

The hotel rooms are spacious and bed was very comfortable. There are two seperate rooms (bedroom and sitting room). The complementary breakfast has a variety of options ranging from fresh omelets to pastries. The restaurant has a parking garage and many stalls are for compact cars. This was perfect for me but be aware if you have a larger vehicle. There are many restaurants nearby and within walking distance. All staff was very friendly and provided great service whenever I needed something.

Great experience in Brea.  Hotel location was perfect and easily accessed. Staff was great and texted us to make sure our stay was going well. Parking was easy.  Breakfast was always good and buffet changed a little from day to day.

We came in for a conference and arrived the same day, so we were very early for check-in, but the staff got us checked in early so we could put down our luggage and change before the conference started which was so helpful!

Our grandson's wedding in Brea included 6 adult family members plus other family members from Seattle area.  We were in close   proximity and were able to easily connect for joint activities. Our rooms were large, well lit and very comfortable, close to elevators. Staff was friendly/ helpful with transportation, they offered free shuttle within  within 5 mile radius, .  Loved it, will stay there again!

Summary Heading: Lovely place to stay very well-maintained and a great staff plus great for families with children for breakfast
Summary: Especially nice if you have children because of the free breakfast and me adults would enjoy the happy hour in the bar where you can watch sports and other things on the TV    The pool and the hot tub are very nice also

Embassy Suites never fail us!!! The breakfast is always great. Staff is amazing!! Free Happy Hour you can't go wrong!! Room was clean and very quiet. Bed was soft we slept like babies! Check in was fast and efficient.

We stayed here in room 637. The mattress was horrible. It was so worn the head of the bed was lower than the foot. It was also terribly lumpy. I had to pull off the covers and sleep on the bed reverse. Thinking it’s time for a remodel. There was also some sort of splat on the bathroom door. Perhaps someone threw their beverage?
