The happy hour snacks left quite a bit to be desired. I can get chips and Chex mix across the street at Target. So we went there and got cheese and crackers along with a veggie tray.  On the plus side parking was free and the breakfast was decent.

Very good for business travel. Good home base for family activities in the area. Close to shopping and restaurants. Great for underground parking. Has laundry, pool and Gym. Did not use the restaurant but looks busy.

Gotta love when you find a hotel with free parking! The supervisor checked me in, he was very friendly and outgoing! This is actually the second time i stay here, i love the room size, so roomy, and the balcony is nice that you can actually open it. Will def be returning.

Summary Heading: Great service, quick check-in, fast room service
Summary: The service at this hotel was really great. The people at the front desk were very accommodating. My room was clean, towels well stocked and the lotion smelled amazing. Room service was uber fast! I recommend this location.

Happy hour, breakfast, room everything is wonderful only bummer was pool was freezing cold at least they have a nice hot tub. Next to mall and across the street from Target, grocery store, tons of restaurants. Can open the doors on the upper floors to get fresh air inside. Nice place.

Summary Heading: Really nice hotel, esp Lobby and next to Shopping centre
Summary: We loved it here, the inside of the hotel is square looking down onto a lovely lobby with water fountains. A piano is there for the pianist. The rooms excellent, free breakfast excellent, service excellent, location excellent, free happy hour excellent. Free parking. It is now a favourite to return to. Price excellent too. Great place.

Summary Heading: Great lobby and atrium, great breakfast and staff, room #635 NOT SO GREAT
Summary: We have stayed here before.  It was 2 years earlier, room was okay then even though they were doing a huge atrium renovation.  Rooms according to the manager I spoke to said the rooms were updated in 2016, so that is not newly renovated, that was 3 years ago now.  This time, we stop here when in this So Cal area to visit family close by.  I would like to start by saying you might have had a good stay and great room.  This one room was not so great for us.  Devon the Manager tried to help after a week, my husbands jacket that he tried to call and retrieve is now gone.  Bummer, he called the same day we checked out..........................it was hanging inside the closet.  The room we were put into was 635, just curious if anyone else complained about the bathroom faucets not

We had a 75 person pre-wedding reception as well as many wedding party members stay at the hotel fort the weekend. The entire staff was outstanding, both in planning the event and the evening of the reception.I received many positive comments on the quality of the food. We had many out of town guests and all were impressed with the facility and the staff. I would highly recommend this facility and staff for any event.

My bf had a business trip here and they put us up in the Embassy Suites. I had no clue how nice this place would turn out to be. The staff was friendly and welcoming, our room was very spacious with the extra room with the little kitchen area and table, couch and tv. The property was very clean and surprisingly quiet. It's located off a major street and across a small street from the mall.   I loved the breakfast here and ate way more than I should have but it was all so good. This isn't one of those places that advertises breakfast and has those awful waffles and powdered eggs. There are a few stations set up, you can have the bread selections, but they also have omelets and sides, along with fruit and other items. The coffee was great, surprising, I am very picky about my

this hotel exceeded our expectation for room and services.  We attended a wedding in the area and liked the room, and breakfast options.  We also attended a reception at the hotel which was very well done.

Summary Heading: Updated ES but not like what is pictured
Summary: My last stay at an Embassy Suites (another location) prompted the title "Are all Embassy Suites Dated?". Well, I will give this location credit for having had a major overhaul from their original corporate design. It is much more contemporary. Unfortunately, IMO, the update did not go deep enough. The aesthetics are nice but the bones (bathrooms, etc.) are still in need of help. Old toilets and plumbing. Very poor TV service. Bed was hard and linens were of poor quality. Lobby is nice, breakfast was fresh and plentiful and staff was friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Ask about room prior to accepting key
Summary: Ask about room prior to accepting key. 2nd floor with view if parking  lot was not the kind of room expected for the $$$. I paid for first class flight tickets expecting the same kind of room. Great location with view of snow cap mountains but got the mall parking lot. Not good.

Very attractive lobby and rooms but really serious deficiency in handicapped parking so anyone disabled must walk too far to reach elevators.  Parking area also spooky and deserted feeling, especially at Night.

Friday night couples celebrating a birthday! Perfect location from downtown Fullerton restaurants and clubs to Uber. Embassy Suites never disappoint great room size and great breakfast. Definitely coming back to this hotel!

I have stayed here three times, the longest for over 10 days on one visit.  I enjoy the amenities of breakfast and evening managers reception,  breakfast is a great way to start my day!   The gym is modern and open 24 hrs.  The pool is not heated or at least didn’t feel like it, but the area is clean and appealing looking.  Some rooms have been updated and they did a wonderful job, they are working their way through the property.  I enjoy the flora around the hotel area and centre next door.  I look forward to my next stay, I hope it’s soon.

Summary Heading: Wanted To Love It, But Didn’t.
Summary: This is the fourth time we’ve stayed at this property. I have reviewed it three other times. The first two stays were amazing, then they started a remodel, we stayed during the remodel and it was awful, so we decided to try it again now that the remodel is complete.   The lobby is absolute gorgeous. The hotel is in one of the most convenient locations a hotel could be in, and the staff was much friendlier this time around, but that’s where the pros end.   One thing I have always liked about Embassy Suites is the windows which look out into the atrium, this ES decided to install cheap, shower-door looking forest glass in place of the windows, it looks tacky and now one cannot see out into the hotel.   The rooms did not get a legitimate remodel, they just painted and tossed in new

This is the only hotel we chose to stay at when in The northern OC. The location is perfect, easy freeway access, adjacent to a mall, and a variety of quality restaurants with in a mile.  The staff here is always professional and efficient. We choose Embassy Suites for a reason and this one in particular exceeds our expectations.

My uncle held my aunt's celebration of life in 3 banquet rooms at this hotel. They did an excellent job helping my uncle set up. Our room was very comfortable. The only negative thing was there was a long, black hair on the bathroom ceiling. The staff was very nice and helpful, both at check in and departure. Also, they have the BEST continental breakfast I have ever seen. The property is conveniently located by a mall, with a ton of restaurant selections if you want/need to leave. My husband and daughter had lunch in their restaurant, which was good, except my daughter's grilled cheese was burnt on the outside. My husband just scraped it off. I would definitely stay here again!

Very comfortable and conveniently located near shopping, restaurants, and grocery/drug stores.  Clean and spacious suites, and a very friendly staff!  Complimentary breakfast and parking were plusses I wasn't counting on, but appreciated.

As a Southern California Manufacturer we bring in clients for Factory Tours and Training. This time I brought in 10 people for training and this hotel was very accommodating. The Hotel has a great breakfast Buffett to start our days but more important was they had enough space for all of us to sit together. The location is terrific and staff was very friendly.

Summary Heading: Not quite great but very good
Summary: Rooms need some updating, at least mine needed new carpeting and furniture . Breakfast was very good , restaurant seemed over whelmed with the bar area so close.  My room was noisy on Monday morning, grass cutting noise I believe

It’s so wonderful to have a great hotel like this Embassy Suites so close to home. They have a wonderful happy hour where Jesse and Kim make you feel so welcome. The rooms are spacious and jacuzzi, pool are heated and grounds kept so clean. It’s attached to the Brea Mall so shopping is convenient

Embassy suites Brea Is a great location and beautiful hotel!  The staff is very nice and attentive. Complementary Breakfast & evening drinks a great touch too! Rooms are spacious, beds comfortable! Can’t wait to return

We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. Clean rooms and nice service. The pool and the hot tub were great. Parking was free and the hotel is very close to everything. Plenty of places to eat and shop around. Breakfast was very tasty.

I recently stayed at Embassy Suites over New Year's as I was in town for The Tournament Of Roses Parade.  Room was spacious and clean and staff was very friendly.  A great central location if you are visiting several different areas while in LA.  Highly recommend!

I would stay here again! The rooms are very spacious with kind of a separate living room / entrance area. The hotel is quiet and just next to Brea Mall and some dinner places and bars.  If you look for having breakfast or even halfboard at the hotel, I wouldn‘t recommend it. The food has the quality of a canteen and also breakfast looks more like in a fast food place.

Great staff and rooms!  Rooms were not the newest but they were nice and clean.  Location across from the mall was very convienet for a weekend stay.  Didn't use the evening reception were the snacks looked like chips and a dip.  Would have liked to see some healthy snack options.

The Hotel Staff  members were always very friendly and professional. The accommodations were clean, well-layed out, and comfortable.It was nice being able to leave the room and go down to a breakfast that was good and had a variety of choices.

When we arrived we been in our room about 25 minutes when I stepped out of the bathroom without my slippers I stepped into a puddle of water in the carpet was soaking wet, I had noticed a drop in the bathtub and some black substance and was going to report it and then I stepped into the puddle upon closer inspection I saw a black mold on the carpet and on the wall. We called the front desk who gave us a new room 25 minutes later, and they sent up someone to look at the mold who stated that must’ve been there for quite some time and housekeeping should’ve reported it. I don’t know if I the rooms have this Issue but I certainly wouldn’t want to chance it. The cleanliness of the room besides the mold was fine but I wouldn’t stay there again just for the simple fact that mold had

Summary Heading: Used to love this place - no more
Summary: I used to love the convenience of this hotel and the decent service, though prices were always a bit on the high side. However, after decades of business association, we recently had a nasty experience. An employee got sick and we tried to cancel her room reservation 30 hours before scheduled arrival. No dice, first night's fee forfeited - at $205 a night, no less!!! The manager strictly applied the new Hilton 48-hour cancellation policy, which we only learned about in the context of this cancellation attempt. He gave NO consideration to our decades-long business relationship with this hotel. I felt we were absolutely NOT treated as valued customers, and therefore, we will take our business elsewhere in the future. They won their battle and got their $205 for zero service this

Summary Heading: Love everything except the back ache
Summary: We have used Embassey Suites since 1998 and have always loved it. They’re always clean, have fantastic ammenties and nice extras like the complementary breakfast and room snacks.  I would easily give this review a perfect rating if it wasn’t for the horrible back aches we woke up with every day.  The beds are terribly uncomfortable and we didn’t get a single good night sleep the three nights we were there.  This is the one in Brea CA.  We’ve never had this problem before so I don’t know if they’re using different mattresses since the remodel.

I booked the Embassy Suites in Brea in November 2018 since it was close to my wedding venue and for the suites that would help with getting ready for my wedding day. Rooms were adequate size for my bridesmaids and makeup artists to work and get ready in.    After a long day of wedding festivities and celebrations, I was looking forward to resting in the hotel room. However, when my now husband and I came back to our room, it was not serviced or cleaned by housekeeping. The towels were still on the floor which we wanted them to change out. We left the room around 2pm which they should have had enough time to service. This was frustrating as we were already tired from the wedding and it was already 12am when we arrived and the room was not cleaned. Luckily one of my bridesmaid

We visited family over the Thanksgiving Holiday and found the hotel exterior to be in very good shape, as well as the lobby area, however, the room was very dated.  The carpet needed to be replaced, the cottage cheese ceilings needed to be scraped and painted, as well as  paint for the walls.  Bathroom fixtures need to be updated.  The bed was comfortable and we slept well.  The staff was friendly and professional.  Great location near shopping and restaurants.

This is Embassy is very nice, and located close to places to shop or eat.  It's also about 10 miles from Angel Stadium.  We have stayed here several times and it has always met our expectation of Hilton properties.  This time the breakfast was not up to par as in the past.  Otherwise great place to stay.

The hotel is a nice venue.  The breakfast is good and the rooms are nice.  The atrium can get loud if there is a function going on , but the rooms are well soundproofed. Parking was free and ample. Afternoon reception is a nice touch
Manager Response: Thank you 59christo59 for taking the time to review your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We strive to allow all of our guests to have a comfortable and uninterrupted stay with us, so your comments are very valuable to us at this time. We really hope you will return to visit us again soon! All the best. Team Embassy Suites Brea

Summary: This hotel was in a good location for us to visit our daughter at college.  Has a mall and shopping right by it.  Restaurants near as well.  The public area looked nice and fresh.  The rooms do look like they need the popcorn ceilings redone and updated. But our room was clean, beds and pillows comfortable.  I would stay here again.

This was a nice hotel, with freindly staff right near the mall. It seems like that might detract, but it doesn’t plus it’s a nice mall and you’ll appreciate the convenience if you forget something. The room was nice, modern style with good solid furniture and nothing too fancy. Our room smelled faintly musty, but it was a minor issue in what was otherwise a pleasant stay. The breakfast was okay overall, the sausage and potatoes stood out, the scrambled eggs where kinda “meh” but the provided pico di gallo made them edible. The waffles were stale, but the coffee runs endlessly, as does the cream and sugar. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, and I would come back, and encourage other to stay here.

This hotel is in a great location for shops and eatery’s. Hotel over all was accommodating and clean. The bed was comfortable with clean linens. Bathroom was clean. Living area with table and small kitchenette was functional. Only thing I would recommend would be to steam clean or shampoo the carpets because there were a few stains in the living area and bedroom.   We checked in through the app and was able to pick our room as well as ask for additional items like towels and blankets. Such and easy process to check in and out. I literally didn’t have to speak to anyone at the front desk.   All and all I would stay here again.

The hotel is across the street from the Brea Mall. Off in the other direction is a strip mall with a Target. Our suite was large and you could close off the bedroom and have guests in the front. There was a TV in both sections and the front included a mini-frig, microwave, and coffee maker. The suite was clean and orderly as would be expected. There is complementary breakfast with a cook making omelets to order with over a dozen ingredients offered. There is also an evening reception but we did not attend. The staff was polite and helpful. Security is apparently important as you must use your room key card to have the elevator go above the lobby level. Although they don't  change the linen but every three days, housekeeping will still come in and make the beds, clean the

Summary Heading: I will come back to this Embassy Suite again
Summary: The staff at the front desk were fantastic, helpful, friendly, and helpful. Especially Joanna. But the evening reception is not as good as other Hilton's chains or similar chains that offer evening receptions. Still it is acceptable.

Overpriced for room and smelled musty, great location but not a good deal for your money.  The location was great right across the street from the brea mall and on the other side the target shopping center

Summary Heading: Great place to stay next to the Brea Mall
Summary: Great location to the Brea Mall with many restaurants near by to choose from.  Close to downtown Brea with a ton of restaurants.  Free parting underground. free cook to order breakfast and a great manager reception. Try it.

Second time here and as I have seen so far everything is very well maintained even though it had been renovated. Staff is attentive and friendly. However this time around my digital key was not functioning and was very inconvenient as I had used it previously and we had arrived late only to find out I had to walk to the front desk carrying my child that was asleep. However other than that everything was great.

Staff is very friendly!  The new decor is fantastic and suite is comfortable.  New mattress was comfortable, but without the box spring it felt like you are sleeping on the floor.  Other than this, it was a pleasant stay.

Summary Heading: Breakfast and Happy Hour Make It Good
Summary: I upgraded to a "Corner Suite" only to find out that my imagined two-window walls was not to be.  The "corner" was just a blank wall that looked no different than any other room with a single sliding door.  The room felt shabby, with cheap furniture and a stand-alone closet.  Worn carpet and scraped walls made me think more of a motel than one of my favorite suite chains.  The "kitchen" was just a sink and a small micro under the counter.  Typical hotel coffee pod maker and institutional coffee.  The shower was terrific with a bowed curtain bar and a great shower head.    I really appreciated having the sliding door and the SoCal fresh air helped me sleep great.  The bed was very comfy (I stayed three nights) but they use cheap fluffy pillows that I had to double and triple fold

Strange title for a review of a hotel in Orange County, CA, but Beef Wellington is one of my favorite dishes because it's loaded with flavor and texture components, and with puff pastry, it's super hard to nail (Overcooked, under cooked, flavorless, etc. Some of the common flaws...) but THE CHEF at Embassy Suites in Brea NAILED the execution of this dish. Yes it's $38 when nothing else is more than $24, but 1 bite in, you can see where that extra $14 is going. Treat yourself right if you attend the restaurant. As for the rest of the hotel, it was a problem free stay, comfy beds, chilly room, friendly staff. Definitely worth the visit (We were in town for Knotts scary farm in BP, and it was only a 20 minute drive.)

Came here for business and this was one of the hotel options and I am glad that I picked this one.  Beautiful hotel, great location in beautiful Brea and clean and fresh.  Staff is great, rooms are clean and fresh and location is great.  Loved the view in the morning looking at the hills (you just have to look over the top of Target).   I would stay here again for sure

Have stayed here many times since it opened. Considered Brea my favorite Embassy. What made it great was a koi pond as the central feature. Now it's just another good hotel. I reserve average for the newer Embassys, which lack an atrium.

This for what you may think, this hotel is beautiful and in a very convenient location. You can walk to the mall, and do many things in the area. I would certainly recommend that if you plan on being in the area to check it out.

Don’t trust front desk to do their job upon check out. Asked front desk to email copy of check out, three days later still no email, going through bank statements gotta verifie no additional fees were charged.

Hotel was overall nice. Front clerk was kind of rude can use a customer service class. We booked two rooms neither of the, were ready. Breakfast was delicious. Mall was in the same parking structure. That was pretty cool. Walk outside front and there the entrance to Jcp.

The hotel was conveniently located around quaint shops, malls and other attractions (Disney).  The rooms were comfortable (except for the air conditioning in the bedroom) and the convenience of the breakfast and happy hour was appreciated.

Was originally booked into room 318 but they had cleaned the carpets and it smelt like smoke....was just getting updressed and thinking about it when the cleaner came in....could have been awkward :o/ Anyway, she kindly moved me across into a new room...338. The view was null...overlooking a road and a spa but I wasnt bothered, here for a 3 night stay on business. Room was huge, had a lounge area and huge bedroom.  Didnt touch the lounge, wasnt really needed. Breakfast was included which was really good.  Rooms are spacious and clean.  Gym is small and the pool is outdoors.  Restaurant and bar was ok, although I will comment and say I had a discount ticket for the bar for a beer and it was valid until 7:30.  I got there at 7:33 and he said no....rules are rules i suppose but bit

I love the Embassy Suites. The beds and pillows are very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast is delicious. Love the pool also. Our food for the banquets was great. The only draw back is the rooms on the street side is kind of noisy due to the traffic. Overall I enjoyed my stay.

Great place to stay, tucked in between the street and the mall. Parking is all underground.  Walking distance to Brea mall, shopping stores across the street and plenty of restaurants.  Rooms are quiet and comfortable. Free hot and continental breakfast is great, even has an omelette station! Staff is friendly and courteous. Would definitely stay here again if I had to..

Really enjoyed the suite because it was cozy and had a lot of room. Breakfast was wonderful. Depending which day I stayed, the choices of food changes. WiFi was around 100%. Many places nearby to shop and eat.

Embassy Suites was very accommodating for our casual 55th high school reunion. Hotel is perfect for this type of get together with the big atrium and seating area, snacks and drinks in the evening and generous breakfast in the morning. The rooms are large with a sitting room, two TV'S, refrigerator,microwave and coffee. The beds are very comfortable. Room service was good and the staff very friendly. There is a pool.

Stayed here one night for a business trip.  Hotel is next to Brea Mall.  When I checked in, I noticed I had 2 double beds, where I would have preferred one king.  Front desk staff were extremely accommodating and friendly.    Hotel is structured around a giant atrium.  There are windows facing the outside but the windows facing the inside are opaque.  Just a bit odd...  Room service was OK, nothing spectacular.  Breakfast bar was very nice.   All in all, I would not hesitate to return.

Rooms and service are excellent. Great presentation as you walk into the lobby. Disappointed that the area were I had my party had the tiles fall, water was leaking and when they moved the cake table my cake ended on the floor.

Summary Heading: Excellent choice if you need to stay in Brea
Summary: I took a suite and it was big and clean; staff was kind and helpful; I was year two times in 2014 and 2018 and found the hall renovated and improved; I recommend it if you have to stay in Brea; it is just nearby a shopping mall which is also very good.

I have stayed in many hotels around Brea, CA and found this hotel to be a real gem. Professional and clean.The Embasy Suites by Hilton is in a shopping area, for the family, yet close to many corporations making it a good place for business travel.

Summary Heading: Amazing experience, a must if you have a family with little ones!
Summary: From the time we arrived, it was non stop exceptional service our entire stay. We arrived about 45 minutes early for check in, I expected to have to wait but they checked us in with no hassles. The parking was great, the room was very spacious and set up perfectly for our family of 5 (with three little boys). The pool is HUGE, and very kid friendly. The night reception hour was unexpected and very cool...the bartender was awesome!! The morning breakfast was delicious, the set up was awesome..not a lot of congestion, very easy to get in and get plates made for our family. All of the staff were very courteous and friendly....I cannot say enough great things about this hotel and our stay, we will definitely be coming back..and I strongly recommend this hotel for anyone with

This was a wonderful Embassy Suites. I brought my family down to go to Disneyland and we stayed at the Embassy Suites in Brea. Only 9 miles away but after spending the whole day in a amusement park you would like it to be comfortable. We started our day with made to order breakfast.  There's cocktails in the evening which we weren't around for it, but I could have used it. We had two queen beds and a hide-a-bed and it worked out perfect. Every room has a mini fridge and a microwave. A pool that was open till midnight and a fitness center.

This was 1 of the best hotels we’ve been to in a while!! Leah at the front desk was professional, courteous & genuinely wanted her guests to have a great stay.. Wish there was more of her!! Fabulous!!

When visiting family I will always stay at the Embassy Suites in Brea.  The accommodations are typical Hilton/Embassy and never let me down.  The breakfast is the highlight for my kids and it’s close to all my family and SoCal attractions.  If you’re going to the beach it’s a bit of a drive but if you’re going to spend your time in OC and possibly venture to LA it’s a good place to stay because you’re near all the freeways.    You also have the Brea Mall in your backyard and can walk to a great shopping center that isn’t as fake as Fashion Island or Irvine Spectrum.    There is also a Claim Jumper down the road and a fabulous Japanese Buffet across the street.

The hotel looked really nice and it was a nice location. We arrived to the room the first thing we did was get the kids ready for a bath . The tub seemed clean my five year old was put in the bath and was taken out immediately black stuff started coming out from the drain . I took off the plug found a shampoo cap and a handful of hair stuck on the drain along with mold buildup. I reported it to the front office but they did not seem to care. I had just gone to the beach in La Jolla and the public shower had a cleaner drain than this hotel.

Updated hotel with excellent amenities. Hot tub feels like an oasis surrounded by greenery. Free breakfast with made-to-omelettes and delicious hot food. Free drinks for evening reception and sweet potato fries, cantaloupe, Chex mix, carrots and celery-nice spread for a free evening reception.   Jennifer at the front desk was lovely and very efficient! Highly recommend this place for families!

Checking in was easy, parjipais below ground, hotel was clean, suite was clean and quiet, breakfast had a lot of great options like made to order omelettes, pancakes, and bacon, checkout was quick. The breakfast alone made this worth it. You can't get that deal for a family of 5 for the price of the room normally. Loved our stay.

Summary Heading: Favorite place to stay when in Brea.
Summary: We have never had a bad experience.The staff is always professional, courteous and accomodating!! I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Brea , Disneyland , the O.C.!! The best!! Thank you to all of the staff!!

We stayed here for one night and we loved it. We booked for the price and vicinity to our event. We love Embassy Suites and this exceeded our expectations. It was so clean and bright and cheerful. Great service topped off our visit. Parking is very convenient and this hotel is very close to the freeway. We would recommend this hotel to anyone in the area.

I highly recommended to stay in this hotel! Location is very good from restaurants, stores and about 15 minutes from Disneyland. The service was great!! The staff is very helpful and friendly. Also parking is free!

We only stayed one night. It was clean and comfortable. The bedroom was fine but the living room was showing signs of wear. The sofa and dining table were needing some care! But we went for the bedroom so our stay was ok. The evening snacks and drink offer were pathetic. The barkeeps were bored and could have cared less if anyone showed up. The snacks themselves were awful. Cold greasy tortilla chips with chopped tomatoes and onions as a dip. Celery and carrot sticks were old. Chex mix was normal. At the end of the two hours they brought out some fruit. The drinks were served with no flair or interest. The environment was suffocating at best - stuck into a corner of the grill/restaurant. The beautiful fountain area was blocked off for a private party.

For a family trip this location was great. Across from the mall and plenty of restaurant options. The hotel was very clean and welcoming. We enjoyed the breakfast and the evening reception. The pool was very large and the temp was perfect for our kids.

Loved this location! Parking is free, mall and shopping center next to hotel so plenty to do. We came for a family party in Whittier and this where we chose to stay. Must say one of my favorite spots. They aren’t uptight with breakfast or the managers reception in the evening. The last embassy suites I stayed was in Downey and let’s just say I will never be staying at that location again.

After renovation, lobby & dinning area are clean line & modern feeling.  Overall, good experiences with 3-night stay attending meeting in city of Brea.  Maybe the garage area can be improved with larger parking space for each vehicle.

Our family just returned from spending five nights at this Embassy Suites. Overall, the hotel has been updated very well. The bathroom was small, but no complaints. The outside pool and fitness center were both good. This hotel is very consistent with other Embassy Suites. The breakfast each day was good and offered variety from day to day. The evening reception could be better and offer additional food variety. Not a big deal.   This hotel is adjacent to the Brea Mall and offers many retail and eating establishments within close proximity. The location was also close enough to Disney and other area attractions. We would stay here again.

This hotel is a favorite of mine. The rooms are spacious and offer a separate living room area and sleep area.  The service is excellent and the location is perfect for accessing all your shopping and dining needs.

Summary Heading: NOT what I've come to expect from Embassy Suites.
Summary: The room was in a horrible state of disrepair compared to what I expect from ES and certainly from a Hilton property.  In short, there were stains on the walls, holes in the sheets, a huge crack at the bottom of the door (large enough to slide a shampoo bottle thru), exposed wiring in the ceiling of the gym bathroom, cracked mirror in the gym bathroom, shower handle trim kit was falling off, security latch on front door was close to falling off of the frame, 4 adults in the room woke up with a severe case of allergies because of what was assumed to be drapes/etc needing to be cleaned, the pool was very dirty as well as the hot tub, ZERO towels were available in the poolside cabana, instead old used towels were strewn across the pool deck, there was a very loud wedding going on

Our wedding party had a block of rooms so we all stayed there for the wedding weekend the hotel was nice the downfalls are there were room service trays laying outside of all the doors all throughout the day. The shower curtain in our room was torn so water flooded the bathroom every time we showered.

Summary Heading: Great hotel but far from many attractions
Summary: This hotel was large and comfortable. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was excellent with a custom omelette bar and service there outstanding. Complimentary evening reception also a pus. Would have preferred to be closer to many of downtown/Hollywood/beach attractions - all were an hour or more away with the LA traffic. Other than the distance to attractions, there were lots of restaurants and shops near the hotel and it was convenient to the highway. Great stay - terrible commutes.

Beautiful hotel and very comfortable rooms. We really enjoyed our stay and the complimentary breakfast was really good too. Even a free omelet station. Would definitely stay here again. Love the Hilton brand!

The staff here all know their jobs and that is reflected in the quality of the service and cleanliness of the rooms.  The rooms are generally quiet except for those above the banquet room can get a little noisy.  Having Brea Mall just across the street is very convenient if you need to pick up something you forgot.  The availability of laundry services is a plus especially if you have an extended stay here.  Parking does not seem to be a problem even if you have been closing down the bars.

I had a great stay at the Embassy Suites in Brea! The complimentary Manager’s Reception and morning breakfast were great. The pool and gym were nice. Even though it was crowded on weekends, the staff still made sure that the areas were clean and food was replenished and bathroom refreshed.

I liked the staff they were nice but the hotel itself was average at best for the cost. The breakfast on pete was good but other offerings were ok, fruit selection was not good, drink selection was not great and sausages were very greasy.

We always have a great experience at the Brea Embassy Suites. The staff and hotel are in a great area and work for us. We stay here often due to family living in the Orange County area. Always comfortable beds and breakfast are appreciated. We will return.

Great hotel in Brea that was recently renovated. Fantastic staff, very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are large and clean. Wifi works great and is complimentary for Hilton Honors members. Tasty breakfast with buffet and cooked to order options.

My husband and I stayed here when we were attending our daughter’s college graduation from Biola. It was fairly close and one of the nicer hotels near the school. Location has plenty of restaurants nearby and the mall as well. Breakfast options were plentiful. Downsides: room was very dark, had popcorn ceilings and the mini fridge barely kept things cold even on max setting. Upsides: Breakfast area is nice and bright, goodie bag on arrival, large room.

Summary Heading: Nicest Hotel in Brea in perfect location
Summary: Very nice all suites hotel.  Located between a mall and shopping center and close to several restaurants.  Rooms are quiet due to the same layout, living area hall side and sleeping area street side.  All rooms have sliding door access to standing balcony.  Full open atrium seats quite a few guests during free, buffet and made to order breakfast, all free and quite good.  7 floors, 4 elevators.  Laundry service but only 2 washer/dryers on 3rd floor.  Outside pool & spa via small but well equipped fitness room.  Good restaurant and bar.  Several meeting rooms.  Lots of free parking on two floors below hotel, with elevator access.  Fridge/microwave/coffee maker/SAFE and 2 TV's.  Room prices vary day to day and although I have been here 2 weeks I can't decode the formula, but

I normally really look forward to staying at embassy suites as I always have a great time. I expected the same from this embassy but unfortunately I was disappointed. We checked in on Friday night and when we got to our room we saw they had put us in a room with 1 king even though I specifically booked a 2 queen. I called the front desk immediately and was told they were sold out and there was nothing they could do. I explained how there were 4 quests staying in the room and how I had called the hotel the day before to ensure we were booked in a 2 queen room. The night auditor said there was nothing they could do for that night and that there was no indication on my reservation that I needed 2 queens (so frustrating considering I went out of my way to make sure it was noted and
Manager Response: Good morning, Carolina A,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us at our hotel in Brea and I am sorry we fell short of providing an excellent and satisfying stay. I will follow-up with our front desk team and we are very sorry for the miscommunication that took place from check-in, through the room change, and until check-out. We have certainly reversed the $30 charge on your reservation. Most banks will typically take 2-5 business days two return that amount into your account, though some banks may take up to 30 days to do so, depending on their policy.  Please do not hesitate to contact me with any other questions or if you would like to further discuss your experience. I will be happy to continue assisting you.  Again, we are very sorry for being unable to provide you with an enjoyable stay due to our service, but we thank you for your patience with us throughout the stay.  Thank you.

Summary: This was the closest hotel to my wedding and the accommodations were great! Jeanie and Lauren were so helpful with the room block and pickup bus. The rooms are very nice. Breakfast... DELICIOUS! Thank you for helping make my wedding memorable.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the wonderful review.  The team is happy we were able to be a part of your special event and wish you and your husband the best!

Summary: We just came from the Tahiti village resort in Las Vegas and the service was horrible. The rooms were bad and nobody cared. We then drove here for the next part of our disney land trip and stayed here 3 nights. The service is great, especially Raquel, the buffet runner. She is amazing, and helped with anything we needed and then even tried to not take my gratuity. She stated she was here for us and not for tips. I gave it to her anyway because those are exactly the people who should receive them. Raquel was great! The hotel is nice and comfortable. The pool area is really nice, being cover with palm trees for privacy. The staff always said hello, opened doors, and were just what should expect from any hotel you stay at. This is why I like staying at Hilton properties because you

Summary Heading: Nice hotel. Our room needed work.
Summary: The Embassy Suites Brea was excellent in terms of customer service and hotel amenities. The hotel had been re-furbished in the past few years and was very nice. The breakfast area had plenty of seating and the food areas were spread out to help eliminate crowding. Our room, however, was another matter. 1) The AC/Heating unit would only work on AC. The room was 64 degrees when we arrived and the only way I could get it to warm up was to completely turn it off. 2) The bath/shower nozzle dripped and I could not turn the faucet any tighter to stop it. 3) The toilet leaked because the flapper was not installed correctly. After I loosened the chain, it finally stopped. 4) The bar faucet was completely loose. All in all, for a hotel that had been refurbished recently, this was pretty
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our two-room suites. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

Summary: Excellent experience from check in to departure.  Typical Embassy Suites room was quiet and comfortable.  Staff were all very accommodating.  Shopping maul and many types of restaurants just across the street. I would definitely stay here again.

First time staying at this hotel. It is conveniently located to be able to get around the LA area. The room was great, clean, very big with a separate living room area. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom seemed recently updated. The rate included a full breakfast buffet and evening reception.  The breakfast was very good and had a lot of options.  Our only complain is that the breakfast during the week finishes at 9am. That’s fine if you are a business traveller but for vacationers, that’s a bit early. The staff we interacted with were friendly and attentive.  There is a mall next to the hotel with a lot of shopping and dining options.  Tip: get a room on the mall side as it can be noisy on the side facing the street.  Overall, we were very impressed with the hotel and we

Summary Heading: Kind staff, good breakfast and spacy room
Summary: I stayed for one night in connection with a businesstrip. The hotel appears very new, and the frontdesk employee was very kind and accomodating.  I got a very spacy room with a living room and a bed room, and it presented itself very clean and new. The hotel is located right next to a large mall and a Target across the  street. With not much time, it was great to be able to quickly run right into the mall in the evening and get presents for the family. The breakfast was good and had everything I needed. I didn't have time to try the omelets which were made on the spot by some chefs, however I will definitely try them next time, as they looked delicious. Really no negativ critique to give, as everything worked according to expectation. Will definitely book this hotel next time

In town from the east coast to watch daughter play her first California college softball tournament.  When checking in online, I hadn't noticed any change to our reservation, but was admittedly distracted after a long flight and a day at the field.  When we got to our room, we surprisingly learned that we had the keys to the Presidential Suite!  After double checking with front desk that this was no mistake,my husband and I moved in for the long weekend!  While we are frequent guests at Hilton properties, our travel is generally limited to weekend stays in "normal" rooms, so this was an absolute treat!  The accommodations were awesome, especially loved the shower, sectional couch, extra space and glorious windows and views. On top of the always welcomed cook to order breakfast,

We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel.  The staff was accommodating for us with our infant and 3 year old, and they obviously had a lot of business guests.  The outdoor pool and hot tub were very nice.  They had a great breakfast buffet.  Overall, a great place to stay.

Here with my wife and son for a football game and weekend getaway.  Hotel is your usual Embassy Suites, rooms clean and comfortable, and great for a small family.  Staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast and happy hour areas well done and comfortable.  Close to the Brea mall, and a fair number of restaurants nearby.  Easy access to Anaheim, and fairly easy to get to the beach, but a good drive.  Long drive to LAX, so would likely try Orange County airport next time.

Summary Heading: Not As Good As I Would Have Liked
Summary: An average suite that could have used a livelier color scheme; service help of room attendants and breakfast personnel were FAR friendlier than the main desk clerks; not near as pleasant overall as other Embassy Suite properties I have stayed at.

Summary Heading: Technology challenged, needs some updates, great location
Summary: Was staying here with a group.  For whatever reason they could not get the system to accept my Hilton Honors number or to email me a receipt.  I am still waiting for it days after my stay.  Lobby area and break fast were nice.  Free underground parking was a nice touch as well.  HVAC, TV, and the plumbing seemed to need some updates.  Bed was comfortable enough.  Hoped for better.

While furnishings in the TV room may seem a little older, the comfort of the room works for me.  I do like that there is a separate bedroom and bathroom and also a decent sized fridge in the room.  The staff here are very personable.  I have stayed here twice now with a 3rd trip coming up next month.  Definitely value for the money and you have to try the breakfast and evening reception!

We stayed there this past weekend and the service was absolutely wonderful. As a Hilton Honor member we check in early and had a late 2pm checkout. The rooms are a little outdated but the beds are comfortable and the rooms are spacious we stayed in room 531. The have free parking, complementary breakfast with made to order omelette bar, evening reception not to mention complementary evening drinks.

Used room as a stop off point for a friends wedding weekend. GREAT EXPERIENCE. Everything was in tip top condition and we were all very happy with the service and quality of everything. We will return!!!!!

Our family and friends stayed too. We had a great visit and the staff was very good. We had a celebration event in Fullerton and moved party to hotel bar where we enjoyed great food and drinks. The bartender was on top of any service needs.

the 2 rooms makes it worth it cause we can put the kids in the living room.  add to that a great breakfast and I’ll never stay anywhere else.  I like the option to pick my room and then check in and use my phone as a key.  I can completely avoid the lobby in and out if I wanted.

We recently stayed here for our trip to Disney.  The hotel is about 20 minutes away from Disneyland and an easy drive.  There is a mall, Sprouts market, Target and plenty of restaurants walking distance (across the street)so that’s a plus.  The rooms are nice sized with a separate sitting area.   The hotel seems run down, on the outside, it looks well kept, but it isn’t.  Our room was not the best, with a leaking shower, horrible toilet that wouldn’t flush properly and hair was found in the bathtub, not from us, which means it wasn’t cleaned properly.  The rooms were full of dust and stains were noted on the curtains.  The curtains are also hard to pull apart to let sunlight in.  The rooms are dark and depressing. The breakfast is nice, the usual at any given Hilton that offers

Great out door pool and largest hotel spa in the area. Just remodeled a few months ago. The free parking is an additional value! The location, close to the 57 freeway, lets you get to anywhere in Orange County quickly.

Once Again I fin myself in an Embassy Hotel. I enjoy staying with them and find for the most part the staff is friendly knowledgeable and ready to help. The made to order breakfast was yummy as usual. Downsize for me was small outdated bathrooms, in most locations for double rooms. However, I'd still recommended this chain and gladly stay at most of their locations.

Summary Heading: Excellent atmosphere and Friendly, Professional Staff
Summary: This Embassy Suites provides the best atmosphere of any one that I've visited.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  I've slept like a baby in the bed.  I usually have trouble sleeping on my first night in a hotel.  Not here.  The staff are friendly and professional.  The night that I arrived, I had a fraud alert occur, due to the fact that the charge was in California, not in my home state or a state that I frequently visited.  I took care of the Fraud Alert on my phone, but it didn't immediately clear my card to be charged.  The gentleman at the desk allowed me to go to my room and sleep, and he'd try again.  I've been there for several days now, so he was open to it....  He actually suggested it.  I'm here for work.  They provide a free shuttle service to places within 5

We really enjoyed the huge, clean, comfortable suite. Beautiful remodel. The breakfast with cooked to order items was delicious and very generous portions. Loved the free parking too, that’s becoming a rare amenity.

They have very outdated rooms. Need new furniture and paint, etc. They room look very dingy and worn. What I paid for was a non-smoking room, but what I got was a room that smelled horribly of old cigarette smoke. When arriving, we had to wait to get into the room since the door lock did not work. Apparently the battery in the door was dead. We waited for that to be fixed. No extra blanket, come to find out in the middle of the night. This place is not what it used to be. It needs help.

My stay was great and convenient.it was by the mall and Dimond Bar. We had a celebration there.So after we just got to the room and went to sleep. Breakfast was great. I would stay there again in the future.

Very clean and the rooms are very spacious.  I’ve stayed at multiple Embassy Suites including Vegas.  All were very nice and clean.  The breakfast omelette bar is fantastic.   Plan on staying at Embassy Suites again in the very near future.

Convenient location with the mall, target, groceries, great restaurants and downtown Brea close by.  Clean hotel, great space for a family and staff is great.  Breakfast is outstanding!  We stay at this location often and always have great experiences.

Summary Heading: Tired old dame. Still a pleasant experience
Summary: Came to stay for Thanksgiving holiday.  This hotel has been here a while and it shows in places.  Parking is free, but very crowded.  Elevators are OK, but showing their age - controls, lights, etc. Breakfast was good, but can be crowded at times. A/C was welcome since it was 90+F this week.  But fan was noisy and required the bedroom door to be closed at night. Wish this hotel accepted pets.

I was unsatisfied with the front desk staff. They seemed knowledgeable and  not willing to correct their errors. I was checked out a week before the end of my stay because the front desk did not care to ensure they were assisting properly. My corporate card was maxed out by the billing process and was left without funds for a few days. Front desk service was horrible!!!

Me and my fiancé had a romantic get away and the staff was kind enough to upgrade our room and set it up with rose petals, champagne, etc.. would like to thank everyone there for all the help making it a special night

Our recent 11/25 stay was great.  The room was spacious and nice.  The parking garage made parking safely and close to elevators easy.  The free breakfast the next morning was very good.  We stayed there years ago and would do so again.

Made reservations at this Embassy Suites because of it's proximity to Cal State Fullerton. Was pleasantly surprised to find it next door to the  Brea Mall as well. Great service at the front desk, was checked in in under 5 minutes. Room was clean, just had a bit of a funny smell when you first opened the door but it seemed to go away after a few minutes.  Breakfast was good and had lots of choices. Parking was underground and easy to access.  Nice place to stay for a couple of nights.

at check in my room was not ready and had to wait 40 minutes to get a new room and then when we did get it we had a issue with the shuttle that was promised to us for our event ,we had to find our own way back at a cost of 35.00.

Summary Heading: We Always Stay Here When in the Area
Summary: If you like Embassy Suites you will be happy here.  We are treated well by the staff.  Lots of room, kids are happy with space and food.  Parking can be a bit of a challenge.  Location is excellent: close to all sorts of great shopping and attractions.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites hits all the marks
Summary: I stayed at the Embassy Suites in Brea recently while travelling for work.  I always enjoy staying at an Embassy as they are usually consistent and I like the amenities.  I enjoyed the Manager's reception all 3 nights and let's be real - who doesn't like free drinks!  The staff was friendly and after the first night, the bartender knew exactly what I wanted and poured my drink while I waited in line!  That's the sign of a good bartender!  I also enjoyed breakfast each morning.  The omelet station was good and fast and the breakfast selection was good.  One nitpick - if you're from the south like I am, you'll be disappointed that the biscuits served are canned.  I don't go to CA to eat biscuits, but just be aware.    Service was good all the way around - everyone was friendly and

Check in and check out was terrible.  Room was smokey making it very hard to sleep much less do anything in the room. The facility is located in a good location - next to the mall and placed to eat.  Worst experience I have had at this place and I have stayed there many times before.

I’ve stayed at a lot of properties but this one is by far the best.  Rooms are exceptional and the penthouse suites are some of the biggest rooms I’ve ever seen. Great location with plenty of restaurants and things to do as well.

The free breakfast was very good.  The evening reception was drinks and snacks.   The room was very clean and modern.  The frig and microwave worked well.   The location is fantastic.  We walked out the hotel door and into the Brea Mall. We will stay there again.

Stayed one night. The rooms were clean not the most updated but nice ... The breakfast had a lot of variety ... gym is open 24 hours ... location is great. Bathrooms do need some renovation and the carpets are worn. Over all a good stay

I've frequently stayed at Embassy Suites. Like the brand, service, price (usually) and amenities. The one in Brea, CA knocked my socks off. It had been totally refurbished. Not what I was used to in an ES. Staff was up to their usual ES top notch  quality and the bed provided a relaxing, restful night. The only thing I missed was the  magnifying mirror in the bathroom for shaving. Otherwise, perfect.

I have stayed here before a while back but decided to return when I heard they remodeled.  Great Job on the remodel.  Place is bright and updated.  Breakfast was very good and the evening reception was okay.  I like that this hotel in next to the Brea Mall so I was able to do my shopping and have lunch at the food court. Great place.

Great location and great rates.  Use HH points to get killer deals and superb breakfast and evening receptions.  Make sure to ask for as room away from Convention Center on weekends. A little loud, but with TV on it is no bother.  Like the movie channel when relaxing in room,  Great to have microwave and fridge in room to.  Excellent location and easy to find.  Parking is under hotel and two levels, so look for entry off of the main street, just past the front door lobby area, or you will miss is! Thanks for the great breakfast and evening reception, as always.  Next time going to Oxnard CA Embassy Suites for killer beach 2 room and 2 bathroom suites!

Stayed here after a night of terror at Knott's Scary Farm (actually not that scary) It was nice after leaving the park not having to drive to the high desert. Embassy Suites is the only hotel that I am confident in booking no matter what city or state.  The Suite was great, the breakfast is good, and the staff is pleasant.  In fact the breakfast lady making my omelette was very sweet and I had a nice conversation with her.  I recommend asking for the omelette with cheese, bacon, and jalapenos'. Overall a great hotel to stay at and will be booking again in the near future.

It’s our favorite in the area. Quiet, good service, great location, excellent breakfast, underground parking. Right next to Brea mall & lots of great restaurants. It’s also just down the street from downtown Brea.

We were so disappointed to see a wedding taking place in the courtyard ... and other areas in the hotel.  There were several groups that couldn't use the courtyard because the courtyard was taken over the  entire night.  We selected the hotel for the courtyard so our group could sit down and enjoy.  We went into the bar which was so noisy you couldn't have a conversation with the TV, displaced guests, different weddingS guests, etc.  For one thing no one told us about the courtyard not being available nor any of the space in the surrounding area.   Absolutely disappointed.

We recently stayed here while in town for a family wedding.  I was a great location with lots of great restaurants we could walk to.  The breakfast was good and had a large selection of items we could chose from. In the evening there was a managers reception with snacks and drinks.  I found this hotel was in a great location we could get to the mall in just a few steps from the front door.  Room was large and very clean. There was a living area with pull out sofa and table/desk.  A fridge, bar area with coffee maker and sink.  It was a very nice room. There is a pool but it was a little hard to find. back left corner through the gym area. Beautiful landscaping nice pool and large hot tub.

Stayed here in August 2017 while visiting family. Hotel was undergoing renovations at the time. The hotel is in a good location with shopping and plenty of restaurants nearby. During the week there is a complimentary managers reception for guests. The swimming pool is awesome! My kids enjoyed it. The breakfast buffet was just ok. It closed earlier than advertised each morning so my pre-teens who slept in to 8:30 would miss breakfast. 😕 It was also irritating to be competing with hotel staff and the construction crew for breakfast items. The room was nice and recently updated. Parking is complimentary in a covered garage and the front desk staff were professional and polite. I’d stay again.

Comfortable accommodations, courteous & friendly staff, food was excellent.  Location was within walking distance to very nice restaurants and we were comfortable walking even in the evening.  Great little boutiques and friendly people.

The hotel was very clean, great location, staff was really helpful. Easy underground parking. The breakfast buffet was bountiful and delicious.  The pool was a great place to unwind and relax with a swim.

Good location with eady access to a mall and various restaurants. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice lobby, and well-equipped guest rooms and meeting rooms. Good food selections of free breakfast and enjoyable happy hour service.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in a nice location
Summary: Stayed the weekend at this hotel and it was a modern decor. The breakfast is good as well as the location. The bed was comfortable but the room was a little dusty. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the Brea or Fullerton area.

Paul, the waiter, was professional, engaging and willing to work with my dietary needs. The food was excellent. The steak was prepared as I would expect from a four or five star restaurant.  There was a problem with the room and was quickly taken care of. The gym is someone inadequate possessing three ellipticals, three treadmills and a rack of dumbbells. Definitely could use some machines TV connections not work on the used.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for business or fun
Summary: I enjoyed this hotel's breakfast variety. The building is under renovation but still beauitful and operational. Professional staff, great location and easy to locate. Next to the Brea Mall, easy under ground parking.

I appreciate the extra living space offered by Embassy Suites properties.  This hotel offered the extra room to spread out and work, and is also conveniently located adjacent to the Brea Mall, offering lots of quick and casual dining options - a huge difference at the end of a long work day.  The lobby and atrium areas were very clean and well kept, and it looks like the meeting space is being refreshed.  Free breakfast is of average quality - a 2.5 on a 5.0 scale.  The rooms are clean and okay - wasn't new, and wasn't too old.  The bed was ok - a little tired and squeaky.  Noise wasn't an issue.  Free parking in the garage was also a nice feature.  I'd return because of the convenience.

Summary Heading: Location and Staff Make for a Wonderful Stay
Summary: Every year I stay at this hotel from August through the end of October. The location is perfect, with access to the mall, restaurants, and a 24 Hour Fitness--all within walking distance.  But what really makes this hotel great is the staff! Every morning I look forward to the positive energy and smiling face of Rachel in the breakfast area. And in the evening, the hotel offers free happy hour from 5:30 p.m. until 7:30 p.m. Justin, Jessie, and the beautiful Kim go out of their way to be accommodating to whatever I need, even anticipating my needs before I even verbalize them!  And a special thanks to Emily (front desk) who helped me free myself from a tangle-resistant round hairbrush that became so ensnared in my hair that she literally had to cut me free after working on it for

This location was a beautiful site. clean and very presentable even with some construction was being done. I didn't feel it happening and was not noticeable. All staff was courteous and kind and very helpful.

Our return to this hotel was better than ever!  We were there 4 nights, had a corner room on 6th floor overlooking the pool, quiet and very clean. Staff is very friendly, smiles everywhere.  The complimentary breakfast is now more enclosed, the selections have increased and the food was great.  The included cocktail hour was moved to a corner space on the lobby floor, not as accessible as before.  They are continuing a remodel, so we DID have to walk a maze of tables from our elevator to the lobby on our side of the bldg.  The other side was open and we could have taken the lobby elevator and passed by  the rooms on our floor, but we preferred to use the one closest to our room.  We requested additional coffee cups (paper) and coffee pods and got them daily.  The lighting isn't

The Embassy Suites in Brea is clean and efficient. The breakfast is nice. No Gluten free nor dairy free options, sadly. But our overall experience was very good. Polite and accommodating staff for a large hotel.

Excellent service in bar and breakfast areas.  Had only one complaint-poor lighting in living room.  Otherwise, excellent stay of 5 nights.  Previous stay of 7 nights very good also. servers in bar and restaurant were exceptional.

I've have stayed here on business periodically for 6 years.  I have never been disappointed by anything.   Clean room, friendly staff, nice facility, wonderful location, delicious room service, fresh and satisfying breakfast, decent internet, and more.

I have stayed at many Embassy Suites. The Brea One is one of my favorite. The staff is so professional and pleasant. They will make you feel at home. The front desk employees always so pleasant and helpful. The entire hotel staff is one of the best service I encounter. I always enjoy my stay their.

I have stayed here twice in the last year. Both times were because my kids had games in California and the team stayed here. Our most recent trip was after the full renovation and I must say it is perfect for large groups. They have a very friendly staff and the rooms are perfect for up to a family of four. They serve a great breakfast buffet in the morning that comes with the price of the room. It is in a great area right off the highway and right next to a mall. They have plenty of parking in their garage and have a pool.

The location, cleanliness and comfort of the beds are outstanding.  The staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed from arrival to checkout.    Breakfast in the morning was very good.  I would highly recommend this hotel in Brea to everyone.

We had a excellent experience. Room was large and clean. Complimentary breakfast was very good. Staff was pleasant and courteous. Lobby was beautiful and welcoming. Underground parking was plentiful. We would happily stay here again.

Overall the our hotel stay was good. The room was nice & spacious. I love suites with separate rooms. The made to order breakfast was great and staff was friendly. The only issue was our room hot at night. I would have expected the room to be warm during the day than night. I explained the room temperature to the front desk staff but she didn't seem interested in what I was saying!

Summary Heading: Suite life here and it includes "cooked to order" breakfast.
Summary: High floor and "penthouse" suites located on the upper four corners. Comfortable beds and do go down elevators and on the south side is the pool.  Quality of housekeeping, breakfast and the pool area is delightful. Centrally located and  within walking distance of the Brea Mall.   Excellent on-site restaurant and sports bar for "that someone who needs to catch the game." Thanks for the wonderful "cooked to order" breakfast and coffee.

Summary Heading: Good stay at mini-suite hotel, would come back
Summary: This hotel, with its large atrium and surrounding rooms on 7 floors, is a bit dated now.  Still, it is well designed, so that the noise level in the sleeping rooms is very low.    The included breakfast buffet (with omelette line) is quite good.  (Breakfast is worth about $20 a person, so consider that when planning.) Ask the staff about the best times to avoid the rush.  Tables can be hard to get.  With the two-room design, one night owl can watch TV while another sleeps early or late.  The outer room has a small desk and a couch that folds out for kids or a single extra person.  It also has a small bar with fridge and sink.  The bath is nothing special but functional.    The bed was moderately firm and pillows varied from overfilled to thin.  Closet space is limited so be

Summary Heading: Great hotel and I highly recommend. Staff went out of their way to handle our requests.
Summary: Rooms were clean and have been updated.  Complimentary breakfast had good quality and variety.  At Managers Reception, the bartender remembered what we ordered the previous night.  Our family looks forward to staying here again.

Carpet was stained. Rust in shower. My credit card was charged $86 more than what my hotel confirmation said when I reserved my stay. Even after sending my email confirmation they said they could not give me that exact same rate. I will never stay at this hotel again!

Our 1st stay at the Embassy Suites in Brea was fantastic.  Booked via HILTON On-Line. Room Selection and Digital Check-in worked fine. All was ready at front desk upon arrival.  Parking was 'Tight' on the Wednesday evening we arrived as there was an event in progress. We circled underground lot 3 times before finding a vacant spot.  Bring Patience.  Our stay was excellent, the moment we arrived from our 6.5 hr. trip, greeted by Host Mr. Erick to the morning Housekeeping & Kitchen staff and hearty morning breakfasts.   We were on the 5th Floor facing JCPennys on the mall side.  We found the room to be quiet each night and comfortable for a family of 3 adults.   Bathroom is clean and well lit with a shower that had great water pressure. We arose to start our days with the

This is the first time that I was dissatisfied, hopefully it's the last time. The cleanliness was not what I'm use to. The pool was closed and the hot tub didn't function properly. The bars drinks were not as good as previous experiences.

What a gem. We had not expected such a delightful hotel in Brea. The pool area was perfect for the fact we had a 5 year old with us. Unlike many hotels who have a concrete area and nothing else, this hotel has a wonderful grassy area with shade, tables and lounge chairs. Plenty of towels and the area was very nicely manicured. The staff at this hotel were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was amazing - lots of food even at 9 am and all of it hot and fresh.

The location is perfect for a quick getaway and the staff member are excellent, from the lobby to housekeeping and staff in between! The room that we have are really clean and smell fresh! They have some remodeling going on at the hotel and can't wait to go back and see the new look.

Very nice hotel with upgrades. Bed was really comfortable. High quality television. I had a room with a balcony and it was wonderful! The embassy breakfast is the best yoinwill find anywhere. I hope to stay here again.

This hotel was very quiet, comfortable, and beautiful! The complimentary breakfast has a wide variety of delicious choices  and the breakfast area is bright and cheerful. The hotel is conveniently located near the Brea mall and other shops and restaurants.  The staff, without exception were delightful and very accommodating.  We were visiting town for a family funeral, and this was the perfect lodging for our family of 9.  Our request for our rooms to be placed together was honored, as well as an early check-in for funeral related events.   We will definitely choose to stay here again when we visit the area in the future!

This was a stay for pleasure and necessity. We were taking my mother-in-law to a 9:00 am Dr. Appt but live 75 miles away. This was an excellent choice. close to her and her doctor. Also the Brea Mall is next door. An easy walk to enter and shop...which we did. We ate dinner in the restaurant. We were surprised at the selection and quality of the food. I had Beef Wellington and my wife had an appetizer. The food was good. We would definitely stay here again. The staff was extremely helpful and very friendly.

Summary Heading: Perfect location for North Orange County family reunion!
Summary: Perfect location for our visit to a family reunion.  Breakfast was great, especially the inlet station.  Need to keep some food items stocked better. Room was clean but could use some touch up paint here and there since it was recently renovated.

Stayed here July - August 2017 for a family vacation.  Everything was great!  Hotel was very clean and updated.  Breakfast area was large so even with a big crowd it was easy to navigate.  The pool area was very attractive and felt secluded despite being in the middle of a city.

The hotel is kept immaculately clean. The a/c was silent and excellent. Each member of the staff was cheerful, helpful, courteous, and capable. The beds are very comfortable. The bathroom is well supplied. The splendid complimentary breakfast is very well done.

Nice and quiet, centrally located. Very friendly and helpful staff. A bit crowded at complementary breakfast (probably with some non-hotel guests), but excellent variety and quality of food service. Gym better than most, but still a bit lean on equipment.

If you like poor service, including housekeeping rolling eyes at you when asking for additional blankets then this is the hotel for you. The gym is also poor and is in a make shift room with very little equipment.

Stayed at the Embassy Suites in Brea on a business trip for three nights and it met my need quite well. I have stayed at many Hilton properties over many years and this is a very typical Embassy Suites. They include a nice cooked to order breakfast and a happy hour (which I never make it back in time for). The room was generally quiet and clean. Complimentary parking is available in an underground deck with elevator service directly to the lobby and all floors. The location is convent to the highway and shopping in the area.

Took my girl scout troop here for an overnight stay and it was perfect.  The hotel made sure to accommodate my need for joined rooms. The free breakfast is a value for a big group.  This location has tons of shopping and restaurants nearby. It's close to the Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm and Raging Waters.

Cool, clean, comfortable, yum yum food and convenient to shopping with our grand babies. Helpful staff, pool/spa, shuttle, bar, WiFi and nice desk/sitting area to work from. Really enjoyed our stay. Thank you.

Although close to Disneyland, expect around a 30 minute drive.  Nice, clean area.  Easy on/off interstates.  We weren't in the room much, so didn't take advantage of the hotel's amenities.  Breakfast was good as always at an Embassy Suite.  I would stay at this hotel again.   Note: there is construction going on right now.

Penthouse suite was beautiful. However, the A.C. units.are too loud in ALL rooms. Penthouse had no towel hooks in the bathroom, the toilet room was too small for that huge of a bathroom. Pillows were mushy and way too soft.

When we stay at other hotels, this is the one that we compare it to.  Everything's not perfect (always room for improvement) but we've never had any major problems in our several stays over the years.  The recently remodeled rooms and lobby are nice.  Rooms are clean and nice to stay in. Parking can be a bit of an issue on holidays especially if you drive an SUV that will only fit on parking level 1 due to height restrictions but most times this isn't an issue. The complementary breakfast is one of the bests we've had but the new lay-out has a few issues they should work out.

I've now stated twice at this property, and as a business person who travels with my spouse, this hotel is really a great choice for me.  Very nice suites, great pool and gym, free cook to order breakfast, and manager reception each evening.  I'm very pleased with everything at the Brea Embassy Suites.  For the past two years I've spent 60+ nights per year at a competitor, and I'm now seriously considering making this hotel as my "go to"

Pros: Great breakfast, fantastic restaurant, responsive staff, beautiful atrium interior of the hotel.  Cons: The room was dim, several things didn't work and the pull out bed is a terrible spring mattress that was completely unacceptable.

The hotel is in a great location (near Disney Land) -- the layout is unique -- free happy hour at 5:30pm and a great breakfast buffet -- that's hard to top!  The hotel was a great venue for our family gathering (22 people). Sean, the person greeting us at front desk, he was very polite to customers, and his attitude makes people feel comfortable. His professional, attentive, and friendly behavior directly contributes to customers having a positive  impression stay at Embassy Suites. The waitress (she is short) who works at the breakfast buffet, she always has a friendly smile, a soft voice and a good attitude focused on serving the customers. With employees like Sean and the breakfast buffet lady, they make people feel comfortable which goes a long ways towards retaining and

Breakfast staff is rude. Felt like they were trying to rush you in and out. Also felt like they were watching everything you did like you were a theif. Food was average. Also to many unattended children in food area messing around making it hard to get to buffet.

We stayed four days; with three kiddos (1, 9 & 11) & everything was GREAT!!!!   The front desk checked in on us by phone & then went out of there way to come up to our Sutie to make sure we were ok when our little one accidentally pushed the RED "medical assistance" needed button on the phone.  We were so embarrassed; but the gentleman from the front desk was so nice about our mishap. We plan on returning soon.

We always stay at embassy suites and never have a problem.. Its across the street from the mall and lots of places to eat.. The hotel has lots of parking the rooms are clean the pool is nice and big breakfast is great!

Summary Heading: Squeaky doors and leaky showers keep you up at night? Don't think about staying here than!
Summary: 200 dollar a night room shouldn't have the same qualities a $75 dollar room ata cheap motel have that's all I have to say about that you can figure out the rest by the title of this review bye the hotel is going under construction and you hear loud banging on every floor as early as 7:00 am so if you need peace and quiet this isn't the right embassy suites right now

Our room was clean and staff was courteous. We were hoping to check in early, but were told early check in could not be guaranteed. Embassy Suites Staff made it possible the morning of check in day! My only recommendation would be to allow early check in.
Manager Response: Dear Y6975ZIheathert,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary Heading: Will be my first choice when I'm in Brea!
Summary: I have zero complaints. Everything was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. I appreciated being able to check in early as my international flight arrived several hours before check in. Thanks!
Manager Response: Dear 740marissac,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary Heading: Great Service by Devin and Lauren!
Summary: Devin and Lauren always go out of their way to accommodate my parents who are disabled. They made Fathers Day weekend a pleasure and memorable for all of us. They even did a few extra things no one else usually thinks about doing. Devin had a plate of cheeses and fruits sent to their rooms, he took the time to make sure the suite they were located in had handrails and other amenities for my mom. Embassy has a great team in place. FYI...there is another hotel in the planning stages which is possibly set to be built right down the street. No matter how nice it may be it is not likely in my view that they will have someone as attentive and professional as Devin.
Manager Response: Dear Mark M,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. Your comments will be passed on to Devin and Lauren! We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Fell at pool area due to uneven cement. Suppose to be a family vacation my wife fell at the swiming pool No warning signs and management aware of concern.talked to management and front desk about concern. After the third day   Still had no warning signs at the pool area. The Door got stuck and could not open.  Had to through your shoulder for the door to open.
