The  Makeup vanity bench broke while my daughter putting on make up

Beautiful hotel with well-trained, caring staff. Hotel is adjacent to expansive shopping area.  Check-in was a breeze and the room was spacious with a window looking out to the entire atrium area.  The towels and sheets were soft and the a/c worked well.  I was there only one night but would definitely return if I am in the area again.
Manager Response: Dear debbiec444,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: We loved everything about our 3 month stay, except that it was a 3 month stay.  Always felt comfortable, the staff were all very inviting and friendly. We were able to utilize all of the amenities with no problems, the pool, workout room, evening reception as well as the internet.  The hotel is located directly behind the mall so that was even better.  Great location
Manager Response: Dear J1985NAlisan,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: I travel all over the U.S. and this hotel is always one of my favorites. Primarily because of the staff. Very courteous and the customer service is excellent. I am always impressed with how hard the staff works. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.
Manager Response: Dear donaldmP713OX,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: This is a great location, with lots of local shops, stores and food within walking distance especially if staying a whole week or more.  The remodel of the rooms and lobby is going well, really like the new look much better!
Manager Response: Dear R1248SVrebeccam,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary Heading: It was ok. Room clean. Staff was awesome
Summary: Most of the staff was exceptional. Suite was very clean. HBO worked periodically. A/C barely worked. Managers reception was a joke. Raunchy booze and weird snacks and not much of the normal snacks. Card swipe on room worked after 8 swipes at best. Was a good stay but wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again. Breakfast offerings/Ladies were perfect

This is the second time my fiancé and I have stayed here. Our first time was 3 years ago and we just returned from our second stay.  We like this location as it's a great jumping off location for us if we want to go south or north. The updates to the atrium were noticeable and I really like how bright and open the public spaces are.  Our room was  nice enough but the popcorn ceiling takes away from the other updates.  The bed was really comfortable. Unlike other reviews we didn't have any issue with our air. The door to the bathroom was so creaky and loud it could use some wd40. I am all for saving water and our towels don't need to be washed every day. However there is only one hook in the bathroom. When we hung our towels they never dried. (It is Southern California)

Summary Heading: Room hot as H.E. double chopsticks
Summary: A/C in room nonexistent. Front desk would not move me at 11pm. Told me I could sleep with a technician in my room. Might I add, I was a single woman traveling alone. Rooms smell like stinky feet. Frayed carpet and nails sticking out of floor in bathroom doorway. Shower took 10 minutes to get hot. Staff seemed to feel this was all normal. Building next door is vacant. For 2 nights I was awakened in the night by teenagers hanging out and drinking in the vacant building.

Disappointed with the room rates for weekdays. How can it cost more to stay at the hotel on a weekday than a Saturday or Sunday?  Come on embassy suites Brea!  It will be a nice place though when the construction is completed

This hotel was comparable to a fancy Motel 6. Looked great on the outside and has been renovated but we were throughly disappointed with our stay. We had to switch rooms 4x due to our rooms smelling like cigarette smoke. In the 2nd room it was "checked" by the front desk staff which meant they sprayed it with lemon deodorizer to mask the smell but it still smelled like cigarette smoke when that dissipated! In the 3rd room, which still smelled like smoke my baby found toenail clippings on the carpet. In the 4th room I couldn't give her a bath because black specks were coming out of the faucet even though we drained and rinsed out the bath multiple times. The staff was really nice and tried to "make it better" but the niceness does not make up for the shortcomings of the hotels

we enjoyed the Egyptian style décor, especially the fountains and the coi fish, but things change, the all white is very cold and perhaps too modern. This is perhaps the best embassy suites we have ever stayed in, we have been staying there in excess of 16-years

Room are spacious and clean.  Complementary evening drinking, but don't expect much for snacks.  Great area to unwind outside of your room with a glass of wine.  The complementary breakfast was okay and was lacking fruit, but they have an impressive made to order omelet bar. Easy parking and walking distance to shopping and eateries.  I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Great place to stay for any event. Shopping area is great. Plenty of restaurants close by. Not far from Surf City and beaches. Library is next door.  Pool water was cool and some areas shaded but plenty of tables and chase lounge chairs to relax in out out of the Sun.
Manager Response: Dear johnbB2095NJ,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: We've stayed here many times.  Construction was ongoing but that wasn't a problem.  We didn't like the changes to the atrium, the old one was more inviting.  The AC was noisy.  As usual the cooked to order breakfast was very good.

Summary Heading: quiet, lots of stuff to do
Summary: they had construction going on, but did  not bother us. evening reception could have had more choices of snacks as we have had at other Embassy Suites, such as fruit/veggies. otherwise the stay was fine, walking distance to mall, target and lots of near by restaurants. 20 minute drive to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear crystalr779,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Nice stay at a convenient location. The facility is older, but has been nicely remodeled. The room was very clean, quiet and nicely appointed.  There are several good restaurants within easy walking distance.  I would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.
Manager Response: Dear umgrizzlies,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Very expensive hotel; plumbing in bathroom broken; AC noisy; Internet slow and unreliable, with frequent access-code changes not communicated to current guests.  Hotels in Anaheim are 10 minute away, about half the price, and better condition.

This is a very nice hotel and relaxing environment. Breakfast was great even made to order Omelets!!!! They also have a light dinner in the evening as well as a restaurant and bar.Located near shopping.
Manager Response: Dear Loretta G,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: The variety of food and flexible of the breakfast hours worked great for us.  Each morning the staff greeted us and explained where everything was located.  We plan to stay there again when our travel plans take us to the area.
Manager Response: Dear leroyl346,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Very impressed with the facilities, large rooms, friendly staff. Will visit again! Breakfast was great, especially made to order omelettes. Atrium was incredible and made eating breakfast feel like we were at some nice restaurant!
Manager Response: Dear G9196BGpauls,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: We stayed here for two reasons. One, I wanted to get more points for my HH account. Two, we just wanted to get out and get away.  This was a nice hotel in a nice location.  Plenty of restaurants near by and walking distance, and for you shoppers, the mall is just across the way.  Breakfast in the morning was very good.  The only "situation" we noticed was the busers were not to be found.  We had to bus a table so we could sit down. Otherwise it was a nice morning and the food was good too.
Manager Response: Dear Lars_92705,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Very comfortable and clean, superb breakfast, great overall. Internet is very fast, The beds are super comfortable. Location is great, Brea Mall is next door and restaurants and shops are across the street
Manager Response: Dear Hugo M,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary Heading: Nice suite and pool area, best free breakfast
Summary: Good size entry 2 room suite for me, wife and 3 kids (11, 8, 8month).  We put the 2 older kids on the sofa bed and we had the bedroom with a pack-n-play crib for the baby.  Nice king bed and balcony w/ sliding door.  The door didn't slide very well, but it was very nice to have the balcony, which I wasn't expecting.  Good size/quality TV's, 42" or so, in each room.  Pool was bigger than usual and hot tub area was nice and private tucked behind the pool.  Heated pool was good but got a little chilly on cool April nights.  Hot tub was nice and hot.  Breakfast was excellent, made to order omelet/eggs, and great buffet for everything else.  Good options including unlimited sausage and bacon.  Free parking garage in basement was nice with elevators to every floor.  Overall a great
Manager Response: Dear G7917OGjasonb,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Had a great time, LOTS to do close by. Welcoming staff and very professional. All the different amenities and warm hearted staff made the stay worth while. Talk with Jeannie Kim if you have an event soon. She is great, professional and caring.
Manager Response: Dear John B,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We will certainly pass your comments on to Jeannie. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: This is a hidden gem that has a great local tin and is close to freeway access. The facility is spotless and inviting. Typical quality Embassy Suites room. The staff is efficient and unassuming. Check in is a breeze as is check out. Parking is included in the room rate. Our #1 choice when visiting the N. Orange County area.
Manager Response: Dear jkentris,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: On the PLUS side:  The front desk staff were very nice. My room was large and clean. It is conveniently located close to several places to eat both in the mall and outside.  On the NEGATIVE side:  The lobby is sterile and unfriendly looking - just a big, echoing area without warmth or charm. The location is unremarkable, next door to Brea Mall.   I was in town for business, and spent the night, checking in after a meeting at 1:00 a.m., and checking out at 10:30 the next morning. Did not have time to use any of the amenities or eat the complimentary breakfast. For the privelege of spending one night in one room (one person), I paid $258, with taxes.  The view was of the mall parking lot - not pretty.
Manager Response: Dear kaecie,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated as we go through our hotel modernization. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Pleasant and very helpful staff, nice clean rooms and good location. The free breakfast is excellent. The drawback is noisy air-conditioning and less than comfortable beds. If that could be corrected this hotel would deserve an exceptional rating.
Manager Response: Dear Matsmd,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated as we go through our hotel modernization. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: There is construction going on in the hotel leading to noise and smell issues. My toilet ran all night and there was rust in the tub and sink. There was chipped paint on the doors and walls as well as missing tiles in the bathroom.

I was there for an event - breakfast is amazing, rooms are clean and smell good. Event staff were helpful, food was wonderful, even the AV guys we on it!  Fabulous hotel.  Center area is light, airy and lots of space to congregate and chat.
Manager Response: Dear Heartofahawk,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated as we go through our hotel modernization. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Hotel and staff excellent. Clean, comfortable, good value. Breakfast very enjoyable. Nightly reception provided. Location is close to many restaurants and shopping. Underground parking is easy to access.
Manager Response: Dear C4388MUpatricias,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: I've stated good praise throughout, and again very happy with the service provide. The construction made the lobby look plain, but again once it is complete. I am sure it will be a wonderful looking hotel lobby.
Manager Response: Dear 37ramona,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated as we go through our hotel modernization. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Renovation where going on during stay, was not a good seen. Also 2 very large groups where in attendance at the same time and had to wait over an hour for breakfast. Water to the entire hotel was shut off for several hour 1 day during the stay.

Traveled for business and had to change rooms because I asked for a quiet room and they put me in the middle of a hallway, in a handicap room, facing a busy street, which was loud. Didn't get my Hilton honors welcome rewards, housekeeping didn't leave towels and left clogged drain in sink which led to bugs in room (fruit-fly like). No hot water on Saturday and couldn't shower for a presentation I was speaking at OR had to take a freezing shower. Sunday NO water at all for 4 hours. Staff 'compensated' me by removing a meal from the bill and said couldn't give more than 5000 Hilton rewards (joke). Paid a lot of the room too.

Summary Heading: Maybe when construction is done it will be fine . . .
Summary: This hotel is under construction, and the quality of the stay in the interim is NOT up to Embassy Suites standards, though the pricing still is. Dust, dirt, paint fumes, hanging plastic, noise and chaos were the order of the day. Our room featured a creaking bathroom door, a tub drain that didn't, and AC that didn't, either. The breakfast service was not up to the size of the hotel, so was slow (a wait line over 100 feet long on Saturday morning.) Not impressed at all.

I highly recommend Embassy Suites Brea.  Every time that i stay is truly a pleasure.  The staff takes care of any need that comes up.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  It is always a pleasure coming back to a thoroughly cleaned room.  The location is excellent with multiple restaurants and the shopping mall right next door.  The overall service this hotel provides is 2nd to none.  There is currently some construction going on however it does not detract from the environment and I look forward to seeing the end result.
Manager Response: Dear J0ebw,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: The entire property was under construction.  The smell of fresh paint was prevalent everywhere.  I was not able to access my points, along with paying more for my room than others.. I am a Hilton Honors member and a AAA member, and not sure I received the best rate..?

2 Big rooms with a small kitchen. Good bed. 2 flatscreen tv monitors. My room had a Nice view of the mountains with snow on. The gym was too small with too few machines. Nice out door pool. Good bar with happy hour from 17.30-19.30 every day. All beverages for free. My stay was 9 days in march. Hotel is still under heavy construction. Brea mall and many other shops and restaurants very close by. Brea downtown is within walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear Nicolas,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated as we go through our hotel modernization. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!  Sincerely, Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Lots of restaurants, a mall, and Target within walking distance. Very Nice hotel. great complimentary breakfast with omelette station, cold and hot buffet as well. Nice complimentary evening reception with appetizers. The rooms were comfortable and roomy.  Will stay again.
Manager Response: Dear kathleenr407,   It is great to hear you had a 1st class stay with us! Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!   Sincerely,  Team Embassy Suites - Brea

Summary Heading: Under construction last spring of 2016-will be awesome when it's done!
Summary: I stayed here last spring of 2016 and it was under construction. My stay was still fine though as the hotel did a great job keeping things flowing. It will be really nice when it's done. Sean at the desk was wonderful. There was free underground parking which was helpful. Only 1 elevator was working at the time b/c of construction so that slowed things down in the morning. Everything else was fine ... no odor in the room. I would stay here again. : -)
Manager Response: Dear Eulalia_3,   Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our hotel! It is greatly appreciated as we go through our hotel modernization. We hope you will come back to visit our new-look venue again soon!   Sincerely,  Team Embassy Suites, Brea North-Orange County

Summary: Our overall stay was adequate despite the major remodeling going on at this property.  We love this location because of the proximity to shopping and family.  The room was dated and the bathroom had plumbing issues.  The bathtub ran continuously and the sink faucet leaked each time the water was turned on.  The staff was friendly and helpful.

Summary: I've stay  many times at Embassy Suites hotels. The Brea Embassy is one of my favorites. The staff is excellent, everyone is very nice and friendly. The hotel  is in a great location. Right next to a Mall and many restaurant's.

Was extremely pleased with the hotel accommodations and service provided by the hotel staff.  Was especially pleased with the Hilton Honors program and the ability to process and review the request, rooms, etc., online.  Will definitely return and recommend to family and friends.

Summary: They offer so much more than just a room. I was on the 7th floor. the room has a full balcony.  They are renovating so you'll need to excuse the mess and the weirdness of the "hotel lobby" for now.    The hotel location is next to a mall a library post office and several other stores all within walking distance.  They offer local shuttle service, the best Breakfast EVER! Come for the breakfast alone. they offer evening drinks too.  Please remember to tip the staff, they are wonderful. I can't say enough good things about the staff.   I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear 920phyllise,   It is great to hear you had an enjoyable stay with us!  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!    Sincerely,  Team Embassy Suites Brea

It has a free shuttle service that will take you anywhere within 5 miles, which is a great plus.

Summary: The hotel is conveniently located.. for  both business and family trips I will definitely stay here..They only have to add a bellboy to help us with our luggage's. Hopefully renovations will uplift the lobby and should be finished in the next two months.

The hotel despite undergoing final renovations provided a great stay for my family and all of our guests.  The location for shopping for basics or more is so convenient being adjacent the Brea Mall.  The complimentary daily breakfast and evening reception can't be beat for the all inclusive price!  The entire staff were friendly, accommodating and professional.  Highly recommend for large groups.  The location near the Nixon Library couldn't have been more convenient!
Manager Response: Dear Spartow,   It is great to hear you had a 1st class stay with us!  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit our new-look hotel again soon!    Sincerely,  Team Embassy Suites - Brea

Summary: Close to the freeway and located next to two mall complexes, but far enough away to feel like you are secluded from them.  The inner courtyard was under construction at the time of this review, but it was still very nice to have a large courtyard with a glass ceiling at the center of all the rooms.  Very nice!
Manager Response: Dear Davidap61,   It is great to hear you had a 1st class stay with us!  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit our new-look hotel again soon!    Sincerely,  Team Embassy Suites Brea

Summary: For a Hilton hotel, the whole hotel is rather outdated in appearance. In the room itself, some elements were rickety. The  carpets, the interior of the building, it all looks a bit dirty and outdated. Not a huge problem -- the staff is friendly, the bed big, and the shower hot, but for $200 a night one can expect more. The fact that the Wifi is not free (9 dollar if you are not a Hilton Honors member) is frankly ridiculous in this day and age. I'm choosing another hotel next time I'm in Brea...
Manager Response: Dear Joeri E,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel, and we appreciate the kind words regarding our staff. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our suites. Guest comfort and safety are our top priorities and we regret you did not experience this. As you saw, we are in the middle of our hotel modernization, which is due to be complete in the coming months. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.   Best regards,  Warwick Prendiville - Director of Operations

Summary: This was our third time staying at this particular Embassy Suites, and while we had really good experiences the first two times, third time was definitely not a charm.   My husband, myself, and two of our children attended Supercross at Angels Stadium on 1/21/17, and had booked a room two months in advance for the event. Check-in was fine, the young woman working the front desk was pleasant, and because I am a Hilton Honors member, I was able to check in before arriving at the hotel, so we could get into the room early, and head to the pit party before the races started.   We checked in at 1:30 p.m., left the room at 3:30 p.m., and did not return until nearly 11 p.m. We all woke the next morning ready to shower, and eat some breakfast, when all of a sudden we heard what sounded
Manager Response: Dear packyourheart,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our your stay here. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. The condition of our suites is very important to us as we aim to provide guests with the best accommodations and service. The issue with the shower, as well as the issues with our front desk team have been addressed and we are very sorry this led to uncomfortable stay at our hotel. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future at our new-look hotel.  Sincerely,   Warwick Prendiville - Director of Operations Embassy Suites Hotel - Brea

Summary: Great stay. Good value for the price. Clean rooms. Staff was helpful. Breakfast was wonderful, lots of variety. Unfortunately the Complimentary dinner was lacking in variety. Consisted of chips & dip.

Summary: If you've never stayed at an Embassy Suites, then you need to know that there is no real "hallway" at this chain. Meaning, the rooms all face the open lobby and you could walk outside your room and look down below to the lobby/bar/restaurant. Which, to me, isn't ideal if you're a fan of "quiet." There was a group of women, who were apart of a bachelorette party staying the same weekend I was, and let me tell you, a group of women getting wasted at the bar + single men + hollering = loud! Not good if you have young children who are trying to sleep.   I do like the suite style rooms at the Embassy. It has a seating area in a seperate room with a pull out couch and TV. A little kitchenette with sink, coffee maker and fridge. The beds were comfy. Bathroom was clean.  Parking at this

Very, very nice! Great size for multiple friends. Close to the elevator. Great area to stay in. Close to good restaurants and places like Target for last minute supplies. Had a great time. Parking was super easy for my friends which I appreciated.

Summary: Good hotel - will be better after the lobby renovation is done.  Staff is VERY helpful and service oriented.  Will stay there again.  Breakfast and evening reception was good, the staff there is extremely accomodating

Summary: Hello, I'm staying here tonight on business. The hotel has been renovated over the last 15 months. They are nearing the end of their renovations. The hotel rooms are chic modern and completely updated. They are finishing the lobby the main area as well as the restaurant next month.       The hotel is been updated to include all of the digital key access to each of the rooms the exercise area has been updated to Precor exercise equipment.    The pool outside was kept up very neatly and look like a very inviting place to sit and have a glass of wine.     Overall I am very satisfied with this hotel. I stayed in 87 different Hilton properties last year and this one is amongst the top of what I have seen.      If you're in the area I would recommend staying at this hotel. The hotel

Needless to say Embassy Suites will be my hotel when in town .

Manager Response: Dear Angela,   It is great to hear you had a 1st class stay with us!  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!    Sincerely,  Team Embassy Suites - Brea

Summary: Nice hotel, even while under construction.  Breakfast is delicious and always more than enough variety of food. My only issue was the parking.  Mall shoppers go in and make it difficult to park when returning from meetings at night.  In my opinion, that needs to be fixed.

Embassy Suites in Brea is a wonderful hotel.  I am never disappointed when I stay here.  The evening happy hour reception was a great way to meet up with other friends who were there and we also enjoyed the full breakfast the next day.  I felt very welcomed there.

Embassy Suite is a little more money but it is always well worth the money. It is easy off the freeway and central to all my Orange County stops.  The have been remodeling the entire hotel. The rooms have been finished.  The main ballroom downstairs. It has never been a problem. It is always a pleasure to stay there.

Once the remodel is complete this Embassy Suite will be beautiful.  The rooms are very nice and clean. The restaurant was not a great choice  for dinners and was very expensive for the atmosphere. The complimentary breakfast was great and very helpful since we were there for a Softball tournament for my daughter.

Summary Heading: No one told me of the remodel
Summary: This hotel is being totally remodeled and isn't up what it should be for the price that you pay! You pay for a full price but you don't get a quality hotel! Someone should of explained that this hotel was under a major remodel and what you would normally expect from a Embassy Suites hotel you definitely don't get it now but you still pay full price!

We were greeted by an exceptionally friendly and cheerful check-in staff  (Lauren?) when we arrived in the evening.  Thank you!  The suite was exactly of what we needed.  It's spacious and had been remodeled recently.  In fact the hotel is under renovation; much of the ground floor was a construction zone.  The contractor had kept it clean and tidy though.  Breakfast was free and the selection was very good, including made-to-order omelette.   The only issue we ran into was with the bartender.  It was a slow night and the music was cranked up.  My companion and I were the only customers. We asked him to turn down the music so we could hold a conversation without yelling.  The first response was he had no control over the volume (really?).  After I gave him an incredulous look,

Summary Heading: Glad it was being Refreshed but Needed More
Summary: Stayed at property about 3 times now, first couple of times noticed that rooms were beat up and in bad need of refresh. Was happy to see model of refresh after our 2nd stay. On this most recent stay, our 3rd, we thought we were lucky enough to be put in one of the newly refreshed rooms, it was so new, we still smelled the wet paint. Sadly for us, the job that was done on the refresh was sloppy at best. I found multiple spots of failure within seconds of entering the room, made me wonder if the room was punched before being released into service. We didn't complain since we only were staying 1 night this time. We overall love the property and the location is great for us since we have family within a couple of minutes of the hotel. We will be back soon! Hope the refresh got

This hotel is under construction with dust everywhere. The center atrium is being redone with no ability to control dust and sandstone. If you have any respiratory problems, would definitely stay away.

This hotel was undergoing renovations but no mention was made of that fact when I made reservations. I have grown accustomed to higher standards and expected more from Embassy Suites Hotels. Staff were less than helpful. An unexpected situation.

Summary Heading: Might be a good idea to wait until the remodelling is complete.
Summary: This hotel has lost the excellence of the Embassy Suite franchise during remodeling.  The prices are the same in spite of the noise, the paint, and relocation of the breakfast area.  The chairs placed in the breakfast area were soiled.  The fruit used for the evening free gathering appeared to have been previously frozen.  The rooms were decent and the plus was being in walking distance of the mall.

basically in a nut shell it was my wedding weekend and they gave my presidential suite that i reserved more than 5-6 months a head of time to a person who extended their stay.  and all they can tell me is that by law they cannot kick that person out of the room but they can cancel my reservation.  yes they gave me another room but still its the principal.  also they did not tell there was going to be renovation going on at this time which was unpleasant to look at.  also i keep on trying to call house keeping supervisor d/t a lost item and they still have not contacted me.

Room was very clean, nice and comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was great too! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it. Even though there was some construction/remodeling going on, I never heard noise from it, but would love to go back to see what it's going to look like at the end.  And to have the mall right next door, even better!

this was a great stay at the hotel! i deff recommend it.  I know the lobby is going under construction right now but it is stated on the website so it should not be a surprise.  it will prolly take a few months which is normal. doesn't effect my room stay.  the front desk was great. it would be Jordan and Bridgett and Devon ( FOM )  thank you guys for always giving a helping hand.

Summary Heading: Its not easy being a guest when a hotel is undergoing a major renovation
Summary: I stayed here recently for 2 weeks with my husband, we both were aware that the hotel was under renovation & we still chose to stay here. The renovation taking place is more major than we had envisioned & the first week of our stay was probably the worst. Everyday there were lots & lots of dust it lingered with no way of escape, there was quite a bit of noise from machinery & workmen. Its a major renovation & its happening right outside your room in the middle of the hotel, theres no way any guest could escape that. There was a huge amount of dust & i was concerned that this could be a health risk.  The second week of our stay they had laid the concrete slab & things really did quieten down noticably. But after the concrete cured & the workers returned the noise also returned a

I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.  Unfortunately, it is the only hotel in the Brea area.  It is under construction and they have the nerve to charge the same rates that they would if it wasn't under construction.  The management is less than professional and a few of the desk staff were incompetent.  When a medical emergency arose, they did not call the paramedics in a timely manner and then tried to make excuses for their lack of attention to the matter.

Breakfast could be better.  Especially for The price of the hotel room per night.  The snacks served during free cocktails could have been better.  Bartender was looking out window waiting for something while I was there.  Normally a great hotel.   A shame i went there during construction, I wish I would have known, normally in great shape there but this trip was forgettable to say the least.

I've been here a few times for convention, and loved it every time. It has been the best place I have stayed in years. The service we receive while here was prompt and well done. Their food is always yummy and plentiful.

Interesting fact: This is the third Embassy Suites I stayed in the last 3 weeks that was of poor quality. WHAT IS GOING ON?!?  The room we were given seemed fine upon initial inspection.  However, as we entered the bathroom, the toilet and bathtub were disgusting! Both had hairs, brown marks, etc.  It looked as if had just been used!!  We immediately called to the front desk, who found us another room ALL THE WAY across the floor.  Just a heads up.  Please be mindful of the wheels of the luggage carts and how smoothly they can traverse the thick carpet.    When we got to the second room, it was bigger but a few pieces of furniture were missing.  The excuse was renovations are being done.  Same excuse given for why we could not book a room on the top floor.  That's something that

I was very disappointed I didn't know about the massive renovations that were doing on at this property. It was a mess and my favorite part of these properties was not available. The ability to sit in the atrium each evening after a long day at work. This is more a reflection of not having advance notice that the chain as a whole. Make sure you check to ensure they are finished before you book soon.

Our group was told this hotel was under going minor construction, when we arrived we found out the entire hotel was having renovations. There was dust and debris that filled the air daily along with the sounds of jack hammers.

We stayed here on a Saturday night.  Our suite was clean and very comfortable. We enjoyed the 2 rooms.  We were able to sleep in the next morning since it was quiet up on the 4th floor.  Breakfast was extremely busy.  We couldn’t eat at the same time, since one of us had to find an empty table and save it while the other went to get their food.  There were not enough tables for the busy Sunday morning crowd.  The food was fine.

Arrived to find the hotel heavily under renovation with the main ground floor area closed off and just a building site. Rooms have recently been updated and are an improvement. Breakfast was not great. The temporary room is very dark and the breakfast options spread out into different small rooms. I question whether the hotel should be open at this time. Work starts at 9am so anyone hoping to sleep in will struggle. Whilst checking out there were a number of dumpster type vehicles driving through the lobby removing rubble so was vary noisy. Work is due to complete in Feb 17 so would avoid until then. Was surprised that rates were still high based on the current offer.

Embassy Suites offers spacious 2 room suites that are very comfortable and clean.  The staff is very helpful, and the free made-to-order breakfast is always made very well, with a good selection on the buffet as well.

Summary Heading: Lobby construction and dust made the experience forgetable
Summary: I have stayed in this hotel for work before and was pretty good. However, walking last week into it and tasking the dust in my mouth due to the messy construction made me wonder why they would remain open when the whole lobby and atrium area is a major construction zone (see photo). I booked online and don't remember seeing a warning. Definitively I thought it was a bit beyond what is okay to do while you still take guests in and though the room was clean, seeing the dust in the air and taste it was not what I would expect for the price paid.

This hotel is undergoing a massive demolition activity, with constant jack hammering, concrete saw cutting, and with air thick with concrete and other toxic dust.  The staff referred to it as a renovation, but the entire inside of the hotel is being demolished.  Bulldozers are being driven in through the front lobby.

Summary Heading: Blood on Sheets and melt of cig Smoke
Summary: My son has asthma and upon arrival the room smelt of cigarette smoke, when asked for another room I was hung up on then told they were booked. In the middle section of our bed sheets there were blood stains, when calling house keeping 3 times they never arrive to clean the sheets, we slept on the couch. I always reserve the penthouse/presidential suite and have spent a lot of money at this location in the past 2 years. I recommend for your own safety to stay elsewhere

Summary Heading: Construction took away from overall experience
Summary: This hotel will be very nice once construction is completed.  Currently there is allot of work under way, which makes getting around the hotel a bit of a hassle.  Compared to many other Embassy Suite Chains I would rate this one very low...especially for the price during construction which will last into 2017.  The breakfast was about the same but more variety offered at other Embassy Suites than what was available at this particular hotel. The rooms were nice and after a long day, it was nice to wind down and relax for the evening.

The hotel is good but the construction noise and dust was unbearable. You should inform your guests a head of time so they have the option to stay somewhere else. Also I did not get any warm cookies as others did

Good, friendly and attentive staff. Great rooms with plenty of space and comfortable bed. The only thing was that the in room coffee maker did not have an electrical outlet at it's location and had to move it to another table. The food is great and they have a good variety. The Ballroom where we had our 50th Reunion was great and we were able to accommodate the photographer, bar set up, buffet dinner, stage for our DJ and large enough dance floor for at least 120 persons. The service in the ballroom was excellent. This is the second time we used this facility for a 50th reunion.(mine and my wife's). Location is great being freeway close and shopping within 100 yards.

Don't stay here until next year when the construction nightmare is done!! I can't believe they had this place open during the construction. The lobby and atrium looked like a war zone. The noise was unbearable. Safety was not a consideration for guests. They were welding right in front of my room (within 2 feet of my door) and had construction vehicles driving right down the middle of the lobby. AND THEY CHARGED ME THE FULL RATE!!! Unbelievable....

Summary Heading: War zone instead of a lush tropical Atrium
Summary: Save your money.. major renovations at Embassy Suites Brea. Was my 50 year reunion and we had worked hard for 3 years. Was so disappointed that Embassy Suites Brea did not find it necessary to share this information with us before we signed our contract. Will never stay here or book another event with them. Rooms were over priced as this hotel  looks like a war zone in the Atrium. We were told it wouldn't really matter once our reunion started. Here's a news flash.. it does matter.

We have stayed here several times over the last ten years. It is our first choice in the Brea area. The staff is friendly and helpful and the location is great. Highly recommend! They are currently doing renovation of the atrium area but it didn't affect our stay.

Hotel Is undergoing major renovations not just a little hammering I'm talking jackhammer very loud pounding dust debris and very disruptive for a business traveler would never stay there again! No warning

We called and made a reservation because we were going to a family member's funeral.  We were not told that the hotel was under construction.  When we arrived, the noise level and air quality from broken concrete were unbearable. To top it off, the staff really didn't care.

Super comfortable mattress with a great night’s sleep in a beautiful, freshly renovated two room suite.    A well appointed gym to start the day and a captivating oasis just past the pool and spa where I completed my floor exercises accompanied by a gentle breeze, swaying palms with humming birds and butterflies; it felt straight out of a magazine or local morning show. After that a hot and delicious complimentary breakfast, shower and on my way. Was there construction in progress? Yes, but no noise or disturbance and I'm looking forward to a return visit to see the completed renovation.  A special thank you to the staff, especially Jay, for unrivaled service.

Summary Heading: Bring a hard hat and boots!
Summary: Arrived at what can only be described as a demolition site. We booked this hotel many months ago and we were not made aware in advance that the hotel is going to be a building site.  On arrival a small sign saying work due- which is the understatement of the year.  The Health and safety is non existent - guests tripping over the plywood flooring left out for the diggers to drive on as they enter through the main entrance.  The dust which is in the air throughout the building is definately a health hazard as it could trigger reaction in a susceptible individual.  Lost for words! Have tapped 1 out of 5 as tripadvisor will not allow a zero score. I would speak to the manager but I can even speak to the front desk without having to wait for the digger noise to stop.

Clean, Curteous  friendly fun and a great place to dine. The staff was courteous and professional. Bridgette,Claire, Devin, all house keepers, Managers Sean And Devin. Excellent professional staff hard workers to please people that go beyond the call of duty. Excellent and each employee deserves employee of the month for there hard work.

Summary Heading: Typical Embassy Suites ++ Remarkable Staff and improvements in process
Summary: There is much about the Embassy Suites in Brea that will remind you of the Embassy Suites experience around the world.  A courtyard style hotel, 2-room suites, made-to-order breakfast, etc.  It's a terrific experience and a good value.  This particular location is distinctive because of its staff.  The front desk staff listened carefully to the details of our complex reservation (a wedding with multiple rooms and guest arriving at different times and blah blah blah) and not only attended cheerfully to the non-standard requests, but were able also to anticipate our preferences.  Well done.  The staff are remarkably friendly.  Even the staff busing the tables in the breakfast area were cheerful and engaged.  Wow.  The facility itself is under renovation.  (During our visit, they

Comfortable room with minor issues, center area is under renovation so water feature was green and planters were bare. Decent made to order omlette station, needed more bus service for the tables. Great parking and location. Devin took care of us with a great attitude. We will be back.

The decor is a little outdated, but it looks like they're updating. The breakfast buffet was excellent, however, there doesn't seem to be enough staff to clean up. We ate at a dirty table twice during our four day stay. Bridgette at the Front Desk is amazing.

This is a typical Embassy Suites in a good location near the Mall, Civic Center, a Target, and other stores.  Many restaurants are nearby. Hotel is clean and offers a free breakfast buffet, although the quality of the food isn't the best.  Rooms are spacious with a real wall (not a half-wall) between living room and bedroom.

In a state where parking is usually pay by night, it was great that this hotel did not. The location was ideal for getting away from the theme park crowds.  As always, on site free breakfast is a welcomed sight. The staff was very helpful and polite. We will be staying here again in December.

This hotel is located right in the Brea Mall parking lot.  Excellent location for daily access to shopping and eating!  The full complimentary breakfast includes made-to-order eggs or one lets, waffles/pancakes, bagels, toast, fruits, and a wide selection of drinks!

My husband, our 18 year-old daughter, and I had a very comfortable and accommodating stay here several nights in August. Staff was very courteous, helpful, efficient, and all had great attitudes. There was ample space in the two room king suite.  The hide-a-bed slept just fine and the king bed slept very comfortably. The full breakfast was very good and did include an omelette bar.   Room service was tasty and accommodating.  This location is very convenient with a shopping mall across the street, more shopping all around you, and restaurants very close by. Pool and hot tub were well maintained. The only thing I didn't like was that the living area was not super bright and it had whited out, privacy type windows. Although, it was very relaxing and you were never concerned about

I stayed 2 nights at the Embassy Suites in Brea, CA.  The hotel is wonderful.  I was greeted with very friendly employees that were quite helpful.  The room was wonderful! Very clean and decorated nicely. Any time I met up with an employee of the hotel they were helpful and quite friendly. I will definitely go back to Embassy Suites.  Every time I've stayed at one of their hotels it's been a great experience.

Excellent room breakfast everything cleen and very friendly staff.  I woud recomended this place for bussines or vacation with the family... the place is very pretty, it is worth it, I would back againg with  my family...

Summary Heading: Top Notch amenities, classy hotel, PERFECT location -  best choice in area by far
Summary: My wife and 2 sons 9 and 5 had the chance to stay here recently and if had everything we needed and more. Everything we needed:   -Restaurant on property with good food and reasonable prices -Swimming pool for the kids; well appointed workout center for us -Free Breakfast that included made to order omlettes, pancakes and waffles -Recently renovated rooms with fridge and microwave -Hotel right next to mall and in the middle of tons of food options in walking distance of it all -Staff that was professional, courteous and extremely helpful -- Thanks again Brooke! AND MORE -There was a large pond in the middle of the hotel with large koi in it.  The kids could get fish food at the desk and feed them for fun. I would absolutely stay here again in the future.

clean and great hotel, the bar staff is a bit snotty and rude at times and makes weak drinks, like barley a 1 second pour.  Breakfast is good because of the fresh eggs but bacon was cold.  Pool was a bit cloudy and looked a little green.  Room was clean and having a patio was a plus just for fresh air.  Lobby staff is amazing and always friendly and approachable.

The bed was very comfortable and the view from my room was spectacular. The staff working the front desk as well as those working the dining atrium in the morning were incredibly friendly.  Unfortunately, I had trouble doing work from my room because the wifi was incredibly slow during many nights of my stay. Streaming video was completely out of the question. I called the front desk and was told the hotel was very near full capacity and Internet usage was high.  Also, there was one night where children were running rampant around the hotel. They were incredibly loud and abused the gym equipment.  One of the straps was broken on the exercise cycle and I assume this was caused by them. I also had to wait a long time for an elevator because two boys pushed all the buttons on the

this hotel is well located (restaurant, mall..). easy parking, nice pool, nice hot tub, breakfast is decent, nice lobby, room are cleaned and big, the only weak point i internet that is slow and has a tendency to lag. overall is at least 9/10

Excellent service, bedding was comfortable. There was a hair on the sheets. Maybe from the maid that made the bed!! Beautiful atmosphere in the hotel. very clean. I would stay at this hotel again or any Embassy Suites. Food was excellent.

This is now the 109th different Embassy Suites property I have stayed (and counting). Pre-checked in. Got a nice room overlooking the outdoor pool.  Fairly standard ES breakfast and manager's reception. Hotel is across the street from the large Brea Mall, lots of shopping. Great restaurants nearby too. Overall, staying 3 nights, this was a very pleasant hotel.

Absolutely the best!  Loved it! We asked ..we got!  Everyone was sooo nice and  everyone always greeted us with a smile. Now we are home..we already miss it! Everything was so clean and top notch! Henry & Carol Wing

The hotel was an awesome experience. Clean, quite and the mall across the street. There omelettes are the best. Everyday was a different omelett. There customer service was awesome. First time in California. Felt very secure and had the best five nights.

Summary Heading: A fine location in the midst of awesome shopping
Summary: This is a great Embassy Suites location. We loved both the suite size rooms with extra doors that eliminated most of the hallway noise and the security of most rooms opening towards the courtyard with a glass elevator to boot. Traveling with half-independent age teens, these extra security features were a big plus. The rooms had fresh furniture and great bedding. The hotel serves free breakfast which is ample though somewhat underutilized by guests due to proximity of so many other quality restaurants. There is a small restaurant/bar on site. The hotel is a few short steps away from the Brea mall and it crown jewel, Nordstrom. What else is there to wish for?!

We stayed at embassy suites for six nights. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and our room was fantastic and spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable and the complimentary breakfast was delicious!!!  We would highly recommend this hotel.

Excellent all around :-) Nice Garden Pool outside. Plenty of free parking underneath building. Nice bar with pool table for HH. Great discounted prices at bar btw 3 to 5 PM n 9 to close. Building surrounded by shopping and restaurants within yards away. Just a great hotel at a great location.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with shopping within walking
Summary: This hotel had ample parking in the garage and easy access to hotel elevators from there. We had a 2 room suite and this room is a living room with a seperate bathroom and a bedroom with 2 beds. It was an ok set up but not ideal for privacy. The breakfast spread was well received by all guest and had ample choices for all ages. Friendly staff and my family really enjoyed the outside pool. It was across the street from the brea mall to the south and target to the north.

As always we enjoyed ourselves at our home away from home the service we received from the staff was great, especially Devon for remembering everything my family appreciates that makes us ever so comfortable, see you again in a couple of months

Hotel needs some upgrading. Ice maker on our floor didn't work. Pool had no towels and when they brought clean ones they only brought 10. They were gone in 20 seconds. Kids had to use hand towels from gym. When we got to our room air conditioning was not working.  A maintainence worker came to our room and brought two small fans. We were six people. None of use slept all night we were so hot.

Summary Heading: Good Embassy Suites in Brea, Yorba Linda, Fullerton, Rowland Heights
Summary: Nice Embassy Suites. Ussual Embassy style, however room, beds, bathrooms, all amenities in the room are recently gone through complete renovation & upgrade.  Upgrade is showcased near hotel reception.  Wouldn't say more than it's been a mice & pleasant stay.  Will definitely recommend for business & family stay for visiting inland SoCal

This trip was a business trip where I was able to combine some down time with my wife and daughter. I was very pleased with the location and overall amenities provided by the hotel. My wife and I were somewhat impressed with the quality and variety of the complimentary breakfast. Not just packaged food.

Summary Heading: Long weekend for a wedding in Fullerton
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights as our friends were getting married in Fullerton. Great choice as brea mall is steps away. Great dining within walking distance too. We had a suite which was lovely and gave my 10 year old her privacy too. Breakfast was included every morning and there was a great selection. Parking was an underground parking lot and was free.   I would highly recommend this accomodation

I have been traveling to this hotel for over 1 and 1/2 years . I fly in once a month for a week. Excellent Hotel. Professional Staff. I highly recommend to all professionals and families that travel to stay at this particular hotel !

Lovely hotel, great location, staff is wonderful. Stayed here for a user convention for 4 nights. Rooms include fridge and microwave. Sheets are on the rough side and outside noise isn't blocked very well.

Hotel is going through renovation right now rooms were dirty heard hammers during day dusty through out the showers were dirty - we have stayed here previously and really were overall happy with all amenities hoping they turn it around after renovation

Summary Heading: July Stay at Embassy Suites Brea
Summary: Embassy Suites is a nice hotel.  The bed was very comfortable (and we are pretty picky about that), the breakfast was very good and could be made to order.  They have a decent fitness center and a large pool.  We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

This was the most amazing hotel stay my wife and I have ever had. Amazing rooms! Awesome breakfast! The staff was incredible! Every morning when they saw us come down for breakfast they ran over and washed a high chair for our baby and brought it over to us. Less than a minute walk to a great mall. There is also an incredible children's museum near by if you have young kids.  When we arrived our keycard didn't work so I had to go back to the front desk. It was quickly solved and I didn't give it another thought. Later that night, a card and cookies were sent to our room apologizing for the inconvenience and "wanting to make it right."   We will absolutely stay here again if in the area. Truly our best experience ever.

Having never stayed at an Embassy Suites before, I actually expected something completely different.  I was under the impression that this was a higher end property than a normal Hilton.  It is not.  It is in fact more geared to hosting families.  All rooms sleep at least 4 people, and the once with two beds sleep 6 people, quite comfortably.  Some of the rooms even ajoin, so if you are a bigger group, you can have connecting rooms that accommodate a total of 12 people.  I never got an opportunity to use the pool.  Had planned to, but just never had the time.  I could see it from the room though, and it was always busy.  The kids loved it.  The buffet breakfast was average for an included breakfast, but if you took the time to stand in line for some fresh eggs or omelets, they

If you are planning to visit Disney Land and want the best service, the best breakfast, the best value on your dollar and want to avoid large crowds, Embassy Brea is the place to stay  FREE PARKING, FREE BREAKFAST AND FREE COCKTAIL HOUR, if you added all of these of items as an expense we would have spent $500-$700 above what we did for the 4 days we were there.   Save your money and spend it on the family, let Embassy Brea take care of you and you will have a happy wife, happy kids and money in your pocket

Every part of our stay was fantastic.  Hotel is beautiful and well maintained.  Staff is courteous.  Rooms are spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated.  Breakfast was delicious, service was great.  If I were in the area I would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Very good if not using sofa bed
Summary: We had a king bed suite. The primary bed was great but the sofa bed was awful. It was full of broken springs that poked up when we lay on it.  The breakfast was great - lots of variety and served late enough for our sleepy teenagers.

Who would check someone in a room where construction is going on. Talk about safety hazard for my kid! We ended up walking over paint cans. We also heard drilling and sawing up until 4 or 5 pm. Horrible place to take children.

Very nice hotel, if we are ever in the area again we would choose to stay here.  my only recommendation would be to clean and clear dining table a little quicker in the mornings. Our bed was extremely comfortable, our room was very clean and nicely decorated.

We stay at this hotel often when in the LA/Orange country area visiting family. I am going to start with all of the wonderful things and then end with a couple issues and some suggestions for the hotel in case they read their reviews.   After booking the room we were offered the possibility of an upgrade to one of the corner rooms and I responded yes to this. Often we are in town visiting family and they come to see us where ever we are staying and the extra room is really nice. The lobby and atrium have a new coat of a white paint. It has lightened up the feel of those areas. Looks great! The room we were in was recently refurbished. The room is of what I like to call as a transitional style. It's modern but still has some traditional elements to it that makes it very warm.

Be aware of the fact that despite this being a non-smoking hotel, guests are allowed to smoke on balconies. Keep your windows closed to avoid smoke entering your room.   Keep your breakfast voucher with you, it is asked for at random. As for breakfast, if you are looking for the bacon, it is at the omelette bar. That is annoying as you must stand in line to get it vs being able to serve yourself. I assume this is kept behind the counter to keep it from vanishing. The breakfast buffet was varied, many choices of food, fruit, yogurt, breads, pastries, eggs, sausage, pancakes. Arrive early for a low line, see the elevator posters for suggested "low occupancy" times and plan ahead.   The room was clean, everything was in order despite the hotel undergoing renovations. There was food

Summary Heading: Quality of service/accomadations/overall stay @ The Embabassy Suites in Brea, CA
Summary: 4 days of absolute focus of your staff regarding everyone of our needs and wants. An aproximent 150 persons retreat was attended at the time we stayed yet it appeared to your staff that we were the onlys ones they had to accomendate. Breakfast and food at the "Gathering" could not be better.

Summary Heading: great hotel for a Anaheim area stay
Summary: We were attending the track meet at Cerritos College and were here two nights.  The rooms were clean and well equipped.  My son especially liked the snack tray.  Breakfast was good with a wide variety and hot items well cooked.  We found the ice makers working and the staff very pleasant.  Parking was simple and convenient.  Rooms were quiet and pool too.  I liked the courtyard with the fountain.  My only issue was one elevator was out with the remodel.

Wouldn't stay if they were remodeling. Also the price was $50.00 more then last year at this time. one of the best things about this Embassy Suites is the large pool they have on the outside. most pools are inside at a Embassy Suites.

Summary Heading: Very Nice with Great Shopping Nearby
Summary: I stayed here for a business conference and was pleasantly surprised to find a mall on one side and a Target on the other.  It was very convenient to pick up a few things and take care of some birthday shopping in my unoccupied evenings.  The hotel was very nice and the staff was always really friendly.  The meeting room was comfortable and they always provided nice stacks.  Lunches were provided and the food and service were always good.  Overall, a very nice trip!

Remodeled rooms are perfect! Color scheme  furniture and mattress are comfy! Very very nice! And love the sensor lights in the bathroom...nice when you get up at night and they automatically go on when you walk in the room!

I travel to this hotel a few times per year for work and am always happy. The front desk personnel are helpful and accomodating, the rooms are very spacious and clean, and of course the included hot breakfast every morning is a huge plus. I personally love the Egyptian theme the hotel has, but they are doing a renovation and are doing away with the theme. I did stay in a renovated room, and will say it was a nice improvement and the rooms were do for a refresh. They have done a great job. Also while on my last visit there were renovations happening on another floor and I did not once hear a peep from the work. So do not let any renovations that are happening now (June 2016) deter you. The location is directly next to a mall and a huge target and shopping center, so it is quite

Traveling with 3 kids is never easy, but at least it's fun when you have a spacious room to retire in. We ordered room service fot dinner and it was delicious. The complementary breakfast was delicious, and was the cherry on top for us!

Good location for our visit with family, and the complimentary breakfast is much better than what we've experienced at other hotels. Renovations being done were not a problem, and hardly noticeable. We will probably be back next year!

Loved the goldfish. My kids had a blast feeding them. Only thing was the busboy at breakfast refused to get me a high chair. Was willing to show me where they were. I was alone with my three small children. Would have been a huge relief to not have to drag all three of them

This Embassy Suites is undergoing renovations as of May 26th. Other than that this place is great even by Embassy Suites standards. They warned of noise possibly after 630 but it wasn't noticed by me and I'm a light sleeper. Great breakfast and their omelette chef did a great job. Comfortable rooms and the restaurant was also very good. I had the Buffalo wings and loved them. Great service and we will be back when in the area.

Upgraded to a suite, however, the suite was not finished with renovations.  Faucets did not work.  Rooms were bare.  Toilet paper holder missing pieces.  Motion detection lights in the bedroom went on every time you turned in bed and you couldn't turn them off.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites, always a good choice!
Summary: I love this hotel. Mostly for the pretty atrium area which has a nice complimentary breakfast. This one had a great workout area for my daughter and I. The only issue was there was construction going on when we were staying so there were closed off elevators and some noise.

I recently stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms. The room was very nice, clean and quiet. This is exactly what I am looking for when traveling. The breakfast was also very good. I ordered room service several times and the food was very good and the servers were very friendly. The only issue I had was my telephone was not working and it took two service requests and two days to get it fixed.  They are also finishing up the renovation on a couple of floors so you may get some noise during the day.

The Embassy Suites in Brea is a great place to stay if ever in town on business. The GM Jay is so helpful and accommodating. If you need anything the staff is great and they are almost done with their complete remodel!

I am in hotels on a weekly basis and average >200 days in hotels.  To date, this is the worst hotel in which I have stayed.  Frankly, as a Hilton Diamond member, I am surprised Hilton hasn't forced an upgrade here.  This Embassy Suites is close to the office in Brea so I have stayed here a few times but this most recent stay was the last straw  There was mold growing around the intake and register for the AC system, the toilet was dirty and there was a LOT of hair in the bathtub.  Within 30 minutes of arriving I started having asthma-type symptoms. The front desk was very courteous and gave me another room but it was only moderately better.  I was sick for a week after leaving and I have a suspicion it was due to the room.  I won't be returning and I recommend you stay away.

Summary Heading: A nice home away from home
Summary: Being away for two weeks from home, this hotel is very welcoming great staff. Staff attending breakfast are very welcoming, happy hour is ok, attended twice, recommend the staffing to be a lil more welcoming.

We enjoyed our stay there during our family get away, even though they are remolding it didn't really disturb our stay,  the room was in good condition does need a bit of love but it was good, the complimentary breakfast was better than what we expected and the staff where very helpful and friendly. We will be back soon.

Embassy suites their breakfast beast them all!  Although you are in the heart of a city you still feel like you’re on a vacation far way. Beds are comfortable bathrooms are clean.  Price is a little high but quality is also high.

Staff always accommodating and eager to please and helpful. Nice bar/restaurant on site and close to lots of other great restaurants and other stores.  Breakfast is fantastic!  Always clean.  Nice spacious rooms.

Everything about this stay was perfect, from the service, the complimentary breakfast, complimentary shuttle service, and the room -- wow, what a room!  I highly recommend this hotel for a romantic stay.  There are lots of things to do close by -- lots of shopping, restaurants, freeway access.  Staff could not be more outstanding!

Very good location and staff was friendly and accommodating.  It was very quiet and the free parking was great! The beds were comfortable and room was clean.    I was there because of the location and was busy outside of hotel with family and friends so I did not stay in room much.  When I checked out--overcharged me so be careful!

Hotel was great for the location, but, overall, average. The room and facility need updates and our room had a stale odor. Pillows were flat and needed to be replaced.  We stayed here because of the location  and convenience to family that we were visiting.

The service was excellent, I recommended all my friends to go their. It was quite an experience. The sitting area was great there were two desk one in the bedroom ether other in the living room I was in ah.

Summary Heading: Great stay. My family loved it!
Summary: We were there for a competition. This was near the location. Complimentary breakfast was nice. Room was roomy but sofa bed could be more comfortable. If you turned sideways, you could feel the springs. Overall very good, would stay again.

The hotel is under renovation but this did not hinder the staff from giving of their best. The service from everyone was out of the top drawer. The breakfasts were very good and very substantial. The rooms were large and very comfortable with a large sitting room. Very close to downtown Brea and right across from a large mall, which my wife really enjoyed. I enjoyed the evening snacks and drinks is a great way to get to know your fellow guests.

Currently Embassy Suites is going through upgrades to their facility.  It is outdated as it stands but after upgrades will be very nice.  I Check-in was rushed lacking engagement from staff. Exit Manager was not friendly at all.  Room was spacious and overall I was happy with the comforts.  Conference room was comfortable as well and the meals provided were more than satisfactory.  I would stay here again.

The hotel was perfect for our stay especially with the the 2 rooms suites. Rooms spacious and clean and have built-in wet bar with refrigerator, microwave, & coffee pot. Staff friendly and morning breakfast great. Good Location close to everything as well. No complaints!

Summary Heading: One of My Best Long Term Stays
Summary: Stayed here for several weeks straight while working for a defense contractor over in Fullerton.  Very comfortable rooms looking over an interior large courtyard.  Very friendly bar/restaurant staff, especially Paul the waiter and Kim the bartender.  Huge mall behind, and restaurants several miles down the street in downtown Brea, but I mostly enjoyed the great free drinks and munchies at happy hour, and the food in restaurant ws comparable/better than going elsewhere.  Big hot breakfasts and parking in garage under are also free, as is free internet - all of all, a good deal and a great place to stay.

Broken toilet seat. Microwave wedged into cabinet at floor level. Couldn't read controls. Remote in bedroom doesn't work all the time. HHonors should get a refurbished room, not one that is in need. The rooms were large. Happy Hour? Drinks were good but carrots, radishes, etc to go with them sucked. Freshly made omelets were good for breakfast. No gas stations around for miles.

We flew in from Illinois to meet our first grandchild. How special. We chose Embassy Suites mainly because of the location. The hotel was perfect and look forward to our next visit. The remodeling that is going on is beautiful.

Summary Heading: Very little value for the money!
Summary: Our experience was as follows:  You were under construction that affected the quality of our stay.  The flush on the toilet was broken so it was impossible to flush the toilet without taking the top of the tank off to do so.  We were told that a  letter or email was sent to everyone staying at this Embassy Suite regarding the construction - but neither we or our son who was also staying there received any such email - bad policy to lie!  We were told by the manager that we would received compensation on our bill - again another lie!  We find your customer service to be lacking greatly

Staff needs to greet guest with courtesy and smile. However, I was very impressed of the cleanliness of the room. I would consider checking in to this hotel again. The whole family enjoyed the breakfast

Thus was a very expensive hotel for a old antiquated room. Everything is old or broken. Paid extra for a sleeper and it was a lumpy old couch. The shower did not work correctly and the air did not function properly. It was either too cold it too hot.

This is a nice property, and about 20 minutes from Disneyland. The usual free breakfast, free cocktail happy hour, and safe and clean typical of Hiltons.  This location was under renovation but it didn't disrupt our stay at all.  Free parking under the hotel, and within walking of a number of eateries and a shopping mall.  Really felt good staying at this place.

It's a great location......lots of shops and restaurants nearby. It's close to my California office.  All of the staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms need to be updated including the furniture in the rooms.

We love the Embassy Suites, We never have had a bad experience : ) We love the fresh breakfast in the morning (something for everyone) and the evening socials are always very nice. We recommend this hotel and any other Embassy Suite. We have never been disappointed

While the staff was extremely polite and courteous, the hotel can you a bit of a face lift. It appears a bit tired. For breakfast the first day the California special omelette was filled with a surprising about of bacon, almost too much. But the room met all my needs. The addition of the refrigerator is nice to have not so fast food.

We have stayed at this particular Embassy Suites a few times. It's a perfect location because you have several restaurants near by the target across the street and the mall next door!  All great things but what would really be nice is if they could take over the center right across from it and fill it with some night life or something the pool hall is nice and fun. But it would be nice to have a few more options but that part is almost empty and run down.  The hotel itself is great and looks like they recently made the entry nicer. Staff was friendly and we had a very pleasant stay!

Apparently a confirmation number is meaningless at the Brea Embassy suites. I had one and upon arrival was told I no longer had a room. After a long day of travel and meetings all I wanted was a bed..

Everyone at the front desk was extremely polite, friendly and professional.  They engage conversation with their guests and have excellent manner.  The hotel is clean, although the upper floor is under renovation.    I'd stay at this hotel any time of the season.  There are lots of restaurants nearby and it is next to the major shop mall.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel in the middle of the city
Summary: Staff was wonderful (front desk / check-in volunteered to help me load my luggage up to the room while I parked though they weren't "bell service"). Free breakfast was great, varied, and plentiful. The suite was large and immaculate.

Hands down one of the best Embassy Suites. The facility is well maintained, the staff is excellent and the location is convenient to shopping, dining, entertainment with easy access to other areas close to Brea.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Brea area hands down
Summary: Pros - Extremely friendly staff and California-style laid back attitude.   - Did not charge for my bro who crashed on the fold out sofa bed. - Happy hour in bar area is good value. - Excellent breakfast with amazing selection. - Very kids friendly. - Pool is good for swimming laps, hanging out, and catching sun. - Gym is substantive, spacious, and you can get a real workout. - Parking is free with many spots. - Very central location in Brea. - Business centre was well appointed  Cons - Rooms are dated and hotel needs a facelift (which is underway, but did not impact on our stay)   - Reception staff wear strange "hospital scrubs" as outfits.  Can you please style up?!   - Wifi was weak

We had a soccer tournament in Cerrito college.  We love the hot and healthy choices during complimentary breakfast.  Parking was free as well which add to the great value received.  Adding all the benefits provided by this Embassy Suite you will realize it is the best value for your money.

I have stayed in many hotels in our country and in Europe and Asia and rate this hotel among the best.  Service from every aspect of the hotel was simply outstanding.  The staff was extremely friendly and courteous.  The complimentary breakfast buffet, including an omelet bar, was excellent in terms of quality and items available.  Self-parking was free and plentiful.  This hotel was adjacent to two shopping centers with a number of good restaurants available.

Great location, nice hotel, it is a little dated. It could really use stronger wifi (doesn't reach the rooms consistently) and more power outlets in the rooms, but clean and convenient.  Great shopping and restaurants near by.

Alert - this hotel is beginning a remodel.  And elevator has been taken out of service to serve the effort.  There were not enough to begin with and it makes getting to your room a hassle.  Also, if you are a business person depending on internet, the signal does not reach some of the rooms.  Breakfast is good, though, and staff is friendly.  Room showed signs of wear, but was generally clean.
