Great hotel stay! Large open concept hotel, very clean, and unbelievably friendly staff! Stayed for a week on business, thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast buffet with lots of options. Restaurant staff was very friendly and very attentive to our party and everyone else in the restaurant.   Staff was as accommodating as the circumstances allowed. I hoped for a later checkout than what they allowed, but they were very busy and weren't able to accommodate. I can't fault them for that, they certainly looked into it and tried their best, also offered me access to amenities while I waited for my shuttle to the airport. Truly top notch service!  Next door to a large mall and lots of restaurants in the immediate vicinity.

Warm welcome, very comfy beds, lovely breakfast.  I've stayed here a few times and it has not disappointed.  I will stay here again in a heartbeat.  The complimentary breakfast offers something for everyone.  The beds are super comfortable.  I slept soooo good!

Summary Heading: terrific little cocooning spot in the middle of a whirlwind vacation
Summary: in the middle of a too-short trip to southern california in which i tried to see way too many friends, relatives, and sites, i stole two nights and a day all to myself in a quiet, clean suite here. it was blissful :) the hotel is super easy to get to and from, is convenient to all kinds of stuff to do and places to run midtrip errands, and has free parking and pleasant accommodations. i'd definitely build this into my next trip :)

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay while on business
Summary: While traveling on business I've stayed here a few times now and it is always a pleasure. The Egyptian theme is a little left behind because they are trying to change to something more modern but you can still see remnants of the decorations all around the hotel. Free drinks and snacks from 5:30 - 7:30pm. Nice hot breakfast with an omelette station is included as well. The WiFi works well and isn't as tricky as some places I've stayed.

Summary Heading: Very nice and clean; great location
Summary: This Embassy Suites is right next to the Brea Mall. The best SoCal mall in my opinion. I love everything about this hotel . . . except the room is very dark. They could use some better lighting over the mirrors in the room and bathroom. Makes it difficult to get ready in the morning.

Good fortune placed me into one of the Penthouse suites: 4 rooms, with large and spacious everything.  world class fancy bathroom where the dual headed shower was a treat to enjoy and medicine for tired muscles  Breakfast is "on the house" but beware, weekdays it finishes at 09:00AM  Self parking was easy in large garage with handy elevators to Lobby.  Excellent bed and easy to understand and operate climate controls. Thick curtains keep sunlight at bay if you are rising a bit late.

Summary Heading: Greta location & ammeneties but needs to be refreshed
Summary: Like many Embassies, this one is the atrium style which is very inviting. This property is in an excellent location (next to the mall) and the staff was very professional and friendly. The rooms are as nice as they can be considering the age. They were clean but showed wear. Breakfast was exceptional with many choices. We had a meal at the bar and it was very good - service was very good. All in all, this is a good place to stay if you don't need a new room. We understand that a refurb is in the works which will help.

After a cross-country flight and a two hour delay regarding ground transportation, my wife and I were warmly greeted by the gregarious and helpful staff of the Embassy Suites, Brea!  Offering us bottles of water and a quiet room during my conference stay only added to our pleasure!  Additionally, this amazing staff ensured that our daughter and grand-children shared the same floor with us, and provided the kids with food to feed the on-site koi.  All in all, we were more than pleased!

This hotel perfectly fit my need.The breakfast , the distance to and from my destination is absolutely easy. Staff were gracious and helpful , found breakfast to be very good and healthy. THE PRICE is affordable , and the hotel is close to the mall and convenience store.

We have stayed at this hotel several times over the last 10 years. So happy with every stay! The breakfast is amazing and love the reception with free drink and snacks. The hotel has a nice, quiet feel and excellent location.

I stay here quite often. Very friendly and accomodating staff! Excellent complimentary breakfast (especially the potatoes) :) Anytime we need a hotel, we stay here! Managers reception is very good and staff is very helpfull!

Summary Heading: One of the best Embassy Suites
Summary: We had a big group of family and friends all staying at the hotel for a family event in Fullerton. I have always had a good experience with Embassy Suites, and this one is particularly GREAT. We loved the layout and service. The atrium/court yard is very roomy and breakfast is extremely pleasant and relaxing. Will definitely return.

We really enjoyed staying at this hotel.  The staff were very helpful and courteous.  The location is great with a lot of choices of restaurants and isn't too far away from Disneyland.  The beds were comfortable and easy to get some sleep on.  We did not have any issues with having the room cleaned.  We had a high profile vehicle and the staff easily made accommodations for us since we would not fit into the parking area.

Summary Heading: Met my needs for a business trip
Summary: When I arrived at LAX from Boston, I rented a car and headed to Brea. After parking the car in the garage under Embassy Suites, f.y.i., parking is free, the staff at the front desk greeted me with a warm welcome. That's just what I needed after a long trip.  My room on the 5th floor was large, but dated. In particular, the bathroom and rug appeared both worn and old. As long as they are clean, I'm set.   That was the problem. When I was unpacking my shirt from the dry cleaners the next morning, a clear plastic collar stabilizer must have fallen to the ground in front of the bed. After working for the day, I returned to the room and I noticed the clear plastic collar stabilizer on the rug at the foot of the bed. The rug could not have been vacuumed that well. I know this is a

I agree with some earlier reviewers who thought the hotel needed somd cosmetic updating which evidently is going to happen this year.  But when we checked in, we were upgraded to a Penthouse Suite on the 7th floor, so have absolutely no complaints.  Our suite was huge, clean, quiet, and very comfortable.  The breakfast buffet was delicious and served in the bright and airy atrium.  We were attending a play at the Civic Center which is next door to the hotel.  Very convenient, as is the Brea Mall.  You can park your car at the hotel's underground parking and never have to drive anywhere to shop or eat.  The Egyptian decor throughout the hotel feels a little like "old Las Vegas", but I assume this will be improved with the planned upgrade.

Summary Heading: Pleasant hotel...shame about the early end of breakfast!
Summary: This is a pleasant hotel located in the middle of a shopping mall.   We had a two-room suite complete with a microwave and fridge.  They have one of those coffee makers that use a pod so unable to make tea.  There is a tea pod but as it comes out of the same spigot as the coffee, the tea tastes of coffee.  UGH!  However, at the breakfast buffet place one can get tea to take away.  Not as convenient, though.  We tea drinkers of the world must complain!  There is a gym with modern equipment and every morning I was the only one using it.  No ear phones, though.  One has to ask at reception and I kept forgetting too.  Why cannot they be left in the gym?  The bed was comfortable and there were ample bathroom supplies.  Now two complaints: 1.  The safe is on the bottom of the

We truly enjoyed our recent overnight stay at the Embassy Suites in Brea, CA.  The location was in an ideal spot, close to shopping, restaurants, and easy access to freeways. They provided a great Happy Hour experience, in the early evening, & an outstanding breakfast that included custom omlettes, home fries, real bacon & the regular variety of fruit, cereal & pastries.   We will definitely return if & when we are in that area.

My family like the experience. The place is great very comfortable, clean, organized and their personal is very kind. A great experience for our family. We had an issue with the bath tub but that was all they were able to fix it the next day.

We had to move 3 times before finding a descent room. Turns out the hotel is going to be renovated this year, not good for those staying when we did at Christmas time. We found the staff to be good at their job, but not friendly. They completely sucked all the fun out this time of the year by being politically correct as they saw it, this included no bibles in the "Hotel" at all. I have stayed at Hiltons all over the world and I can only say that this 10 day stay was not what I want to ever experience again.

The sheets on the bed had brown stains and numerous items in bathroom needed repair.  For cost of room, should have had everything working and clean sheets.  The breakfast buffet is always good.  The ladies making the omelets are always very pleasant.  Have stayed here before, and was disappointed this time.

This is a typical Embassy Suites (which is always a good thing) with the Manager Evening drinks and appetizers and breakfast so I won't go into that.  The really great thing about this hotel is where it is.  It is near everything -- walking distance to high end shopping and restaurants, and the 57 freeway off and on ramp is right there.  The 57 will take you to the freeways to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm, beaches, mountains, and even to LA. and San Diego.  This hotel is located where you want to be if you plan on enjoying ALL that southern California has to offer and don't want to change hotels every couple of days.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel with a Fantastic Staff
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel and have referred several co-workers to it when they have traveled to our office on business. The rooms are updated, clean, and well-appointed. All the rooms face a large multi-story atrium the is inviting and brings lots of natural light into the hotel. The breakfast is outstanding. The staff is always welcoming and helpful.

As usual, our experience with Embassy Suites was excellent. Breakfast is outstanding.  Minor issue with in room safe but was quickly resolved.  Only complaint is comfort of sofa sleeper.  Mattress very uncomfortable.  Very minor issues that will not stop me from seeking out Embassy Suites in the future.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Brea
Summary: Everything about the hotel is first class and the location is outstanding with lots of close shopping and eating choices.  The rooms we used were the premium.  The view was nice; we could see the hills and watch the sunset.  There was a small balcony that looked down on the pool.  The pool, spa, and fitness room were all in good shape and made use of all of them.  The morning breakfast has a nice choice of items and a grill where you special order an omelet and other assorted items beyond the standard fair.  The rooms were clean, quiet, and the staff was very friendly.  We had some additional requests which they were able to accommodate quickly.  I have to use the internet for some business meetings and I had no issue with the Internet.  I was also able to hook up my laptop to

I've been attending business meetings at this hotel for 12 years.  It needed renovating when I first starting staying there, so you can imagine how much it needs a renovation now.  The lobby tile, atrium tile and public spaces near the back elevator even smell like old mop water, but I guess the employees are just used to the odor.  Guest room fixtures and furniture are old.  Carpets and upholstery smell.  One genuinely good thing: the swimming pool and hot tub are delightful  :)

Summary Heading: Familiar Place, Family Paced, Fair Priced.
Summary: This property of excellence, aged, but still endearing, first stayed here back in the early 90s. Roomy and relaxing, buffet the best, happy hour filled with zest, great place to rest,returning soon. Miss the sauna, and steam room, that used to be a part of this property. The underneath Parking was a bit confusing, entering, and exiting, we found Parking on the P2, second down level, easier to maneuver. Having lived in Brea, don't miss Old Down Town,  Brea Blvd., now beautifully improved and great venues to relax and have a snack, salad, or latte.  Don't stay anywhere else, I have, and this is still the best Hotel to stay in, proven through time, it still shines, a one of a kind! Cheers!

Embassy Suites Brea provided excellent service.  My group of ten needed accommodations at the last minute and Devin answered my initial questions with patience and professionalism.  In addition, he helped me make the most economical reservations. My group also needed to use the parking structure a few hours after we checked out.  The hotel staff were gracious and allowed me to do so without additional fees.  Lastly, my group was able to use the meeting area in the middle of the hotel for a group meeting after we had checked out.  This helped me as leader

We had a very nice time. We were there for a company party. We stayed for the night. It was nice to be able to go right up to our room. the rooms were nice,clean and quite. the beds were very comfortable. We had a good time, good alone time. The cook to order breakfast was a nice touch. it was a nice time to reconnect with friends.

This is an older hotel and could have some upgrades (carpets) Area was convenient to place of business. Breakfast was very good. Managers reception was adequate.  Did not use any of the hotels amenities so I can not comment. Parking was adequate with enough parking underground.

This is an older property, but very well maintained.  It is located in Brea, CA which gives you access to northern Orange County.  It is an all-suite hotel, complimentary breakfast (cooked-to-order) and manager's happy hour every evening.  It is the perfect mix for business or pleasure.  It is self-parking and free.  Located next to a regional shopping mall, lots of restaurants and easy freeway access.

We like this hotel....why?   Cleanliness, friendliness of all staff and the breakfast and happy hour...all personnel is helpful, accommodating and the location is excellent.  A safe and comfortable facility....and the fish in the pond are amazing!!!

Summary Heading: Always a great time when we stay
Summary: 5 Stars every time we travel or just want to get away for the weekend or holiday. Excellent happy hour and food in the restaurant as well, highly recommended for business or the family and there is always plenty to do in the area.

Four nights (Wed-Sat) for $ 656.76 - half business and half pleasure. The hotel was once nice but is now shoddy, outdated and the rooms are not well-maintained.  There were holes in the carpet, not enough elect outlets, burned out bulbs, the patio door was broken, the curtains are difficult to open, WIFI was spotty, the shower faucet needs replacement, the AC/Heater unit rattled so loud that it had to be turned off to sleep, and the doors need to be rehung because they don't close efficiently.  On the plus side: the breakfast is okay, the location is good, and parking is free.  I would not recommend this hotel to a friend or coworker because - at the price I paid - it was not a good value.

Summary Heading: The worst and smelliest don't stay here your kids will get sick
Summary: Mildew coming from underneath wall and carpet if u stay here just look under a/c condensation black mud mildew we all got sick food made us sicker this place should be closed down everybody think they work in good hotel but really a health code take care of ur issues first I moved to 2 rooms no WiFi  covered in mildew Dennis fat guy with glasses  was the rudest I said please I have kids u got to have a room with no mildew he said no unfortunately all rooms are this way I give them a :(   0..!

Staff was awesome, friendly, and very helpful.  All employees regardless of status greeted us and made us feel as if they really wanted us there.  Close to mall, freeway, restaurants, etc. The breakfast provided every morning by the hotel was hot and really good.  Fresh made to order omelets or hot buffet are your choices.  As you finished there was a staff member politely asking and removing empty plates.  Very relaxed environment.  A lot going on at the hotel but never heard noise in our room.  Room service was quick and food was great. Would definitely stay here again.

The staff at this hotel is very friendly and gives great service.  The hotel is very dated and could use upgrades in all areas. The carpet in the room was very stained.  Plumbing in the kitchenette area did not work correctly, no cold water.  The toilet paper holders need to be replaced in all rooms. We stayed on the fourth floor and it was noisy.  We were not sure where the noise was coming from.

I was there last week for a company  Christmas party. The rooms are very comfortable and they did a fabulous job setting up a reception in the fountain area and  then a wonderful dinner in the ballroom. The hotel is really a short drive to John Wayne Airport! Great trip

Easy parking. Cool room with a patio but the best part was the free breakfast. I'm not talking about some eggs and potatoes in a bin although they had that too. They had two people making your choice of 4 or 5? different omelettes on the spot. They were really good.

The decor is a little dated, but the staff and services were excellent.  The bed and bathroom were great.  Check-in and check-out were efficient.  The complimentary breakfast is at about the level of the other facilities I've stayed in, fair to good but not gourmet.

Overall stay was very good. Hotel provided breakfast every morning. Happy hour in afternoon for cocktails. Suite was  clean and comfortable ... Only under ground parking so do not bring high profile vehicles. Will not fit below.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for shopping, dining, and more
Summary: Wow, it's a great experience. Located in the heart of Brea, it provides a very accessible opportunity to shopping mall, restaurants, and also provides a good opportunity of enjoying swimming pool and spa.

The lobby was a fun place to be for my family and especially my grand kids.  you can get food from the front desk and feed the Koi in the pond.  The cook to order omelettes and pancakes were very tasty.

Within walking distance of many restaurants and the mall. Very big rooms with separate living rooms and a cool atrium in the middle makes you feel like a tropical paradise. The service is great and free breakfast is not some continental but made to order omelettes awesome!

Front Desk was only mildly interested in the issues hat I brought to them.  Example: When I told them about the leaky toilet they asked me if I wanted someone to fix it.  This is in California, where they are supposedly having a severe drought.

This Embassy Suites location is an very good representation of the corporate brand.  It is clean, comfortable, and staffed by unusually friendly multi-cultural staff.  Actually, compared with other properties in the Embassy Suites brand, this site is friendlier than most.  You'll find the usual specialties of cooked-to-order breakfast and buffet, managers reception in the evening, and suite-style rooms.    WiFi is inconsistent.  At the time of this writing it is very fast.  Saturday evening, it was unusably slow.   The rooms have plenty of outlets for the connected traveler to recharge devices, unfortunately, none of them are bedside so it's hard to use your mobile phone as an alarm clock and recharge it overnight.  Underground parking is free, clean, and easily accessed.  The

We had a great stay, will come back for our next reunion. Excellent service. Great food & centrally located for our needs. The staff bent over backwards to fulfill our time & the cleanliness of rooms & hotel is excellent.

Just a few steps away from Brea mall. breakfast was good with the made to order omelette standards of embassy suites. Stayed for 3 nights  .. A bit pricey for an embassy suites but since it's walking distance from everything .. Location > From a huge Target across the street to a Nordstrom JC penny etc etc and an Apple Store to a Cheesecake Factory ... Love this hotel!   I just hope they lessen the rates Per night since it's a bit pricey for an embassy suite average rate.

Rented a room that boasted of amazing views for a very high nightly rate.    My view is that whoever is in charge of this property is too busy counting their dollars to save pennies and the quality of my room suffered for this approach.   I am sure that the staff does what they can based on the tools the administrative staff allows them.    It appears to be a systemic issue.    As they say it rolls down hill.

Summary Heading: If you're in the Brea CA area, stay here.
Summary: I stay at the Brea Embassy Suites multiple times a month, and they ALWAYS treat me well.  Unlike my negative experience at the Long Beach Hilton this weekend, it was wonderful to come back to a Hilton property that values my loyalty.  Everyone, from the maintenance crew to the room cleaning staff say hello and are always very welcoming.  They've done a lot of renovation work over the last year, and this is a great place to stay at a very reasonable price.  The pool and hot tub have been renovated, and it is a great location for work or personal travel.

I stayed there for one week for a company meeting. They provided nice and spacious rooms and a good service and nice breakfast buffet. The meeting room met our expectations and the service provided was good. Especially the daily managers reception at the bar was enjoyable. Gym small but with all necessary equipment and a nice pool area. Conveniently located to the Brea Mall which is just behind the hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice property, remarkably quiet room even though it faced main road
Summary: If you've stayed at an Embassy Suites before, then there are no surprises here. Staff is nice. happy hour is ok (get there early if you're looking for food) and breakfast is decent. Underground parking was free and hotel walking distance to mall and other nearby restaurants.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, next to Brea Mall
Summary: Nice hotel next to Brea Mall, Large rooms (suites), Great breakfast, go for the omelet, free bar in the afternoon +++++ :-) . Trying to be Eco friendly, but the aircon was running 100% with 17C and the empty refrigerator was also running, set the aircon to 21C and turned of the refrigerator.

it was my 1st time there and i enjoyed my stay me and my family and if i'm ever in the area again i would likely stay at this location again. the rooms there are very nice and the food was excellent and i feel my money was spent worth while.

conveniently right across from a Target and in the middle of a shopping mall. Very disappointed that in this day and age Embassy will not offer free wifi. This has been the first hotel we have stay that will not offer complimentary wifi. I read this in a reviews from 2014 hoping that that was not going to be an issue in our stay since it is 2015 and even McDonald's offers free wifi.

Summary Heading: A Hotel in need of a facelift
Summary: Let me preface my comments by saying if it wasn't for your great staff, I would have stayed at Embassy Suites Orange County Airport.  This hotel really needs to be remodeled.  My last 3 visits here required maintenance to repair the A/C.  One time the floor was flooded in the bathroom, the next was the carpeted floor under the vent was soaked and this time it required the maintenance department to climb up and switch the A/C to heat.  This hotel need upgrading.  Ice machines on certain floors are broken and have been for all three times I stayed there.  I was told a remodel is due in 2016.  Let me know when it's complete and I will come back.  The staff has worked diligently to maintain customer loyalty but there's only so much they can do.

We were held back a day because of a huge mudslide that closed the Grapevine. The staff was wonderful and rearranged our reservations. The room we were given was gorgeous and felt like home. I could live there!

Summary Heading: Great full breakfast and nice rooms in a convenient location
Summary: The rooms are really nice- I had a two-bedroom suite that overlooked the pool and this hotel is right next to the mall. They have a full breakfast served daily with made-to-order omelettes and the staff is super friendly. It was hard to sleep the first night because my room was tucked in the corner next to the laundry room and it was kind of loud, but I slept great the next night.

was a clean confortable hotel with outstanding amenities.Staff was very nice and hotel was very clean.We will definitely stay again.The breakfast was very good and included in our stay.I will definitely stay again and recommend to friends and family.

As all Embassy suites - the rooms are very large, 2 rooms with a refrigerator. Nice stock of food in the freezer, nice staff, good local shuttle service but no service to the airport. Quiet and clean.

I enjoy staying at the Brea Embassy Suites because of the location of all the shopping centers, restaurants, the mall. Target is within a mile of the hotel. Downtown Brea is about a mile down the street, the mall is next door and Target is across the street.  Also the staff is very accommodating and welcoming, and the rooms are clean. Worth every penny! I.LOVE.THIS.PLACE!!!!

Summary Heading: Great Area Free Parking A Lot to Do!
Summary: Perfect spot to have an Embassy Suites at. Of course the breakfast and happy hour is great the decor is wonderful especially if you have children. My son loved seeing and feeding the Koi fish. Parking is free in an under garage parking area. The atrium area has beautiful plants and a small pond in the center. The outside pool is very nice surrounded by tall trees. We did do a night swim and I don't believe the pool is heated. The hotel is perfectly in the middle of shopping and restaurants. The mall is a neighbor to the hotel as well. Rooms are spacious being a 2 rm suite. Staff was great Devin and the night supervisor accommodated all our needs during our stay. Great stay!

Summary Heading: Good hotel in a great area
Summary: The hotel was nice, if it felt a bit dated. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was the best continental breakfast I've had at a hotel, and I was very pleased that it was included in the cost of the room. I would definitely stay here again if business brings me back to the area.

This was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. They handled our 45th reunion with care & professionalism. I felt like a queen staying there! The rooms were so much more than I expected, the service was impeccable! and the food was incredible! I could stay there forever! I highly recommend the Embassy Suites for every occasion.

Summary Heading: GREAT PLACE FOR REUNION OR WEDDING OR ALMOST ANYTHING!
Summary: I have been here before and it was a beautiful hotel for our reunion!  The lobby is so spacious and great decor.  The accommodations are very roomy!!! The service was so pleasant.  They even brought me extra pillows with a smile!

this was an excellent experience. your staff was outstanding. the accommodations were super and the food was delicious !!! we would surely stay again. hope to stay with you on our next vacation!!! thank you again !!!

Complimentary breakfast better than Holiday Inn,  Air Conditioning in each of the suites did not work properly.  Beware if its hot outside you might not get a good night's sleep.  Other than that the rooms were decent,  location next to the mall and Target.

Staying at an Embassy Suites is always a good choice.  This one is no exception; the room was clean and quiet.  The amenities at the site were very nice and the location was near everything you need. The breakfast service is amazing; good selection with good food.  I'd recommend staying here to anyone.

My wife and I like to stay here now and again on minivacations usually twice a year or so for the last several years. Regrettably we can readily see the toll of time that has accumulated.  The common spaces still look pretty good but the rooms could really use some tender loving care. We received a complementary upgrade via Hilton Honors to room 722.  A room with a name, Cheops!  Pretty cool!  Located on the top floor on the corner, it should've been a tremendously gorgeous room.  Unfortunately the curtains are not hung properly and do not open as intended.  The sliding glass will only open with Herculean effort. The combination of those two issues make it difficult to enjoy the view!  The bathroom is WAY cool with the huge tube and glass shower and the sitting area spacious!  A

When staying at Major chain hotel, you would expect a certain level for your hotel room.  You do not expect to find a room with an electric outlet partly covered with wall paper, hole in the ceiling, paint peeling off the door and some white fuzzy stuff growing on the carpet.   When checking out, I let the manager on duty, Jimmy G. know about the condition of the room and was promised a gift card for a free night in 2 weeks.  It is over a month later and still no gift card or return call.

Summary Heading: they CATER to your every need!!!
Summary: THIS by far one niecest of motels and amenities....My niece booked family the rooms for her wedding.  WE had major visits in lovely areas.  Breakfast with made to order omelets.  Quality family time sitting and visiting in lovely areas of the restaurant. The pool side is lovely and we were together there often.  Friendly and accommodating in everyway, whether it be room change, more towels, etc.  OUTSTANDING...the location is to die for....so MUCH to see, SHOP and visit!!!  Best location ever.  LOVED IT!!!

Stayed here for over 3 Weeks &  was delighted by the overall experience. Probably one of the best staff I have ever met. The suite type (2rooms) are incredible n very clean!! The Breakfast has a very good variety apart from the custom dish they can offer you each day!! The evening happy hours everyday at 17:30hrs sets in the mood!! Go for it!!

I normally stay at this hotel when ever I travel for work. Up until the last trip it was actually halfway descent. I scored it poorly because the last time I went my room stunk so bad I actually thought about finding another hotel. The smell was a mix between mildew and smoke in a non-smoking room. There was a large stain above my head board and I found ants in my bed. When asking to change rooms the staff told me they were sold out for the night. Not sure who does the quality control there but that room definitely should not have been a room that was available to book.
Manager Response: Teresa, I apologize that you did not enjoy your stay with us. You should not have had to experience a bad smell in your room.  We hope you will give us another opportunity in the future.  Thank you.

Summary: Icemakers not working, Jacuzzi not working, breakfast cook getting orders wrong, Front desk inattentive on check-in, face stuck in the I-Phone. Breakfast gestapo demanded my breakfast card, hotel room key did not suffice, had to go back to my room to find the card, lots of challenges in the property.
Manager Response: I apologize that you did not have a great stay with us.  This is not normal from what most of our guest's experience.  I do have to let you know that we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year.  I hope you will give us another opportunity to make it right next time.  Thank you,

Summary: It looked like an Embassy Suites but one that is in need of a lot of work. The beds were very clean but the carpet smelled old. We tried the hot tub and only two jets were working and it was dirty. It also smelled like urine around it. Somebody must have complained because next morning it was closed for a while. When we went back the water had been cleaned and the smell was gone but the jets were still not working except two. Also, the balcony door was so hard to slide open that my wife was not able to do it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel.  I happy to let you know that we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year.  We hope you will be back soon to visit us.

Summary: Devin Okono went over and above in customer service. He helped us get an upgraded room by speaking with the cleaning service. He personally managed our luggage at the desk and to the room. He would not take a tip even when my husband tried to hand it to him. His timeliness helped us attend a pre-wedding family function that we would have missed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your really nice review.  Yes I agree Devin is fabulous he is one of our best employee's.  Please visit us again.

Summary: It's such a great value for what you pay for the suite. Rooms are extremely spacious, clean and very comfortable. Free hot breakfast in the morning & free happy hour in the evening is just awesome. Only complain is that they charge $27 a day for parking in certain locations. But overall, the stay is worth it!
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice review.  I wanted to let you know that we offer complimentary parking for all of our guest(s).  I'm curious to know where they charge $27 for parking.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: staff very professional and accommodating, shopping and dinning lots to choose from. Close to freeways and easy acces to amusement parks. not far from beaches . Had ample parking for guest. many different restaurants to choose from. All within walking distance. The only discouraging thing wad some idiot decided to turn on fire alarm at 2:30 A.M. Just hope they caught the person who was so inconsiderate and fine him or her enough they will have to think before they act out in this manner again. Not hotels fault for sure but was annoying
Manager Response: Thank you for your very nice review.  I agree with you our hotel staff always makes the guest's stay a special experience.  The location of this hotel is always nice with the shopping mall right across the street and very accessible to the freeways.  I am truly sorry you had to experience the fire alarm that went off at 2 in the morning.  Hopefully, you will give us another opportunity when your in the North Orange County area.

Summary: Stayed here a few nights for business and the hotel was very good.  Rooms were quite, spacious and comfortable.  I liked they had fridge and microwave in room.  The wifi was good - fast with strong signal.    The hotel is in a great location next to mall and lots of great places to eat nearby.  Check-in was fast and there is covered parking in the structure.    I will be staying here again when in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  We hope to see you again when your in the North Orange County area.

Summary: Accommodations are standard and lacking amenities for bathroom. I ask twice for additional bedding for sofa bed that should have already been in our room. Front desk often answerers the phone for housekeeping and that is frustrating.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I understand your frustration that front desk answers the phone calls for housekeeping.  The reason why we do that is so we can make sure we answer all the phone calls and to provide a better service for our guest's. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Staying for business for a few days, I found this Embassy to be consistent with other Embassy's. The hotel was clean, gathering area comfortable and checkin to be easy. The mall is literally a few steps away, however no time to shop.   The room was clean, decor was acceptable, mattress very comfortable and pillows were plenty   Room was nicely stocked but I missed my complimentary  bottle of water for the night. Love the towels, plush and absorbent.   Recommendations would be to add electrical plug ins   I had a difficult time plugging in and charging devices.  Also I was uncomfortable with the bathroom door opening at the bedside. It felt weird when I closed it and it felt weird when sleeping with it open- but I'm sure the building is older and not recently designed.   Cook to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I understand it can get frustrating when there is not enough electrical plug ins for your devices.  I wanted to let you know we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year. Hopefully you will give us another opportunity in the future.

Summary Heading: REQUEST THE ROOM THAT DOESN'T HAVE FLOOD PROBLEMS...
Summary: Would have enjoyed the stay more if the air conditioning worked properly and the tub didn't leak, prohibiting taking a bath.  The staff are friendly and cordial, but kept telling me "it's being fixed."
Manager Response: I apologize that you did not have a nice stay with us. If you could please call or email me, so we can discuss this stay further I would really appreciate it. I wanted to let you know we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year. Hopefully you will give us another opportunity in the future.

Summary Heading: Great place - Noisy equipment on roof
Summary: Top floor rooms are normally the quietest.  However, in locations with tight building codes - like thse in California - rooftop equipment can transmit noise to the rooms below.  When checking into this facility, be sure to ask for the opportunity to check out any top-floor rooms for noise transmitted from roof-top equipment.  A few rooms in this facility are a bit noisy - this won't bother most folks, but bothers some.  Otherwise, this is a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!!  I apologize that you had a noisy room.  Hopefully the next time your in the North Orange County area you give us another opportunity.    Sincerely,

Summary Heading: AWESOME hotel for a Disneyland stay -- if you have a car!
Summary: We LOVED this Embassy Suites! Breakfast was the best of ANY E.A. we've ever stayed at. Pool open until 10pm for kids!!! Amazing! Very clean, comfortable, and QUIET. Target and other shopping directly across the street. No shuttle to Disneyland, though, as it's 30 miles away, but that didn't bother us at all.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   It is great to hear you had a 1st class stay with us!  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!    Sincerely,

Summary: Staff was very kind and have great hospitality. Although the room was booked a smoking room, they did offer to call me if a non smoking room came available which I thought was thoughtful. It was clean and everything I expected. It had a balcony, and it was quiet.Breakfast was a great added bonus. I plan to stay here again.
Manager Response: It is great to hear you had a fantastic stay with us!  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!

Summary: Nice people. nice place. Far from the maddening crowds. But that's MY kind of place and near great shopping , great golf, and Yolanda Linda with many active centurions . Loved it. Would go back to this area in a heart beat.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!    Sincerely,

Summary Heading: No security and smokey rooms. Avoid it!
Summary: I do not recommend this hotel: 1) There is no security in the garage. According to the police, they respond to thefts at least once per week. The third row bench seat was stolen from our vehicle! The hotel offered my family complementary bottles of water for our trouble. 2) The non-smoking rooms stink of old smoke and whatever scent they use to try to cover it up. 3) The bathroom door cannot be opened all the way. It hits the bed before reaching the half-way point. 4) The breakfast lady demands the single card given to your room. In other words, the entire family has to wait in line together. If it is the last day of your stay, she takes the card before everyone has had breakfast. 5) They forgot to leave towels in the room, making it difficult to have a quick turn-around for an
Manager Response: I apologize that you did not have a nice stay with us. If you could please call or email me, so we can discuss this stay further I would really appreciate it. I wanted to let you know we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year. Hopefully you will give us another opportunity in the future.   Thank you,

Summary: Room was very clean.  Ordered from room service and the food was delicious. I didn't partake in the happy hour, because I was at a wedding at that time. I also left early so I didn't eat the complimentary breakfast, but it smelled delicious.  I would definitely stay there again and I would recommend it to my family and friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. I am really glad you enjoyed your wedding event. We hope to see you the next time you're in Orange County area.   Sincerely,

Summary: This hotel is very convenient for while visiting areas around Anaheim and Orange County. Our business took us to various areas around Anaheim and Newport. It was easy to access the freeways close by and the Brea Mall is adjacent. There are restaurants, grocery, specialty and service type stores all around. LAX takes about1-1/2 hour drive on a weekday and about 45 minutes on weekend. We liked that it was not in the congestion of Anaheim hotels and away from crowds and local traffic. The breakfast and cocktail hour is always good. This location is clean and staff is friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   It is great to hear you had a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!    Sincerely,

Summary: I would highly recommend the Brea Embassy Suites.  It is an incredibly relaxing experience.  you are provided at least 2 rooms in each suite and the courtyard is beautiful.  It makes you want to stay at the hotel instead of going to some other destination.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your nice review. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your room accommodations.  We hope to see you in the future and thank you for staying with us.  Cordially,

Summary: So far in my travels in USA and Europe I have stayed at several Hilton group of hotels. Mostly Hamptons and Hiltons. I rarely have to write a bad review about any one them. This Embassy suites in Brea totally disappointed me.  I tried to check in at this Embassy suites at 3:00PM. Rooms were not ready and usual check in time is 4:00PM. Fully understandable. I requested for a pre check in so that I can come late at night and not have to worry about check in at late night hours. The receptionist obliged but would not let me know my room number. No, I don't want the keys. I just want to know my room number. I can't do that was the answer. If I had checked on line then  I would have known my room number 24 hours in advance. I fail to connect the logic here. I can know my room number
Manager Response: I apologize that you did not have a welcome check-in with us.  I wanted to let you know we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year. Hopefully you will give us another opportunity in the future. Thank you,

Summary: This was my second time to reserve a room at Embassy Suites in Brea.  Both times I had a very positive experience and great customer service.  I will always stay at this hotel in Brea if I have another business meeting to attend.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and choosing the Embassy Suites in Brea.  It is very nice of you to stay with us every time you have a meeting in the area.  We hope to see you in the future and thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: If looking for a hotel that doesn't accept pets look elsewhere
Summary: Our family of 8 stayed in two rooms.  The rooms were alright but we had wanted connecting rooms.  The hotel let someone in one of the rooms extend their stay so that was our first negative.  Second negative was the lady at breakfast checking card.  She would keep asking for our card every time we went from one side to the other.  It was annoying to say the least.  Third negative was the lady with a non-service dog.  The dog was not on a leash and was able to run around on the 6th floor terrorizing my kids.  I called twice to complain and was told a manager would contact me.  I never received any communication from the manager regarding this situation.  I noticed a front desk person walking with the lady back to her room so they knew about her dog and didn't care.  Fourth
Manager Response: I apologize that you did not have a nice stay with us. If you could please call or email me, so we can discuss this stay further I would really appreciate it. I wanted to let you know that we do accommodate service dogs.  Hopefully you will give us another opportunity in the future. Thank you,

Summary: This was the first time that my sister and I stayed at this hotel. On our previous visits to the area, we had always stayed at a competitor's hotel in Buena Park. We found the Embassy Suites to be a vast improvement. It had everything that we needed; a sofa sleeper so our niece and nephew could stay with us during our visit, a refrigerator for storing supplies, complimentary breakfast, helpful staff, clean and well-maintained facilities, convenient location, restaurants and shops within walking distance, etc. We visit my brother and his family every year and plan to make this our "go-to" hotel.
Manager Response: "Home away from home"  Thank you for choosing the Embassy Suites in Brea.  We are happy to hear you and your family enjoyed all the amenities the hotel offered.  We hope to see you again when your here to visit your brother and his family.  Thank you,

Summary: I love this hotel, all the wonderful amenities of Embassy Suites with arguable the best location. You are next to a great mall in Brea, 1/2 mile away from downtown Brea and all the wonderful stuff there, down the street from Disneyland and Knox (10-15 min), its everything you want
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are happy you liked all the amenities and the location of the hotel.  We hope to see you in the future and thank you for staying with us.

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel too many times to count over the past 15 years.  It has the potential to be amazing.  When it comes to location, you couldn't ask for a better place.  It's located right outside the Brea Mall and less than a mile from other shopping, civic center, community center, restaurants, movie theaters, bars, and the Improv Comedy Club.  The only real downside is that the hotel is in desperate need of remodeling.  The furnishings have definitely seen better days.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear you enjoyed the location of our hotel.  I wanted to let you know we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year. Hopefully you will give us another opportunity in the future. Thank you,

Summary: Very enjoyable stay. We stayed for one week and never had a issue. I highly recommend upgrading with the breakfast that was out of this world! If you have AAA it's only $9 for the week per family member. Most hotels cost $15 per day per family member. Great pool and fitness room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are happy you enjoyed your one week stay with us and the AAA upgrade.  We hope to see you in the future and thank you for staying with us.  Sincerely,

Summary: Embassy Suites is our choice hotel and has been for many years. This was my first time staying at this property but I was very impressed. Not over crowded, very comfortable and the location was great.
Manager Response: Thank you for always choosing Embassy Suites hotels.  We really appreciate your business.  Please come back soon.  Sincerely,

Summary: This is a great hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful. Great location next to Mall, restaurants, good places to walk outside. The hotel is very quiet even when full which it often is. Lots of free parking too.
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice review and we hope you'll be back real soon.  Sincerely,

Summary: We had a four night stay for a family memorial/reunion. Upon checking in, one room's living area, although appearing clean, smelled of vomit.  After a long day of travel, my daughters were too tired to do anything.  The next morning, it was reported to the front desk.  Perhaps they tried to clean, during the day, but later, we asked for a new room.  Our request was immediately accomodated., but no one should have ever been put in the room.   Regardless of our room issure, if this is the area of Orange County you need to be in, this is a great place to stay.  The atrium style hotel is inviting which leaves a large area for the great breakfast that is included in the room rate.  Omlets are made to order.  A complementary happy hour with snacks is also good.  The pool area is not
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I am sorry that you and your family had to experience a room that had a really bad smell.  In the future, we hope you will give us another opportunity to make your stay very enjoyable.

Summary: I always stay at this Embassy - as they really know how to treat a guest well.  Plus you have the mall next door, 24HR Fitness across the street and many dinning places to choose from...  The staff is outstanding - from the desk clerk to cleaning ladies to the cook - everyone is happy to make ones stay outstanding...
Manager Response: Thank you for always choosing our hotel when you're in the area.  I agree with you that our staff here is amazing.  We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great Time was had by all
Summary: We stay at Brea when visiting our family. The Embassy Suites is the only hotel for us. It is good value, clean, welcoming, great for breakfast (free) and, from my wife's point of view, in a excellent position for shopping, eating and entertainment. A short shuttle ride from Santa Anna Airport and with easy access to Disney without the disturbance of staying too local to the parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for always choosing our hotel and yes I agree with you're wife we are in a great location for shopping.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: There was a leaking water pipe behind the bathtub.  It soaked into the wall and throughout the carpet in the doorway between the bedroom and the main suite.  The stench was obvious but as we had wanted adjoining rooms with family, we could not request another room.  The rest of the accommodations were fine with the exception of that one item
Manager Response: I apologize that you did not have a nice stay with us. If you could please call or email me, so we can discuss this stay further I would really appreciate it. I wanted to let you know we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year. Hopefully you will give us another opportunity in the future. Thank you,

Summary Heading: Stayed here when needed a place close to home
Summary: Nice hotel. Large rooms. Redone bathroom. Fair happy hour. Great location next to brea mall. 15 miles to Disneyland. Courteous checkin. Easy parking with elevator room access and no additional charge for parking

Summary Heading: Buyer beware- if anything else is available stay there!
Summary: Upon checking in we were told that the roll away I had called the property for was not available, in fact we were told they did not have any and the person checking me acted as if I was making it up.  Although I made the reservation online I had called the hotel directly to ensure we would be able to have a roll away.  I was assured my reservation would be noted and we would have one.  Strike 1.  Strike 2- check into our room after walking down a dark, very poorly lit hall to get there to open the door to a nice red stain (see below), and a room that appears they appeared to update via new carpet at some point in the recent past and perhaps new curtains.  The room however is an OLD room which has largely been neglected.  Furniture was worn, AC unit loud and leaking onto th floor
Manager Response: I apologize that you did not have a nice stay with us. If you could please call or email me, so we can discuss this stay further I would really appreciate it. I wanted to let you know we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year. Hopefully you will give us another opportunity in the future. Thank you,

Summary: Embassy Suites set a high standard, and this one fills the bill. We were lucky and had a beautiful suite on the 8th floor. Amazing room, terrific Manager's Happy Hour, and a tummy omelet made to order for breakfast. Easy parking, terrific staff! We'll be back!

My family and I love the size of the suites at Embassy Hotels. And I do believe it is a decent value, however there were some things the way that brought our experience down. Let me first say that every staff member we encountered was pleasant, courteous and helpful. The atrium is light and airy. and quite lovely.   We requested, and got, a non-smoking room, however the room began to increasingly smell like stale cigarette smoke as our stay went on. When we returned home, all of our clothes reeked of cigarette smoke. Perhaps making sure that the floor you are on is not directly above a smoking floor would correct that problem. Not sure.  Many of the lounge chairs at the pool are ripped to the point of not being usable.  Many others are headed that way.  Overall our stay was

i've had good experience at most of the properties of this chain, but the Orange county location was poor.  dated room, one of two sink spots worked, shower was terrible (fixtures, water temp, drain were all bad).    the front desk experience was absolutely horrible from how they checked us in through to the recommendations of what was in the area.  i asked about where to walk for breakfast and was provided with options that were terribly inaccurate.   breakfast, which is typically tricky and inconsistent was handled pretty well by the understaffed folks.

Summary Heading: room smelled and breakfast was ok
Summary: Our room smelled when I said something they did nothing. The  breakfast was ok I have had better at other Embassy suite and not enough sitting. The front desk was not very helpful. The parking was not very good at this location too.

Summary Heading: Food, Amenities great, staff...not very helpful
Summary: The breakfast buffet, the cleanliness of the hotel, and the over all location is great for families.  I only marked average because I requested twice for our shower to be fixed.  We were there for 2 nights, and it was never fixed.  If they would have fixed it the first time, I would have said my stay was excellent.  I just wanted to be able to stay at a hotel wear I didn't burn my skin because I couldn't get the cold water to work.

Stayed here for 3 nights with a huge group of people. Suites are really good but needs more lighting.  Breakfast is very good and they can rally manage a large crowd. Location is apt for shoppers as you have Macy's, j c penny's, target all across the road. Service staff was excellent

Summary Heading: Very Comfortable Rooms and a staff that smiles
Summary: I chose this hotel because of the free breakfast and parking.  But I was pleasantly surprised how wonderful everything was.  The breakfast was a full on buffet and everything kept clean and tidy.  I loved how the rooms opened up to the middle of the hotel.  I wasn't sure how the noise level would be in the evening but everything was manageable.  The sleeping area was cozy, clean and the beds were comfortable.  No noise there, since a door separated it from the front living area.  The little "kitchen" corner was clean and functional.   I had my dinners at the restaurant.  The prices varied and the food was good.  The staff did really well taking care of all my questions and needs.  I had to use the business center a couple of times and everything was working properly.  I would

Just spent 3 days short of 3 weeks there....what a wonderful place,breakfast is excellent the reception staff cannot do enough and the bar staff are a hive of knowledge of where to go...thanks Kim and Justine an absolute pleasure as always Thanks Guys, Lee

The rooms felt a bit dated and our room smelled a bit of stale smoke although it was a non smoking room.  The handle for the shower fell off so it was difficult to control the water flow and temperature.  Internet service is NOT complimentary which is very disappointing.  I have stayed at lower star rated hotels that offered complimentary internet service as well as a nice cold bottle of water upon check in.  We also had a billing issue which was straightened out but still frustrating that the mistake was made.  Also the air conditioning in the room was quite loud.  Overall my opinion is this property is in need of lots of upgrades across the board.
Manager Response: I apologize that you did not have a nice stay with us.  If you could please call or email me, so we can discuss this stay further I would really appreciate it.  I wanted to let you know we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year.  Hopefully you will give us another opportunity in the future.  Thank you,

Summary: Incredibly outstanding 4 star hotel accomodations; conveniently located in north Orange County, timely shuttle service to and from a local restaurant within the 5 mile radius from the property, delicious and prompt breakfast, etc. = great value!!!!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience.  I am really glad you enjoyed the shuttle service and the breakfast that we provide to our hotel guests.  We hope to see you the next time you're in Orange County area.

Summary: Checked in late with guaranteed late check in I didn't have to worry about having my room given away. Got there around 4 am was greeted by Ace at the front desk. He was amazing quick and efficient got us checked in quickly and with a smile. We unfortunately got a smoking room and I'm allergic I called down and he told me to come back to the lobby and by the time we returned he would have a new room for us all set up. He made good on his word and we received our key cards and were off to bed in an instant. Really one of the best front desk experiences I've ever had. Ace really lived up to his name. The complimentary breakfast the next morning was great with eggs cooked to order the staff at Breakfast was wonderful as well. Our room was spacious clean and extremely comfortable.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your wonderful review. I am happy to hear that Ace was very accommodating and that you enjoyed the breakfast at the restaurant. We hope to see you in the future and thank you for staying with us.  Sincerely,

Summary: Great breakfast.  Good beds but poor pillows.  The decor is dated and the carpets are in need of cleaning or replaced throughout. The lighting is a bit dim and gives a dreary feeling.  Rooms on the top floor at the ends have a bit of elevator noise which is annoying.

Usually I check the sheets first thing, but we arrived late and had to immediately go out to meet business partners.  So when I came back late, I just threw on my jammies and went to bed. Getting up the next morning, I found a mold spore circle the size of my palm and a body fluid stain on the sheets. I took pictures and reported it to the front desk.  The young man I spoke to apologized profusely, viewed the room, telling me he was a night auditor, and offered to change the bedding and reduce my room rate (saying it was all they could do after speaking to a superior). This would help my company save money but did little for me who slept in nasty sheets, but what could I do.  I left for the day and when I got back 5 hours later the sheets STILL hadn't been changed.  They then

I stay here for business frequently.  It's so convenient and literally in the parking lot of the Brea mall.  You are near a ton of great places to eat, a target and downtown.  The property is older but very clean and has great employees.  The wine reception and free breakfast are a big perk.  Good food quality from the breakfast and room service.  A really good value.

Summary Heading: One night over New Years Eve
Summary: We had a great stay at the Embassy Suites - I love how you know exactly what to expect at each Embassy property! We had a much later check in than we had planned, but that was due to heavy traffic from LA. We'd pre-checked in online, so we chose our own room and just grabbed the key on the way up. Our 2 Queen Bed suite (3 adults) was the perfect size and we had a large living area to hang out in before getting ready. Our room was missing coffee and cups, but we had those sent up in a matter of minutes.   The negative to our stay was having to go from floor to floor in order to find an ice machine that worked AND had ice... This was frustrating given the time constraints we faced (being NYE) but I found one and the drinks machine, so I got over it.   The noise level was less than

Not bad. Could have been a bit cleaner. But all in all a nice place to stay. I will stay here again. The breakfast is good. I like the central location of Brea to access the beaches for play and the inland for business. The food in the sports bar is okay. But the service is really bad.

All in all, I had a very good experience.  The waiter that served me in the evening was so attentive and I appreciated his warm hospitality! I had no problems; all was handled with efficiency.  I liked being able to walk to the mall.

Summary Heading: Ideal hotel for business or pleasure
Summary: This hotel offers everything from this chain - complimentary breakfast to happy hour in the evening. Wonderful pool, wonderful jacuzzi and an excellent gymnasium. The staff is very helpfull and friendly. Ice machines on every floor and a laundry with washer and dryer for the people staying on extended visits.

Summary Heading: Hotel is nice, service needs improvement
Summary: This hotel is very nice for the most part.  We had some minor service issues and rooms problems.  However, will stay there join the future.  The location is great.  Right next to the Brea mall and close to the freeway.  Loads of places to eat and things to see.

What a wonderful hotel. I worked across the street from it for 13 years and finally stayed there on vacation for a week. I thought that listing things might be easier to read than the "normal" way, so here goes.  Pros  * Clean, quiet room  * Nice comfy bed  * Great shower (newer shower message - not hand held though)  * Made to order breakfast (yummy)  * Staff was very helpful and friendly  * Restaurants within walking distance  * Brea Mall right next door (walking distance)  * Underground parking (with elevator)  Cons  * Internet - seemed to be down occasionally  * Shower needs a better ventilation system  * Pillows - large, but seemed too mushy (subjective opinion)  * TV remote - didn't give info as to what was on (guide)  Other than the few "Cons", our stay was a wonderful

Very good service, good location for theme parks, friendly people to help and advice you. A/C works pretty good and maintained temperature, always clean and very spacious. Overall a very good staying experience

The staff at this hotel make you feel like you are the most important person in the room when they are addressing you.  The interior of the hotel and its amenities is beyond what we have experienced at most Embassy Suites and rivals most of the Hilton Hotels in which we have stayed.  If we are ever in this area again, we will DEFINITELY stay at the Suites on Brea.

Comfortable, large and clean rooms, great staff, fantastic breakfast, excellent service and stay overall. The beds were very comfortable, with 2 large flat screens in the suites and a good selection of channels, Location is great, attached to Brea Mall and across the street from a Target shopping center. Would highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! It is great to hear you had a wonderful stay and you liked the location of the hotel.  It's also nice that where near all the stores and the shopping mall.  We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: An older but very good hotel
Summary: I enjoyed my stay. While the hotel is a little bit outdated it is comfortable and clean. The food is also pretty good for a U.S. Hotel. I would definitely stay here again. Parking is also included/free, so that is a major bonus in California. Reasonably easy access given the issues with California traffic.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I am glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. I wanted to let you know we will be going through a major renovation at the end of this year. Hopefully you will give us another opportunity in the future. Thank you,

Summary: We stayed here for the second time and again really enjoyed it.  We had some confusion as to the reservations, but the hotel went out of their way to help us  check in early.  The breakfast is one of the best and very quiet as the sleeping room is in the rear of the suite.  Our room was updated this time and very elegant.
Manager Response: It is great to hear you had a wonderful stay with us! Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!

Summary: Just spent 16 nights of excellence in this hotel the staff at the hotel are fantastic each and every one of them the free bus service is priceless, special mention to the staff on reception and the Bar staff Kim my restaurant provider and Juss the footy fan. Music great too! Thanks Guys LG
Manager Response: Thank you for the very nice review.  I am happy to hear you enjoyed 16 restful nights at our hotel.  We hope to see you in the future and thank you for staying with us.  Sincerely,

Summary: Very impressed with my room and breakfast. I arrived late my first night. I was there for a wedding. I did not spend to much time at the hotel. I called to see about a late check-out the night before . Gave me 1 extra hour. I wish check in wasn't so late and check-out was later.  Just saying.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   It is great to hear you had a wonderful stay with us!  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!

Summary: My first stay at this property.  I found it to be in a very good location with convenient access to nearby restaurants and shopping and things of interest I needed for my business trip.  The breakfast was fresh and tasty (omelet prepared per my liking) and they also had prepared breakfast (eggs, meat, potatoes) plus breads, desserts, coffee, juice, etc.  The manager's reception was decent with complementary beers and snacks.  Overall a positive experience and I'd highly recommend this property.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   It is great to hear you had a 1st class stay with us!  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!

Summary: Great rooms, mostly great service.  We were in town for a family funeral and all five brothers, wives and kids as well as mom and dad stayed.  Rooms were roomy and a good value.  Most of the staff was super friendly and helpful.  We stayed a few nights left then came back and stayed a few more. When we returned the new room foldout had not been changed/cleaned but they immediately sent someone up to take care of it.  The rooms could use a little updating but are certainly not old.  There was one night desk staff that was not friendly (otherwise service rating would have been "Excellent") but everyone else was great!

The Embassy Suite at Brea is one of my favorites - good facility, great staff, conveniently located... I like Embassy Suites, have stayed at many, and have stayed at this one repeatedly in the past.  In the Brea/Fullerton area, you cannot do better.

Great location and easy access to all corners of the L.A area.  Good neighborhood and located next to the mall.  Right next to the highway so it was only 15 minutes from disney.  Also about 30 minutes from hollywood.

My family of 4 stayed here 3 nights, April 4-7.  We checked in on line and got a room on the 7th floor.  The hotel was near the highway and easy to find.  It is right next to the Brea Mall and across the street from Target and other restaurants and shops.  Parking is in the garage underground and the elevator goes straight to the lobby or your room floor.  Not sure that is safe since anyone can get to the rooms without going through the lobby, but it didn't seem to be a problem.  Check in was easy since we did it on line.  Elevators worked fine.  When stepping off the elevator, there is a sign that says the 7th floor was a VIP executive floor.  Not sure what that means because we really didn't notice anything special about the rooms.  My husband is a gold member and in our room

Excellent hotel. Great location by the mall, not far from Disney Land. Beautiful Egyptian décor. Carpets needs updating, but very clean. Great omelets. Friendly staff. Safe neighborhood. Highly recommend especially travelling with families.

Spent two nights at Embassy Suites in Brea, and there's not much to complain about. Check-in was a breeze and very friendly. It's the typical Embassy Suites, with an atrium. Our room was the traditional suite, with a sofa bed, table and chairs, TV, wet bar, coffeemaker, fridge and microwave in the outer room.  Two comfy queen beds in the inner room, along with a TV, armoire, and small desk with chair. The bathroom was nice. There is a notice that the hotel will supply complimentary items you have forgotten, such as a comb, razor, etc. I did have to take advantage of this, and the service was prompt and courteous.  Complimentary buffet breakfast in the atrium was great. The Manager's evening reception was nice, although I've had better snacks at other Embassy Suites locations.

Embassy Suites is always a good value. Although dated with Egyptian decor and rooms that need updating, I have no complaints.  Friendly staff and good service.  Close to shopping.  Always love the free happy hour and friendly service

Summary Heading: good for vacation and good for business
Summary: Good location to the freeway system even though it's a real-life nightmare.   Location is great for the area north if Orange county, it's by lots of suites and restaurants.  Breakfast is great.  Evening reception is great  Rooms are good, just dated quiet a bit, air conditioning is not to good usually and I stay here monthly.

The purpose of our stay was for a family funeral.  We had 19 family members and were all pleased with our rooms and the service.  We were on the premium floor and all in close proximity.  The staff made sure we had what ever we needed and were extremely helpful and cheerful.  We have stayed at this hotel for family function in the future and look forward to returning for another pleasant stay in the future.

Overall, this is a good hotel, and I would stay here again. It is one of the best options in the immediate area.   Pros: Clean, updated bathrooms Clean, updated beds and bedding Nice, free breakfast selection Free parking Free daily managers reception (free beer, wine, snacks)  Cons: Outdated, worn carpet.  Outdated room decor, including furniture. No easy access plugs for electronics.  Slow WIFI.

After parking our car in the free underground parking structure, we took the elevator to the lobby.  I reserved the room and checked in online the previous evening.  After I gave the front desk my name, I was handed my room key card and a code for free wifi.  I was pleasantly surprised with this extra amenity.  My daughter loved the wifi.  Upon entering our suite, we were amazed by the spaciousness of the room.  My daughter enjoyed having her own space.  The sofa bed was ideal for her. The extra sink in the living room was very useful. There were many outlets to recharge our electronics.  After settling in, we walked down to the lobby. Exiting the door and making a right turn  will take you straight to Brea Mall.  It is a nice mall to explore and get some shopping , food, and

This hotel is conveniently located next to a nice mall and across the street from Target and lots of food outlets.  It is very clean and the hot breakfast that is included in the stay is comparable to the items we would get at a pancake house. We will definitely be back

When I checked in, the woman at the front desk couldn't have been friendlier. In fact, throughout my 2 night stay, every time I passed the front desk, someone always looked up and smiled and/or greeted me.  The room was clean, there's free parking, free cooked-to-order breakfast, free cocktail hours. Bed was comfortable, the tv worked. I have no complaints.

We will be going back. The staff was excellent, the rooms were nice,  the Breakfast was amazing.  They have a nice pool hot tub  & gym.  They have an indoor pond filled with beautiful koi fish which made the ambiance nice & relaxing.  We were going to Knotts Berry Farm and forgot our tickets. Luckily the hotel has a 24 hour business center where we were able to print out new tickets.  WE Loved our stay !

The food was great, the staff was amazing and the room was clean and spacious. Every single experience during my stay made me soooo happy that the conference chose this hotel. I'd definitely stay here again.

Such a wonderful hotel with a  hospitable and helpful staff. The convention accommodations were top-notch. The food was perfect...the staff friendly. The rooms were clean and the location was easy to find.

Our family stayed here for a week. Great location, but a $10 per day charge for internet. Really? Who charges for internet these days? Breakfast is amazing. Very comfortable beds but furniture needs updating.

Very clean,great breakfast, staff very helpful and friendly. Really enjoyed the Managers reception in evenings. Excellent location, right next to Brea Mall. ALso close to many shopes and stores. Great view of mountains also when looking out suite window.  Parking was easy and free, that was a plus. Didnt get chance to use workout facility or pool.

Summary Heading: My one stop shop! Love the service, but updates are needed.
Summary: When I come to Brea for business, I always stay here.  The service is great, lots of repeat staff which I love.  Justin and Kim are awesome in the reception area.  With that being said, the rooms need some updating.  I was upgraded to the penthouse suite complimentary.  I will say if I was paying top dollar for the room, I would not have been happy.  The bathroom is aged as well as the carpets.  I have several issues with my phone that was fixed temporarily, but then didn't work again.  I have stayed in the regular rooms as well and I simply just think the hotel needs to be updated.  The rooms are not bad, they are average.  As I stated before, the service is awesome and the location is a mile from my office in California so I love to stay there.

I stayed at this hotel in February 2015 for 4 nights on a business trip. The hotel is at excellent location just opposite to Brea Mall. The hotel design is excellent but rooms need maintenance at the earliest. Carpet in the room is quite old and has become dirty. Taps in the washroom are quite old and need replacement. Same is for electrical switches. Best thing is location and you can spend your evening and do shopping at the mall just opposite the hotel. Lots of restaurants in the mall make the stay delight for a foodie. Breakfast is complimentary and has lots of variety. They serve eggs to order which is the best part of the breakfast. Every evening there is Managers cocktails in which they serve free snacks and drinks. Overall an average experience but it would become

I stayed here for a week for a conference and the stay was amazing.  The room was very comfortable and quiet despite there being another conference and baseball team all staying that week.  The hotel staff were always polite and cordial.  The hotel itself was gorgegous.

This hotel worked really well for us as we were driving down from San Fran to San Diego and it served as a comfortable over night break from driving. It is located next to a well presented mall, Target store and few good dining venues like California Pizza Kitchen, Cheescake factory, Chillis and TGI Friday. Hotel check in was very efficient and friendly. Free parking and free cooked to order breakfast certainly added to a value of the room rate. Half price Internet for HHonours guests too. The hotel has an atrium lobby however each suite has a sitting room and a bedroom separated by an additional door. That means a silent night as no noise comes in from the lobby of the hotel. Beds are comfortable, so is the shower. A suite has a sink, microwave, tea/coffee making facilities and

Summary Heading: Hotel needs severe overhaul and cleaned
Summary: Not supervised and bad quality in the overall hotel. Needs to be completely updated, rooms are old and uncomfortable . Won't stay here again. Quality of housekeeping is bear minimum. The company owning Embassy Suites needs to make  visit and of over with management and or owner.

had a little problem with the room we were assigned to but the problem was rectified.when we went to go in our room someone was already in it,manager was very good on making sure we were well taken care of after that.

We stayed at the Embassy as part of the Hilton Honors and have always liked their program/hotel.  Most everything was fine with this hotel, a bit dated and in need of some updating but overall a good experience.  Did have a few maintenance issues.  Breakfast great and location superb for my personal needs.

For travelers in North Orange County, this hotel is in a great location, right by Brea Mall and other shopping/dining areas.  The service is friendly and responsive.  They have a nice buffet breakfast every morning, which has an omelet/waffle bar.  Rooms are dark and a little tired, not as fresh and clean as we'd expect.  Beds are comfortable. They have a lot of weddings and events and it can be noisy.    Would love to see this hotel get a makeover, but we continue to stay there for location and service.

I stay at this Embassy Suites from 3-7  nights a month and have done so for the last 4 years.   Not only do all departments execute their jobs at the highest level, they do it with honest sincerity. The F&B department is outstanding and the quality of service in the bar is the best I experience in all my hotel travels.  My most simple rule of good business is that the fish stinks from the head down...the Senior management of this Hotel leads by example and I have never had anything other than the most positive customer service experiences in all my stays  No matter where my business takes me in the OC area I always stay at Brea North and always will.
