My sister, father and I travelled here for family business in January.  We stayed for just over a week.  There is good and bad to this hotel..mostly good but there are things that could use some work.  The Good & The Bad  The hotel itself is quite interesting in design...and the huge Koi pond on the main floor is pretty spectacular.  I noticed that some children had gone to (I believe) the front desk and gotten some food to feed them, which is cool for kids.  The hotel is clean, and the housekeeping staff are very good.  My sisters baby was travelling with us so we went through a lot of towels etc, and they were more than willing to provide us with extra linens etc as needed.  We had registered for the VIP which allotted us snacks and drinks unlimited on our floor.

Room was clean and comfortable, staff very polite.  Great location being so close to the Brea Mall, Target, dining, and the location I was visiting on business.  Shuttle service was very convenient to my work location.  Overall a very pleasant stay - beautiful facility, highly reccomended.

Summary Heading: Solid business stay from a reliable brand
Summary: Recently spent three nights at the Embassy Suites Brea - North Orange County.  I was there alone on business and my stay can best be described as hassle-free.  The property had a lot to do with it.  Some specifics:  -- Really convenient location.  Adjacent to the Brea Mall.  Across the street (on the other side of the property) from a Target and TGIFridays.  About a mile from downtown Brea with great restaurants and shopping.    -- Using Hilton's new-ish early online check-in where you can choose your room ahead of time, I purposefully chose a room that faced the mall rather than Birch Street.  It was quiet, though my 7th floor view was that of the mall's parking lot.  But you're not in Brea for a view nor is a view expected from an Embassy Sutes in the middle of suburbia.  --

I just love ANY Embassy suites actually. They're very accommodating and great staff at all of them. I don't think I've ever stayed at an 'awful Embassy Suites' hotels. I especially LOVE the convenience of their breakfasts. Only wish is ALL of them have their own restaurants inside their hotels

We stayed at this Embassy Suites during a recent weekend in LA.  The hotel needs updating and the front desk staff was rude and needed training regarding customer service and the benefits afforded premium floor guests.  We checked in ahead of time through the online check-in.  When we arrived at the front desk, the clerk threw the key at us and failed to greet us or inform us of the benefits of staying on the premium floor.  I had to call the desk to find out where the included "snack station" was located.  They failed to tell me it was not working (during our 5 night stay no effort was made to fix it) and that we had to go to the front desk to get snacks from them (requiring us to stand in line with check in guests).  They also tried to charge us for internet access even though

I have reviewed this hotel once before in April of 2014, but last time we stayed as a family of five, this time we stayed just as a couple.  My husband and I went to the AMA Supercross at Angel's Stadium in Anaheim but didn't want to stay in Anaheim because the traffic is crazy and the hotels are much more pricey because of the vicinity to Disneyland and other event centers. We chose this hotel because we had such a great experience last time and Brea is a very beautiful clean city. The hotel is only about a 10 minute drive to the stadium and is literally next door to the mall. It is conveniently located close to the 57 freeway and near various other stores, banks, and restaurants. While the hotel seems to be showing signs of wear and tear it is still beautiful and extremely

If you're looking for a quick local getaway - Embassy Suites Brea is the place to be! Short distance from shopping, spa and many restaurants and the hotel and staff are amazing! The room was clean.  The manager's reception was so enjoyable.  The breakfast was outstanding!

First off I like this hotel. I've stayed here the last three January's.  It's located adjacent to a mall. Lots of places to eat nearby. The only issue I had was with the take down of the coffee stations for breakfast @ 9:10. They just stopped serving at 9.  Hopefully the front desk takes care of this for the future. I'm a Hilton Diamond member for numerous year and have never experienced this before

The Embassy Suites time and time again are one of the best values for your travel dollar. This one is exceptional. Free breakfast, happy hours, right across the street from a mall and within minutes to Disney. You can't go wrong with this place.

Met up with my brother and parents for a nearby funeral the next day.  All three rooms were perfect in every way.  We had all travelled from different parts of the state over 100+ plus miles through nasty holiday weekend traffic and really appreciated the ease in checking in and parking.  The complementary "Happy Hour" drinks and snacks in the sports bar just off the lobby helped take the edge off fighting the traffic, until we left for dinner with more family.  The open square layout with rooms around the enclosed open area was most nice.  Complementary made to order or buffet (your choice) breakfast completed a very satisfying stay.

We visited LA area in December and originally stayed at the Embassy Suites, North Anaheim location (which is under construction among others issues). There were no more rooms available so we ended moving to this location in Brea. Let me tell you... WE WERE JUST WOWED with the difference! The hotel, the service, the breakfast, the rooms - all were above my expectation! We had a family of 7 and we were all very comfortable in our rooms.  We could have even shared one suite! The drive to Disneyland was not too far. I would definitely return to this location when I return to LA for an extended trip.  P.S. May restaurants that are walking distance and Target across the street for those last minute needs.  You will not be disappointed if you stay here.  Thanks Embassy Suites Brea!

We stayed here because it is close to a family member.  The hotel is also close to other family friendly locations.  We visited the La Habra children's museum, Fullerton Arboretum and plan to return when we visit Disneyland.  The hotel is close enough to Disneyland for an easy drive, but far enough away to avoid the Disneyland craziness.

Our stay was wonderful from the staff at check in to the staff at the complimentary breakfast to room service to check out. Everyone went above and beyond to make our stay the most enjoyable. We will definitely come back again.

Given the relatively low price we were pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel was and how great our suite was. Clean, comfortable and the room service was great as well. Would happily stay again.

I stayed at this property on New Years eve. We were out until after midnight. When we went to make the hide-a-bed in the suite, we found out there was no bedding in the room.  We called the front desk and were told that they were out of blankets and that they could provide extra sheets for our comfort!  A bed without a blanket, in January and its 45 degrees outside.  Shameful.  I don't recomend staying at this property.

Our family of five stayed at the property for six nights.  The property was excellent.  The rooms were very clean.  The staff was outstanding.  As always, the breakfast was great.  We had a large corner room on the fifth floor.  The location was perfect to get to many local attractions.  It was nice to have the mall adjacent to the property.  There were also many food options at night.  We will definitely be staying at this location on our next return to the Brea/Yorba Linda area.

The Embassy in Brea has always been our go to place when we are visiting So. Cal. On this trip we set up a family holiday luncheon, using the hotel's Event Services Coordiation. We were very please with how everything turned out. It was above and beyond our expectations.

Wonderful hotel. Clean, quiet. Comfortable. staff very friendly. Free made to order breakfast was a plus. Free parking. 20 minutes from Disneyland and Knotts berry farm. Close to shopping. Would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

This property is clearly different in the market place and remains special with because of so many added values. From the very beginning Embassy Suites has offered the breakfasts, PM receptions and a unique lobby ambiance. I found Embassy Suites in the 70's, have been a member of various special Embassy Suite programs and still tell everyone who will listen that the Embassy Suites is by far the best value. With Hilton Honors points it is just that much better!

This is the third year in a row that we spent sometime at this Embassy Suites. Over the years I have seen the rooms become a little worn out. One of the issues was a rattling AC unit. Thank god it was cool so we did not need to run it for a lengthy period of time. I know that they remodeled  approx. two years ago but the ware and tear is catching up. Two of the ice machines (4th and 5th floor were not working) . I know that these are little things but the little become big problems. We maybe changing our location next year.

I am writing to make travelers aware of the inhospitable treatment the staff directed towards our family this past Christmas Eve.  Our niece and her family live a short distance from your hotel and for the last few years they have hosted a Christmas Eve party at their home for all family members who wish to attend. This year my wife and I had reservations to stay at your hotel in order to be close to my sister (my niece’s Mother) and her husband who also had reservations.  My wife and I arrived at your hotel around 1:30 pm and were welcomed by your staff and allowed to check in early. We went to our room, unpacked and then went back downstairs to go to the shopping mall next door for some last minute shopping.  We were surprised to see my sister, her husband and their luggage in

Summary Heading: Last night as a single lady
Summary: I came here with a few friends to spend my last night as a single lady. It was amazing, we all had a blast and the bartender that night was awesome! I would definitely stay at an Embassy Suites again and I will definitely recommend the Embassy Suites to other people looking for a great place to stay!
Manager Response: Tiana,   We are so glad that you decided to spend your last night as a single lady with us, and that you took advantage of our awesome bartenders in the evening reception! Don't forget to bring back your significant other so they too can enjoy all we have to offer! Hope to see you soon!   Lisa K.  Director of Sales

Summary: Reserved room for Christmas Eve to attend annual Christmas Party with my family who live close by.  Called hotel early in the morning requesting early check in if possible. We were told maybe we could check in around 230 My brother was also staying at hotel and arrived around 115 and was checked in at this time We arrived at 2 and were told there are rooms available but there would be a $75 fee if we needed to check in now. I told them my brother already had checked in and they said that was because they were Hilton honor club. Asked again if they could let us check in as it was Christmas and we had a party to get to. We were told to go wait on the couch and they would let us check in at 230. During our wait no one else came to check in and the three clerks stood at front desk

Very good place to stay was here in september for business. I stayed here for one night for business. Typical embassy suites clean convienent breakfast was provided and food. Happy hour was good also. Near shopping center and nice clean area of town I would stay here again

My husband found a pair of shorts, nail with caster from bottom of chair and lid from cosmetics behind the curtain.  Upon bringing attention to the desk clerk, he said you checked in too long ago there is nothing I can do, I can't do anything and can't change your room.  We were just wanting someone to know that housekeeping might need to be reminded to look between the drapery and the wall and/or window.  (I'm a property manager, I notice these types of things).  Makes one wonder what else wasn't cleaned, though the rest of the room was clean and tidy and didn't smell.  The managers reception was a disappointment by 5:45 they were out of tortilla chips and didn't refill them.  (Reception started at 5:30).  The bar tender could not recommend a different wine for me when they

Our party was down the block so we got a room here. Everything was great no complaints at all. Breakfast was good. Room was clean. Rate was very good for time of year. Staff was accomodating. Maybe add some digital music channels to the selection on the TV.
Manager Response: Dear Chris,   We are so glad that you decided to stay with us and had such a great experience! We hope to see you back next time you are in the Orange County area!   Lisa K. Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Good Location, but typical of Embassy Suites Property
Summary: Just finished staying here and found overall my stay was nice.  Being a frequent traveler, I have the opportunity to stay in multiple properties every  year.  This is my second stay here, and a little different than the last which was flawless.  Thought the staff was nice, professional and helpful.  Breakfast in the morning was fine. The rooms on the other hand need some sprucing up. A decor shot in the arm would be very helpful. It's clear that housekeeping does their best. But the rooms are old and tired, must be hard to keep things looking fresh.  Curtains in my room were ripped, and I had an issue with the plumbing, but staff took care of. One thing I forgot to mention to the staff was that the TVs in my room would sometimes just shut off with no apparent reason.  It was a

Summary Heading: Caters for what you need whilst on a business trip
Summary: Large and somewhat out of fashion when it comes to design, but this hotel gives you Everything you need whilst on a business trip. No fuss, straight forward and nice. Good WiFi in room and easy breakfast buffet. A plus for the nice and smooth omelette a la carte service. Very comfy beds. Very well situated if you have business in Brea and you can walk to the Brea Mall - wonderful no car needed for shopping. All in all very convenient and helpful staff at front desk. All staff Always smiling to you.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review, we appreciate any feedback! Looking forward to having you back for a stay and an omelette!

Summary Heading: Not what I would expect of an Embassy.
Summary: The hotel was clean for the most part, but the staff was not quite as attentive as you would expect at an Embassy Suites.  The breakfast, even though cooked to order, did not seem fresh.  They did have the usual happy hour, but the bartender staff just seemed unwilling to serve them up.  His was just not what I expected on an Embassy Suites.

We attended our Holiday party here and will start with the speedy check-in, but I'm a member to the Hilton Honors so the room was  ready and all I had to do was pick up my keys.  The have a Manager's reception every day from 5:30 to 7:30 free beer, some well drinks and wine.  Our Holiday party was great with a very good dinner, dancing, and casino night.  The service was quick and efficient. We checked out on Sunday and they have breakfast included which was nice.  They served omelets', pancakes, eggs any style, bacon, ham and sausage along with breads, coffee, milk and juices.  Checkout easy done on the TV.  The room was large, clean well equipped.

If you wanna spend the money and want a safe location stay here. The breakfast it's great and the evening reception is great. I have a bit of status at Hilton so I get an upgrade of the room. That's great.   The rooms in the hotel are a bit dated.  The decor is outdated and the rooms don't have nearly enough. Most hotel locations have lots of outlets but not this one. I'm surprised this hotel doesn't have outlets and isn't note updated.

This hotel is OK....not a luxury hotel by any means. It meets the needs for staying in the area. Close proximity to the mall and downtown Brea. Food OK, bedding OK, rooms could use some upgrading.....looking a little worn after a few years of use.
Manager Response: Good Afternoon,  I am disappointed we did not exceed your expectations during your stay.  During 2014, we have had renovations throughout the hotel and in the suites including new guestrooms chairs, sofas, new bedding and linen package. If you would like to give more detail to me regarding the upgrades you would like to see I would appreciate it. I can be reached via email at lisa.kotlar@hilton.com.      Sincerely, Lisa K. Director of Sales

Summary: We have stayed here many times over the years while visiting our daughter-the hotel and staff are always top notch. Great location next to perfoming arts theater and the mall with many great restaurants,  The hotel breakfast is excellent as well.

Summary Heading: The staff here are very courteous
Summary: This hotel is conveniently located in a shopping center near restaurants.  I do not think I have ever been happier with hotel staff.  The rooms are nice and the central garden area with koi lovely.  They could use a few more outlets near the desk and bedside dressers and the room was a little musty but all in all a great stay.
Manager Response: Good Afternoon,   Thank you for the positive review.  We are so happy you had an enjoyable stay and thought so highly of the hotel staff.  We look forward to hosting your stay again the next time you are in Orange County.  Sincerely, Lisa K Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Room was nice Front desk needs help
Summary: We were staying at this Embassy Suites because of attending a gather that was being held there. I was looking forward to our stay because I know Embassy Suites are well known & I always held them in a higher class then other well known Hotel chains.  I thought the parking was well maintained & we found a spot right away. It was check in where we had the problem. First when we went to check in we were told they didn't have a reservation for us.  Thankfully our friend who made the reservation's room wasn't ready, so she was still in the lobby & gave them her name which the reservation was under.  We were then told the room wasn't paid for which we had the understanding it was.  The young man took our ID's & card.  We asked how much the room rate would be & they only reply I got

The facility was clean and well appointed.  The staff was friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable. Parking was easy.  Check in and out went smoothly. The complimentary breakfast was amazing and included the option of made to order omlettes. The lobby and atrium were beautiful, and the Bar area was welcoming and comfortable.

I love the location. So nice being near the small. it feels classy but not super rich. Clean, great rooms, nice staff.  My family and I  stay there any time we visit our family in OC. I am not a fan of the parking at all so hard to find a spot, but every thing else was great!
Manager Response: Dear Doctortea,  Thank you for the excellent review of the hotel.  A great tip for parking next time is to use the lower parking level 2, you will go down the ramp and into another full parking lot.    I hope this helps and we will see you again soon!   Sincerely,  Lisa K Director of Sales

Summary: The staff is superb. The hotel is comfortable, clean, spacious and fantastic! Kim and Justin in the bar are fabulous. Stephen at the front desk is amazing. Emily the Director of Rooms is superb. The new General Manager is TOP NOTCH! Never pass up this property when in California! Its worth it!!

This is the third time we have stayed at the Embassy Suites Brea and we probably would choose it again if travelling through L.A. It is situated perfectly for everything we need. Next door to Brea Mall and close to some great Restaurants (Cheesecake Factory & BJs Brewhouse) both of which we would eat at again. Managers greeting drinks is a plus and the breakfast is well stocked and tasty.Only issue we had on this occasion was a noise which woke us early in the morning.I mentioned this at check out and the receptionist said it was to do with the renovation work going on.I wrote to the manager with regard to this via Email and received no reply which was very disappointing as Hilton Customer Service is normally so good. I did expect some sort of reply.Also as a Hilton Honors

Beautiful Atrium area. Peaceful atmosphere. Very good and complete complimentary breakfast. Bathroom 110v outlet did not work for hairdryer use. Electrician tried to repair, but was u sucessful. Have stayed here previously when everything worked fine.

Summary Heading: Restless night in Embassy Suites Brea CA
Summary: Wonderful clean  well maintained nicely decorated hotel.Polite staff, good restaurant. Unfortunately they have not yet rectified the problem of improper bedding. Down comforters only are available and no light weight blankets exist. This is inappropriate in very warm So. CA!

Great hotel with a staff that gives it a caring and special personality.  Unwind, relax, and enjoy your stay.  Complimentary breakfast with omelets made to order start your day off right.  Convenient to shopping and located in a safe and walkable neighborhood.  Parking is safe and easily accessible and free.  The housekeeping staff are efficient and thorough and politely responsive to guests,

I enjoyed my stay. I slept great! I loved how open the hotel was in the middle. The natural lighting made me feel like I was in Hawaii. The room was very easy to find. I will be visiting the area alot more in the coming months and plan to stay at the Embassy Suites over and over again.

Friendly staff and a great omelet breakfast bar.  Enjoyed our stay.  Room was ready when we arrived and very comfortable.  Embassy Suites never disappoints.  Glad they are a part of the Hilton Family. Would definitely stay here again if in the area.

Pleasant hotel just 1/2 mile from downtown Brea. Layout is very typical of an Embassy Suite with a large atrium in the center of the hotel. Bedroom bed mattress was average. Air conditioning did not cool the room very well. Hotel lobby is currently being renovated.  Bathroom had a large crack in the ceiling and a very poorly caulked seam between the wall and ceiling above the towel rack.  Beautiful atrium in the center of the hotel. Very nice breakfast but the line for omelets was very long, and only one cook was present. Tables were well bussed and cleaned very quickly.  Service within the hotel was very good.  Two levels of underground parking contain adequate parking for guests.  I called the hotel for directions and the front desk clerk gave some of the most clear

Having just had a horrible experience at the Embassy Suites in Los Angeles, I was a bit worried about what to expect at the ES Brea (which was the site for my husband's 50th HS Reunion). Upon arrival, I discovered that this is a "real" ES ... in other words, it's what you expect an ES to look like, which is a very good thing.  An overall wonderful experience, starting with the room and, especially, the accommodations for the Reunion. I noted that there was also a wedding booked, the same night, and was concerned about the staff being overwhelmed with 2 large events. No problem! Great food, always kept fresh, and a really nice venue.  My confidence in Embassy Suites is renewed!

Summary Heading: good job providing for our 50th HS Reunion
Summary: Thank you for making our reunion special.  You did a good job and we all had such a wonderful time. Food was good and people was very friendly. We would all stay again at you hotel.  The pool was very clean and the grounds very nicely manicured.  Staff helped us with directions and answered all our questions.

Stayed here for work 2 nights.  The lobby was being upgraded.  The rooms and furniture are old looking.  This is a courtyard style hotel which.  The center lobby is quite nice.  The beds and pillows are clean and very comfy.  Employees are nice.  In had a problem with my toilet and it was repaired when I returned to the room.  Breakfast is quite good but the room is so dimly lit it was awkward finding things.  The bar has a good selection of food and drink but looks old and dirty and everything has a sticky layer on it.  The mirrors behind the bar where the liquor is displayed on the lower level look filthy.  Someone left food in the hallway on my floor and it was there for a whole day.  I notified management on check out.  Overall its a great location restaurants and shopping

The hotel is I the older side , having said that they were painting and upgrading while I was hear. I stay here monthly and it's nice clean and quiet. It's close to the city if Brea for food or hang out time.   It's close to a mall all around you. It's not touristy and has a great breakfast. I like it here.

I've stayed at this hotel several times over the years and I always look forward to it. The rooms are comfortable and quiet and I'm always relaxed. With in-room refrigerators and microwave ovens, you have everything you need.

This works fine if you are just there for business or because of the location. Décor is a little out-dated and your right in the middle of a busy city. However, shopping is good - it's right next to the Brea Mall. The beds are also very comfy.

Mall, restaurants, coffee shops, everything you need in walking distance! I stayed 3 days for a work event and never had to drive my car! Very clean, breakfast waits can be a little long for made to order and the bathrooms have signs of begining mold or recent attempts to remove. All in all, great choice.

Summary Heading: My several day stay at Embassy Suites Brea
Summary: My greatniece was married in Southern California last month and arrangements were made for out-of-town guests to stay here.  Flew into John Wayne Airport and my nephew picked me up.  There is no shuttle from the hotel to the airport.  My check-in went smoothly with a very pleasant young woman, who explained all about the included breakfast, and other advantages of the hotel.  The breakfast was excellent, with many hot/cold choices and even a special counter for omelettes.  The coffee was very good.    The on-site cafe is themed like a sports bar and happy hour includes FREE drinks for guests.  I had lunch there twice and was pleased with both the service and food on both occasions.    My suite was comfortable with a sitting room, including couch, desk, coffee table, occasional

Stayed in the Upper Penthouse and mold and wall paper was peeling off wall and there is a breakast attendant who chases people down if she does not see the comp voucher and is not satisifed with a room key

Enjoyed the stay, so did my colleagues.  The bedding was delightful.  The hotel was clean and the staff was very kind.  The best feature, besides free breakfast, was the evening reception.  My experience was delightful!

Summary Heading: Comfort, Cleanliness, Great Service, and a PURE Room!
Summary: Comfort, service, and cleanliness are important to a memorable hotel stay and guests get this and more when they book at Embassy Suites in Brea California. This large, full service hotel has everything you need for a true home away from home experience.  I stayed at Embassy Suites in Brea California while in California for a business/leisure trip and I was impressed from the beginning, first with the quality of service. Check in was very fast and the guest service reps did everything they could to make sure I was taken care of and comfortable. I was equally impressed at the cleanliness, from the entrance to the halls to the rooms themselves, and. I was confident my stay would be a good one.   I like how Embassy Suites in Brea California has the rooms arranged with furniture and

I have stayed at the Embassy Suites in Brea for most of the last 18 months on an extended business assignment. Let me begin by saying the staff at this hotel is truly world class! I travel extensively on business and I was treated extremely well during my whole stay. As well, when my wife came to join me she was treated like family! I was very impressed.  If you have business travel in the North Orange County of Los Angeles County area I highly recommend this hotel. I was working in Pomona and my daily commute into work and back was 15-20 minutes each way!  Due to my long work hours I had room service often and have eaten everything on the menu. The service is excellent and the overall food quality was good.  The pool is very large, the hot tub is nice and the gym is small but

Embassy Suites was a very nice place to stay with our daughter and grandchildren. Comfortable clean room, quality complimentary breakfast, pool and spa were a real treat. We will most likely stay at Embassy Suites from now on as long as the rates are reasonable.

Won a one night stay in a raffle which included cocktail reception, and free breakfast in morning not only was everything wonderful the breakfast was made to order. New resturants and the Brea Mall and downtown Brea!

We had a great time. This hotel is located close to shopping, restaurants and the Summit House, where the wedding was held. The pool was quite refreshing, but could use more lounge chairs. And the staff, was very polite and helpful. Even the weather was perfect.

Hotel surrounds a beautiful courtyard with a koi pool and two big fountains.  Rooms are spacious and very comfortable although the thermostat was set on 62 when we arrived and it took a while before we could take off our jackets.  The included breakfast was awesome with an omelet bar, fruit and juices.  The catered lunch in conference was bland and overpriced.  Sure wish there was free wifi.

My family had a great time at the Embassy Suites in Brea, California. We would definitely be returning for our next little get-a-way. My favorite part was waking up and still having fresh breakfast in the morning at 9:00 am, even though it started at 7:00 am. It was a overall great experience and I would definitely recommend this particular hotel and I will be back soon.

Summary Heading: Very good but room to be even better
Summary: Stay was really nice and rooms were clean. Staff also helpful. Make sure you don't use the hotels dry cleaning service unless you want to pay a fortune. Internet connection is a bit to expensive and disconnects a lot. Food is good. Location is great.

Summary Heading: The best hotel in Brea, CA
Summary: If you try to look hotels around Brea or fullerton, CA, why don't you pick this hotel, niice location with free pariking and free hot breakfast. Don't forget evening reception. Easy to access to go anywhere in Orange county. All staff was so friendly.  Thank you and God bless you.

Hotel was very clean and the staff was so nice!  Breakfast in the morning was delicious with a wide variety of choices.  I will definitely stay here again when I am in the area and would recommend to all friends/family.

This hotel was amazing! It was our anniversary and the manager made us feel so special!!We can't wait to stay here again. The room was gorgeous. Breakfast was amazing and the evening reception was lots of fun!

Summary Heading: I've stayed here a few times
Summary: Overall Embassy experience was average. I'm sure most would think this is exceptional, and it is very comfortable. Tons of choices for food within minutes driving or seconds walking. My only gripe is with the bartenders, every time I've been there they seem like I'm bothering them. I stay at least 30 nights a year in Embassy Suites rooms, this is the only place that seems to disapprove of a business traveler that tips generously. The overall experience out weighs the couple in the bar.

Came here to stay the day before and night of a wedding that was held at the summit house. They were very helpful in letting us check in early as we had to be at the wedding at 2pm. They also provided a complimentary shuttle to and from the summit house which was very helpful. Overall I was very impressed and would definitely come back again!

Summary Heading: Room too hot, beer too light
Summary: As most hotels are outfitted these days, they have a featherbed mattress cover and comforter. It is waayyyyy too hot, even with the AC at 62 and a fan. And really hospitality should not include only light beer. I know it is "free" but sad.

Strengths: breakfast, clean room, staff friendliness  Areas for improvement, WiFi, room air conditioning  Would stay here again.  Good location, close to highways and shopping.  Staff was eager to make stay enjoyable.  Suggest upgrading nightly manager's happy hour offerings.  Low grade beer, low cost snacks.  Maybe offer better beer/wine at a low price as well as low appetizers at a reduced cost.

Stay in the penthouse located in one of the corners. I had 2 huge balconies that stretched over the 2 corners. It was an open concept living room and bdrm-including bathroom...dont bring kids if u want to utilize the huge spa bath tub, properly. Then...breakfast made to order was fantastic.

can not believe how grimy the shower was and the conditions of the room was horrible for what you would expect for the price.  I have Had better at way lower priced motels along the I 5 interstate. I really couldn't believe it and then they want to sell you wifi after you pay this over priced rate and the grimiest places provide it for free
Manager Response: Dear Daniel E.,  I am sorry you had an unfavorable experience at the hotel.  The hotel team prides itself on a clean and comfortable experience for all guests.  The staff has completed a thorough walk through of the guestroom and any issues have been addressed.  Thank you for your feedback and I hope you will give us another chance the next time you are in the area.

Summary: Embassy Suites is our favorite hotel chain because it has everything.  Rooms are very spacious since there's a separate living room area.  Nice decor and everything is always clean and tidy.  Breakfast is fabulous as they offer a wide variety of pastries, fresh fruit, cereals, sausages, bacon, eggs, waffles, cooked to order omelets etc.  Real good price for a great place to stay with great food, room and service!

The best hotel of our vacation. Lovely room, lovely facilities, no parking charges, lovely breakfast and a happy family.  I am usually very critical when things are not up to standard but, well done Embassy suites Brea, we would come again.

For less than the cost of many area hotel rooms, this hotel is beautiful, gives you a suite amounting to two bedrooms, has free parking, and does everything possible to make you feel welcome. It is conveniently located near Anaheim (think Disneyland, California Adventure, Knotts Berry Farm) as well as Orange County beaches, and it is about forty minutes from Hollywood.  Next door is a big mall, and there are many desirable restaurants minutes away.  The hotel's lavish breakfasts were one of the highlights of our vacation.

Summary Heading: We LOVED it, consistent with other Embassy Suites
Summary: Got in late, late at night from LAX with a crazy big Buick Enclave, no space in the underground parking lot, so they let me park it on the hotel driveway for the night. Lovely 2 room suite, massive King Size bed, great net access, 2 flat screens, good breakfast with okay choices, 2 HOUR free beer/wine/spirits in the evening got our night started! Friendly and capable staff, not that we had any problems to sort out, bill under door on final morning as per consistent Hilton style. Maybe the interior theme is slightly unusual, but we LOVED the Embassy Suites, for a reasonable business stay it doesn't get much better than this. Great shopping all around too, and not far from theme parks if that's your thing.

We held our HS reunion at this hotel and the service, food and Staff was outstanding.  This Hotel was a great value for the money with a convenient location close to Freeways and a large shopping mall nearby.

very nice location, seems like a newer area and plenty of amenties and restaurants close by. Close to disney, LA Angels, hockey and beaches. 35 mins to lax with no traffic,  free parking, large mall next door. Beaches close by as well laguna, newport aprox 30 mins -- hov lane.

Summary Heading: Good hotel with room for improvement
Summary: Family of 4 stayed for 3 nights.  This hotel is a typical Embassy suites in the Brea mall parking lot, which is a bonus.  The hotel has a strange Egyptian theme and seems a little dated.  Had a corner King suite which was absolutely enormous but also dated.  Needs some new carpet, but overall the hotel seemed clean, just dated.  Breakfast was excellent and free parking was also a plus.  The pool was open until midnight, but there was very limited lighting and was swimming in the dark. Pool/hot tub area was nicely landscaped.  They need to do a better job keeping towels at the pool.  Overall was a good stay and would recommend.

Our family stayed here for 3 nights and found the room and common areas needing such basic maintenance that we truly wonder whether the management cares about the place. Our room (333) has issues ranging from the number plate on the door missing (the room number is shabbily painted on) to seriously flaking paint chipping off the bathroom door...chips of paint flaking onto the carpet is really troublesome given that we have young kids. The toilet barely flushed, the wallpaper was noticeably warped in places and the tub caulking was very noticeably mildewed. All of these issues are so plain that you'd assume any hotel staff glancing through the room would notice. We can only assume that nobody cares.
Manager Response: Dear Reichenj,  I apologize our hotel did not meet your expectations.  The maintenance team has addressed any issues in the room and we hope you will give us another chance the next time you are in the Orange County area.

Summary: We had a wonderful experience at the Embassy Suites in Brea.  We had a wonderful experience in Brea, it was a great city.  This experience changed my mind about Southern California, I will definitely travel there again.

Hotel was close to my job site and close to shopping for  my wife.  Everything was clean and fresh.  Staff was very attentive and efficient.  Will certainly stay here in the future.  Complimentary parking and WiFi were a definite plus. Good selection of restaurants nearby.

As I checked into the hotel, Devin made sure everything was superb. He provided outstanding service by providing me a couple refreshments, thanked me for staying with the Embassy, offered me a room with two beds, microwave and refrigerator. He informed me of the complementary breakfast in the morning and free refreshments at the bar in the late afternoons.  The room was clean with plenty of towels, two flat screen TV's, a work desk and a couple couches which were very comfortable compared to other establishments.  .i would stay her again the next time I am in Southern California due to the staff and this amazing hotel.

I would rate this hotel as a 5 star for its level of service and amenities!  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Everyone is a true professional.  Hotel is well appointed and offers updated amenities.  We especially appreciate the heating/cooling system which is central instead of the loud, unmanageable, dirty wall units in most hotels.  The breakfast is great too!  We will definitely stay at this hotel when we return to the area.  There were no disappointments here!

We usually stay at this hotel twice a year. The location is very nice as it is walking distance to good shopping and some nice chain restaurants. The rooms are going downhill. The hotel is dirty and not well maintained. We booked the premier room on the 6th floor and they put us in the handicapped room on the first floor. I book a corner suite and the manager said they overbooked the hotel, so they had to move us to a standard room on the 5th floor. For the first three nights the fire alarm went off. I asked Maintenance to fix it, but during the night it went off again, so finally I disarmed it myself.   The towels are old and dirty.  I have included some pictures of the room condition.  The morning buffet was also dirty. The floors and tables had food stains and food hanging
Manager Response: Dear BackC08,  I apologize you were not satisfied with your stay.  We appreciate your loyalty to the hotel each year and are disappointed we did not meet your expectations.  During 2014 we've received many new upgrades including new mattresses, linen package, desk chairs, sofas and sofa beds.  in addition the exterior was painted and the pool area resurfaced.  We will continue to complete upgrades in 2015 and hope you will join us again, please call me at the hotel directly to make your reservation.   Thank you,

Summary: The hotel is very good with free breakfast (includes lots of items to select from). Evening reception is an added value with some snacks. The suite is suitable for business and family with 2 children. It is very close to Brea shopping mall and some restaurants are in walking distant.

Free made-to-order breakfast was the main reason we booked this hotel.  Omelet line was long, but food was great.  I wish internet were free, if not for everyone, then at least for Hilton honors guests.  That was disappointing.

What a pleasant surprise this hotel is. From the reception at the front desk with Steven, to the bellman that helped us with the bags, to the quick response from housekeeping for more towels, to the great breakfast staff, and to the rapid checkout, this is the hotel to stay at for Knott's Berry Farm. The mall across the street provided many dining opportunities and was an easy walk with the grand kids. They loved having their own room and television.

We booked just one night at the Embassy Suites Brea..We were attending a wedding at the  Nixon Library/Museum..Great idea to stay over after the wedding..Good location, across for the Brea  Mall.Parked in front then checked in..Darvin/Daren at  the desk was, so helpful and accommodating ,(he even tied my husbands tie for him , when i asked if i could bring-it down for him, to do me a favor )we already called to get our room assigned for us.. Breakfast is served definatly between the times it states..Come at least 1/2 hr before closing.Don't come late it will be closing up ASAP..I was waiting for my omelet, and all else was being put away..The staff at the dining area/atrium, was so helpful land nice..The got me some juice, water and extra hot food they had there, even though it

We spent 8 nights in a 2 room suite while visiting family who live 4 miles away.  We had a king size bed with small balcony and bath in one room and a full (I think that was the size) pull out couch in the other room that had it's own sink, microwave and small refrigerator.  An iron and ironing board were stored on the side of a clothing closet in the main bedroom.  Each room had it's own flat screen tv and on several nights our daughter slept on the pull out couch.    Embassy Suites is centrally located between a strip mall anchored by Target and multiple stores in the front of the hotel and a very large indoor mall w/Nordstrom, Pennys, Sears, etc  w/food court and any other store you could imagine behind the hotel.  TGI Fridays is across the street, Cheesecake Factory is

I loved this hotel, the staff is great, the room is wonderful and at a decent price. The best part about the hotel is the location, it is surrounded by great places in which adults and children can have fun! I am definitely coming back !

Despite of being in a Business Meeting, Embassy Suites has provided to me a great experience as a guest. Very good furniture, accommodations, internet access, gym, business center, variety of breakfast and food. A special mention for the very good services provided by Staff.

poor attitude,  poor response to problems,  poor maintenance of interior, poor food choices, higher than average room costs with many hidden fees.  For example, bowl of soup listed as 5.00 ended up being 12.00 with all the add on's.  Also, they intially said they couldn't take my order as it wasn't big enough.

The room was spacious.  The toilet handle continually stuck in the open position and the toilet continued to run.  When we arrived that night the lights in the pool were not on, had to go to front desk to solve that.  We were upgraded to the  premium floor as a HHR member.  Machines in hallway with free snacks and beverages is one of the features, but all the beverages were out and the snacks were sparse. To the front desk's credit they gave us a choice of beverages from their cooler. The air conditioning does not work as well as it should on a very hot day, it was turned down to 62, and ran all night and just barely kept the room comfortable.   The service was good, the room clean, location good. Overall a decent stay.

Summary Heading: Very Clean Hotel in Northern Orange County
Summary: I stayed at the Embassy Suites in Brea, CA for business recently.  I checked into my room and quickly noticed an issue with some electrical wires coming out of the wall.  I notified maintenance, and the hotel staff immediately dealt with the issue, and moved me into a nicer room quickly.  They also gave me a free diner at the hotel, and wanted to ensure my happiness.  The service was above and beyond my expectations.  The hotel was very clean, the staff was friendly, and the pool and workout facility were very nice.  This property is clean, located nicely next to the mall, with underground parking, and plenty of nice restaurants nearby.

It says a lot about a property when the harshest criticism I can think to make is that the towels are too fluffy.  They're so new and fluffy, that the fluff from the towels stick to my beard after a shower.  Perhaps my opinion of this particular hotel is slightly skewed because of a less-than-pleasant experience at a LV hotel from the previous few days, but everything from the staff, to the room, to the amenities and ambience made me feel both safe and extremely welcome.  My wife commented that she's never seen me unpack so quickly before, but within 10 minutes, I'd unpacked clothes for my entire family of 4 and was more relaxed than I'd been at any other point in time since our vacation began a week before.  We're a couple with 13 and 4 y.o. boys, and usually travel at least a

Fire alarm went off twice.  Not fun.  I set the thermostat at like 65 and still felt warm.  The hotel is a little dated.  The rooms are dark.. not so fresh but not horrible.  I don't like being able to hear noises outside my room.  The atrium causes a lot of noise but you can't hear it from the bed which is nice I guess.  I would probably try a different hotel next time I am here for work but I am a HHonors person so I will keep it in the family.  They also forgot my free water as a silver member.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay for our baseball families
Summary: This hotel was exceptional for comfort and convenience with multiple families staying for a baseball tournament.  The teenage boys loved the hot breakfast with omelettes made to order, the pool table in the bar area, the evening reception, etc.  They were able to walk across the street to restaurants and shops.  Easy access to the freeway and easy parking.

Embassy Suites It must be incredibly difficult to figure out how to staff your facility for a big holiday such as the Fourth of July. Before I begin a few issues we had with our stay, I want to commend your staff on their patience and ability to deal with such rude and selfish patrons. Here are a few issues we had, in a top ten form.   1) The tall Robusta palms around the pool should be trimmed just prior to blooming. The pollen which rained down in the area caused the area to be dirty and unsightly. Our swim was not enjoyable and from experience, the pollen most likely contributed to the loud portable filtering station installed to do the job the permanent filter couldn't do because of the overload of Palm pollen.  2) There were no pool towels available, although we were given

The hotel needs updating. We were concerned with pool safety issues as the ladder exit from the deep end of the pool was taped off completely, leaving only one exit. A temporary filter on a wheeled cart, connected to a long extension cord, ran alongside the pool and kids began playing with it even though it was also taped with yellow caution tape. Multiple issues with things breaking, poor ventilation in the suites, cable tv going out, inadequate air conditioning, and an overall worn feeling left us less than happy.

I stayed during the week of 6/30 - 7/4. There were many teenagers there and they were unsupervised. Two nights during the week they kept me up after 11 when I had to be to work at 6am. They were literally running around and using skateboards in the hotel.  I was disappointed that the internet had a fee. I was traveling for business but did not have a need to log on after hours. This means my company would not pay for it and I wasn't able able to have it billed alternatively. In 2014 internet is used for more than work and should be free. Other competitors (Marriott for example) always have free internet. I would recommend they look into this as this is a deterrent for me traveling alone and with my family when choosing a hotel. The breakfast was good and the hotel changed the

This place is awesome.  I love the lobby.  It looks like you are in a tropical paradise.  We were upgraded to the VIP floor for free.  That was pretty cool.  Every room is a suite with two televisions.  My kiddos slept in the living room on the pull out bed and we got to stay back in the king bedroom with our own television.  It is really clean and nice.  The beds are super comfortable.  Wish we could have stayed another night, but I guess it is cheaper on the weekends because it is a corporate hotel.  The breakfast was great too.  Made to order omelets for a free breakfast are never a bad thing.  Everyone was super friendly as well.  They also had a beautiful pool with a cool jacuzzi as well.  I loved that it was open until midnight.  The only think keeping it from a excellent

Summary Heading: Excellent Service with a few minor glitches
Summary: The hotel staff here are professionals and are extremely customer focused which is great.   We were a bit disappointed with the hide-a-bed (which was totally shot and needs to be replaced ASAP) and the AC was a bit overwhelmed trying to keep the room cool, even with the shades pulled.  Overall, it was clean, quiet, well run with a focus on service.  We will use definitely return to this location.

We have a daughter who attends CSUF and have had a hard time finding a nice place to stay, after trying other larger named hotels, finally found Embassy Suites Brea.  Love this place, staff  is very friendly, great food options within walking distance.  Great mall next door and 4 mile straight drive to the school.  We will be back for sure

Summary Heading: The Best at Embassy Suites, Brea
Summary: This is to highly commend the staff at the bar. They have all been there for years.  Kim is so friendly, always has a smile, and always knows what you are drinking. She keeps a watchful eye so you never have to ask for a refill.  She makes your trip relaxing and is one of the reasons I always try to stay there when traveling to that area.  The other bartenders are also attentive and friendly - Justin and Jesse.

Well set up for family get togethers with open court yard that lent itself well to socializing. Small pub with Managers Reception also allowed people to interact with one another. The breakfasts were very good with with all the variety you could want. Rooms were spacious, clean and very functional. Location of shops and restaurants nearby was convenient.

This is always a consistently excellent hotel. The staff are great, the breakfast included is tremendous value and the rooms are very, very good. This hotel has no negatives, what makes it so great I believe is the attentiveness of the staff. Also their cocktail hour is hard to beat!!

We had over 50 people staying at the Embassy Suites Brea for a family reunion and it was great.   While the hotel is a little tired, the staff was thoughtful, helpful, friendly and competent. The hot breakfasts were delicious and generous (so much so that the staff was alert to any interlopers!).   Our bed was so comfortable, I checked the tag: Serta Perfect Sleeper Suites II.  Literally across the street was the gigantic Brea Mall (Nordstrom, Penneys, Macy's and Sears and  a hundred smaller stores and across the opposite street was a big Target, with everything a tourist could want including a grocery store.

I stay at this specific Embassy Suites a minimum of once a month. If ever I was upset or the least dis-satisfied with anything involving this location, the staff immediately rectifies all issues and see's to my every need.

We haven't stayed in an Embassy Suites in years. We stayed here while attending a wedding in the area. It was a very pleasant return to Embassy Suites. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and the fitness room exactly what I needed. I enjoyed a delicious breakfast the next morning sitting with friends revisiting all the fun we had the night before at the wedding.

We love Embassy so no questions we would select this chain for a stay near Cal State Fullerton for a graduation.  Excellent location from the University as well as fine eateries.  Egyptian theme indeed! Very grand upon entrance.  hotel rooms open to the huge courtyard that becomes the buffet area for the free breakfast.  The suites are so-so.  Nothing special.  Sofa bed is very uncomfortable.  The floor on the opposite side of the shower wall was drenched every time somebody showered.  It was near the desk area so it can be easily avoided.  The room seemed dark when you get in which made it dreary.  The hotel is near the mall which is great if you have to kill time.  The pool is heated! There's also a 24hour fitness gym across the street.  We were being charged for $12 per child

Fabulous hotel with great amenities The suite was large and very nice The breakfast was fabulous - made to order omelets and bacon and potatoes along with a buffet of hot and cold food to choose from. We loved it. I would stay there again anytime I visit that area. The rate was such a deal!

We will be back again soon. This is our home away form home. We love the hotel itself the location is great and with all the things to do in that imediate area we feel like we are at home everytime we stay there. Your guys and girls there do a great job. Keep up the good work and  we will see you again soon.

Me and the honey did a quick little getaway to the Embassy Suites in Brea nice break went to lucilles bbq plenty of restaurants next to brea civic center . Near brea mall you can literally walk across the street and your there all room 633 was nice.

Typical Embassy Suites in a good location in Northern Orange County.  Free parking was easy and safe.  Walk to mall and short drive to highway.  Rooms were updated and well maintained.  Overall it was a good experience.  I would stay here again and recommend to others.

Summary Heading: An OK choice if you need to be in that area
Summary: Typical Embassy type of hotel. OK mid-week and crowded and noisy on the weekenda. Some rooms in need of updates. Small fittness center. Food quality as you might expect. Brea Mall is right there so easy shopping and more food choices, also many eatting options in the area. Plenty of parking in under ground garage.

This hotel is perfect for family. We had a great stay we stayed for 4 days. The breakfast was great. We had trouble with our air they came in and checked and changed filters. I would stay at this hotel again if ever in California .

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites Hotel in Brea is Gorgeous!
Summary: A beautiful place to stay in Brea! Great complimentary breakfast! Professional staff. Very Clean rooms! A step above other hotels. Mini-Suites are big with separate living spaces which is superior.  I will stay there again and recommend it to my business associates and friends.

Summary Heading: Great Location if visiting L.A. area
Summary: Perfect for a family that is traveling, or individuals on business, close to a very large shopping mall.  Great variety at breakfast, and plenty of seating in naturally lit atrium.      Room was very quiet and bed was soft and comfortable.  Plenty of hot water in the shower.  Long pool for people to spread out or do laps.

The power went out for many hours and the hotel had no transfromer. It was the most scariest experience to get up at 3:00 am to use the restroom and feel chocked since there was no AC and no light. Thank goodness for my cell phone with a flash light! couldnt even call the lobby to ask when the power was coming back up since their phones were down too. This is also a saftey issue for hotel not to have power! I had to call the police using my cell phone to find out what is going at the hotel since I felt very scared and unsafe on the forth floor of a hotel in a complete black out room.  Worse that that is that they hotel staff didn't even appologize for the situation!

I rated sleep quality as poor for this hotel but there were special circumstances. I woke up several times in the night due to being hot, I had lowered the thermostat before I went to bed but never really heard it kick on so suspected there were issues. However when I woke slightly before my phone alarm went off because the people below me were comatose and sleeping through theirs buzzing for a solid 10 minutes I discovered my room had no electricity. I made myself decent and shuffled down to the front desk where I was greater by a very friendly gentlemen (who also looked somewhat scared of what was in store for him) working in the dark as well. Apparently there were power outages all over Brea so he offered me a cold water and a flashlight. Best you can really ask for given the

I went on a job in Brea from Texas.  My wife went with.  I picked this location because it was adjacent to the Brea Mall.  She loved it!  While I was at work she went shopping!  Plenty of Restaurants in the immediate area like Red Lobster, PF Changs, Olive Garden, etc.  It's also in the heart of Brea for shopping and dining.  Breakfast was great!  Great variety but same thing the whole week.  Good thing for the made to order side!  Omelets, etc.  Eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, cereals, bagels, you name it!  Plenty of room to sit.  Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite.  Really beautiful and spacious!  Great price.  Bed was fabulous!  Sink, Microwave, Coffemaker in room makes it convenient.  They had a couple of events during our stay but that didn't make it overcrowded or noisy.  Really

We were advised of this hotel due to a wedding we would be attending on Sunday. We also are Disneyland Annual Passholders so squeezed in a quick day there also. We arrived early at about 12:30 and were promptly greeted at the front desk and assisted. We did not expect a room to be ready however we were pleasantly surprised they had one for us! We were able to locate a luggage cart easily and headed upstairs. The atrium area is lovely and lets in great sunlight during the day and has a Koi fish pond which my husband loves.  Arriving at the room was quick and easy - the room was freshly cleaned and was spacious. We had a king bed as requested and extra towels and pillows too! The air conditioning is central and quiet and kept us very cool as we love it that way. There was also a

Very friendly staff. One of the best moderately priced hotels we have stayed in. The pool and spa are very nice. The breakfast choices have been good and offered variety. We have been here for a week visiting family and exploring the area. We would recommend this hotel to other families!

I have stayed many times in various Embassy Suites all over the US. This one was recommended by friends for its convenient location and good service. I can confirm that what they have said was correct. To me it is Embassy Suites like I have found most of them which means that I can recommend a stay if you are in the area.

We've stayed here many times because it's close to family but through the years we seen a steady decay. Some of which is inevitable aging of the facility but the shift towards a sports bar has also shifted the available offerings and we no longer eat at the hotel, except for the breakfast which is also getting to be a no-draw.

Summary Heading: Great location, free parking, decent value
Summary: I loved the free parking and the location near shopping is great. The hotel is nicely appointed but the rooms are showing gentle signs of age and need updating. The good news is that it seems the process has begun. On the day we checked in, new beds were being delivered to the rooms.  Breakfast was good and not crowded even at peak meal time. The layout for the food is inconvenient and the security for breakfast was way too tight. A very business like, but unfriendly older woman was checking her rooming list and letting no one by unless you could produce your breakfast card or a room key. She then checked it against the hotel list. I felt like a kid trying to sneak into the movies when I was "caught" without a key. I had to go find my husband to get it.  Crazy.

If you're looking for a nice big room you'll get that here. If you're looking for any sort of decent customer service you won't get that here. We booked this hotel because it was where the wedding we were attending was being held. The front desk staff was inept. The Manager On Duty was completely incapable of providing any level of customer service. Upon arriving before the 3pm check in time, we were told that our room wasn't ready. We were told that a rush had been placed with the cleaning staff to get our room cleaned within the hour. We had to ask if they could hold our bags and if we could access the outdoor pool area rather than waiting in the lobby. We were given a key that did not work. After receiving a new key and waiting the hour we went back to the front desk and the

Summary Heading: Best of Brea because there is nothing else around
Summary: The internet at this location is awful. It's slow and inconsistent. They are doing a makeover of the rooms. Supposedly we received one of the new rooms with new furniture. No way. That has got to be a joke. If the bed we received was new, I wonder how awful the bed was before.   If you have to stay here, I guess it's okay. But just don't set your expectations too high.

Stayed here on a business trip for four nights. My first time at an Embassy Suites. Check in desk staff polished and polite although my colleague's room was not ready until 30 minutes after we arrived they made it up to him with a $20 bar credit so off we went!  Bar staff were not in place at 4:30 pm and we had to ask the front desk to send an employee to serve us.  Happy hour started around 5:30 pm with free wine/beer and munchies for guests.  House wine was not at all bad.  Got to room and had problem with a/c which hotel staff fixed the next morning for me .  Room clean and large and nice updated granite in bathroom.  Great shower with massaging head options :-). Only negative - I got an upset tummy from the delicious breakfast two days in a row.  Once I stopped eating the

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but issues galore this time around.
Summary: The manager at the desk was surly and gave off the impression he was inconvenienced when I approached the desk about my issues.  In fact, he didn't even respond after my first question, and the desk agent ended up answering my question and asking what could he do to help.    The issues: I was being charged for the water in my room on a nightly basis ($3.50 which is ridiculously expensive) and I approached the desk because as a Honors member, I should receive free water in my room.  Nothing was done to fix this and they instead were referring to my bank room rate and indicated water was not a "free perk" of the group rate.  Again, the group rate had nothing to do with this, I am a Hilton Honors member and that is a "PERK" I should've received.   Secondly, when I realized that I

The manager at the desk was surly and gave off the impression he was inconvenienced when I approached the desk about my issues.  In fact, he didn't even respond after my first question, and the desk agent ended up answering my question and asking what could he do to help.    The issues: I was being charged for the water in my room on a nightly basis ($3.50 which is ridiculously expensive) and I approached the desk because as a Honors member, I should receive free water in my room.  Nothing was done to fix this and they instead were referring to my bank room rate and indicated water was not a "free perk" of the group rate.  Again, the group rate had nothing to do with this, I am a Hilton Honors member and that is a "PERK" I should've received.   Secondly, when I realized that I

Excellent location ... close to shopping mall.  Parking underground.  I would stay here again after first making sure that I would have handicap facilities.  I would also request a room situated away from the traffic-side noise.

Expect the unexpected at this property. My family reunion was destroyed by the staff at this property. We could not get the rooms we reserved, tried for 3 and got 1. Could not check in until after 6:00 and the staff was rude, did nothing to honor our Hilton Honors status. 3 families tried and 1 family had to drive back hole and I had to get other accomodations.

Meets very Embassy Suites expectation: Awesome except the gym sucks. Thank goodness there's a 24 Fitness across the street!! Perfect location, Brea rocks! Its at the mall, across the street from Starbucks, nutrition shop, 24 fitness AND a wine bar. Downtown Brea is awesome and Disneyland is just 20 minutes away! Great clean, safe place to stay! Dog friendly, but all of Brea is dog friendly and so is the Lazy Dog restraint close by!

Summary Heading: Elegant, comfy and great shopping across the street
Summary: Very elegant hotel, very nice staff, wonderful inside view.  Ample, comfortable suite with sitting area and big screen tv's that our daughters loved.  Great beds, very nice bathroom, spacey and NO smell.  Great to have breakfast included 7 to 10 am, that made our stay pleasant and relaxing...no going out and hurrying back to check-out.

This was our second stay at this property as we have relatives in the area.  The rooms can definitely use a refresh but the staff was as friendly as ever and the breakfast was what you expect from an Embassy Suites. The biggest pro is that you cannot beat the location - great proximity to the mall and a variety of restaurants. The parking is free and convenient. A con is the oversell of the premium floor. Unfortunately the "free" beverage vending machine (included in the room rate) didn't work so we were forced to go to the front desk for water and the snack machine didn't include fruit or healthy items during our stay - mostly Lays potato chips and Hershey candy.  We did appreciate the wireless access. Would stay there again but nothing stood out.

In general, it's a good place, pretty clean. We were in non smoking room, but one of the rooms (where sofa is) had very strong cigarette smell, we had to close the  door to the bedroom to sleep. Mattress was a little hard for us but not bad at all.

We stayed in this hotel on 4/13/2014 which was a Sunday night. It was the closest and cheapest Embassy Suites near Knott's Berry Farm, which was our destination. This hotel is beautiful inside and out, well-maintained, and perfect for a family of five. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and offered a smile. I called this hotel directly about a month ago to inquire about its distance from the beach and Knott's and even then, the front desk agent was extremely helpful and friendly. The inside was pretty, with an Egyptian-theme in the main entrance and as expected the water fountain and koi pond in the breakfast area. The main entrance to the hotel is literally 20 steps from the entrance to the mall and a short five minute walk to BJ's Brewhouse and The Cheesecake

We decided to have friends and family stay here, versus other recommended hotels in the area, and we were pleased overall.  The public areas are open with a soothing koi pond in the center atrium area which is where they also serve a good breakfast buffet with omelet bar.  The sales manager we dealt with was very accommodating and extremely pleasant, especially when we needed to add rooms.  Our son, and his bride to be, elected to stay in a penthouse suite as did my husband, myself, and our daughter.  At the initial viewing we were quite impressed with the floor to ceiling drapes and windows, the balconies on two sides, the large living room, bedroom, and bathroom.  Unfortunately, that seemed to be the only impressive part.  Our son's room had a sliding glass door that would not

Stayed here again made to feel very welcome good rooms good breakfast and close to all amenities  in the are especially theme parks ,thanks again to Mikey on reception as always greeted us with a smile and our names.

We were here for a wedding and got the junior suite. Everything was to our liking: easy check-in, nice clean room with a large dining table to entertain our after-wedding guests. The bathroom was clean, the roll out bed was not the most comfortable (so I heard…LOL) but the main bed was nice and soft, and we had two television sets. Awesome stay. I would stay here again.

I loved everything about this hotel. Great amenities included, a relaxing atmosphere, friendly staff, you couldn't ask for a better stay.   Free parking, complimentary hot breakfast which was more than just instant oatmeal and a microwave, there was an omelet bar, the complimentary drinks in the evening, the koi pond...

The open lobby and adjoining courtyard with sunroof was so appealing. I really hate staying in dark hotel rooms. I was able to sit in the interior courtyard with the sunlight and enjoy the water feature and work on my lap top when I didn't have to be in my room. The staff were so helpful with my dad who is 97 and the food was great at breakfast with the hot entrees and the in room dining.

Hotel was great, easy parking under building. Embassy  Suites only offer free WiFi to certain class HH Honors.  This should be extended to all hotel guests. This seems to be a Hilton policy and you can pay for wi-fi, however, wi-fi is offered free other Hilton properties. Breakfast was great and the staff was super.  Great place to stay and about 10 miles from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Still good after all these years
Summary: Enjoyed my family stay after absence of 15 years.  Loved the space in the suites and overall good condition, as well as pool/spa facilities which were very welcome venues to relax after for work or play in the Brea/Anaheim area.   Staff were friendly, and found  rooms before scheduled check-in time, and allowed late check out.  Location near Brea Mall allowed multiple meal and shopping options.  Plenty of free parking space underneath.

Summary Heading: Continued excellence of the Embassy Suite Brand
Summary: Embassy Suites has always provided wonderful accommodations, this hotel is no exception.  Great location within easy driving distance to many interesting places.   Loved the included breakfast.  This was a class reunion and the evening happy hour provided by the hotel was a great venue for a few of  us to get together.  There are several good restaurants with varied menus and price ranges within walking distance from the hotel.  The property is on the edge of a very active mall.  Something for everyone.

I've stayed at this hotel numerous times.  They book up often - probably 1/4-1/3 of the times I try to stay here.  There is very convenient parking for this hotel in two levels of the basement.  Either elevator then takes you to the hotel - either the lobby end or the opposite end.  The rooms each have a living room and a bedroom, unless you get one of the enormous corner suites.  The rooms are very quiet and comfortable.  This place has a great fitness center, generously sized, with 3 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 1 recumbent bike, and free weights.  It includes wipes for the machines, towels, and a water bubbler.  Outside there's a heated lap pool.  It is so beautiful, surrounded by palm trees, grass, and lawn chairs.  Lovely even when the air temps are only in the 60's.  The

I love embassy Suites.  I stay at one whenever I travel if they are near by.  The rooms were spacious and clean.  The room I stayed in had a Kuerig, which was super convenient.  The workout room had about 4 treadmills and 2 ellipticals.  There was a bike, but it was broken.  There was a wide range of free weights, ab machine, medicine balls, and a bench.  Water and towels were provided as well.  I would go and work out around 5-6am and it was always packed! The breakfast was delicious with fresh made to order omelettes and the hot special of the day.  One of the days they had strawberry pancakes with REAL strawberries! The staff was friendly.    Side notes: Internet worked well in my room. Free parking under hotel in garage  Plenty of places to eat in walking distance

My family loves to stay at Embassy Hotels. Breakfast is very good. Lots of choices. Rooms are very clean. Very short walk to the mall. Many restaurants close by. Free parking. 15 minute drive to Disneyland.

Loved staying here. My experience started with Devin from the front desk, although we never got to meet him, but he was very helpful and made my stay extra special for my family and I on my nephew's 8th birthday. At check in we had Robert, who was also very nice and very welcoming. Finally we had Claire who attended us (also a front desk agent)she was magnificent! Oh, I don't want to forget the 2 ladies that made our omelettes, very fun to talk to while they cook! Great staff and facility! Thank you guys for making it special for us! We cannot wait to visit again!   J.Siam

This is just what you might expect at an Embassy Suites. The standard layout, room, and amenities. The free Made-to-Order breakfast was not as robust as I remembered it in the past, but there were enough options available (though the quality of breads and muffins was just fair)  Parking is free, but challenging to locate, as the hotel shares a parking structure with the shopping mall.   There were accessible no power plugs near the bed. Having to unplug a lamp in order to plug-in my phone is just not acceptable in this day and age.

The breakfast is tasty.  It's nice to have the variety each morning of our stay!  This is top-notch quality.    Not only was the staff nice they were prompt with any request.    The atmosphere is awesome!  Very clean and beautiful!  There were so many amenities included with the price.  It's nice to not be "nickled and dimed" for everything.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay in Brea
Summary: This is a great place as a SoCal jumping-off spot, most of the LA/Orange-County attractions are reachable within 40 minutes (traffic permitting). Plenty of retail and food options within walking distance. Fridays and Claim Jumper are over the road or I would recommend a 10 minute walk to BJs at the other side of the mall.   The breakfast was great though as we were on vacation we felt a bit rushed during the weekdays to finish in time before items were cleared away. There were no non-smoking king rooms available however the 2 x double worked ok. The outside painting and redecorating along with the constant gantry movement and painters peering in the room periodically was rather disruptive.  Both the noise and the paint/plastic shrouded windows detracting from the overall

Just finsihed my stay at the Embassy for work travels. The hotel is okay, needs updating but still pretty clean. The staff is very friendy and helpful and were very quick to respond to anything we needed. The breakfast is pretty typical, oatmeal, cereal, omlette bar, toast etc...The hotel is in a very nice area, Brea Mall is right behind it and there is many great shopes just across the street.  Overall descent hotel.

You will get your money's worth if you stay at this hotel. It was convenient and offered a lot in the surrounding area if I wanted something different. There is a mall and a target close by for those who need something really quick or want to shop. Would stay here again, but would not invite family to visit if they could not fix the couches because my family was uncomfortable even if staying for a few hours.

Summary Heading: Best night of sleep I've had!
Summary: Hands down the most comfortable bed I think I've ever had on a trip - business or pleasure.  This Embassy Suites might be a little older and in need of a little refreshing, but the rooms are nice and it was very quiet even though there was a lot going on during my 5 day stay including a volleyball conference and some other convention.  Lots of people at the hotel, but I didn't know it.  No noise issues.  Service at the front desk was outstanding.  The free breakfasts were great - omelets, pancakes, etc.    Located in a nice area with access to grocery, shopping mall, and restaurants.  I would definitely choose this again.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites always a winner for family stay
Summary: The staff worked hard to make sure my stay was comfortable. The sofa bed was broken the night we arrived, but they took care of it the very next morning. Very friendly front desk and maintenance. I would like to have known that they pool heater was broken, kids froze! but you can't tell kids they can't swim b/c of a heater!  The room I had smelt and was musty. Definitely needed to get an update, but when your tired with kids, you roll with it.  The location is so convenient. Food and stores everywhere. I'd stay again. Great value.

The staff always does their best to help you and take care of you.  I stay here when I visit Brea for business.  I have nothing but good things to say.  Sometimes it is very busy due to the good nature of the hotel, they get some college sports teams staying there, weddings, several meeting or conventions, but it never feels packed or overcrowded.  Very well organized.

Summary Heading: Best Place to stay in Orange County!
Summary: Excellence as expected from a Hilton property.  A very friendly staff, clean and updated hotel, and a great location.  If you are looking for a comfortable 'home away from home', this hotel would make a great choice.

I was in town for business and found the location to be perfect. Walking distance to several shops, a mall and restaurants. Short drive to office and other shopping and dining options. Clean, good service, easy to park and get luggage in and out. The premium room was a great value and bed was very comfortable.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, good service, good location
Summary: Stayed here on business for two nights. The overall impression of the property is excellent.  It is getting a little tired, maybe, but impressive still.
