Check in was quick and easy, the rooms are very large 2-room suites. The included breakfast is nicer than most with great selection at a buffet and an omelet bar for made to order selections.  There are countless restaurant options within walking distance.... and it feels like a safe, higher end neighborhood be explore comfortably.  The hotel is nestled up into the Brea Mall which is a nice large mall.  I will look for an excuse to be here with my wife sometime.

Summary Heading: friendly staff, but noisey rooms and poorr Wifi
Summary: The staff at the front desk and bar area were very friendly and helpful during my week long stay, the room are large and pleasant, but you hear a lot of noise from other guests. The wifi connection was very poor and had to purchase a mobile wifi to keep connected with work and family. more geared to tourist than business I suspect. Breakfast was self serve and was ok for what it was.

Embassy Suites Brea was the best Hotel experience I've had in years. Great suite room, great value and it includes a full Breakfast and complimentary cocktail hour. The convention services for our business meetings were hassle free. The food was excellent and very reasonably priced. Thumbs way up for this Hotel!

I was very impressed with the friendliness and high quality service provided by all the front desk staff during my recent 5 night stay. I have never had better service anywhere. They dealt with all my requests promptly and professionally.   I thought the layout of the rooms was exceptional and afforded a very quiet, restful sleep with the separation of the bedroom from the hallways. The room was clean and well-appointed - no complaints there!  As a woman staying alone, I felt very safe in the hotel and to go for walks by myself in the vicinity of the hotel. There is a big mall right across the road for convenient shopping. There are several restaurants nearby and the hotel provides a substantial breakfast included in the price of the room.   I only had two negative experiences

We just held our annual convention at this hotel and all of our attendees were very happy with the hotel, the location and the staff.  I personally like to stay at Embassy Suites when I travel and I have to say the décor of this hotel was one of my favorites.  The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms were nicely furnished.  The meals we had were excellent as well.

Summary Heading: dark and depressing with paper-thin walls
Summary: Check-in service was good and the bed was reasonably comfortable--if only I could sleep with the noise coming in from the neighbors, whose conversations late into the night came through with clarity I'm sure they did not intend. The living area of the suite faces onto the motel-style walkway that leads to the rooms, so that you must keep the blinds down unless you want everyone walking by to see you as they walk by. This means that the living area is perpetually dark, as the only window that can let in light is in the other room (the bedroom). I found this extremely depressing and unpleasant and by the end of my stay I positively FLED with a feeling of desperation to get to some sunlight. The hotel's cheap and ugly atrium style lets in little light, giving the entire place a

We have stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel in Brea  several times on our visit to Orange County and have always received great service and the rooms have always been great.  The complimentary breakfast is one of the better ones we have enjoyed.  The only complaint would be that it ends a little early at 9:00am making it a struggle to get down too.

I booked a King bed in a Non-smoking room. When we arrived, the hotel had us in a king SMOKING room.  I have asthma!!!!! I I would never agree to a SMOKING room. My husband and I had planned a getaway for Valentines's Day and our birthdays which coincide. The Embassy Suites offered us a double bed non-smoking room. That really Is Not what we Paid For.  We were charged and paid for Nothing!!!!!

Summary Heading: Can't say enough good things about it!
Summary: I had a great business stay.  This is the nicest E.S. I've seen.  The hotel has an Egyptian theme, and there are attractive extras in artwork and decorating details.  The atrium has a large pond with fish, and an Egyptian fountain.  The rooms also have extras--looks like silk drapes, and granite thoughout the bathroom--in good condition and clean.   Location is accross the street from a mall with a lot of dining options.   I ordered room service and it arrived in less than 30 minutes.  The menu (in room and in restaurant) has a pretty good variety, and reasonable prices.  I had a fantastic chinese salad--very fresh and again reasonably priced. Business center is big--not crammed in a corner.  Free made to order breakfast was good, as usual.   All the staff that I came in contact

I was there for the business trip with 50 other co-workers. It was very good. Lots of good looking space in the dining area to have small meetings. I think this hotel is perfect for business and vacation. I would go there again.

this hotel is my home away from home i stay here as often as i can and I love it here.the staff at the front desk are exceptional especially Devin who greets me with a smile and a kind word every time.you should clone him.the hot tub and pool are great and i love the breakfast.the same lady makes my omelet every time.change nothing this hotel is incredible

This hotel was completely booked and yet our check-in was swift and friendly. The desk clerk gladly gave us printed directions to the wedding reception venue. The room was so quiet, even when the atrium lobby was full of breakfast diners.Tthe free parking garage on the lower level was a pleasant perk!

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It's gorgeous, and the staff is very friendly and courteous. The breakfast is not very vegan/vegetarian friendly though. I requested a tofu scramble for breakfast days before my arrival, and they were very accommodating in buying the tofu, but it was very obvious that they'd never made it before, and there seemed to be no effort or desire to learn. There was no scramble and no seasoning, just blocks on the grill. The internet is also costly, which I was not informed of prior to my arrival. It was $9.95 per day, per unit. So 2 laptops is $20 per day. Insanity! I didn't pay it, I just used the business center.

Very enjoyable stay. Everything was convenient and most staff was very friendly and helpful. Very clean environment.  Food was delicious and dining experience was good. Convenient to where we needed to go.

Great location but they should heat the swimming pool.  Fitness center is nice...how about an upright bicycle?  Breakfast was very average and if you come at the wrong time, you can have a long wait for an omelet or specially cooked breakfast

My wife and I always enjoy staying at the Embassy Suites.  We like the big suites and the great breakfast and cocktail hour.  The granite tile in the showers is awesome.  Since the bed is in the back area we never here people in the hall ways.  We saw one customer with a small dog, we did not know pets were allowed or we would have brought our small Shitzu with us.  My company had our Holiday party there and the staff, food and drinks were excellent.  We would stay there again and would recommend it to all of our friends and business partners.

My family chose to stay at this hotel while attending the BCS game in Pasadena. We did not want to be located in the heart of the action but neither be so far removed as to spend all of our time driving to the events. The hotel was well situated among dining and retail establishments with easy access to ground transportation routes. We had a minor situation with the HVAC system (which we reported) but because of the full occupancy of the hotel we decided against pressing for another room as the current room met our needs for sleeping arrangements. I am quite sure under other circumstances the staff could have easily handled a request to swap rooms if we had so requested. Parking was sufficient and convenient. Breakfast was a little disappointing, seemed more institutional in

Really good breakfast. Big shopping is close. Room was very good, the only exception was the hide a bed was old, hard and very uncomfortable.  Master bed was excellent. Nice layout and good service. Fyi. Breakfast starts at 7 am on the weekends.  We weren't notified of this but just an inconvenience is all.

We stayed at this hotel for a wedding in Fullerton.  The group rate was fantastic.  The breakfast we had in the mornings and the drinks in the evenings practically made the room free.  The food was great, the room was big and clean.  I would definitely stay here again.

We had a great experience.  We are local and wanted to spend some time together away from the kids and our stay was just what we expected.  We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.  There are several Embassy Suite locations in Orange County and each is slightly different but all are very nice and have the same warm, expansive feeling.  The Anaheim location has the beautiful atrium iconic of the chain but the décor is different than Brea which gives each a distinctive feel.  The Santa Ana location was created from a pre-existing building and is the most attractive from the outside especially and not the usual exterior box look of most locations.  Bigger balconies and a cool Spanish mission look with nice landscaping too.  Embassy Suites is a great value and we will be

price was excellent for the week we were there and very clean free parking and in a very clean safe area. great helpful staff all around. very convenient to all attractions, convention center and sports stadiums

The holel service was very good and the location excellent for our needs. We were attending a wedding near Brea and the hotel's location and easy to access to the shops at the mall came in very handy. Our breakfast was very good and the evening reception was appreciated.

Summary Heading: Unmitigated external room noise and poorly maintained room carpet
Summary: Excessive external room noise - poor insulation - located next to stairs with teens running up and down stairs after hours - hotel staff did not respond to complaint.  Carpet was badly stained and should have been replaced.  Hotel staff was unresponsive upon complaint.

Hotel suite was very spacious and clean. The complimentary breakfast could be improved, but overall, a very good hotel. Will return when opportunity arises. This hotel was right next to the Brea Mall. Can walk out your door and go shopping at any of the major stores, Including JC Penny's, Nordstrom and Macy's

This location is excellent, near the mall and other attractions.  When you walk into this Embassy Suite you walk into a WORLD of Luxury.  This Embassy Suite reminds me of the luxury hotels in Vegas minus the smoke casino.  The complimentary breakfast and evening refreshments allow you to enjoy your stay at the hotel and relax with your family.  I am super impressed by this location.  Five STAR services.

Stayed for five nights over New Years.  Very convenient for many Los Angeles area attractions.  Staff was incredibly helpful during stay.  Room was clean, even if furniture/carpet is dated and showing signs of wear.  Matress on fold-out couch was thin and not comfortable, but kids did not seem to mind.

Convenient and upscaled, safe location; can walk to the Mall right behind hotel, or across the street to Target, restaurants among other stores... Easy getting in/out to various Highways nearby... Friendly service; family loved this place!

We had just a single night stay but the hotel staff was very friendly.  The hotel was clean and well kept.  I was a little leary because it is an older hotel.  The rooms are very spacious and the two rooms make it nice to have a few others come in for a cocktail while still getting the privacy in the bedroom to finish getting ready.  No drawers or any storage space in the bathroom but the countertop had a good amount of space on it.  The rooms have a small safe & plenty of closet space.  The location is good it has easy freeway access.  You have a few restaurant choices close by because it is next to the mall.  Target & a very yummy Mediterranean restaurant right across the street that you can walk to easy.  Embassy’s generally have the breakfast buffet in the morning this hotel

Summary Heading: Me with 2 Yr old baby, forced to stay in smoking room
Summary: Even after multiple requests, beggings, forced us since "you booked via priceline and don't expect much", according to the manager on duty. He insisted no other room was available, which was a lie: I did a new booking attempt online via Hilton and rooms were available. So unethical, heartless people. My daughter has started allergic kind of reactions, already.

Excellent complimentary breakfast!  Check-in was a breeze and no problem using my Hilton Honors points.  Big shopping mall across the street.  Free drinks at the manager's reception every night.  We use it as a base for visiting family.

the hotel was nice for the price , outdated rooms, but very quiet . great free stuff with the upgraded room. Free drinks at the bar area during happy hour great idea. great location in brea, easy too walk to other places to go have fun, very safe area.

A front desk staff doesn't seem understand or know the policy of room package type of reservation.  When I asked the person, his attitude was bad and reply with "We already gave you more than what we should" ! …….. a such kind of attitude shouldn't really be working in front desk of any hotels.

Great hotel with a terrific location.  Near shopping and plenty of restaurants. Underground parking was also a plus with elevator service directly to the garage made for easy entry and exit.  Complimentary breakfast was fast and delicious with many choices.

Summary Heading: Great and convenient place to stay
Summary: I stopped at the Embassy Suites in Brea on business recently. Location was good and in walking distance to the Mall. The room was a good size and i liked that there was an extra living here, bed was very comfy! Free breakfast and wifi was a bonus and staff were very friendly.

I stayed here while in town for work.  Parking is below the hotel and is free.  Check in was fast and easy.  As a diamond member, I was upgraded to the 6th floor.  It was convenient and had a lot of places near the hotel for shopping and eating. Pros: My room was very quiet.  It seemed like I was the only person on the floor.  I didn't hear any noise. Room was clean and spacious. Cons: Internet was VERY slow.  I had work to do and eventually got my Verizon stick out and had normal speed internet.  The hotel's Wi-Fi was slower than I have ever seen anywhere. Water in the shower never got hot-lukewarm at best. It took a while to get warm-but never got hot. I might stay here again if in the area-prices for the area were very reasonable.  Overall with the internet and shower it made

We will absolutely be back to the Embassy Suites in Brea, CA.The bed was great. The staff friendly. Free, full, excellent breakfast every day, an additional living room with another TV, mico, fridge. It is also across a side street from a large lovely mall that has a large variety of places to eat and shop.

Summary Heading: Great place for family to meet !
Summary: WE HAD A GREAT TIME .  We had family over for brunch  before left to go back to Arizona . It was a good central location  for Orange County and L.A. County . The staff at check in were the best and upgraded our room .

On a recent family trip to the area we chose this hotel because of location .  The staff was most helpful and very professional.  The room was spacious and clean.  The cook to order breakfast and food bar had many options.  The hotel is located next door to the Brea Mall, the third largest in California.  There are two levels of underground parking which was also a plus.

I was working in the area and was very pleased with the accommodations at this hotel. The rooms were clean and good size. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The parking is conveniently located underneath the hotel. There is a large mall adjacent to the liter with many restaurants. I have stayed at this hotel before and would definitely stay again.

I stayed for 5 nights on business in December.  Checkin was disappointing, I was told as a diamond member they couldn't put me on the premium floor (6) since I was staying too many nights, nor would they give me access to the snack room on 6.  The room I stayed in on 5 smelled like mildew but was otherwise clean.  The atrium ceiling looks terrible, I've seen better maintained ceiling in abandoned buildings (see photo).  Overall it's a good location, but the property is starting to slip.

It was a very beauitful place to stay at. The workers there are so nice and welcoming. It is also right next to the mall, we literally walk out of the hotel to a beautiful mall. The place where it's located is surrounded by stores. Not also that, our room was roomy and spacious. I love it.

When I need to do my Christmas Shopping I stay here its right next to the Brea Mall, I shop all day with lunch breaks and wrap all night,. never have to drive around waiting for a parking spot, I m always there bright and early its the best time of the year

I stayed here with my wife while going to a friend's wedding. The hotel was very average. The room was large, like all embassy suites, but otherwise unremarkable. Our room had a musty odor that kind of annoyed me, but wasn't bad enough to complain.

Stayed here twice for business during the past year.  It's a good Embassy Suites.  Not the best Embassy Suites I've ever stayed at but certainly not the worst.  The Good: -The staff is excellent.  Great customer service. They are willing to go the extra step to ensure you have a good stay -Parking is below the hotel and seems to be safe. I experienced no issues -Breakfast/Brunch is good!  They have an omelette station that offers excellent selection of ingredients to choose from. They also have fruits, cereals and other items to choose from. Alwasy got my day off to a good start while I was here. Again, the wait staff is quite friendly and helpful. -The bar served good stiff drinks for happy hour -The rooms were good, not great but they were clean and very quiet. The only I

Everything was good. The women loved being next to a mall and the complimentary breakfast and managers reception was nice. Beds were comfortable and it is always nice being in a suite. The pool is not heated so was cold with it being November and the hot tub was not working but those were the only downsides.

After cleaning our room the maid left our door UNLOCKED, by leaving the upper latch wedged in the door. Our room was directly off the elevator. It was unlocked for at least 8 hours on Thanksgiving day. Thank God no one entered our room to steal our belongings. Not happy about this!!!

Very friendly staff. Good reception and breakfast time. Rooms could use an update and have a bit of an odor problem. A bit more pricey than some others but trying to makeup for the 'freebies'. All in all a good option

I read a number of reviews that made this hotel out to be good.  I don't know what more one could expect.  We had an excellent experience. The rooms are true suites, with separate living and sleeping areas. The review were correct about the breakfast; for a free breakfast it is fabulous.

Summary Heading: Three C's covered:  COMFORT, CLEAN & CONVENIENT
Summary: Great hotel, very comfortable, great staff, tasty breakfast, convenient to local area attractions and highway system.  A mall was literally right out the door!  Beds were very comfortable and housekeeping staff does a very good job!  only draw back was it was a little pricey but perhaps that's just california.   Will stay here again and again and again, as opportunities arise!

It was easy to make reservations and were very helpful when we needed to changed locations.  Great  location, helpful staff, good breakfast, safe underground parking.  I would be more than willing to go back again.

I want to thank from the bottom of my heart the employee who cleaned my room after I checked out. I was in town to attend my father's funeral and received personal jewlery from my father that I happened to accidentally leave in the room when I checked-out. Your employee turned in the velvet bag containing an expensive watch and heirloom gold chain to lost prevention. This wonderful person needs to be commended for their high moral values and honesty as an individual and as an employee of Embassy Suites Hotels. Your hotel will forever be our first choice when traveling. Thank you again, Tony Hernandez & Family.

Good:  Nice lobby, friendly staff.  Not good:  Parking-very tight and hard to find a spot.  Despite being a Hilton Honors Silver level, they tried to stick me in a handicap access capable room.  No thanks.  They did change my room to a king bed, right next to the elevator.  Gee thanks.  Room was clean, but in typical E.S. fashion, it looks well traveled with some wear and tear.  Bad:  Tuts Sports Bar looked like something out of my college days.  Spend a little money here folks and make it look nicer.   This pretty much made up my mind not to stay at an E.S. for a business hotel again.

I was in Brea for work related meetings. The Hotel was very accomodating and the staff were terrific.   The complimentary breakfast was exceptional.   Rooms are comfortable with one exception, the King size bed was too soft for my needs.  I used the fitness center 3 days, arrive early to find a tread mill or eliptical machine. Free weights are numerous and were available for use anytime.  Because of working late, I was unable to attend the Manager's reception within the bar.  All-in-all, this was an enjoyable stay.

Summary Heading: Very nice property - consistently great service
Summary: The Brea Embassy Suites is a very nice property, but the most exceptional feature of this location is the staff.  The high quality service they provide to their hotel guests is noticeably better than what I experience at other nice hotels.    They are not the lowest price hotel in the area, but I believe they easily offer the best value.

Love the location of this hotel and best of all, we were able to sleep well on the bed.  It was very comfortable.  The parking was easy and it was easy to get in with the luggage.  The breakfast was good and check in and out was very easy.  We got a great room next to the elevator.

this hotel was an excellent choice for our reunion many friends mentioned and agreed I would highly recommend to others reunions to use because of its location, parking, friendliness and accommodation to large groups

Stayed 2 nights during a road trip around southern California. Nice Hotel in a great location for shopping and Restaurants.You can virtually walk out of the Hotel front entrance into a Mall.Not great for some maybe but for me travelling with four Females a real bonus.They shopped while I whiled away a couple of hours watching the World Series at the Managers get together.(1730-1930 every night).First night was brilliant but the second night the Hotel was overrun by a school party who unfortunately were on our floor and made a lot of noise overnight and next morning.The Hotel when contacted did stifle the noise and were very understanding about the situation.Overall I would highly recommend with the proviso you get an early night.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites Hotel BREA CALIFORNIA, no a/c
Summary: Travelling from Connecticut, I find temperaturs in the 80's on the warm side and temps at night in the 60s also warm.  Upon arrival the phone was broken but fixed. The a/c and fan was also broken. The front desk promised a fan so that I could at least have circulation in the room, but no fan during my 2 night stay. There was rust on the drain in the tub and the fan in the bathroom was very loud.  The room was 'cheap' and included breakfast and free parking. The internet cost me $9.995 per night. I never pay for internet at other hotels I stay at....this is obviously geared more for families than the business traveler.  I stayed at the hotel 10/31-11/1.

Summary Heading: There's a Reason Why I Keep Coming Back Here
Summary: I travel a lot throughout Orange County and have stayed at several Embassy Suites.  I also do a lot of group bookings and the Embassy Suites Brea is by far my favorite location to stay at in this area.  I've done some last minute bookings and group reservations, and the staff and management at this hotel has always gone above and beyond to accommodate me.  I can't say enough about the level of service that I have always been provided here.  Very, very happy.  The location of this hotel couldn't be better-- in walking distance to restaurants, mall and grocery store.  While you may drive a few extra minutes if your destination is one of the local attractions such as Disneyland, it is absolutely worth it.

The staff was friendly and very helpful.  The hotel is in a good location, across the road from a large mall, and just far enough away from the highway to be easily accessible without the noise.  There is quite a selection of dining choices, both within walking distance and short drive. It is a great value, priced comparable to lower tier hotels (Hampton, Holiday Inn Express, Fairfield...) with better amenities.

This was our second stay at Embassy Suites Brea and we had a great stay. The hotel is conveniently located next to the expansive Brea mall and within walking distance to tons of restaurants (TGIfridays, Red Lobster, Olive Garden, the mall food court and more).   We stayed on a premium floor this trip and it was well worth the extra $10 a night. Our room was much larger than the standard room. We also had a free snack area on our premium floor that provided drinks, popcorn, candy, crackers, etc.   Our room was nice, very clean and roomy. The only downfall to this hotel is it is probably due for some remodeling and upgrades since the style, furniture and furnishings are the standard ES style for the past few decades. everything was very clean and you could tell the bathrooms had

Embassy suites hotels are always nice to stay at however this one was really nice. For those of you that have Diamond status with Hilton they something called Embassy Access which allows you to get water and some various other snacks without paying any additional fees. I thought that was a great added value service. The rooms are very nice with updated bathrroms. Each room also has Kuerig coffee makers which are really nice. If I'm in the area again I can tell you this hotel is on my top list of places to stay in the area. Plus you can't beat free cooked to order breakfast. In addition the hotel is next door to the Brea mall, 5 minute or less walk and your in the mall. There is also plenty of dining options within that same mall area. Looking for a menu with a lot of options I

Hotel is clean and attractive in a location very central to the amusement parks, malls and other attractions in Orange County.  Outstanding service by all hotel staff and an above average full breakfast spread.

Stayed here for 3 nights when visiting daughters in LA area; I was so impressed!  Rooms look recently redecorated, very spacious, clean, comfortable beds, updated bathrooms!  Room was very quiet!  Great complimentary breakfast with made to order omelets.  Embassy's signature atrium was beautifully tropical, with water features and koi fish; very peaceful.  Conveniently close to many restaurants and the Brea Mall.  I will be staying here again!

What a great hotel and super fun weekend. We had family and friends come here from all over the country for a big wedding event. This weekend will go down in history as one of the best family events ever. This hotel looks amazing and what a great location. The staff is super friendly and our family had a great time. Thank You so much!

Stayed at this place for business and really enjoyed it, would return for pleasure.  Rooms were clean, beds very comfortable (that is huge for me), Lots of room with a bedroom and living room which is standard.  Buffet breakfast was included which had a huge array of food to suit all tastes and there were complimentary cocktails at about 5:00 - 7:00.  Staff were great and ever so helpful with anything you would want.

Very nice hotel, nice part of town and safe, many restaurants within walking distance including a very large Target across street for your Starbucks fix , great easy access parking with elevator from garage to the lobby, free evening booze and food in the sports bar, free full breakfast. Well worth every dollar for the stay!

Just a excellent facility for our reunion and I would recommend we would have our next event there. The service, employees and outlay of the facilities were very instrumental to our reunion being so successful.

Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff! Check out Chef Z's excellent offerings and say "Hi" to Justin in the bar! If you are having any sort of event - the banquet staff here is superb! Definitely one of my favorite hotels!

Dirty, poor customer service, asked for linens for sofa bed and was told there were none available and they didn't know what to tell me. Furniture grimy. Linens in bathroom had hair all over them, sink in bathroom would not drain, on and on and on.
Manager Response: It is with great disappointment that I read through the feedback you have kindly taken the time to post here. I would like to extend my apologies that your experience at the hotel has fallen short of your expectations and our goals. We value you as a guest, and I am troubled to know that your recent visit did not deliver a positive experience for you , as we intend to provide for each of our guests.   At Embassy Suites Brea, we aim to instill the highest levels of service and professionalism in each of our employees, as we continuously strive to exceed guests’ expectations. When we regretfully miss the target, I understand that we can only improve with thoughtful input from our guests, and I want to thank you for providing your comments. I assure you I have taken the time to discuss your feedback with our management team, so we may improve our overall guest experience.   Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect, and hope that we will have the opportunity to regain your trust and confidence.  Thank you again for taking the time to share your candid feedback.

Summary Heading: Excellent Experience at Embassy Suites - Brea
Summary: This facility has excellent service.  The staff is top notch and will go out of their way to help whenever possible. They even address their guests by name. It's a very comfortable hotel with great breakfast and happy hour. The hotel is very quiet and clean.

It was the best place and the room was great, it was just beautiful, scenery, landscape, pool , liked it all. The surrounding area was great for walking around and shopping. Loved the food at breakfast everything was great and the omelet was fresh.

Breakfast was good, but prefers location on Anaheim by disneyland. A/C in the room worked in the living room. Water pump in the pool was out. Therefore water was cold and dirty. This are little issues that could be fixed as I have stayed at many other Embassy suites and never encountered this issue before.

Summary Heading: Very good location and friendly staff
Summary: I stayed here this past week for a conference that was taking place at the hotel.  You cannot beat the location, adjacent to the large Brea Mall, with many eating options within walking distance, less than a mile from the charming downtown area of Brea, and close to all the attractions for which Orange County is famous.  The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was very good, which is typical for Embassy Suites.  I would have rated 5 stars but for 2 things:  The outdoor pool/spa area was very dark at night, and the 2-bed rooms have double beds, not queens. Really?  Double beds are VERY SMALL!!  I didn't know there were any hotels of this class that did not have queens in their 2-bed rooms.  Other than that, I was very satisfied with all aspects of our

I don't think I will stay anywhere else in what ever city I am in. I love Embassy Suites Hotels. Staff Friendly, Room very clean and had everything we needed. Breakfast was fantastic and we enjoyed the evening reception.  We will stay here again.  Chuck & Cori

Summary Heading: An excellent oasis during a time of sadness
Summary: I came to your Hotel to have a home base while attending my dear friend's funeral.  You provided a home town feel, the staff was helpful and pleasant. The breakfast each morning was such a treat and I appreciate everything your staff did to prepare it. Our dinner & dessert in your restaurant was truly excellent.  I never wanted to leave.  Thank you. Susan Bertaux

We had a great experience. The complimentary breakfast was great.  We also enjoyed the size and cleanliness of the room. The overall experience was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to visit Brea.

Excellent staff, nice building, hot complimentary breakfast, limited open bar with snacks at happy hour, well-appointed rooms, generally very clean and well-supplied with accessories.  The non-smoking room had been a smoking room at some time and not adequately refurbished.  So the room stunk of stale tobacco smoke and was very musty.

Quick trip to a family wedding.  The hotel was clean and welcoming with a great location.  I think there is some remodeling going on (or there should be).  Otherwise, great experience.  Breakfast was good but the scrambled eggs were a bit cold.  Nice to have a good full meal without any lines.  Could not access wireless without paying which was supposed to be part of the premium room.

Great place, family friendly, great Egyptian décor and lots of koi fish in the courtyard.  Convenient breakfast bar and nice bar/grill especially for appetizers/beer.  Nice suite especially for bringing along the kids.

Summary Heading: Odd Decor But a Good Night's Sleep & Breakfast
Summary: So be prepared for a date with King Tut!  The lobby and dining area decor are Egyptian themed.  A bit odd but OK! I found the hotel clean and the staff very helpful.  The bed was great!  We stayed an extra day and were accommodated although they were sold out.  The room was updated and had a coffee maker.   The free breakfast was plentiful with a good selection.  The staff was a little harried in the a.m.  Underground, free parking.   Swimming pool and workout room.   The hotel is located in a neat area, close to shops, etc.  Easy to find and get around.

I guess this place needs soem soul searching. They have Trip Advisor Certificate at their reception however our experience was quite different than other many Embassy suites. Furniture, housekeeping, what is Premium at 6th floor, internet issues and the list keeps going.

The hotel is nicely situated directly across from the Brea Mall and down the street from the beautiful Brea downtown. Minutes from great food and shopping. The hotel hosts a free continental breakfast & a nightly "manager's reception" from 5:30-7:30, which is basically a free happy hour.The lobby was clean but dated as were the rooms.  At first look, the room looks very nice but mine smelled of stale cigarettes eventhough it was supposed to be a non-smoking room

My room was great, super comfortable and cozy place to stay. the hotel is just beautiful i love it.  A very quite and just plain great experience over all.  Close to shops, Grocery and near many other great locations. the Service is wonderful the hotel staff is friendly. Slept like a baby.i will for sure return to this location for my next visit.

Summary Heading: Mediocre - overpriced for an average hotel
Summary: Not a great hotel...overpriced and rooms are just in average condition. Bathrooms are tiny. The breakfast buffet was in need of attention... Not very appetizing especially on some of their busier days. It seems like this hotel is understaffed in all areas.
Manager Response: Washington100,  I’m very sorry to hear that you did not have a pleasant experience at our hotel. Guest satisfaction is extremely important to us and we apologize for letting you down. I will be sure to keep your feedback in mind as we're always working to improve our overall guest experience. I thank you for your review and I really hope you'll give us a second chance if your travels bring you back to our area.

Summary: The hotel is nicely situated directly across from the Brea Mall and down the street from the beautiful Brea downtown. Minutes from great food and shopping.  The hotel hosts a free continental breakfast & a nightly "manager's reception" from 5:30-7:30, which is basically a free happy hour.   The hallways are slightly strange with inward facing (hallway) windows that give it the feel of being in a motel with external doors.  Very odd in a nicer hotel. The suites themselves are pretty nice with a full sitting room.  Unfortunately, my front room had a strange odor, like wet carpet but the bedroom itself was nice.   All in all, a nice trip for a business trip!

Summary Heading: Come for the breakfast but not the couch/bed
Summary: **Minor Problem** The toilet ran for most of the day until I went jiggled the knob to get it to stop. Not a big deal, I just don't think a hotel guest should have to do that. ***MAJOR PROBLEM*** the couch bed was IMPORTANT to our stay because we have 2 children. The couch was broken, it had a major dip in the middle that made our legs meet our chest if you tried to lay on it. The pull out bed was even worse. The mattress was old and had NO cushion. The springs came right threw. There was no way anyone could sleep on it. We spent the next 3 night sleeping as a family in the 1 king size bed.  **IRRITATING** this problem actually has me looking for "FREE WIFI" when planning our next trip. Not only do I think that charging your guest an additional $9.95 for WIFI is a rip off but PER

It is the second time we choice this hotel. This time my daughter came with us so we need a living rome for our family.  Oversea vacation always brings time jack so when my daughter couldn't sleep in midnight, I can watch TV with her in living room's sofa bed and my husband could sleep in bedroom.  The breakfast buffer was great and the restaurant was beautiful(my daughter likes the Koi in the pond) .  The shopping mall was just outside and it's a great continent for us to buy gift and every thing we needed.  And Disney Land is also nearby（10 minutes by car)...good hotel !  Only the pool was not clean.... 建议家庭出游洛杉矶可以选择住这家酒店。是套房所以晚上倒时差睡不着可以在外间看电视不吵到别人睡觉。很大的shopping

This is a nice property convenient to business and education facilities in the Brea/Fullerton area.  Breakfast and managers reception were a plus.  Custom made omelettes. Rooms are average.  Two room suites give extra space.  Across the street from a shopping center.

This hotel has friendly staff, great service, and is a very nice hotel to stay in! The beds are heavenly to sleep in and the complimentary drinks and free breakfast is a nice touch to your entire stay!

My son wanted to stay in a hotel, swim in a pool and eat food in the room just like the TV show,  Suite Life of Zack and Cody...and wanted to have his friends with him and recreate his own version of the Suite Life! This was the perfect place to do it! This was completely worth the price!!!!

Where do I start? This was an amazing experience! The hotel is beautiful. The room was more like a timeshare. The bed was supremely comfortable. The free breakfast was great. All this and I got a killer deal from Priceline! I highly recommend this hotel, even at full price.

2nd visit to an Embassy Suites in the area and second cockroach seen. At least this one was dead. Furnishings in room are out dated and need repair (makeup mirror falling off wall as well as the curtains in the living area. No place to hang your towels after using them and hot water faucet not working in one of the sinks and this was the Penthouse Suite.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and reviewing our hotel! Please accept my apologies for your experience during your stay. These items will be discussed with our staff, and we will work to correct them going forward. Our goal is always to provide the best, most accommodating service possible, and I regret that we failed to do so in your case. I hope you'll come back and give our hotel a second chance if your travels bring you back to our area. Thank you for your review.

Summary: This hotel is beautiful to see, but the service does not match that of other Embassy Suites.  Our reunion had about 47 room including the ballroom and the front desk was very helpful.  The event area was fine, but the meals we sampled prior to selecting our buffet menu were far superior to what was actually served.  The room service left much to be desired.  Rooms were not cleaned in a timely manner and clean towels were not left.  Cups and coffee supplies were not refreshed.  The complementry breakfasts were excellant, but the coffee urns were not refilled in a timely manner.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  It is with great disappointment that I read through the feedback you have kindly taken the time to post here. I would like to extend my apologies that your experience at the hotel has fallen short of your expectations and our goals. We value you as a return guest, and I am troubled to know that your recent visit did not deliver a positive experience for you and your family, as we intend to provide for each of our guests.   At Embassy Suites Brea, we aim to instill the highest levels of service and professionalism in each of our employees, as we continuously strive to exceed guests’ expectations. When we regretfully miss the target, I understand that we can only improve with thoughtful input from our guests, and I want to thank you for providing your detailed comments. I assure you I have taken the time to discuss your feedback with our management team, so we may improve our overall guest experience.   Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect, and hope that we will have the opportunity to regain your trust and confidence. Thank you again for taking the time to share your candid feedback.

Summary Heading: Why stay in Anaheim when you can stay here!
Summary: This hotel is awesome! I stayed in a penthouse suite (only a few dollars more and totally worth it). The room was lovely (if done in the kitschy Egyptian style) the bed awesome and the shower huge. Room a/c was so cold I turned it off for awhile. The hotel is like a large square with an atrium and koi pond in the middle on the lobby level. As I wandered around there were framed pictures of art about Egypt drawn by children (adorable) and the staff was friendly. The breakfast buffet was comprehensive (including an 'omelet cooked to order' bar.  There is Egyptian 'art' liberally sprinkled about but it doesn't detract from the niceness of the area, and indeed, adds a bit of interest to what could be otherwise a cookie cutter hotel. Kids will love it-expect to take pics with the

Air conditioning did not work and sofa bed had numerous broken springs and it was too late (when we discovered the problem) to have someone come and fix it.  We had already unpacked and settled in.  They offered to give us a new room.  What!  pack up every thing at 11PM and change rooms.  No, just fix the bed.  Sorry, maintenance man went home and they cannot get him back.   Very poor, very poor

Summary Heading: Nice hotel.  Good choice if visiting Anaheim.
Summary: I stayed here last week for 3 days.  It is a very nice property.  Room cleanliness is good and the building is kept up well.  I didnt have much interaction with the staff but the clerk who checked me in was nice and very professional.  The free full breakfast is outstanding.  The cook who made the omelets made one of the best I've ever had.  The outdoor is pool is nice too.  The location might be the best thing about staying here.  You are near a huge indoor mall and right across the street is a plaza with a Target in case you want to stock up on snacks/drinks.  Restaurants choices are all over the place near by.  Disneyland is a convenient 10-15 minute drive away.  LA is a bit farther (anywhere between 25-50 mins depending on traffic) but I didnt mind the drive really....I

Summary Heading: Good choice if you're in the Brea area
Summary: This review is being generated after my third stay at the Embassy Suites Brea location.  For starters, this location is very convenient for me when I’m on business travel (working in nearby Fullerton).  The hotel is surrounded by everything a traveler might want; there is a shopping center across the street, a mall behind the hotel, food choices galore and plenty of things to do in the general vicinity.  I suspect it is for that reason that this hotel gets booked to capacity quite often and you have to do some thinking ahead to secure a room.  The layout of this ES is similar to most other ES.  This particular hotel has 7 floors. There is a manager’s reception nightly (7 days a week) from 5:30 to 7:00 which offers light snacks and well-brand drinks. Breakfast is served during

This is a Very nice Embassy. The area it is in would be a nice place to just spend a day there=. There was a mall and a bit of adown town area near by.   The price was really good the staff was too.  They have a good pool to swim laps in and the Jacuzzi was pretty big.  Drinks were good and bartender nice.  My favorite part of the whole experiance was in there is a parking garage below the hotel. When  the elevator (glass) went from the bland garage up to where the hotel was the kids went crazy. They had culture shock. It was fun.

This is the 2nd time that we have stayed at this particular Embassy Suites. Good location and good value if you factor in complimentary breakfast buffet and evening reception. Always nice to have separate living area which is good to entertain a group of up to 10 adults. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Overall the hotel was clean and friendly. Breakfast was good, but crowded. The swimming pool appeared clean in the day light but when the underwater nightlights came on you can really see how filthy the water is. we never got to use the pool.

We had to be in Brea for business (otherwise, why would anyone go to Brea?) and have stayed at the Embassy Suites many times.  Rooms are large (I could do without the King Tut theme) and clean, but the living area of the suite is dark because it is on the interior of the hotel.  The desk clerk was prepared to make us wait until 3 PM for check-in (until her colleague came over and apologized, saying there actually was a room ready for us).  The first room they gave us was outside a giant a/c generating unit parked on the street below.  So we asked to be moved and had better luck with the second room they offered us.  Brea is a bland, mall-ridden town in inland Orange County, and we had to try really hard to find interesting things to do.  Fortunately, the mall across the street

Summary Heading: Good Hotel Location for Area Attractions...
Summary: We always like staying in Embassy Suite hotels because we know what to expect and like the expanded room accommodations. This one is located close to Disney and other attractions. The staff was very accommodating, however the first room we were given had a bad odor. We had asked for non-smoking, but this room had at one time been a smoking room. They were great however and the next day gave us another room, which was better. We were sitting in the living room area and clearly noticed a bunch of crud under the TV credenza on our last day, which didn't give us a good feeling about the thoroughness of  the cleaning...:(

The hotel was very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean and roomy. Everything was nearby, especially the mall being adjacent to the hotel. Enjoyed the great complimentary breakfast every morning. Will definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Embassy Suites Brea for 10 nights in late June and early July.  Our room was nice and clean.  The housekeeping staff was very helpful and attentive.  The front desk staff was very accomodating as well. Breakfast was great with many options. The property is well maintained and the pool area and gym are great. Our king size bed was very comfortable. The sofa sleeper was ok for our kids but I don't think an adult would find it comfortable. Parking is available but becomes challenging on weekends especially when coming back late in the evening.  The hotel is in a great area that offers many conveniences such as the Brea Mall, Target and many restaurants within walking or a short driving distance; downtown Brea offers nice eating options as well.  We spent an

Overall Embassy Suites are among the most comfortable hotels in their class - and offer the best value for the money. The Brea property is exceptional, though. The layout conforms to the typical Embassy blueprint but this hotel adds an ancient Egypt theme which is followed throughout the building and adds a fun theme park quality, which is appropriate considering a lot of families use this hotel as a base for a Disney vacation. I was impressed with every staff member I met but especially Roy at the front desk who demonstrated outstanding customer service with his quick resolution of a minor problem. The hotel is located in an ideal spot for tourists, with a major upscale shopping mall and dozens of family restaurants within walking distance. For business or pleasure in Orange

Summary Heading: Stayed two nights for daughter's wedding
Summary: The accommodations (we had a suite) were excellent.  Clean and comfortable bed (pull out couch bed not so much). Complimentary breakfast was delicious and plentiful.    Daughter and new son in law stayed in Penthouse which was BEAUTIFUL!    We'd definitely stay there again!

I arrived late at the hotel, but still was given an amazing room on the seventh floor. It was the Executive/Penthouse Suite! It was like staying at home. Once you enter the room, you will need to walk up a flight of stairs, but once your upstairs, the place shined with all the necessities one needs. It has a king size bed with a full bathtub, glass shower, a minibar with frig and microwave, a couch allowing one to sit and watch shows off their 32 inch TV. The bathroom has two wash basins with amazing floor tiles. The shower is built with tile walls. The view outside the balcony is stunning allowing views from three different vantage points.  Morning offers a full breakfast assortment of goodies. One can place to order omelets with a variety of choices, Belgium waffles made to

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites No. Orange County, Ca.
Summary: Embassy Suites is always a wonderful stay it includes a full cooked to order breakfast and cocktail reception daily. This location in Downtown Brea  which is full of quaint  restaurants and shopping. This location is also very convenient  to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Worst Hilton chain hotel I ever stayed
Summary: We were given the worst room in the entire hotel even though we booked it more than 3 months in advance. It was next to a conference room, an elevator, and above the laundry room, a noisy blower motor outside running 24 hours. Our entire view was the back of a shopping mall's parking lot.  The toilet paper dispensers never worked. The 2nd room key failed after one day. The old sofa bed was lumpy and smelly. All the pillows, bed blankets and sheets have a sweaty smell.  As an Hhonor member, I only stay in Hilton chain hotels. The Brea Embassy Suites is by far the worst Hilton chain hotel I have experienced.   Everything was old and outdated. It needs to be renovated!!!

The hotel is located a short drive from Knott's Berry Farm and Disneyland. We chose it because of the pool, sadly it was closed for our visit.  Breakfast was good, typical ES breakfast. Nice location close to a large mall, across the street from Target.  Room was fine, but had no bath towels in it when we arrived called the front desk and they had them sent right up.  Common areas were nice.  Sofa bed not the most comfortable, but adequate.  For the price a good value, especially considering the rates of the competition located close to the theme parks.

This is a great hotel perfectly located in Brea.  The staff are welcoming, professional and attentive to their guests needs. Gives the hotel a five-star feeling from the moment you check-in.  The spacious rooms are especially quiet so you can enjoy a great night's sleep.  The fitness center is well equipped and twice the size of most hotel facilties.  Another nice feature is the free garage parking.   Our company uses this property frequently for employees visitng our Brea office and the feedback is consistently good. You won't be disappointed.

Summary Heading: mold and mildew smell in penthouse
Summary: I had the last room which happened to be the penthouse.  It smelled like mildew/mold.  Furniture in bedroom torn, worn, smelled. Carpet in front of bathroom sink not meant for getting wet from sink - smelled. Breakfast was wonderful. Personnel were great.  But if u get headaches from mold go somewhere else.  Pillows all down/feathers smelled.

Summary Heading: Best property and most caring property I have ever experienced.
Summary: The title says it all. I cannot say enough to explain how much I appreciate the way my family was treated. A1 customer service. Truly Champagne taste on a beer budget for this hotel. From the moment I walked in, the stress of 3 hr traffic melted away. I will go out of my way to stay here again if every near the area. Fantastic property and staff. GREAT breakfast to!!!  Thank YOU

Convenient and complimentary breakfast especially if lots of friends and family need to gather together. Don't have to drive and park.  Friendly staff and easy shopping mall access.  Would definitely stay at Embassy Suites again.

good hotel to stay. Location is excellent close to the freeways and restaurants and malls. Parking is tight and you have to be there early to get a good parking spot. Breakfast quality was good and elaborate. The hotel is aging however the maintenence is good.

So I was looking for a hotel to stay at for one night with my girlfriend on July 4th.  I wanted to stay in Brea, and I had always wanted to stay at the Embassy Suites at the Brea Mall, so I booked a reservation on the Embassy Suites website.  As part of the reservation process, I chose the option where they will upgrade me to a "better" room if one is available, for $5.  Boy did they.  When I checked in I was informed that I was receiving the "upper penthouse" suite as a "complimentary upgrade."  I didn't ask why it was called the upper penthouse suite, but I found out as soon as I opened the door:  we had to walk up about 25 steps once inside the door to get to the suite itself.  And what a suite it was: huge dining area with large table and six chairs; huge living room area;

I stayed here on two weekends in June.  The rooms are as good as any Embassy Suites I've ever stayed in.  The staff was helpful and friendly and the full service breakfast is always awesome.  The Manager's reception in the evening was a bit lame, compared to other Embassy Suites I've stayed in over the years.  On my first stay, the drains in the bathroom were really slow.  The maintenance staff woke me up at 1:00 AM in order to check the plumbing in my room.  Apparently someone else had trouble and they were trying to fix what was broken.  I appreciate their concern but the time was a bit inconvenient.  Listened to them work in the walls for over an hour, didn't get much sleep that night.  On my second visit, the room I was originally checked into smelled awful!  I went to the

Very nice hotel.  Clean and not too far from Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm and the beaches.  Parking was free.  Nice pool.  Complimentary breakfast was outstanding.  Will stay at this property again next time we come down south.

This has got to be the easy meeting I have ever booked. The staff was wonderful and everything well like clock work and exactly as we spoke ahead of time. It is hard to find spacious affordable and still enjoy the services afforded in booking a larger conference. The facilities were wonderful, the staff available and the food was cooked to order on the buffet. We had a great meeting.

Another wonderful stay at this Embassy Suites location in Brea, this time I went with family bringing my mother-in-law and 9 month old grandson for the first time. It was a great trip to say the least, my mother-in-law is now hooked on this location and can not wait to plan another family trip here. Everyone is always happy to see you from the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff, greeting always with a smile, calling you by your name, now that takes skill. If ever you need a place to stay for any reason business or pleasure, this is the place, this is my home away from home.

This was our second time staying here at the Embassy Suites in Brea.  We were in town to attend a wedding - and a block of rooms had been set aside for the out of town guests.  We were here for three nights, had a pleasant stay, clean room and the staff, as before, were friendly and helpful.  The free internet in the business room is a huge plus - not just to print your boarding pass, but to also be able to surf a few websites.  The staff in the Sweet Spot were always accommodating and friendly.  The pool and hot tub are clean.  The inclusion of breakfast is a great touch.  So all in all - we had a good experience here.  However, many of our friends were not quite so lucky.  I'm aware that ANY hotel at any given time can have water issues/problems, however, it was quite a

A quite and a great place to stay. Home away from home.  If you want to take a break for the Disneyland experience and just want do other things while you are here, there is the Brea Mall right next door and many other shopping areas with in 2 minutes away from the hotel. This is it for us. This is our new home away from home.

Summary Heading: Overall nice stay in Penthouse Suite - Detailed Review
Summary: 23 - 25 March 2013 -  Penthouse Suite - Detailed Review  CHECK IN:  Devin was very courteous, friendly, and efficient.  The room was not ready at 3 pm, as promised by hotel policy.  We waited about 15 minutes after that, then, Devin upgraded us to a penthouse.  We thought this would be the "cat's meow," but, we were mistaken, as you will learn as you read.  He also gave us a free Internet pass for our wait.  The hotel was fully booked, as there were a few different special groups there.  LIVING ROOM:  There were many winding stairs as we entered the suite.  It had a unique, square layout with a cathedral ceiling.  There was a nice dining table with 6 chairs, one which was broken and, due to an attempt at fixing it, had nails sticking out of it.  It was nice to eat room service

Summary Heading: Gorgeous hotel that provides smoking rooms
Summary: Start to finish everything was perfect at this hotel, from desk staff to maid service.  Beautiful, clean and lavish. Place where I could smoke in my suite - unbelievable nowadays. Very comfortable mattress, but didn't try the hide-a-bed.

I booked this room just to so my new husband and I could get away on our wedding night. I was surprised by the fabulous room they gave us! They also surprised us with chilled champagne and chocolate covered strawberrys. This made our wedding night so special. Our room was outstanding and the bathroom was incredible! The breakfast in the morning was absolutely delicious!! Thank you Embassy Suites! We will be back soon!

Summary Heading: Another plus stay at the Embassy Suites
Summary: We have repeatedly stayed at the Brea Embassy Suites for the past several years.  We enjoy the privacy of the two room suite, complimentary breakfast, the spaciousness of the lobby and adjoining interior area, attractive decor and soothing pond.  Our only suggestions would be to add a make-up/shaving mirror in the bathroom and door delivery of the morning paper. We appreciated the good light for reading, rare in most hotels.

We enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites in Brea. Staff were friendly and the hotel is in a very good location.   Only issue was the internet which was slow at times and kept disconnecting.   Apart from this we enjoyed our stay the Embassy Suites and would stay there again.

We stayed one night at this hotel to start off our California vacation.  Overall, it was one of the most comfortable and enjoyable hotels we have ever stayed at.  Our room was very clean and surprisingly quiet even with all of the activities that were going on while we were there.  The bathroom and shower area were very nice.  I would have liked a little more water pressure, but it was not a problem.  There was a nice big screen TV, refrigerator, and microwave.  We found the beds to be very comfortable.  As others have stated, the wifi was somewhat sluggish, but it was not a major problem.  The included breakfast was very good and added a lot to the value of the hotel stay.  Self parking in the garage was pretty easy, although with everything so close by we mostly walked where

OUTSTANDING staff !   Excellent location & services.....simply the BEST in the area !!!!!!! From booking to stay & checkout, we were  treated  royally.   Our trip was last minute, we were banking on the Embassy Suites reputation & we were not only not disappointed...we won't stay anywhere else when in the Brea area as a result of this visit.

This hotel is located next to a great mall and across the street from a Target. There are a lot of dining choice, from fine dining to casual counter food. The hotel Staff is friendly and helpful. Even though the hotel is usually very busy on the weekends, the rooms are quiet & private. Wonderful Breakfast with made to order omelets is my husbands favorite thing.

We booked this hotel for Memorial Day weekend - through Expedia.  The photos for the hotel were very enticing!  The price was very good!  Being an Embassy Suites, we knew what to expect.  PROS: - Good price for a spacious suite - Great location within the city of Brea - Included Breakfast is always good - Gym, Pool, and Spa were nice facilities  CONS: - Suite was not what we envisioned - WiFi surcharge - Noisy hours - Small bathroom  We have stayed at several Embassy Suites before and most of them are starting to show wear and tear, along with their age.  This one in particular presented nice.  The lobby and atrium are in the center of the hotel, which gives it a nice airy atmosphere, but the noise travels through.  Their photos on all the travel sites show a suite with double

I travel frequently and this property is ideally located to shopping, restaurants, business parks and interstates.  It was a great choice for business allowing options for leisure activities if given the time.  The staff was wonderful and the hotel was very comfortable.  I highly recommend this property for business or leisure!

We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Brea for a soccer tournament over the memorial weekend. It was in a great location near the mall and had lots of dining options. The hotel was a little outdated but very clean. great breakfast and the staff was excellent. The only minor complaint the pillows in our room were horrible. They were either too thick like stuffed with cotton balls or just too flat with nothing in them. And there were no down feather options on the beds.   I  have stayed at many Embassy properties and have at least some down pillow options in the rooms. Overall was a very good and would stay there again.

After canceling a night, my per night room rate was increased.  I followed the hotels rules by canceling well in advance of 24 hours, yet the per night room rate that I originally booked at was increased.  Otherwise, my stay was very good.

The room was clean and comfortable.  We liked having two TVs.  We were a little disappointed that we had to pay for  wi fi service in the room ($9.95 every 24 hours).  The comped happy hour was nice....but the selection of beverages was limited.  The free breakfast was awesome!!  Overall a very nice experience.

We could not have picked a better place to stay than this hotel!  Friendly and efficient staff, great accommodations, convenient location to shopping and restaurants. We were here with family for a wedding and everyone loved their stay.  Each morning we enjoyed the delicious free breakfast, with made to order omelettes and/or waffles, plus lots of other good breakfast food.  The kids could then go take a swim in the beautiful pool while we relaxed nearby.  Shuttle would take us where we needed to go within a five mile radius, but we had our choice of many great places within walking distance.  The only negative comment I have is that we did not have free Internet service.  We will stay here again when we are in Southern California.

This hotel is very convenient to everything SoCal has to offer, especially great restaurants and shopping within walking distance.  On this trip we experienced a mechanical issue in our room and it was handled very well-we were offered a comparable room and help in moving.  The manager Dennis, was very accommodating and courteous.  Love the convenience of the parking garage that is quickly accessible by the very speedy elevators.  Breakfast and happy hour make this hotel an excellent value.

We enjoyed staying at this hotel which, is located right next to the Brea mall and accross the street from a very nice Target store. Hotel is surrounded by excellent shopping and dining. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The front desk staff, Jorge was exceptional at customer service. The lounge/restuarant waiter, Paul was outstanding. Food was excellent. My only hope for this hotel is that they quickly obtain an identity for their "sports" bar and restaurant. Turn up the music in the bar. Wash and paint the walls. Paint the ceiling black. Wash the windows and add a wood style plantation type shutter or shade. Cover the television cords with conduit. Take down the ceiling fans. Clean the EXIT signs. Ditch the slip covered, moveable booth seats. There is major

I stayed at this hotel last year. It is a nice hotel for business travel - love the daily breakfast.  The front desk staff if friendly and very helpful.  Bonus - great restaurants in the area and close to Disney.

Check in and check was a breeze.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  The room was great, very clean. One of the best stays I have ever had. I would recommend a stay at this Hotel to anyone, and would definetly stay at an Embassy Suites again.

Great everything. Continental breakfast is awesome. Rooms are great, service is some of the best I've ever had anywhere, well located, next to the mall and a Target. The beds are extremely comfortable.

Embassy Suites on HiltonHonors is an added bonus. Great complimentary Breakfast. Custom omlet and oatmeal with fixins' both excellent. Ice machine on every floor. Easy access to parking from lobby elevator. Hotel staff all friendly and helpful. Big mall right across the street.

Love the location, love the balcony, great breakfast, nice pool and hot tub. Love the fish pond. We upgraded to a corner suite this time which was much more spacious. Friendly staff. I think this is going to be my go-to hotel when coming to So Cal from now on.

Summary Heading: Embassy is my new favorite brand!
Summary: This hotel was great. I was worried about the location because I have never been to LA before. I wanted to see Hollywood, disneyland and universal studios. I also flew into Santa Ana. This hotel proved to be a perfect choice. Brea is a very nice area. The hotel is right next to the mall which I went to everyday! Also walked to target and Fridays from there. The beds were amazing. I should have checked what mattress or pad they used (if anyone knows please reply). I want to buy one.  I slept so good every night. Embassy is def my preference now. I used to be a huge marriott fan but you cannot beat the value of embassy and this one in particular is very nice. They have an Egypt theme which was cool. The hotel bar was great on the first night and I had a great time at the

This is a nice property in a great location.  I like the format of the Embassy Suites, with a living room and separate bedroom.  The rooms in this hotel are nicely appointed.  The furniture seems fairly new and is in good condition.  Nothing appeared to be worn or overused, and everything is well maintained.  The bed was extremely comfortable, and we are picky when it comes to good mattresses.  The bed linen was very soft and of high quality, and the towels in the bath were nice and thick.  We had breakfast both mornings in the atrium.  They serve omelets or eggs cooked to order, as well as a buffet.  There were cold items such as cereal, pastry, fruit and juice, as well as a hot buffet with scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, coffee, tea or hot chocolate.  There is also a

This property is not only well located, well appointed, and meticulously maintained, it's just a great location for a get-away.  Super service at breakfast from friendly and helpful staff in a clean dining area.  I would go out of my to stay here again.

I've stayed here several times for business trips.  I love the Embassy Suite's format with the living room and bedroom; a large television is available in each room of the unit.  The theme at this location is ancient Egypt.  The courtyard has pools with Koi.  The manager's reception each evening in the sports bar is a nice way to relax.  There is a selection of some free alcoholic beverages and snacks.  The free breakfast is nice, with omelets made to order and other hot choices.  The hotel is a very short walk across a parking lot to the mall and there is another shopping center across the street.  Lots of choices for restaurants right in the area.  I have never used the pool or the exercise facility so I cannot comment.

This hotel has become our destination of choice for LA stays - from the ornate, spacious lobby to the lush atrium filled with the music of multiple sparkling fountains, to the comfortable guest suites overlooking the interior of the hotel, its a place to just relax and hang out!  Delicious breakfast including made-to-order eggs and all the fixings.  Only downside - we had to pay for internet connection, and it was per-device.

Summary Heading: Initial quality, but some significant problems
Summary: I've stayed at this Embassy on a number of occasions, and while I really enjoy the ease of parking, location, great room design, service and interior layout it's important enough to mention the few things that I do NOT like as well, which is why I am writing yet another review of this property.  I think most guests will get their money's worth out of this place but the two glaring weaknesses I've encountered so far are as follows:    There is a $10/day rate for internet unless you are a HHonors member and even though I am, I still had to call the front desk before their system validated my membership number.  Who does this anymore?  Really?  I can go to any McDonalds or Starbucks, spend $1 on a cup of joe and get free internet there that's just as "Hi-Speed".    Secondly; and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry that you did not enjoy your most recent stay. We will take your comments regarding the internet under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. The condition of our suites is very important to us as we aim to provide guests with the best accommodations and service.  The issue that some of our rooms smelled like smoke has been addressed with our Director of Engineering and we are very sorry this led to uncomfortable stay at our hotel. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a family wedding.  It is centrally located in downtown Brea, next to the Civic Center and a major mall.  The hotel itself is very large with a huge atrium surrounded by 7 floors of rooms.  Breakfast was included in the rate and was served in the atrium.  We also saw other cocktail-style events being served there.  Because it is such a focal point, we were surprised to see the number of skylights which needed to be replaced. It looked like their protective coatings were cracked and peeling.  This gave a sense of deferred maintenance - never a good thing. The breakfasts were diverse and had something for everyone.  Our rate also included a Manager's Reception in the Sports Bar during happy hour.  We are not big drinkers, so the offerings

This location is close to shopping. The rooms are 2 rooms which is nice if you have company. I did have problems with accessing the wi-fi and I am an Honors member, so it should have been free, so that was disappointing.  The Breakfast is typically the same daily, but good overall, and plenty of food.  There is a manager's reception in the bar which is nice with light snacks. Overall this location has a great staff and the stay was good.

Summary Heading: A reasonable hotel but wi-fi a complete rip off at $9.95 per device per day!
Summary: Before you book this hotel, you might wish to check out  the price they charge for wi-fi – more later.  I have to start off by saying I’m not a fan of the standard Embassy Suites design. Seven floors of open landings and rows of solid doors with spyholes, arranged around an atrium, tends to give them the feel of a prison. Having seen a photo of the atrium laid out for a wedding, my colleague questioned; ‘Why would you want to get married in a prison?!’  Prison environment aside, the Embassy Suites, Brea isn’t a bad hotel, although it does seem somewhat anonymous and impersonal.   Suites are good size although bathrooms are small for the US. Rooms suffer from the terrible 21st century fad of low levels of lighting. Even with every available lamp turned on, they are very gloomy, a
Manager Response: Hello Andy, Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel, and we appreciate all feedback from our guest that can increase the guest experience while visiting Brea.  We’re very sorry you were unhappy with the hotel layout and lighting in the guest rooms.  i have passed on your comments to our Director of Engineering to reference as we continually work to improve our guest experience at the hotel.

Summary: My wife and I were there for a family wedding.  The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean.  Liked the complimentary on-site parking garage as well as complimentary breakfast and happy hour. Good to have HD tv that was actually broadcast in HD, unlike many places that have the tvs but don't get an HD signal. Bed/pillows were comfortable. Carpet and furnishings in room  need to be updated, and it would be nice if there wasn't a charge for Wi-fi. We would definitely recommend and would stay there again.

Us: 2 Adults and 2 Early Teens Reason We Chose: Chose this ES over our usual ES Anaheim South due to the complimentary parking (and my belief that there would be a lot less grade school ages flying around the hotel =). Really didn't want to give over another $45 (3 nights) just to park my own car.  Access: This ES is literally 15 minutes up the 57 from Disney etc...and makes for a good launching spot for LA attractions as well. Very easy access from the 57 and right next to a very large Brea Mall.  First Impression: Lobby was amazing! Looks chic and modern. Well maintained/polished. Huge Ipad on the wall for Guest to access local attractions at the Front Desk. Issue: Our room (extra sq. ft corner room on the 5th floor) was not ready at the assigned check-in time (3pm) By 3:30 we
Manager Response: Hello, Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel, and we appreciate the kind words regarding our hotel location and appearance of our lobby. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our condition of our suites. Guest comfort and safety are our top priorities and we regret you did not experience this. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

Summary: This hotel is amazing!  The food is amazing along with the hotel staff!  If you are in Brea or a near Brea you must stay in this hotel!  The Brea Mall is right next to the hotel.  The pool was very clean and nice.  Everynight from 5:30 to 7:30 free drinks and snacks in the sports bar.

Really nice hotel and like all Embassy suites, has breakfast and evening mangers cocktails included in the price of the room.   Ancient Egyptian motif throughout the hotel.  Situated next to a mall and major shopping area, which is good if you have free time or must walk to restaurants.  The rooms were large and comfortable with modern TVs (usb and hdmi ports).  No room fans that you can borrow from the hotel (I like white noise).

Great hotel.  The rooms are huge, and include a bedroom and a separate living room.  The bathroom showers are very nice, all stone, nice shelves, and very good shower pressure.  Also, the rooms are very quiet.  The fitness center is large with plenty of equipment, and there is a heated, outdoor, 25-yd lap pool.  The complimentary breakfast is awesome, and even includes plenty of fresh fruit, and omelet bar, scrambled eggs, toast, oatmeal, yogurt, etc.  The location is incredibly convenient to shopping and restaurants, and the hotel is directly adjacent to the civic center.  Great spot, great hotel.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and close to everything
Summary: I have stayed here with my family many times in the past few years and have always enjoyed the accommodations as well as the very courteous staff.  The suites are very nice and well kept as well as modern and comfortable but what makes the place an outstanding choice is the staff.  Everyone from the Manager to housekeeping, bar and restaurant make you feel valued as a guest.  The place is right beside one of the major malls in Orange County and is 15 min from Disney and Knotts.  I have recommended this Embassy Suites to colleagues and friends and they all have thanked me.  This is to thank the hard working people of the hotel for their great service and attention to detail

Usually I'm very critical of the hotels I've stayed in as a business traveler. This time I was pleasantly surprised of about everything which was better than what i expected. First, they let me check in early which really helped (normally it's 3:00, but I got in around 1:00) Next, this hotel was conveniently located to everything you need. A very nice shopping mall within 100 feet. A very good TGIF across the street and lots of other shopping and restaurants within 3-4 minutes away.  Next, the staff was very courteous and friendly with excellent customer service. The room was clean and beds very comfortable. The hotel may be a few years old but everything is modern, updated, clean and sanitary. The price I got was below the average price of other comparable hotels with similar
