Summary Heading: room not clean and smelt bad
Summary: I love the location but the last couple of times I've stayed there the room smelt horribly of old cigarettes and the bathrooms were not clean.  The toilet was filthy and I had to call housekeeping to come up and clean it.  Unfortunate because I do like this location a lot.
Manager Response: I apologize for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay, please let me assure that the way you found your room is not to our hotel standards. Housekeeping must pass an extremely thorough training period and all rooms should be fully inspected prior to new guests arrival by a housekeeping supervisor. I have spoken to the Director of Housekeeping regarding your review, and she has advised me that she will inspect the room personally, as well as speak directly with the housekeeper responsible for servicing that room.  I hope the next time you are in the Brea area you will give us a second chance to provide you with the best service possible.

Summary Heading: Great location for a business meeting
Summary: Catering staff went above and beyond to make the event experience spectacular for our guests. Very convinient location for all our guests to get to. Rooms are spacious and clean. Beds very comfortable.

Summary Heading: Clean, spacious, friendly, upscale...but you'll pay for in-room wifi
Summary: An excellent location for any activities or events in inland Orange County or southeastern LA County, with shopping and restaurants just steps away. The room and the hotel common areas are well maintained and very clean, and the king-size bed was quite comfortable. The bathroom was immaculate and the toiletries were very good quality. There is a Manager's Happy Hour in the bar, with complimentary beverages and bar snacks - a welcome end-of-day perk. Free underground parking was convenient, with an elevator large enough for lots of luggage. The breakfast buffet (included with the room) was decent, and the service was top-notch. The fitness center had new elliptical machines and treadmills, a complete array of free weights, and we had the place to ourselves.  Now the downside:

Located close to downtown Brea, right next to the Brea mall and civic center and across the street from Target. Stayed here to settle a student in to Cal-State Fullerton. Easy access to campus and shopping for dorm things. Beautiful rooms. -wi-fi is not free unless Gold+ Hilton Honors members but free in business center -love the manager's reception nightly with free drinks and snacks - gym has 2 ellipticals and 3 (?) treadmills, weights, etc. and an outdoor pool -free parking under the hotel -rooms are mostly quiet. heard muted people next door but white noise maker took care of it. very little traffic noise - great staff and clean, comfy rooms.  -there is a spa next door- Embassy Court.  -free shuttle to Disney and around the area if needed -free breakfast! Very nice. I will

Nice hotel, but I for one am tired of other people using my money, let me explain upon check in I was asked for a credit card for miscellaneous charges. I explained that I would not have any room charges, so their was not need for them to charge my card an extra $50. Which would not be returned to me for 3-4 days.....!   How many $50 charges are they collecting (using) and drawing interest on in a day or week...!  Otherwise nice location, free parking, and great breakfast....
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent experience at our Hotel. While I was pleased to hear that you enjoyed the hotel, I was sorry to hear that you were inconvenienced by the authorization processed on your credit card. I understand your frustration with having to give a credit card at check-in, even though you did not intend to have any additional charges billed to your room.  Please note, that this is a common practice throughout the hotel industry to not only provide a convenient means for our guest to charge incidentals to their room, but also as a security measure to recuperate losses for any possible damage sustained to the room during the guest’s stay.   I do apologize that you were not properly informed of the pre-authorization before your arrival at the hotel.  At the Embassy Suites, we do our best to make the customers aware of the authorization prior to their arrival at the hotel; by posting verbiage on our website above the credit card entry section when you are initially booking the reservation, on the confirmation email that is sent out after booking, and finally by posting signage at the front desk.  This authorization would only show as a pending transaction, not allowing the hotel to gain any interest during that time, and would be released by your bank/credit card company within 72 hours after departure. If there is a $50 charge that has been posted to your account, please contact me directly at the hotel so I can discuss this matter.   Thank you again, for the opportunity to respond to your concerns, and I hope to be of service to you again in the future.

Summary: I love this hotel!  It is very close to all my business needs when I am visiting Orange County. It has great shopping nearby, and great restaurants.  I will stay here every time I need to visit the Brea area.

Cannot beat for under 150$ Great location - right next to brea mall, we just walked over during the crazy Christmas shopping period without the hassles of finding mall parking.  Close to downtown brea - plenty of restaurants, movie theaters, improv Free parking in underground garage Very clean rooms, I don't think we paid for wifi too. The best part is the embassy suites breakfast for sure. Very good spread and especially the omelet station Happy hour was great too - pleasently surprised by the decent bar there Overall, a wonderful experience

This hotel is at the Brea Mall, 11 miles to Disneyland, and 2 miles to CSU Fullerton.  All the employees we met, including the front desk and people at the breakfast buffet were very friendly and helpful.  There's two levels of free underground parking.  The hotel is literally across the street from the JC Penny store at Brea Mall, which also has a Sears, Macy's, and Nordstrom.  We stayed at this location to attend a basketball game at CSU Fullerton and to be close to Disneyland.  Several High School marching bands stayed here for their visit to Disneyland.  The breakfast buffer offers cook to order omelets, pan cakes, waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, cereal, juice, and coffee.  Room are spacious, typical for ES, with two rooms, each with a flat screen TV, microwave and

Summary Heading: Above average Embassy Suites in Brea
Summary: As a frequent traveler who prefers suite hotels, I have found that the accommodations vary even within a chain like Embassy Suites.  I stayed the next night at the Embassy Suites (Arcadia) which while not unpleasant was a different experience altogether.  This Embassy was newer and had some very nice amenities not always found in Embassy Suites hotels.  The marble bathroom and shower and the upgraded living room furnishings were a nice touch.  Everything else was standard and comfortable.  The breakfast was the usual top notch and the fitness room had new (alas Precor) equipment.   Since I book partially on the location of outside fitness centers I can tell you there is a very nice 24 Hour Fitness directly across the street.  The hotel does have passes (for a fee), but I am a

Summary Heading: Great room, comfortable bed but bring your own pillow
Summary: All of the recent reviews of this hotel are spot on. We stayed Christmas Eve and the night of Christmas Day. Not sure if they were fully booked but it was very quiet both nights other than a dinner party going on in the central atrium that could not be heard at all from our room. The rooms in this hotel are quite spacious (seemed bigger even than other Embassy Suites in which we have stayed) and nicely furnished/decorated. Quality toiletries (Crabtree & Evelyn soap/lotion/etc) are provided. It was clean. The shower head was nice and high for us tall people with no hot water issues. There is plenty of free parking under the hotel. We did not take advantage of the comp breakfast but the eating area appeared to be a good size, which is often a problem in other hotels that offer

Summary Heading: Just OK - Not sure why there are so many rave reviews about the breakfast???
Summary: Just OK. Good location if you have business at the mall, other than that nothing exceptional. Breakfast was not exceptional, as other reviewers have suggested.   On both mornings I went to breakfast there we no cups, juice was empty, no bacon, and one worker (might have been more??? only saw one - but these issues never got corrected in the 30 minutes I was there)hustling to fix and fill everything for a nearly full hotel.

I stay here about 6-7 times a year and am never disappointed. The rooms are clean and spacious, the breakfast is eat above average compared to other Embassy Suites, and the location makes it an easy drive to John Wayne and Disney. Note that the bathroom can only be accessed through the master bedroom, so if you're sharing the room with kids or other adults this may be a consideration. Overall, though, a great place to stay!
Manager Response: Dear soapandco,  Thank you for your feedback about our hotel. We are so pleased to see that you choose our hotel to meet your travel needs throughout the year. Our location is definitely a wonderful benefit of our hotel and our full hot and cooked to order breakfast is a great bonus.   We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: I had booked a non smoking room but the front desk attendant stated that smoking was requested. The truth then came out that the hotel was fully booked and no non smoking available. The room stank like an ash tray. I requested a transfer or other measures to remove the smell but nothing offered. I was on a long business trip and my clothes stank like an ash tray for the duration of the trip. I understand where a hotel is fully booked and only have smoking rooms left but please do not lie to me!

Being a member of Hilton Honors we visit different Embassy Suites often.  They are usually very reliable and this one in Brea is no different.  Really friendly staff throughout the Hotel. Free ample parking and a nice Cocktail Hour and excellent Breakfast served by very friendly Mexican Staff.  Good maintencance and plenty of good Restauramts within easy walking distance. This Hotel is next to the Brea Mall.
Manager Response: Dear John8433,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are so pleased to see that we were able to accommodate the needs of you and your family during your visit to Brea. It really is wonderful to hear that our friendly staff has made an impression on your stay and we hope that you will stay with us the next time you are in town!

Summary: I really enjoyed my recent stay as the accommodations were nice and the staff was friendly!  The suite room was great with an outer room to work and the bedroom was large.  I recommended the hotel to friends while I was traveling because of the hotel's complete package for most travelers. Brea really has so much to offer, from shopping to night life in the downtown promenade, all within walking distance. Hope to return for another visit the next time I am in So Cal.
Manager Response: I would like to take the time to thank you for reviewing our hotel. I am so pleased to see that you were beyond satisfied with your experience here at the Embassy Suites in Brea. Being so close to all of the shopping and restaurants Brea has to offer is definitely a wonderful benefit of our location. Additionally, I am happy to see that while you were hesitant about being near an elevator, that the noise was not an issue at all. With our spacious two room suites, we find that guests are rarely bothered by the sound of an elevator or people passing by in the hallway. Thank you again for your response, we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: This hotel is located next to Brea mall & walking distance to many restaurants and shops..the hotel staff was friendly..hotel was clean..rooms were clean and comfortable..my only complaint is the gym..the machines were usable but needed some work done on them..
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel on Trip Advisor! We look forward to what our guests have to say about our hotel and were very pleased to see that our staff was notably friendly and our rooms met your every expectation in regards to comfort and cleanliness.   We have very recently replaced a few of the machines in our gym that were in need of some work and hope that upon your next visit to Brea, we are able to meet your every need!

Summary: Have been here for the first time in September for a business trip, and should admit the structure is wonderful. A lot of space, rooms are apartments instead, common areas are wide and there is a good choice of food for both breakfast and other meals. The structure is in the immediate vicinity of a shopping mall, so that there is also chance to spend some free time there.
Manager Response: We are so happy to see that you were pleased with your experience here at the Embassy Suites in Brea, CA. Our spacious rooms and location are just a few of the many amenities we pride ourselves in having beyond the typical business hotel. We hope that you will think of us to meet your future travel needs!

Summary Heading: Centric Location, comfortable beds, and a great breakfast!
Summary: First time staying here in Brea. There was a musty smell that hits you when you walk into the room. Everything is clean though, maybe an air freshener in the room would be a good idea. My suite was nicely appointed and was spacious. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom toiletries were of very good quality (Crab Tree & Evelyn). I really like the breakfast included, gives you a good start to the day and they have an omellet station that cranks out some pretty good eggs and French toast as well. There is the Manager's Reception in the sports bar restaurant that gives the hotel another plus. It includes beer, wine, and liquor along with some small snacks. Good Overall experience and they even took me to work intheir hotel van for free.  Will stay here again next time i'm in
Manager Response: Dear TheNicaTraveler, Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel. I was happy to see you were able to take part in our compliment breakfast and evening manager reception, this is what brings our guest back to us. We appreciate the feedback and hope you will stay with us again soon!

Summary: The hotel is located in downtown Brea.  It is near shopping mall, movie theater, and a lot of restaurants to choose.  It is also close to freeway 57, half an hour from Orange County airport.  The room is small but very nice.  I love their window curtain very elegant.  Price is not too bad $166 a night.  Will definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: KseiTrotter, Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel. We are in a perfect location for shoppers, walking distance to the Brea mall and one mile from downtown Brea . We appreciate the feedback and hope you will stay with us again soon!

Summary Heading: Lovely for a last minute reservation
Summary: My family and I stayed here when we had a blackout of at our house one evening. It is a beautiful hotel very clean and a friendly staff I was very impressed for something that was last minute booking. Great breakfast! It was a short stay but loved it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. We are glad to see that we were able to accommodate you during the untimely power outage at your home, even on such short notice; and that our staff and breakfast made your stay that much more enjoyable. We hope that you will think of us to meet your future travel needs!

Summary: The hotel is very nice, and the room I stayed in was huge and i will return and the price is great, with free breakfast. I stayed there over night because i went to a baseball game. Between 5-7 there is free drinks and also a really great breakfast in the morning. This hotel has free parking.

Me and my girlfriend stayed here for two weeks. We arrived on September 1 and check in was very fast. I didn't note the name of the gentleman who checked us in, but he was very quick and thorough, going through everything.  We was located on the 7th Floor - the "Hilton Hhonors VIP" top floor. I'm not sure if we was upgraded to this level, but it was great. Nice view overlooking the mountains. We requested a pool view, but due to the number of events taking place, these were taken. Perhaps we was upgraded seeing as the pool view was unavailable. Either way, we was very happy with what we were given.  The breakfast was complimentary which included a variety of cereals, cakes, hot food, and all the usual beverages you'd expect. The cooked to order omelettes were superb and staff

My husband and I were in Brea, visiting family, and attending a memorial service.  The hotel was clean, comfortable, the staff friendly and courteous.  The salt water pool was kept a bit warm, but the hot tub was luxurious.  The breakfast was wonderful - omelets made to order.  Parking was never a problem in the underground parking lot.  The room was spacious, nice size shower and nice brand new TV's.  Happy hour a plus!

This is the first time that my wife and I stayed in a Embassy Hotel.  I waoud just like to say that we thought it was great.  Clean, and everyone there was very nice and polite.  We like it so much that whean we do travel, we will always sta at a Embassy Suites Hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Patrick T , Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel. One of the great things about Embassy Suties is there are over 200 of them, so I'm sure you will find one the next time you travel. We appreciate the feedback and hope you will stay with us again soon!

Summary: Had to attend a funeral in nearby Whittier,Ca and stayed 3 nights at this Embassy Suite in Brea.As previously noted by other reviewers,this Embassy is situated next to a shopping mall and is close to city hall.All the staff were very nice and my wife was especially pleased with their outdoor pool.Her niece is an aerobic instructor and was also pleased with the exercise facility near the pool.Just be aware that the scale in that room may not be too accurate.We did not attend any of the functions but noticed a lot of people at the manager's reception in the afternoon.We really appreciated the breakfast and the staff was most accommodating even when a big tour group stayed there.We had a faulty coffee maker in our room and after notifying the front desk,we immediately received a

The hotel is located next a great shopping center and there are restaurants, etc within walking distance. I like to stay at Embassy Suites for their managers reception and breakfast. This hotel fell short in these two areas. Managers reception was  cheaply done, as was breakfast.

PRO'S: lotsa COmmercial AREA AROUND, EVEN bevmo and target, AS well as a mall, pool NICE, breakfast WAS AS EXPecTED, ROOM typical, egyptian setting FINE, SPORTS BAR LIKED. IN RooM AMENITIES fullfilling, CHECK OUT process, staff  CONS: JACUZZI was broken in POOL AREA, WHEN we got back from DISNEYLAND AROUND 0100, NO ONE AT front desk NEUTRAL: THOUGHT the street it was ON, WAS A FREEWAY EXIT.  OVERALL, I reallyenjoyed this PLACE!  EVEN though it may be A LIL FURTHER than other hotels AROUND DISNEY, I  saw a good rate AND jumped on IT.  I  would stay here AGAIN.
Manager Response: Dear oneeddy1  , Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel. Our location is one of the reasons our guest love it here. As for the jacuzzi i will make sure our engineering team is aware of the issue.  We appreciate the feedback and hope you will stay with us again soon!

Summary: First time stay at the Embassy Suites.  The location is great, about 30-35 mins away from LAX without traffic.  The hotel is located next to a mall, so everything is within 5-10 mins walking distance. Stay at the hotel was very good.  Breakfast was definately worth extra $$$.  The manager's Afternoon specials in the lounge were especially great.  The rooms are very accomodating and comfortable.  My only gripe was with the toilet :)  The lid would not stay up and the toilet would make noise at night (probably a leaky valve or something).  Other than that, this is a very good hotel.
Manager Response: Dear TravelingPekniks , Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel. I was happy to see you were able to take part in our full cook to order breakfast and managers reception. As for the maintenance issue my engineering team will be able to fix that.  We appreciate the feedback and hope you will stay with us again soon!

Summary: Huge rooms, decent amenities.  Cooked to order breakfast at the omelette bar.  Staff tried hard to accommodate us and went out of their way to make things right.  This was true of the front desk, the busboys at breakfast, and the staff in the sports bar who set us up with an off-the-menu to-go meal for our grandchild.  Will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear WorldD_TRaveler789, Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel. Customer service is what we are all about. We appreciate the feedback and hope you will stay with us again soon!

Summary Heading: Great Value, Big Rooms, Breakfast Included
Summary: I enjoyed this hotel.  Very large rooms, suites actually.  Flat screen TV, a free drink in the lounge between 5 & 7 with light appetizers.  Free breakfast in the morning, including an omelet bar.  I liked the pillows so much I tried to buy some, but the head of purchasing never called me back.  My only complaint was the pool hours, kids running around jumping in the pool until late.  Though as soon as the pool closed, they left so at least they followed the rules.  I would go back for business or personal.  They do have free parking as well which is a plus.  The hotel was clean and the staff I had interaction with were friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: To Our Valued Guest,  First and foremost, we would like to thank you for your positive feedback! We are excited to hear about your pleasant stay with us.  Summer happens to be our busiest season with many diverse travelers; and with our many great amenities, it is no wonder why we are so popular with families. However, we did take note of your comments and mentioned it to our security staff. We want you to get a good night’s rest during your stay. With embassysuitesathome.com, you can get a good night’s rest at home as well. On this website, you can find all of the comfortable amenities featured here at Embassy Suites, including pillows, towels, and even mattresses. If you have any questions or need assistance with making a reservation, please do not hesitate to call. We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel in a fabulous location!
Summary: As a family of five, we often stay at Embassy Suites and are usually very pleased with this chain. Embassy Suites in Brea is one of the best. We traveled for our faughters softball tournament and  chose this hotel because of the suites, full breakfast, happy hour, location and convenience to where the tournament was.   The location is ideal, being just steps from the Brea mall and across the street from a large shopping center that has restaurants, Target, Bevmo and more.  The hotel parking was very convenient in the basement of the hotel with elevators that go up to the rooms. The rooms are up to date with nice furnishings and comfortable beds. We enjoyed the full breakfast with extras like fluffy blueberry pancakes, a waffle station as well as te standard made to order
Manager Response: Hello Ranchinmom,  Thank you for the kind words about the hotel and the new sports bar - The Sweet Spot.    Having a great breakfast is such a wonderful way to start each day, we are glad you enjoyed the blueberry pancakes, waffle station and the made to order omelets.   See you again the next time your daughter has a game in the area.

Summary: Pros - beautiful lobby w/Egyptian theme; nice large pool; great buffet breakfast and manager's reception; great location since walking distance to mall where one have access to restaurants, chain stores and big department stores.  Recommended for families.
Manager Response: Dear littleones28,  Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel.  We appreciate the feedback and hope you will stay with use again soon!

Summary Heading: Room Cleaning was Non-existent or Sub-par
Summary: Stayed during December 2011.  After the first day, room cleaning left a broom in our room.  3 day, room cleaning never even bothered to clean our room?  I did not care for the cheap shower heads in our room also.
Manager Response: Dear MG1a, Thank you for your feedback. I was distressed to hear of the issues that occurred with our housekeeping not servicing your room properly.  I will be investigating this issue further and informing our Director of Housekeeping to avoid any further incidents. We are constantly looking for ways to improve our guest’s experience and the quality of our hotel. The issue you mentioned with our showerheads will be considered for possible upgrades. Once again, we appreciate your feedback and will be taking steps to resolve the issues you mentioned.

Summary: I recently booked a night at the Embassy Suites in Brea as a short swim day for my kids. I used the Hilton Honors option of points and cash so that I spent only $60 and used half the usual necessary points to enjoy a nice day with the family. The nice thing about using points is that you can have two adults and up to four children and still pay the same amount of cash and points as having only one adult stay in the room. Thus, I asked my friend and her two kids to come along and we were able to swim, have a wonderful time at the cocktail hour, AND best of all, enjoy a delicious full breakfast with our children. The pool area is small, but lush and nicely shaded. I know most people like full sun, but I prefer sitting in the shade. We ordered lunch from their restaurant Tuts,
Manager Response: Dear jek134, Thank you for your wonderful feedback. We are very pleased to hear that we are your choice for your local getaway. It is also great to hear how helpful the Hilton Honors reward system is for you. Thank you for choosing to stay with us for your swim days! We hope you come back soon- we’ll have a cup of fish food waiting for your kids.

Summary: I stayed in this hotel a few times over the last years and witnessed it's deterioration. Now it simply very very old and filthy. Carpet, furniture, bath curtain and walls are stained. Room smells very bad. Never again for me.

Stayed night of April 12, 2012, with my wife and six-year-old.  Arrive 9:30 PM and departed 10 AM next morning, so no free happy hour, but did enjoy their complimentary breakfast buffet.  I like Embassy Suites because of the extra space, separate bedroom, and big free breakfast.  Embassy Suites Brea was basically exactly what I expected from an Embassy Suites.  Room was large and clean and staff was very friendly.  Small business center allows for quick free Internet access.  I get the feeling business has not been great at this location – reasonable amount of deferred maintenance visible, but the rooms and important things seemed in very good condition.  Finally, Embassy Suites has the best in room coffee of any hotel I have ever stayed at – the machine delivers individual cups

We booked into this hotel after a problem of our doing with a booking ay Embassy North Anaheim which cost us a nights fee. Our room was fine and the location was in an upmarket area of Orange County so we thought all was well. Upon arrival we saw a large contingent of teenage cheerleaders who had some convention on the next day. We had stayed at the Embassy suites at LAX the night before and encountered another group of girls in town for the same reason. They were well behaved and presented no problems. The group in Brea were another matter !. The running around in groups of 3 or 4 at a time between rooms started at 10 oclock when they should have all been in  bed. There was yelling and screaming outside our door which prompted me to call reception and complain. Absolutely

My husband & I stayed at the Embassy Suites in Brea for 12 days while we visited family.  After a swift & friendly check-in, we were assigned a suite on the 7th floor (top floor) directly across from 1 of the 2 elevators.  The hotel has 2 levels of free underground parking so we were able to park our rental car near the elevator closest to our room.  Our room had a king-sized bed which was quite confortable; 2 flat screen TV's - one on the bedroom, one in the living room; a 2-seater couch with a pullout bed; a mini-fridge; lots of drawer space and closet space to hang clothes; and a medium-sized bathroom.  Our room was serviced each day; the hotel provided 3 bath towels in addition to hand towels and face towels, plus making the bed & emptying the trash bins. Black-out curtains
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking time to submit a review of the hotel - we always like to hear the experiences of our guests.  Each year March is a very busy student travel month with spring break, conventions and event at both the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland.  We apologize for any noise issues you experience and I have passed along your review to our Director of Guest Services for further review.  Also as of May 1st, the 37" flat screen TVs in all of the rooms have gone to an HD signal and added over 30+ channels.  We hope the next time you travel brings you to Orange County you will stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Access to everything, great customer service
Summary: Stayed for three nights on a business trip and wish I had more time to spare.  The property is adjacent to a great mall and surrounded by other retail and so many restaurants.  But the real plus were the spotless rooms and incredibly helpful staff.

The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. My husband & I came down for breakfast about 10 minutes too late--almost everything was cleaned and put away. Maria & Rosa both smiled and provided what they could so we could eat breakfast. That's service! Our room was clean, comfortable and they have great pillows. Fitness room, a pool, lots of parking and easy access to restaurants and shopping added joy to our stay.

Summary Heading: Loyal Customer at this property, but needs a serious updating
Summary: I have been staying at the Embassy Suites in Brea for well over 10 years and counting. Things I love.   Location Friendly Staff Good Breakfast Good Gym and near 24 Hour Fitness Great Parking Good places to eat within walking distance  Things I hate: Dated rooms - Old TVs Bathrooms sometimes smell of urine Beds are not the best Linens need updating Never ever have been given any perk for staying here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on the hotel.  During February 2012 we recieved all new 37" flat screen TVs and completed updates to the exterior signage. During the last part of 2011 we also recieved all new pool furniture and a new bedding package, which included new duvets and covers.  Please let me know the next time you stay with us and let me know if you've seen an improvement.  Sincerely, Lisa Kotlar Director of Sales

Summary: The roooms were nice and clean. We stayed on the fifth floor. the hotel was very busy that weekend but staff had all under control. Morning cook to order breakfast was good. Right next door from the brea mall. Walking to dining.

I'm not the biggest fan of the ES chain, but this stay was different. There was not loud atrium echo and the room was very classy!  Nice furniture and very convenient walking distance to shops and restaurants. Highly recommended.

We stayed here with a group of 50 high school kids and 8 chaperones. The set-up at this hotel was perfect for us. All of the corridors are open to the central, indoor corridor. So it was easy to keep an eye on all of the kids' rooms. In the morning, the complimentary, hot breakfast was fast and a great way to ensure all of the kids started each day with a good meal. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The rooms include hideaway couches allowing us to put more kids in each room, so this was an economical choice as well.
The hotel is in a great location....the quality of the room service food is fantastic.  Try the French Onion Soup!

JUST simply GREAT!  I stayed 3 years in a row and still adore the place... Brea Mall is next to it...  Great Breakfast... I just love the staff... Thank you!  P.S.  Please try to use eco friendly cleaning solutions as I do smell "Lysol" or some air freshener... NO Fabreeze... Thank you.

Stayed four nights 1/5 - 1/8/12  Arrived early (12:30) check in time was posted 3pm.  No problem, checked us right in.   Room was nice, although it would be nice if the cleaning staff sprayed with Lysol as they leave the room.  All hotel rooms smell a bit stuffy.  Three trash cans - yeah.  I guess all hotels buy their trash cans from the same itty bitty trash can vendor.  Rooms were very, very dark when all shadew were drawn - I should take a traveling nite light.  Bathroom roomy, and the shower had good size shelfs in them, providing easy access for shampoo, soap, etc.   Shower would not drain, service was there within minutes of our call.   Staff was outstanding; check in, breakfast area, happy hour, cleaning.  Everyone seemed to truly care about their guests.  The breakfast

Stayed here for two nights in May. Good location and great hotel. The main thing i can say about this hotel is how great the breakfast is. So much choice and such good value for the price you pay to stay. Would stay here again for the breakfast, the rooms were average but enjoyed our stay and would return.

Summary Heading: Safe Bet with Comfort and Convenience
Summary: We did a family of four stay during the holiday week (Dec 25 – Jan 1) and came away quite satisfied with what was to be expected from an Embassy Suites Hotel.  Situated in the City of Brea just outside of Anaheim, this ideal staging area hotel gave you the ability to be far away from the hustle and bustle of Anaheim yet just a short drive to all the major parks.  The hotel had some signs of age but was mostly well managed and maintained.  Hotel rugs, although dated, did pass the white sock tests.  Walls were rock solid.  Some oddities during our stay included only receiving towel sets for three when we had four registered guests.  As previously mentioned, the age of the hotel has also caused our shower unit within the room to require repair during out stay.  We did notice some

Summary Heading: Consistent Quality in a Convenient Location
Summary: My husband and I stay at the Embassy Suites Brea every year during Thanksgiving -- mostly for its location, which is close to my parents' house as well as the Brea Mall (i.e. great for Black Friday shopping). This Embassy Suites has an Egyptian theme, so don't be surprised if you see a few fake sarcophagi or Egyptian paintings in and around the hotel.  As Embassy Suites go, the layout is pretty standard: courtyard-style structure, with daily buffet breakfast on the ground floor. The breakfast includes a great omelet station, as well as solid basics like fresh fruit, cereal, oatmeal, bacon, and sausage. The suites are comfortable, too -- front room with couch and TV, back room with bed and additional TV. Good size space, if a little dark.  Overall, it's a good, consistent
i had a great stay. it was clean and spacious. The food in the restaurant was really good.  Delicious shrimp dish.

Summary Heading: Great convenient location, excellent customer service
Summary: After reading some negative reviews, we were apprehensive about this hotel. However, it was just great! We travelled with a 2 year old baby (main purpose - Disneyland visit), and the location could not be more convenient. Target is right across the street, along with tons of different shops, restaurants, fast food places, downtown Brea all within a 5 min drive. Highway exit is convenient as well, 15 min to Disneyland door to door. The hotel is very clean, and well mantained. Customer services is world class, special thanks to Peter, manager on duty, who helped us out with all our special requests :) Bottom line - for a family travelling with a small child, the convenience of this hotel was amazing. Clean, safe area, lots of shops and eateries, full breakfast with a wide variety

Summary Heading: I have liked this hotl or years but it is starting to get tired.
Summary: It can be very noisy because of the open courtyard design and their being a very popular wedding party place on weekends.  I find the value the it question here. The extra charges add up. They want ten dollars per unit for extremely slow wifi. So if you have an iPad, a computer and a smart phone they want to charge you thirty dollars per day. And Hilton Honors has to be Gold or Platinum to get it complementary.  So this is not a pod hotel for business folks or even online vacationers.

For $117 a night we got a huge suite.  Friendly staff, clean, slightly dated (a fresh coat of paint would do wonders for an otherwise nicely decorated Egyptian theme hotel).  Next door to huge mall and excellent woman's fitness center.  Hotel's own fitness center was fine and outdoor pool is heated supposedly.  We paid $5 in advance and got a nice upgrade on arrival. Good cooked and noncooked breakfast in spacious atrium, nice to avoid cramped eating quarters.  Have not participated in free PM snacks yet.  Tips:  do not waste time looking for parking on first floor of undergound garage, there is plenty of parking one floor below and you can get close to elevators.  Linen service is only every three days unless you specify otherwise. We plan to stay here again.

We stayed here one night, for a party at the hotel.  Good deal on advance purchase.  Nice facility, seems updated and well maintained.  King Tut/Egypt theme.  Very busy - hotel was full.  Free breakfast and manager's happy hour.  Rooms are typical, large, 2 room Embassy Suite rooms.  Walls are moderately thin.  View is of the mall parking lot or other shops.  This facility is next to the Brea Civic Center and a stone's throw from the mall.  So, if you have business at either of those places, this is a good place to stay.  Staff was accommodating.  Facility has underground parking for free.  Plenty of it.  Close to CalState Fullerton.  Not as close as many others to Disneyland, etc.  Close to the Nixon museum and library.  Not a destination, but a good solid place to stay if you

This is a fairly standard Embassy Suites, with very good customer service.  We've stayed twice now, and I expect that the Embassy Suites Brea will continue to be our hotel of choice when we're in the area.  The food is not great, the rooms are a little outdated, and there's often a late night event going on in the center area.  However, it's a great value, is close to what we need, and provides a spacious home away from home.

Summary Heading: Great place for a business trip
Summary: I stayed here whilst working in the Brea area and was pleasantly surprised by the complimentary bar between 5.30 & 7.30. I managed to get some free time and spent the day in the nearby shopping mall followed by a relaxing sunbathing session by the pool. The rooms are nice and big, the staff friendly and the huge fish pond just makes everything relaxing as you enjoy the complimentary breakfast. Can't wait to stay again.

This was the best hotel of all that i have ever stayed at.......and breakfast was unbelieveable! When they say full cooked to order thats what they mean...any kind of eggs,waffles,pancakes,sausage,bacon,plus cereal hot or cold, juice,coffee etc.etc...................Room was clean and comfortable...we needed a coffee pot, one call and bam it was there, extra coffee bam it was there...never have i had faster service anywhere!!! With all rooms being a 2 room suite was a bonus...was there for a wedding and my sister slept on the sleeper sofa in living room and hubby and i had a separate bedroom ( only con to this is there is only 1 bathroom which was in the bedroom) which really wasn't a problem for us.........also room rate was great @ $99 a night since it was a block of rooms for

We stayed here with our soccer club for a tournament.  It was the perfect location for the family and the event.    Large two room suites, breakfast for all, and free easy parking and access.    I also like the Center Garden Design, where all the rooms in the hotel are around a central garden.   The staff was friendly and helpful.  One of the hotel elevators, 1 out of 4 and this caused a few delays going up and down, and the 2nd day was a bit more crowded, so lines formed for breakfast.  But all in all, I will go back and stay there again.

Our family traveled to Disneyland for the Labor Day weekend, but all the nearby hotels were sold out.  We've always enjoyed staying at Embassy Suites, but the closest E.S. to Disneyland with available rooms was in Brea.  We used our Honor Points to book a 2 night stay.  I AM SO GLAD I DID!  Beautiful property with an Egyptian theme.  We checked in after midnight and were pleasantly surprised when we were complimentarily upgraded to the Penthouse Suite!  WOW!!  An extra large room with a huge bathroom.  The living area contained a desk, formal dining table to accomodate 6-8 people, a sofa sleeper with TV.  The sleeping area contained a king size bed, TV and the largest bathroom I have ever seen.  Bathroom contained a huge, oval roman tub, a walk-in shower with 2 showerheads,

Summary Heading: We loved it and going back
Summary: It was a great place and we are going back for our wedding!!

We stayed in the room number 231 in August 2011. Here are the main points... Positive:  - free parking in the hotel garage - complimentary breakfast (hot and cold) - manager's reception every evening with free drinks and nibbles - free USA Today newspaper - outdoor pool and hot tub - a gym - we arrived early (at noon) and had expected that our room not to be ready, but we got checked in immediately despite being early - the hotel is tastefully decorated in an Egyptian theme  Negatives:  - we had a non-smoking room but the room smelled very strongly of cigarette smoke, we tried spraying it with Febreze but it didn't help - the housekeeping was sloppy (the bathroom was barely touched, it seemed that all the maid did was exchange towels and make the beds, she often forgot to empty

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Clean, Friendly, not far from Disney
Summary: Our family stays here twice a year.  Beds are comfy, rooms are clean, staff is friendly.  We love the heated pool and the workout room.  The morning breakfast staff is always helpful and we really like seeing the same faces every year, especially Alex.  We ordered room service while we were there and had a good meal and a glass of wine brought up to our room. Front Desk has given us early check-in when available.  You have the Brea Mall next to your hotel, Target across the street and so many places to eat.  We can't wait to go back.  Thank you!

What a hotel. Great room even thought the air conditioner did not cool the bedroom...the living area was like an icebox. All that aside, wonderful pool and spa area, great fitness center and the over all hotel was wonderful. Cool Egyptian theme thru out. Especially liked by our 8 yr old grandaughter.  Worth it to stay here.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel- highly recommended for suites, room servce and free breakfasts!
Summary: This is a typical chain pitching to business and family users. As part of the Hilton chain, Embassy suites has retained its charm and value attributes. TVs in rooms are crt versions- may need to think about upgrading these to flatscreens at some stage- but they do work and you get two per suite! Bathrooms are well-equipped with some of the best soap products one will experience (very high quality- not cheap and nasty). You get a suite with microwave and coffee-making with separate stainless steel sink area. Hotel is typical- rooms arranged around a central "garden" area. Lifts are at each side of floors and work efficiently, taking you to lobby or underground car-parks which are great. Brea Mall is just next door- very convenient. Brea city is couple of miles away- recommended

Summary Heading: Favorite stop when in Orange County
Summary: In looking back at my contributions, I was surprised to find that I hadn't reviewed this hotel. I've stayed here many times while in Orange County, and always look for its availability before any others. There are three Embassy Suites in range of my business stops in Orange County and a lot of other similarly-priced hotels, but nothing matches this one.  Rooms are very good - comfortable, complete, and quiet. They're serviced well and in good condition, with a quiet air conditioning system.  Service is always polished and friendly. The free breakfast is fully up to the standards of Embassy Suites, and the fare at the manager's reception is quite satisfactory.  The neighborhood features the largest mall in the area just across the street, a lot of nice restaurants, a grocery in

We are a family of 4 who love staying at Embassy Suites.  We were on our way back from San Diego and we were touring So Calif. colleges.  The hotel is right across the street from a mall.  We liked shopping in the mall and ate dinner at the Cheesecake Factory which was also within walking distance.    The room itself was spacious although the air conditioner seemed to benefit only the first room so we froze out one child while the rest of us were hot!    The manager's reception is in the bar which made it a little awkward for families with kids but we got our drinks and snacks and then went out the tables in the atrium.  Breakfast the next morning was very good and the food all seemed fresh.

We were in town for a wedding in Fullerton.  Some family stayed at the Holiday Inn down the road.  We chose the embassy because we needed more room with two kids.  The price was about the same, but we had the cooked to order breakfast and evening reception.  The room was a huge corner suite that was very quiet.  The hotel smelled a bit like smoke even though we had a non smoking room.  Also, people would order in room service or take breakfast back and then leave the dishes out.  The hotel rarely came by to pick up the dirty dishes.  One very positive thing was that our daughter became sick at night.  The staff was more than happy to help us clean up and provide clean sheets and towels.  They even offered a free Sprite.  The weather was a bit cool to use the pool, but the pool

Summary Heading: great hotel, great location, great service
Summary: This hotel is located a short drive to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. It's actually on the corner of the Brea Mall. If you need to do any quick shopping, you can just walk outside your door and you're in Macy's, JC Penny's and Target with a Starbucks inside!  The room is a very nice size with a kitchenette and microwave. But what i really appreciate is the full breakfast served. There's even a cook who will make you eggs and pancakes to order.   I'm not crazy about the location of the pool, it's too isolated for evening swims. And they really need to update their TVs and computers. Other then that, I love the place.

Have not stayed at an Embassy in quite a whlie. We were here for a wedding and spent two nights. The room was very large and clean but shows it age. The funiture and TV's all need to be replaced. The breakfeast buffet was good but the cocktail hour snacks are a joke. I guess is you get a free beer or cocktail I should not complain. So the heck with the snacks drink up! The do have a very nice pool, hot tub and a fitness center that actually had some free weights (dumbells) to work out with. Good location , You can walk out the front door to the mall. So if you need a place in Brea for a night or two it is fine.

Have stayed in this hotel several times in the past but this was our first visit in 18 months.  We were very disappointed with the wear and tear since we were last here.  The room really needed a face lift and several repairs were immediately needed to the room – from doors not closing to difficult faucets, broken chair, etc.  As a big fan of Embassy Suites, I am very sorry to see this one allowed to fall.  One final note is that the hotel does many weddings and parties with attendees staying at the hotel.  Because of the open architecture this often causes the hotel to be very loud past midnight on weekends.

Summary Heading: Good room, but outrageous charge for wifi!
Summary: The room was large (like a typical Embassy Suite), and clean.  The hotel itself is decorated nicely, and the staff was very friendly.  The breakfast buffet was included, and featured omlets, pancakes, waffles, fruit, cereal, eggs, meat, etc.  There was free parking in a garage, and there is a mall within walking distance.  But the hotel charges for wifi -- $9.95 per computer, per day!  We have been to many hotels where wifi is free, and this charge seemed outrageous to us.  For the rooms and breakfast, I'd go back.  But having to pay for wifi left a sour taste in my mouth -- that's why I gave 4 stars instead of 5.

Their rooms and buffet breakfast are actually not bad but It took so long for them to get help with our luggages that we end up loading our luggages on their cart and bringing our own luggages to our room.  What a nightmare!  In all our hotel stay, this is our first time to experience this kind of very bad service.  Service in this hotel especially upon check in really sucks, the worst so far.  Hotel staff particularly front desk needs a lot more orientation/training on service improvement.  We all have a very bad impression of this hotel.  Will never recommend this hotel to anyone even if they assured us of room upgrade on our next visit.

This hotel is right near the best places to eat in Brea.   The hotel staff was fantastic and the waiters at the restaurant were especially great.   Had one complaint for loud noise during a graduation party night and they upgraded me to the penthouse for free....very nice!

Summary Heading: A fine place to stay in Orange County
Summary: This is suburbia, and it embraces it to the hilt:  * Free parking * Across from Target * Across from a mall * Close to the highway * Lots of local events in the common areas (we saw a bridal shower and a memorial service)  As usual at an Embassy Suites, we were impressed with the quietness of the room. I was disappointed at the lack of free wi-fi. Overall, though, I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.  I will say, for the record, that the Egyptian motif is weird.

gorgeous hotel, excellent staff who were more than willing to give me instructions or help (I needed to find a pharmacy, and fast). breakfast in the morning was much better than the standard danish and cup of coffee.

Summary Heading: Not bad, but light sleepers beware
Summary: There was a loud group next to us (I think it was one of the many wedding parties the hotel was hosting that weekend) that came into their room around 1am and kept me up until after 3. To be fair, they weren't screaming or anything, but they were speaking at a pretty high volume and the walls were very unforgiving. I could clearly hear their endless conversation about nasal spray and how surely the front desk would be able to provide some if they called down and asked for it. I ended up sleeping on the floor for a while with the bed between me and the wall to act as a noise insulator, and then getting back in bed after they finally crashed. But the others in my room were relatively unfazed by it, so if you're a heavy sleeper you'd probably be fine. Not me, though.  I've stayed
One of my fav hotels to stay at :)  Always the best rooms, large and comfy, and a wonderful b-fast in the morning.

I stayed here for one night on two different trips.  Hotel is clean and in a good area for food and entertainment. I went to a restaurant about a mile away called Taps and would recommend. There are a lot of choices available.  Free evening drinks and breakfast are a great addition to a fine hotel.  Parking is free in an underground garage with elevators to any floor in the hotel. Next to a nice mall.
Really enjoyed the 3 nights we spent here, the staff very friendly,very clean and the breakfast was great. Very close to cinema, shopping mall and restaurants.

Summary Heading: The best hotel experience I ever had!
Summary: I booked the hotel reservation for Saturday at the last minute. I needed a place to stay for the night and finish my work. I was frustrated and stressed. However, after the complimentary breakfast that Embassy Suites offers, I felt like the luckiest person in the world.  Once I entered the Egyptian- themed hotel, the hotel itself and the room was spotless. The room is extremely spacious. I felt like I was just at home. I didn't feel like I was in a typical hotel room where I have to watch my tv in my bed. I was able to sit on a couch, or a working table, or a bed in a separate room without feeling so cluttered.  I went to the restaurant inside the hotel, Tut’s for lunch and fell in love with their Crusted Salmon Spinach Salad. The salad included a filet of salmon that was

Summary Heading: Frequent guest appreciates outgoing staff, good location
Summary: I've stayed here for work many times over the past three years.  I am always impressed by the professionalism of their staff.  The location is ideal for Brea.  The furnishings and decor are somewhat dated, but rooms are clean and in good condition.

The rooms were large and very comfortable.  The management went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and pleasant.  It was a good place for a large group.  The buses had a private drive to load and unload off the street.  A hot breakfast with a lot of selections was included every morning and when our group had to be eat at 4:30 a.m. to make it to the Rose Bowl Parade on time, the hotel had a special breakfast arranged for us. I would definitely go back by myself or take another large group there.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but a bit dated
Summary: We had a corner suite, and the rooms are huge.  The facility is somewhat dated and maintenance is a bit lacking.  Our room's rugs had quite a few big patches of cigarette burns.  The bathrooms are small given the size of the suite.  The hot water for the shower is somewhat erratic and tough to control.  The bed is on the soft side, but still quite comfortable.  The TVs are old, and especially evident when we tried to watch a football game in the manager's reception lounge area.  We could hardly make out the score -- the TV was just that blurry.  But you get a decent breakfast, and parking is free.  Beware, internet connection costs $10 a day!!

This is a hotel that is part of the Hilton Group and lives up to its name. The stay was very comfortable with all amenities provided for. Excellent for short business trips and you have to appreciate the quality breakfast served by them which also includes a cooked to order omelette's or pancakes with hot maple syrup. There is a also  a nice selection for veggies with fruits, potatoes and cereal.   The mall next door, Brea mall, also offers the convenience of shopping and stepping out for a trial of different food types at the food court and a selection of restaurants which include - The California Pizza Kitchen, Olive Garden, Cheese Cake Factory and Red Lobster.  Do try and have fun while you are there.

Summary Heading: Very nice and elegant suite hotel.
Summary: This is a very nice suite hotel.  I stayed on the seventh floor which is reserved for Hilton HHonors VIP elite status members.  The room was very nice and elegant and was very clean.  There was not a detail that was missed and this was very refreshing.  It has a sliding glass door that opens to a very little balcony.  It was quite nice.  I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for the free parking.  Definitely eat across the street at La Cucina Ristorante.
We were here with 6 other family members from 6 different states from ME. to HI. It was perfect. The hotel was very clean. They staff was very helpful. The breakfast and Happy hour were outstanding!

Summary Heading: Needs work, used to be nicer, getting rundown dirty
Summary: I Stayed overnight for meetings. The people were nice, polite and helpful. The room smelled musty and smokey.  Bathroom was missing amenties (shampoo, etc.), floor was dirty (nut shells) it clearly had not been vacuumed after previous guest. The in-room coffee station had only decaf, no "real" coffee. Couch was dingy and dirty and had a large 8" rip/cut on the arm. Floors in room and hallways were dirty and in need of cleaning. When I arrived there was a bag of garbage and some pizza cartons in hallway.  Overall this hotel had a shabby run down appearance. Too bad, I've stayed here a number of times, but it is definitely going down hill.

You know, I absolutely LOVE this hotel.  It is so perfect: comfortable, friendly, all the right amenities, etc...I always look forward to staying here, and it has become my Girlfriend and I's favorite place for a "night away".  What's so great?  Everything!  The rooms are incredibly comfortable.  The beds, the linens, the AC, etc....sounds silly and all that, but really, you should know by now that the AC is the single most important part of a hotel room!  Well, here it's perfect.  It works so well, it's quiet, it actually spits air out that matches the number on the unit, etc...lol.  The beds are soft and comfortable.  The lines are always in perfect condition, clean, and so soft.  The rooms are large too, with great living spaces/pull out bed, sofas, chairs, desk, it has it

Located next to Brea Mall near 57 freeway.  Parking is free in underground garage.  Large atrium, attactively decorated.  On-site restaurant and bar.  Evening reception had  fairly limited snacks, breakfast had good variety of items.  Hotel was clean throughout and staff was friendly and helpful.  Upper penthouse suite is quite large, with a large bathroom equipped with double shower and tub.  There are a number of stairs to climb to reach the suite.  Some details were lacking, such as missing stopper for the sink, and some of the ceiling lights were out.  Bed was comfortable, but the a/c fans ran almost continuously.  View is of the mall next door.  Could use a nightlight in the bathroom, it is very dark.

As anyone who stays at Embassy Suites knows, the layouts are pretty similar.  This property had the basic but certainly clean standard suites, along with the improved bedding. (Lots of great pillows.)  Staff was all very friendly, and drink and breakfast service was quick. Great weekend rates.  The Egyptian theme is pretty subdued; restaurant and lounge were titled "Tut's" and there are some Egyptian themed decorations.  Only complaint I had. You couldn't even buy a local newspaper  - Los Angeles Times or Orange County Register - at the hotel.  (Saw an empty USA today rack, but they weren't selling ANY newspaper on the weekend.    Staff did direct me to some street boxes about a block and a half away.    And with everything else included, seems silly to charge $10 a day for

I have stayed here two times and both times I enjoyed my stay. The rooms are well equipped and nicely appointed. I actually live nearby and my fiance and I enjoy stopping by to have a few coctails at Tut's Lounge. The bartender Justin makes great drinks. The brea mall is right next door as are many dining options. TGI Fridays is across the street and Red Lobster, Olive Garden, Bobby McGees, Cheesecake Factory, Red Robin, BJ's and The Yardhouse are close by. There is also a pool hall (Diamonds) adjacent to hotel. I would definetly recommend staying here if you are considering. It's a great value if you take advantage of their managers reception (free drinks/coctails) and breakfast. You wont be disappointed.

We were visiting family in the area and this hotel was a most pleasant place to stop.  It is convenient to the freeway and located next to the Brea Mall.  Free parking is located under the hotel and was very convenient to access.  There are many restaurants in the area and Brea is a pleasant place to take a walk.  The hotel offers a very nice complimentary breakfast and complimentary beverages and Hors d'oeuvres each evening.  Our only problem was they did not have the style room available which we booked but they did upgrade us and the room was fine.  We would definitely stay here again.

I am kind of new to this site, but after reading the reviews before I was a bit hesitant.  But I have stayed with the ES Brand before and I have family that lives in Brea, so it was worth a shot.  I definitely was shocked at the reviews before, we enjoyed a great stay.  As mentioned the hotel has been recently renovated, and it's gorgeous.  The work out facility is especially nice, all the machines are new, and they even had free weights for my husband to use!   The entire staff was incredible from the front desk all the way to housekeeping.  The breakfast was amazing, the managers reception was great, and we even hosted some of our friends at the restaurant, and they had delicious food!    Definitely disregard the other negative reviews, because the hotel itself and service are

I just stayed one night but it was almost adjacent to the Brea Mall which has a Nordstroms and other great dept stores.  Theres also a cheesecake factory there too.  The front desk staff was nice and gave us a map of the area. The room accomodations were definitely above average.  The rooms were in good shape and the comforters and interior decorating were far above average as far as style goes. I would definitely stay here again.

I just love staying at Embassy Suites.  I have never been to one that I didn't like and this is another winner.  The rooms are just so large and the beds so comfortable.  Our room had a foldout bed, tv and then a separate room with 2 beds, tv and full bathroom.  The bedding is so luxurious and the pillows are always plentiful and fluffy.  We always get a good  night sleep and never hear any noises in the room next to us or below /above us.  The business center is great and it is the first time that we have used one but it won't be the last.  We had to print out plane tickets and the business center had plenty of office supplies if you needed anything.  It was well stocked with pens, highlighters, paper clips and had large desks to work from.  The breakfast was cooked to order

run down beds lumpy old pillows shower head with no pressure at least 15 years old dangerous slippery tub when showering poor quality breakfast buffet  manager Tim rude on phone & in person  charged $199 a night (not worth it) will not be back, spend your money elsewhere

Summary Heading: Good place to stay towards the north easter edge of Orange County.
Summary: This is a nice Embassy Suites. Egyptian motif. Pleasant staff. Parking has a "crowded" feel to it. Rooms are little more compact than the usual ES. Staff friendly and keeps the whole area tidy and clean. Brea mall is across the street. Whole area feels real safe.

Totally Agree with last review on Oct. 21, 2007!  They must have remodeled it because it is fantastic!   The rooms were plush with great Egyptian decor.  We were able to check in at 11:30am with no questions asked.   The free breakfast buffet was wonderful!  There was an Omelet bar on one side, the other side consisted of potatoes, bacon, sausage, fruit, cereal, danishes, bagels, toast and all you can drink orange juice, milk, juices, coffee, etc.   The only little thing they did not mention was, at check in they give you a white card with your name and room number on it. You need to bring this card with you in order to have the Happy hour and the breakfast buffet.  Other than that, it was great!!!

After looking at other reviews we almost did not book here.  However, due to proximity to a funeral we were attending, we opted to stay.  We are GLAD we did.  We arrived at noon, expecting to be told no room yet ready.  However, we were allowed early check-in.  Our room is one of the nicest we've had in the Embassy Suites chain (have probably stayed in 25 of them).  Immaculate, new carpet, granite-type bathroom and wet bar countertop, slate type tile bathroom floor, "Egyptian" motif with very nice bedding, curtains, towels.  "Bloom" amenities (better than the standard Neutrogena).  Did the happy hour - nachos, fancy chip mix, popcorn, 5 TVs with both football and baseball.  Very personable bar staff - manager dropped in and chatted.  Ate dinner at the Tut grill - steaks, great

Summary Heading: Great hotel....  Great rooms...  Great location...
Summary: Had to stay here with my girlfriend for a few nights while she took a class.  The rooms were outstanding.  Everything was nice and clean and the staff was very friendly.  Parking is easy and extremely convenient.  The rooms were HUGE and the beds weren't too shabby either.  If you need a place to lounge or study, the "living room" is the place to be...    I don't know why people were giving this hotel bad reviews.  It's definitely one of the nicest 3 star hotels I've ever been too and even better than lots of 4 stars...  Perhaps I got a good room cause it was on the top floor.    The location is perfect cause it's right by EVERYTHING.  The Brea Mall is pretty much in the same complex...    I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed for 2 nights April 13th-15th.  Not happy.  Hotel is under renovation, which we weren't warned about, with on going construction through out.  Which means, noise, smells, construction stuff every where.  The room was barely cleaned and worn thread bare.  Hence the renovation.  When we complained to the front desk about our concerns we were given the run around, and still have not found satisfaction with our complaints.  I would recommend staying away from this hotel until the renovation is complete.

This was a last minute chose hotel.  We did not know the area so we stayed close to all the conveniences, the mall is across the street, restaurants and free parking. But that is it, as the other reviewers mentioned, this hotel needs an upgrade.  The carpet had spots everywhere, the remote in the living room did not work and the room was dark.  An included  breakfast was filling but there were no seats and I wanted to mention the flatted rat in the parking lot.   But it is convenient.

I've stayed here 2-3 times a year for the last few years because the hotel is conveniently located near my family.  It has gotten worse and worse every time I've stayed here and this was the last time I'm staying here.  The problems are very numerous.  First, the service is terrible.  The staff just plain lie to you.  Second, the whole hotel needs to be renovated.  The beds just killed my wife and me.  The exercise room had a lot of broken equipment, no AC, and I couldn't hear the TV (which had broken volume controls).  There were numerous noisy parties in guest rooms aroung the hotel and the staff did nothing about them.  The Manager's Reception is a joke.  I went to it one night 1/2 hour before it closed and there was no food.  The bartender actually told me that he couldn't

My girlfriend and I stayed in one of the lower penthouse suites and were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. The bedroom and bathroom alone were bigger than most hotel rooms. We thoroughly enjoyed the dual headed showers with glass enclosure, sunken Roman tub (although whirlpool jets would have been a definite plus) but most of all the large, feather down, pillow top mattress! This bed was actually hard to get out of! Very comfortable! It made up for the drab out of date furniture that needs to be replaced as the dressers and coffee table had old stains on them. Also the carpet under the bed looked like it hadn't been vaccumed in some time. The complimentary cooked to order breakfast was decent with a large variety of food to choose from. The staff was pleasant and

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel - I miss it!
Summary: I was browsing this site to get some reviews of hotels in Miami and thought I would use Embassy Suites in Brea, CA as a kind of "calibration baseline" as I know this hotel very well. I was surprised to see the quite negative reviews of this very nice hotel, so I'd better put my own review here, along with some pictures from some of my trips there (taken for testing new cameras). I think I have a pretty good idea about the quality of the place - I have stayed at the hotel 3 times: 1 week in 2002, 3 months in 2003 and 3 weeks in 2004. And I must say, I am a very, very satisfied guest. I cannot recognize ANYTHING with respect to mold, rude personnel etc. The three rooms, I have stayed in (and the rooms of my co-workers) have always been very high-standard and clean. The people

The brunch is great, the atrium beautiful.  However, the room we stayed in was not pleasant at all. Carpet fraying, cottage cheese ceilings, 120 thread count beige sheets.  Our fold out bed broke and they worked on it for 30 min. in our room with power tools with no apology.  Definetely needs an update!

I stayed at this hotel during business travel and it was an awful experience!  My room had mold, the carpet was so worn and the bathroom was awful.  I could not even sleep at night. When I asked if I could switch rooms, the man at the front desk said rudely to me "No, we are all booked!!!" he didn't even ask me what was wrong with my room.  I was so disappointed.  Unfortunately there aren't very many hotels near this location, so I stuck out my stay there, but I would not suggest that anyone stay there.

For the money I spent on the suite here I would have imagined much better service and accomodations. First, we ate at the restaurant there and both my husband and I got sick a few hours later. The staff did not care and shrugged it off. Maybe it happens alot?!?! Also at check out there was a movie on our bill that we did not order and they REFUSED to look into or remove it from the bill. To top it all off...are you ready for this??? It was unexpectedly my time of the month. I called down to the Front Desk and was told by a man named Lance that he thought he had tampons somewhere but didn't know where they were. I asked if he could look around (should i HAVE to ask!?!?) and he said it was really busy at the Front Desk and would not have time for awhile. I told him I had to meet

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel In A Decent Area
Summary: I'm originally from the area and will somtimes stay here when I'm back in town. The hotel is pretty much a standard Embassy Suites (as another reviewer stated) with a reasonable breakfast and decent sized rooms. My main complaints are the parking structure which is challenging to negotiate unless you drive a small car and the rooms can be noisy if neighboring guests are throwing parties (there are wedding receptions and other events held here). This is a nice central location to stay if you plan on venturing out to the outlying areas like Los Angeles, Orange County (Disneyland, Knotts, etc.) and there are plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby.

Standard Embassy setting with open courtyard in the center of the hotel.  Rooms are Ok but showing some wear.  Complimentary breakfast and managers reception is part of the room rate.  The Brea Mall is next door for burning some time if needed.  I stay there often for convenience but the property could step it up a notch.

i have stayed here many times whilst my Husband was working in the States and i can not fault the hotel.The staff are more than helpful and nothing is too much trouble,the rooms are clean and of a good standard,i would definately recommend it.I stayed here for 3 months in total and I didn't want to leave!!
